original: de dang 'dra ba me dang bud shing gis tshogs pa'i skad cig ma @278a * //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba me dang bud shing gis tshogs pa'i skad cig ma @278a * //
translated: Likewise, the second moment of smoke is similar to the first moment of smoke, which is produced from another assembly of fire and fuel.

original: gzhan las skyes pa dang po kho na las gzhan pa'i skad cig ma yin pa de bzhin du de las gzhan pa'i dngos po nyid me dang bud shing gi tshogs ba gzhan las skye bas de 'dra ba'i du ba ni dus 'byung ba mi srid do //
analyzed: gzhan las skyes pa dang po kho na las gzhan pa'i skad cig ma yin pa de bzhin du de las gzhan pa'i dngos po nyid me dang bud shing gi tshogs ba gzhan las skye bas de 'dra ba'i du ba ni dus 'byung ba mi srid do //
translated: In the same way, another entity is produced from another assembly of fire and fuel. Thus, it is impossible for smoke to occur at the same time.

original: la lar 'bras bu la yid brtan du med pa ma yin no //üîΩde bzhin du ci 'dra ba'i skad cig ma gnyis pa la 'byung ba ni du ba'i skad cig ma dang po la skye ba'i du ba'i skad cig ma de dang 'dra ba du ba gzhan gyi skad cig ma dang po las skyes ba can gyi du ba'i skad
analyzed: la lar 'bras bu la yid brtan du med pa ma yin no // de bzhin du ci 'dra ba'i skad cig ma gnyis pa la 'byung ba ni du ba'i skad cig ma dang po la skye ba'i du ba'i skad cig ma de dang 'dra ba du ba gzhan gyi skad cig ma dang po las skyes ba can gyi du ba'i skad
translated: In some cases, the effect is not unreliable.

original: cig ma gnyis pa dang gsum pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: cig ma gnyis pa dang gsum pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: In the same way, the second moment of smoke that occurs is similar to the first moment of smoke that arises from the first moment of smoke. The second moment of smoke that is produced from the first moment of another smoke is the second and third moments of smoke.

original: de bzhin du skad cig ma gsum la sogs pa'i myu gu la sogs pa rnams la yang thams cad du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du skad cig ma gsum la sogs pa'i myu gu la sogs pa rnams la yang thams cad du brjod par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, everything should be stated for the third moment of smoke and so on, and for sprouts and so on.

original: gang las 'di'i rnam par dbye bar bya ba yang yin zhe na /üîΩde las 'byung ba can ma yin pa ni me dang bud shing la sogs pa'i ngo bo de las ma yin ba'i du ba las 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can skad cig ma dang po dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i du ba ni lan 'ga' yang ni lan gcig
analyzed: gang las 'di'i rnam par dbye bar bya ba yang yin zhe na / de las 'byung ba can ma yin pa ni me dang bud shing la sogs pa'i ngo bo de las ma yin ba'i du ba las 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can skad cig ma dang po dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i du ba ni lan 'ga' yang ni lan gcig
translated: And from what is it distinguished?

original: kyang ngo // de las ni me la sogs ba'i tshogs pa las mi 'byung ba'i phyir 'byung ba mi rigs so //
analyzed: kyang ngo // de las ni me la sogs ba'i tshogs pa las mi 'byung ba'i phyir 'byung ba mi rigs so //
translated: It is not from that, because smoke that is not of the nature of fire and fuel, which is not of the same nature as the first moment, is never produced from that, because it does not arise from the assembly of fire and so on.

original: dper na skad cig ma dang po la ltos pa'i gnyis pa de dang 'dra ba de bzhin du skad cig ma dang po la ltos pa de yang de 'dra ba nyid du khyad par med pas de dang 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: dper na skad cig ma dang po la ltos pa'i gnyis pa de dang 'dra ba de bzhin du skad cig ma dang po la ltos pa de yang de 'dra ba nyid du khyad par med pas de dang 'dra ba yin no //
translated: For example, the second moment in dependence on the first moment is similar to it. Likewise, that in dependence on the first moment is also similar to it, because there is no difference.

original: me ma yin pa las 'byung ba can me las skyes pa de dang 'dra ba'i ngo bo med pas lan 'ga' yang de las mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me ma yin pa las 'byung ba can me las skyes pa de dang 'dra ba'i ngo bo med pas lan 'ga' yang de las mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not from that which is not fire, because that which arises from fire, which is of a similar nature to that, never arises from that, because it does not arise from that which is not fire.

original: des bskyed par bya ba'i ngo bo yin na ni bdag nyid yin pas mi 'dra bar ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: des bskyed par bya ba'i ngo bo yin na ni bdag nyid yin pas mi 'dra bar ga la 'gyur /
translated: If it is the nature of what is produced by that, how could it be different from itself?

original: de'i phyir mi 'dra ba las byung ba las mi 'dra ba ma yin pa des na 'khrul pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi 'dra ba las byung ba las mi 'dra ba ma yin pa des na 'khrul pa med do //
translated: Therefore, since what is not different arises from what is different, there is no error.

original: gal te du ba'i skad cig ma thams cad ni mgul pa skam pa dang mchi ma 'byung ba dang / kha dog gnag par byed pa la sogs pa'i don byed pa nye bar mkho bas /
analyzed: gal te du ba'i skad cig ma thams cad ni mgul pa skam pa dang mchi ma 'byung ba dang / kha dog gnag par byed pa la sogs pa'i don byed pa nye bar mkho bas /
translated: If it is argued that since all instances of smoke are required to perform the function of drying up the throat, producing tears, and darkening the complexion,

original: ji ltar de dang 'dra ba'i rang bzhin du mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar de dang 'dra ba'i rang bzhin du mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: how could they not have a nature that is similar?

original: de la yang don byed pa med de skad cig ma tha dad pa la rag las pa'i ngo bo ni de dang 'dra ba med pas de las skyon mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang don byed pa med de skad cig ma tha dad pa la rag las pa'i ngo bo ni de dang 'dra ba med pas de las skyon mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In that case, there is no function, because the nature that depends on different moments does not have similarity, and the error is the same as before.

original: gal te de lta na 'jig rten pa thams cad ji ltar du ba'i tha snyad pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na 'jig rten pa thams cad ji ltar du ba'i tha snyad pa yin zhe na /
translated: If that is so, how can all worldly people have the convention of smoke?

original: 'dra ba gzhan 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan @278b gcig tu mngon par zhen pa'i dbang gis skad cig ma'i tha snyad du rung ngo //
analyzed: 'dra ba gzhan 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan @278b gcig tu mngon par zhen pa'i dbang gis skad cig ma'i tha snyad du rung ngo //
translated: The reason for the arising of another similar one is that it is suitable to designate it as momentary due to the power of manifest clinging to a single cause.

original: gal te 'dra ba de dang 'dra ba ji ltar ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'dra ba de dang 'dra ba ji ltar ma yin zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúHow is that similar one not similar?‚Äù

original: 'dra ba ni de dang 'dra ba las gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dra ba ni de dang 'dra ba las gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because the similar one is different from that which is similar.

original: de lta na ba lang dang 'dra bar gyur pa'i ba me na ni de dang 'dra ba ma yin gyi ba lang nyid gzhan de dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta na ba lang dang 'dra bar gyur pa'i ba me na ni de dang 'dra ba ma yin gyi ba lang nyid gzhan de dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In that case, a cow that is similar to a cow is not similar to that, but the other cow itself is similar to that.

original: don dam par na de dang 'dra ba med kyang blo dman pa rnams de dang 'dra ba 'dod ba 'byung ba gang gis bsal bar nus de lta na tshu rol mthong ba de ma yin pa re zhig der mngon par zhen pa bsal bar nus pa ma yin
analyzed: don dam par na de dang 'dra ba med kyang blo dman pa rnams de dang 'dra ba 'dod ba 'byung ba gang gis bsal bar nus de lta na tshu rol mthong ba de ma yin pa re zhig der mngon par zhen pa bsal bar nus pa ma yin
translated: Although ultimately there is no similarity, how can the desire for similarity that arises in those of inferior intellect be dispelled? In that case, one who sees only a part is not able to dispel the manifest clinging to that for a while.

original: na / de dang 'dra ba mngon par zhen pa la ci zhig byar yod /
analyzed: na / de dang 'dra ba mngon par zhen pa la ci zhig byar yod /
translated: What can be done about the manifest clinging to similarity?

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: It is said:

original: dbyibs dang kha dog mtshungs pa yi //
analyzed: dbyibs dang kha dog mtshungs pa yi //
translated: The shape and color are the same.

original: rgyu gzhan skye bar gyur pa la //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan skye bar gyur pa la //
translated: If the cause of another‚Äôs arising were different,

original: de min de blo'i skye bo ni //üîΩrgyun gcig pa la'ang ci byar yod //
analyzed: de min de blo'i skye bo ni // rgyun gcig pa la'ang ci byar yod //
translated: then the person would not be born from that,

original: ces bshad do //
analyzed: ces bshad do //
translated: and what could be done about the continuity of the one?

original: de kho na nyid sems pas ni de dang 'dra ba de dang mi 'dra ba'i rgyu tha dad pas de dang 'dra ba dang de dang mi 'dra ba rnams rjes su dpog go //üîΩde 'dra ba nyid ma yin pa gang gi tshe de dang 'dra ba ma yin pa la yang de dang 'dra ba med pa de'i tshe de skyed pa'i ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir de las 'byung ba can ma yin pa ni lan 'ga' yang de las 'byung
analyzed: de kho na nyid sems pas ni de dang 'dra ba de dang mi 'dra ba'i rgyu tha dad pas de dang 'dra ba dang de dang mi 'dra ba rnams rjes su dpog go // de 'dra ba nyid ma yin pa gang gi tshe de dang 'dra ba ma yin pa la yang de dang 'dra ba med pa de'i tshe de skyed pa'i ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir de las 'byung ba can ma yin pa ni lan 'ga' yang de las 'byung
translated: The thinker of reality infers the similar and dissimilar from the difference of the similar and dissimilar causes.

original: bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: When the dissimilar is not similar to that, and the similar is not dissimilar to that, then, because it is not the nature of the producer, it does not arise from that, because it never arises from that.

original: don byed par nus pa ni phan tshun ltos pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: don byed par nus pa ni phan tshun ltos pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The ability to perform a function is mutual dependence, etc.

original: rgyu la ltos nas bskyed par bya ba'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo la ltos pa'o zhes shes so //
analyzed: rgyu la ltos nas bskyed par bya ba'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo la ltos pa'o zhes shes so //
translated: It is understood that, in dependence on the cause, the nature of the effect to be produced is dependent.

original: de lta ma yin na de las byung ba dag cig shos mi rigs pas des bskyed par bya bar mi rung ba'i phyir ro /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na de las byung ba dag cig shos mi rigs pas des bskyed par bya bar mi rung ba'i phyir ro /
translated: If it were not so, then it would be impossible for the other to arise from it, and therefore it would be impossible for it to be produced by that.

original: gal te de ltar de las dpag phas ci zhig 'grub ce na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar de las dpag phas ci zhig 'grub ce na /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúIf it is so, what is established by inference?‚Äù

original: de la zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúIn that case . . .‚Äù

original: de la rig par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de la rig par gyur pa'o //
translated: In that case, it is known.

original: gal te du ba ci 'dra ba dang por me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa las skyes pa skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs par byung ba de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: gal te du ba ci 'dra ba dang por me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa las skyes pa skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs par byung ba de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: If the smoke that arises from the collection of fire and so on in the first moment is similar to the smoke that arises in the second moment and so on,

original: me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa'i ni bud shing la sogs pa'i tshogs pas de skyed par byed pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa'i ni bud shing la sogs pa'i tshogs pas de skyed par byed pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: the collection of fire and so on is the collection of fuel and so on that produces it.

original: de spangs pa ni de las gzhan pa'o //
analyzed: de spangs pa ni de las gzhan pa'o //
translated: The exclusion of that is different from that.

original: me dang bud shing la sogs pa'i tshogs pas bskyed par bya ba de las gzhan pa las du ba'i skad cig ma 'byung bar gyur na de ni @279a * //
analyzed: me dang bud shing la sogs pa'i tshogs pas bskyed par bya ba de las gzhan pa las du ba'i skad cig ma 'byung bar gyur na de ni @279a * //
translated: If the arising of the moment of smoke that is to be produced by the collection of fire and fuel and so on were different from that,

original: de dang 'dra ba'i ngo bo 'di'o //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba'i ngo bo 'di'o //
translated: then this would be its similar nature.

original: des bskyed par bya ba ni me'i tshogs bas bskyed par bya ba'i ngo bo ma yin no //üîΩ'on kyang du ba bskyed par bya ba kho na byas zin pa lan 'ga' yang me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa las mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: des bskyed par bya ba ni me'i tshogs bas bskyed par bya ba'i ngo bo ma yin no // 'on kyang du ba bskyed par bya ba kho na byas zin pa lan 'ga' yang me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa las mi 'byung ngo //
translated: and it is not the nature of what is produced by the collection of fire and so on.üîΩBut the nature of what is produced by smoke is such that it never arises from the collection of fire and so on that has already performed its function.

original: de dang 'dra ba'i du ba'i ngo bo gzhan las 'byung na des bskyed par bya'i ngo bo ni ma yin pa la sogs pas bskyed par bya ba'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba'i du ba'i ngo bo gzhan las 'byung na des bskyed par bya'i ngo bo ni ma yin pa la sogs pas bskyed par bya ba'i ngo bo'o //
translated: If it were to arise from another with a similar nature to smoke, it would not be the nature of what is produced by that and so on.

original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: From what?

original: lan 'ga' yang de las 'byung bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: lan 'ga' yang de las 'byung bar mi rigs so //
translated: It is not logical that it would arise from that even once.

original: 'dir dpe ni don gzhan pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dper na myu gu las don gzhan pa de ma yin pas bskyed par bya bar mngon par 'dod pa ni gzhan las 'byung bas de ma yin pas bskyed pa'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: 'dir dpe ni don gzhan pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dper na myu gu las don gzhan pa de ma yin pas bskyed par bya bar mngon par 'dod pa ni gzhan las 'byung bas de ma yin pas bskyed pa'i ngo bo ste /
translated: Here the example is like another object. For example, it is accepted that what is produced by something other than a sprout arises from another, and so it is the nature of what is produced by something other than that.

original: me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa las skye ba'i ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir lan cig kyang de las 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du de dang 'dra ba'i du ba yang de las byung ba dang mi 'dra ba nyid 'dir rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa las skye ba'i ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir lan cig kyang de las 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du de dang 'dra ba'i du ba yang de las byung ba dang mi 'dra ba nyid 'dir rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Because it is not the nature that arises from the assembly of fire and so on, it will not arise from that even once. In the same way, it should be understood that the similar smoke does not arise from that.

original: gal te me la sogs pa'i tshogs pas 'di de ma yin pas bskyed par bya ba'i ngo bo yin yang de dang 'dra bar stobs kyis skyed par byed la rag las na de'i nyes pa yin no zhes 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te me la sogs pa'i tshogs pas 'di de ma yin pas bskyed par bya ba'i ngo bo yin yang de dang 'dra bar stobs kyis skyed par byed la rag las na de'i nyes pa yin no zhes 'dod na /
translated: If you assert that although the assembly of fire and so on generates that which is not it, it generates it through its power, then that is a fault.

original: de skyed pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de skyed pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: To respond:

original: de skyed pa'i ngo bo ma yin pa'i bdag nyid 'ba' zhig de las mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de skyed pa'i ngo bo ma yin pa'i bdag nyid 'ba' zhig de las mi 'byung ngo //
translated: That which is not the nature that generates it does not arise from that alone.

original: 'on kyang me la sogs ba'i tshogs pa des kyang de dang 'dra ba'i du ba skad cig ma gnyis pa 'byung ba ci 'dra bar mi skyed do //
analyzed: 'on kyang me la sogs ba'i tshogs pa des kyang de dang 'dra ba'i du ba skad cig ma gnyis pa 'byung ba ci 'dra bar mi skyed do //
translated: However, the assembly of fire and so on does not generate the second moment of similar smoke.

original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: From what?

original: de skye ba'i ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de skye ba'i ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not the nature that generates it.

original: de dang 'dra ba gzhan las 'byung na ni de kho na des bskyed pa'i ngo bo yin te me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa de skyed pa'i ngo bo ma tshang na ji ltar de skyed par 'gyur /
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba gzhan las 'byung na ni de kho na des bskyed pa'i ngo bo yin te me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa de skyed pa'i ngo bo ma tshang na ji ltar de skyed par 'gyur /
translated: If it arises from another of the same kind, then it is the nature generated by that. If the collection of fire and so on is incomplete in the nature that generates it, how could it generate it?

original: 'dir dpe ni tshogs pa gzhan yin no //
analyzed: 'dir dpe ni tshogs pa gzhan yin no //
translated: Here the example is another collection.

original: dper na tshogs pa gzhan de ma yin pa skyed par mngon par 'dod pa'i ngo bo ni des bskyed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa las kyang yin no //
analyzed: dper na tshogs pa gzhan de ma yin pa skyed par mngon par 'dod pa'i ngo bo ni des bskyed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa las kyang yin no //
translated: For example, the nature that is not the other collection, which is the nature that is manifestly desired to be generated, is not generated by that. In the same way, it is also from the collection of fire and so on.

original: de lta na de bdag nyid kyi ngo bo'i rjes su 'brang bas 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na de bdag nyid kyi ngo bo'i rjes su 'brang bas 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is engaged in following the nature of its own entity.

original: de'i phyir tshogs pa'i stobs kyis 'di skye bar ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshogs pa'i stobs kyis 'di skye bar ga la 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, how could it arise by the power of the collection?

original: gal te me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa las skye ba'i ngo bo las kyang de dang 'dra ba'i du ba'i ngo @279b bo skyed pa yang yin te /
analyzed: gal te me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa las skye ba'i ngo bo las kyang de dang 'dra ba'i du ba'i ngo @279b bo skyed pa yang yin te /
translated: If it arises from the nature that is generated from the collection of fire and so on, then it also generates the nature of smoke that is similar to it.

original: dper na du ba de nyid bud shing las skye ba'i ngo bo dang me las skye ba'i ngo bo gnyi ga yang yin pa de bzhin de 'dra ba du ba yang tshogs pas bskyed par bya ba'i ngo bo yin pas gnyis las 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe na
analyzed: dper na du ba de nyid bud shing las skye ba'i ngo bo dang me las skye ba'i ngo bo gnyi ga yang yin pa de bzhin de 'dra ba du ba yang tshogs pas bskyed par bya ba'i ngo bo yin pas gnyis las 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe na
translated: For example, just as smoke is the essence arisen from fuel and the essence arisen from fire, so too, smoke is the essence arisen from the assembly of causes and conditions, and thus it arises from two.

original: / du ba de ni zhes bya ba smos te de dang 'dra ba'i du ba de dang de ma yin pas bskyed par bya ba ni me la sogs pa'i tshogs pas bskyed par bya ba dang du bas bskyed pa'i ngo bor rigs pa ma yin na rigs pa dangüîΩ'brel pa ga la yin /
analyzed: / du ba de ni zhes bya ba smos te de dang 'dra ba'i du ba de dang de ma yin pas bskyed par bya ba ni me la sogs pa'i tshogs pas bskyed par bya ba dang du bas bskyed pa'i ngo bor rigs pa ma yin na rigs pa dang 'brel pa ga la yin /
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúThat smoke‚Äù and so on. That smoke, which is the essence arisen from that and not arisen from that, is not suitable to be the essence arisen from the assembly of fire and so on and the essence arisen from smoke. How could it be logical?üîΩBecause it is a single essence, there is no separate smoke that is similar to it.

original: ngo bo gcig yin pa'i phyir na de dang 'dra ba'i du ba tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro / de'i dus tha dad pas kyang de'i ngo bo tha dad par mi 'gyur pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo gcig yin pa'i phyir na de dang 'dra ba'i du ba tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro / de'i dus tha dad pas kyang de'i ngo bo tha dad par mi 'gyur pa ma yin no //
translated: Because it is a different time, it is not that its essence is different.

original: tha dad pa ni mi 'dra ba las byung ba'i mi 'dra ba brtsad par mi rigs so //
analyzed: tha dad pa ni mi 'dra ba las byung ba'i mi 'dra ba brtsad par mi rigs so //
translated: It is illogical to dispute that difference arises from nondifference.

original: gang gi tshe de'i de 'dra ba dang de mi 'dra ba'i rgyus bskyed pa de ni de 'dra ba dang de mi 'dra ba ngo bo nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de'i de 'dra ba dang de mi 'dra ba'i rgyus bskyed pa de ni de 'dra ba dang de mi 'dra ba ngo bo nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: When it is produced by a cause that is similar to it and dissimilar to it, then it would have a nature that is both similar and dissimilar.

original: de nyid bstan pa ni du ba dang du ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa ni du ba dang du ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To demonstrate just that, he says, ‚Äúsmoke and non-smoke,‚Äù and so on.

original: du ba smos pa ni ci 'dra ba'i me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa la skyes pa de dang 'dra ba'i ngo bor mngon par 'dod do //
analyzed: du ba smos pa ni ci 'dra ba'i me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa la skyes pa de dang 'dra ba'i ngo bor mngon par 'dod do //
translated: The word ‚Äúsmoke‚Äù indicates that it is accepted that it has a nature that is similar to the collection of fire and so on, from which it is produced.

original: du ba ma yin pa smos pas kyang mi 'dra ba'i rgyu las skyes pa'i du ba ma yin pa mi 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: du ba ma yin pa smos pas kyang mi 'dra ba'i rgyu las skyes pa'i du ba ma yin pa mi 'dra ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúnon-smoke‚Äù indicates that it is dissimilar, since it is produced from a dissimilar cause.

original: de dag kyang de dang 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba'i rgyu las skyes pas de dang 'dra ba dang de dang mi 'dra ba'i ngo bor 'chad par mi 'gyur ba'i rigs pas khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang de dang 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba'i rgyu las skyes pas de dang 'dra ba dang de dang mi 'dra ba'i ngo bor 'chad par mi 'gyur ba'i rigs pas khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Since they are also produced from a cause that is similar and dissimilar, it is reasonable to understand that they would not be described as having a nature that is both similar and dissimilar.

original: des na me dang du ba'i mtshan nyid las du ba las du ba skyed pa'i ngo bo ni de dang de mi 'dra ba skyed pa'i ngo bo yin pas de dang 'dra ba dang de mi 'dra ba dag 'byung ba yin na du ba dang du ba ma
analyzed: des na me dang du ba'i mtshan nyid las du ba las du ba skyed pa'i ngo bo ni de dang de mi 'dra ba skyed pa'i ngo bo yin pas de dang 'dra ba dang de mi 'dra ba dag 'byung ba yin na du ba dang du ba ma
translated: Therefore, the nature of the arising of smoke from smoke is not the same as the nature of the arising of that which is not similar to it. Therefore, both that which is similar to it and that which is not similar to it arise.üîΩ

original: yin pa dang de 'dra ba dang de mi 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yin pa dang de 'dra ba dang de mi 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since the nature of fire and smoke‚Äôs characteristic is the nature of smoke‚Äôs generation, it is the nature of the generation of that which is similar to it and that which is not similar to it. If that were so, then smoke would arise from smoke and from that which is not smoke, and it would be similar to that and dissimilar to that.

original: gang las 'dra ba nyid yin zhes ga las she na /
analyzed: gang las 'dra ba nyid yin zhes ga las she na /
translated: From what is it similar?

original: 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe nature of effects, etc.‚Äù

original: 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid rnams ni phan tshun 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni phan tshun mtshan nyid mi mthun par rgyu'i tshogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis byas pa yin gyi ngo bo nyid kyis ni ma yin te /üîΩrgyu med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid rnams ni phan tshun 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni phan tshun mtshan nyid mi mthun par rgyu'i tshogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis byas pa yin gyi ngo bo nyid kyis ni ma yin te / rgyu med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The nature of effects that arise from each other is made by the nature of the collection of causes that are mutually dissimilar, not by their own nature, because it would follow that they would be causeless.

original: de'i phyir de 'dra ba dang de mi 'dra ba las byung ba'i du ba de 'dra ba dang de mi 'dra ba'i ngo bor mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de 'dra ba dang de mi 'dra ba las byung ba'i du ba de 'dra ba dang de mi 'dra ba'i ngo bor mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, smoke that arises from that which is similar and dissimilar to it would not have the nature of that which is similar and dissimilar to that.

original: @280a * // gal te de 'dra ba dang de mi 'dra ba'i ngo bo ni rgyu de 'dra ba dang de mi 'dra ba la ltos nas /
analyzed: @280a * // gal te de 'dra ba dang de mi 'dra ba'i ngo bo ni rgyu de 'dra ba dang de mi 'dra ba la ltos nas /
translated: If you say that the entity that is similar or dissimilar depends on a cause that is similar or dissimilar,

original: 'bras bu skyed pa tsam kho na rgyu la ltos ba yin par 'dod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu skyed pa tsam kho na rgyu la ltos ba yin par 'dod do zhe na /
translated: then the mere production of the effect depends on the cause.

original: rgyu la mi ltos zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rgyu la mi ltos zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: We reply, it is not dependent on the cause.

original: de 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba'i ngo bo dag de dang 'dra ba dang de mi 'dra ba'i rgyu la mi ltos na de dang 'dra ba dang de mi 'dra ba dag rgyu med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba'i ngo bo dag de dang 'dra ba dang de mi 'dra ba'i rgyu la mi ltos na de dang 'dra ba dang de mi 'dra ba dag rgyu med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If the entity that is similar or dissimilar does not depend on a cause that is similar or dissimilar, then that which is similar or dissimilar would be without a cause.

original: de 'dra ba dang de mi 'dra ba'i ngo bo ma byung ba las tha dad pa gzhan 'ga' zhig skye ba ni med do //
analyzed: de 'dra ba dang de mi 'dra ba'i ngo bo ma byung ba las tha dad pa gzhan 'ga' zhig skye ba ni med do //
translated: There is no other arising of an entity that is similar or dissimilar apart from that which is similar or dissimilar.

original: gang la de 'dra ba de mi 'dra ba'i rgyu la mi ltos pa rnams kyang de la ltos par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: gang la de 'dra ba de mi 'dra ba'i rgyu la mi ltos pa rnams kyang de la ltos par 'gyur ro ;
translated: That which is not dependent on a cause that is similar or dissimilar would be dependent on it.

original: / de lta bas na skyed pa smos bas ni de dang 'dra ba dang de mi 'dra ba'i ngo bo nyid brjod do zhes bya'o //
analyzed: / de lta bas na skyed pa smos bas ni de dang 'dra ba dang de mi 'dra ba'i ngo bo nyid brjod do zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the statement ‚Äúproduction‚Äù expresses both the similar and the dissimilar natures.

original: de la rgyu la ltos par khas blangs pa ji ltar de 'dra ba dang de mi 'dra ba rgyu la mi ltos pa yin /
analyzed: de la rgyu la ltos par khas blangs pa ji ltar de 'dra ba dang de mi 'dra ba rgyu la mi ltos pa yin /
translated: How can you maintain that the effect is dependent on causes, yet the similar and dissimilar effects are not dependent on causes?üîΩTherefore, since the collection is both similar and dissimilar, the causes are to be distinguished as having similar and dissimilar natures.

original: de'i phyir tshogs pa ni de 'dra ba dang de mi 'dra ba yin pas rgyu rnams de 'dra ba dang de mi 'dra ba'i ngo bo rnam par dbye bar bya ba yin na gang gis na mi 'dra ba las 'dra bar 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes de ni
analyzed: de'i phyir tshogs pa ni de 'dra ba dang de mi 'dra ba yin pas rgyu rnams de 'dra ba dang de mi 'dra ba'i ngo bo rnam par dbye bar bya ba yin na gang gis na mi 'dra ba las 'dra bar 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes de ni
translated: But how could a dissimilar effect arise from similar causes?

original: bshad zin to //
analyzed: bshad zin to //
translated: This has already been explained.

original: dper na du ba gcig kyang me dang bud shing mtshan nyid mi mthun pa dag las skye bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'bras bu gcig pa yang mi mthun pa'i tshogs pa gzhan las kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: dper na du ba gcig kyang me dang bud shing mtshan nyid mi mthun pa dag las skye bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'bras bu gcig pa yang mi mthun pa'i tshogs pa gzhan las kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: For example, although smoke is one, it arises from fire and fuel, which have dissimilar characteristics. In the same way, although the effect is one, it arises from a collection of dissimilar causes.

original: de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te /
translated: This is illogical.

original: gang gi phyir kho bo cag kyang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa rnams skyed par byed pa nyid sel bar ni mi byed kyi bskyed par bya ba nyid phan tshun mtshan nyid mi mthun pa yang rang gi rgyu yongs su gyur pa las skyes pa'i chos de'i gnas skabs
analyzed: gang gi phyir kho bo cag kyang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa rnams skyed par byed pa nyid sel bar ni mi byed kyi bskyed par bya ba nyid phan tshun mtshan nyid mi mthun pa yang rang gi rgyu yongs su gyur pa las skyes pa'i chos de'i gnas skabs
translated: Because we do not refute that things that are not similar in type are producers, but we do assert that that which is to be produced is definitely the state of a phenomenon that arises from the transformation of its own cause.

original: nges ba'o // de'i 'bras bu gcig pa de ni de dag phan tshun ltos nas bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid du nges pas de dang 'dra ba las de 'dra ba kho na skye bar brjod kyi mi 'dra ba las ma yin te /
analyzed: nges ba'o // de'i 'bras bu gcig pa de ni de dag phan tshun ltos nas bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid du nges pas de dang 'dra ba las de 'dra ba kho na skye bar brjod kyi mi 'dra ba las ma yin te /
translated: That single effect is definitely the nature of that which is produced and that which produces it in dependence on each other. Therefore we say that only that which is similar to it arises from that which is similar to it, not from that which is dissimilar.

original: de ni des bskyed pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: de ni des bskyed pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro//
translated: Because that is the nature produced by it.

original: de med kyang gzhan yod pas de skyed pa nges pa ni mi srid pas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ma nges pa ni mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med kyang gzhan yod pas de skyed pa nges pa ni mi srid pas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ma nges pa ni mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since it is impossible for that to be produced by another even if it does not exist, the relationship of cause and effect is not tenable if it is indefinite.

analyzed: de ltar na de'i phyir de bud shing la sogs pa'i tshogs pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa dang por du ba skyed ba gang yin pa de'i du ba ni dang por du ba skyed ba gang yin pa de'i dbu ba ni dang por me la sogs pa'i tshogs

translated: Thus, the cause is like that and unlike that. The summary of the conclusion that the effect is like that and unlike that is stated by ‚ÄúTherefore,‚Äù etc.

original: ci 'dra ba'i 'bras bu ni ci 'dra ba'i rgyu las rgyu las byung bar mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag gis mthong bas lan cig nges pa de ni de la 'khrul pa med do //

translated: Since the effect that is like that arises from a cause that is like that, and since the effect that is unlike that arises from a cause that is unlike that, one sees by direct perception and non-apprehension that the effect arises from the cause. Thus, the ascertainment once is not mistaken with regard to that.

original: de 'dra ba mi 'dra ba las mi 'byung ste rgyu gang yin pa des na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po grub po //
analyzed: de 'dra ba mi 'dra ba las mi 'byung ste rgyu gang yin pa des na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po grub po //
translated: It does not arise from a cause that is unlike that. Therefore, the fact of cause and effect is established by that cause.

analyzed: de 'dra ba'i 'bras bu ni de 'dra ba'i rgyu kho na las nges par gyur pas /

original: ji skad bshad pa'i rigs pas 'bras bu la rgyus khyab pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i ngo bo grub pa yin no //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i rigs pas 'bras bu la rgyus khyab pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i ngo bo grub pa yin no //
translated: the pervasion of the effect by the cause is established by the reasoning explained above, in terms of the nature of the forward and reverse pervasion.

analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa las byung ba las byung bar mthong ste rgyu rigs mi mthun pa las rgyu dang mi 'dra ba mi skye ba ma yin no zhes don med par bstan pa ni rigs mthun pa'i rgyu las 'bras bu mi skye'o zhes bya ba 'di'i @281a * // don 'dir mngon par 'dod do snyam nas gzhan dag rtsod pa ni gal te rang nyid rigs mi mthun pa las kyang 'bras bu cung zad 'byung ba mthong na /
translated: But it is seen that effects arise from causes of dissimilar type, so it is not the case that effects do not arise from dissimilar causes.üîΩThe meaning of this statement is meaningless, since the meaning of the statement ‚ÄúEffects do not arise from causes of a similar type‚Äù is accepted here.

original: de rigs mi mthun pa las mi skye'o zhes bya ba ji ltar mthong ba dang 'gal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rigs mi mthun pa las mi skye'o zhes bya ba ji ltar mthong ba dang 'gal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one sees that an effect arises from a cause of a dissimilar type, then how could it be contradictory to say that it does not arise from a cause of a dissimilar type?

original: dpe ji lta bu zhe na /üîΩdper na ba lang gi lci ba zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩsogs pa smos bas ni rva dang chu shel la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dpe ji lta bu zhe na / dper na ba lang gi lci ba zhes bya ba smos te / sogs pa smos bas ni rva dang chu shel la sogs pa'o //

original: sha lu ka la sogs pa smos pas ni smyug ma dang chu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sha lu ka la sogs pa smos pas ni smyug ma dang chu la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' gzhan gyi 'khrul bar bstan pa ni rigs mi mthun pa las byung ba ma yin te zhes bya ba smos te /

original: gang gi phyir rgyu gang las 'byung bar mthong ba de dang de ni mi 'dra ba las mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba 'di'i don 'dir brjod par 'dod kyi 'bras bu rigs mi mthun pa las ma yin pa'i phyir de la 'khrul pa med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgyu gang las 'byung bar mthong ba de dang de ni mi 'dra ba las mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba 'di'i don 'dir brjod par 'dod kyi 'bras bu rigs mi mthun pa las ma yin pa'i phyir de la 'khrul pa med do //
translated: Because whatever is seen to arise from a cause, that does not arise from a dissimilar cause. The meaning of this is what is intended here. Since the effect is not from a dissimilar cause, there is no error in that.

original: de ni de lta bu kho na'i zhes bya ba smos te ;
analyzed: de ni de lta bu kho na'i zhes bya ba smos te ;
translated: ‚ÄúThat is just like that‚Äù is stated.

analyzed: ba lang gi lci ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo de dang 'dra ba'i autpala la sogs pa'i dang po'i rgyu mtshan de /
translated: The sign of the entity of cow dung, etc., which is similar to that, is the first cause of the lotus, etc.

original: autpala la sogs pa'i rgyun gyi dang po thog mar rtsom pa'i skad cig ma de'i rgyu yin par grub pas autpala la sogs pa'i rgyun du gyur pa las rgyu tha dad ba mi 'dra bas skyed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: autpala la sogs pa'i rgyun gyi dang po thog mar rtsom pa'i skad cig ma de'i rgyu yin par grub pas autpala la sogs pa'i rgyun du gyur pa las rgyu tha dad ba mi 'dra bas skyed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Since it is established that that is the cause of the first moment of the beginning of the continuum of the lotus, etc., the continuum of the lotus, etc., is not generated from a dissimilar cause that is a different cause from that.

original: thams cad kyi sa de'i tshe dang por ba lang gi lci ba la sogs pa rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyi sa de'i tshe dang por ba lang gi lci ba la sogs pa rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: At that time, the first moment of the sprout is the reason.

original: gang gi tshe rgyun gyi sngon ma'i skad cig ma rgyu mtshan yin pas phyi ma phyi ma'i skad cig ma rnams rgyan gyis bskyed pa'i mtshan nyid du 'jug par 'gyur ba de'i tshe smyug ma las smyug ma 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rgyun gyi sngon ma'i skad cig ma rgyu mtshan yin pas phyi ma phyi ma'i skad cig ma rnams rgyan gyis bskyed pa'i mtshan nyid du 'jug par 'gyur ba de'i tshe smyug ma las smyug ma 'byung ngo //
translated: When the previous moment of the continuum is the reason, the later and later moments arise in the nature of being produced by the continuum. At that time, a bamboo arises from a bamboo.

original: de ni de bzhin du gang gi rgyun rva la sogs pa dag las 'byung ba ni smyug ma de dang 'dra ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni de bzhin du gang gi rgyun rva la sogs pa dag las 'byung ba ni smyug ma de dang 'dra ba ma yin no //
translated: That bamboo is not similar to the bamboo that arises from a bamboo.

translated: Also, because what arises later from that bamboo is not similar to what arises from a bamboo, it is impossible for a dissimilar cause to produce a similar effect. Therefore, the pervasion and counter-pervasion of the effect reason are ascertained.

translated: When you assert that the continuum of the lotus and so on is homogeneous and related to the prior and arises continuously without beginning, then the continuum of cow dung and so on would also be similar.

original: med pas 'khrul pa yin no zhes bstan pa ni yang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: med pas 'khrul pa yin no zhes bstan pa ni yang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore it is mistaken.

original: autpala'i rgyun gang yin pa dang ba lang gi lci ba la sogs pa'i rgyun gang yin pa yang thams cad du rigs mthun pa'i rgyu mtshan dag gis ba lang gi lci ba dang / cig shos las skye ba can gyi autpala ngo bo nyid tha dad pa yod do //
analyzed: autpala'i rgyun gang yin pa dang ba lang gi lci ba la sogs pa'i rgyun gang yin pa yang thams cad du rigs mthun pa'i rgyu mtshan dag gis ba lang gi lci ba dang / cig shos las skye ba can gyi autpala ngo bo nyid tha dad pa yod do //
translated: The statement that the continuum of the lotus and the continuum of cow dung and so on are all homogeneous in every respect is similar to the statement that cow dung and the other arise from the lotus.

original: gal te phan tshun mi 'dra ba nyid kyi gzugs kyi rnam pa tha dad par gyur pa la yang rnam pa mtshungs pa yin na ji ltar mi 'dra ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te phan tshun mi 'dra ba nyid kyi gzugs kyi rnam pa tha dad par gyur pa la yang rnam pa mtshungs pa yin na ji ltar mi 'dra ba yin zhe na /
translated: If the form of a cow and the form of a horse are different in being dissimilar, but they are similar in aspect, how are they dissimilar?

original: dngos po rnams kyi rnam pa mtshungs pa kho na'i zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi rnam pa mtshungs pa kho na'i zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe mere similarity of the aspects of things‚Äù is stated.

original: ni zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir ro //
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThe mere‚Äù means that which is only.

original: de nyid de dang 'dra ba'i rgyu mtshan ni ba lang gi lci ba dang cig shos las skye ba can gyi autpala dag rnam pa mtshungs par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de nyid de dang 'dra ba'i rgyu mtshan ni ba lang gi lci ba dang cig shos las skye ba can gyi autpala dag rnam pa mtshungs par 'gyur gyi /
translated: The reason for that is that the lotuses that arise from cow dung and from something else are similar in aspect.

original: rigs tha dad pa'i rgyu ma yin /
analyzed: rigs tha dad pa'i rgyu ma yin /
translated: But they are not the cause of a single type.

original: 'di ga las she na /
analyzed: 'di ga las she na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rnam pa tha dad pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rnam pa tha dad pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause they are not dissimilar in aspect.‚Äù

original: gang dag rnam pa mtshungs pa nyid kha cig gis dngos po de dag kyang gang las rnam pa las khyad par gzhan gyi sgo nas tha dad par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang dag rnam pa mtshungs pa nyid kha cig gis dngos po de dag kyang gang las rnam pa las khyad par gzhan gyi sgo nas tha dad par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Those things that are similar in aspect are also seen to be different in other ways, from the point of view of their aspects.

original: de'i phyir rnam pa mtshungs pa nyid rigs gcig pa'i rgyu mtshan ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam pa mtshungs pa nyid rigs gcig pa'i rgyu mtshan ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, similarity of aspect is not the reason for a single type.

original: de ltar na rnam pa mtshungs kyang kha cig me tog tha dad pa mthong ste sngon po dang cig shos kyi ku su ma'i zhva mo lta bu'o //
analyzed: de ltar na rnam pa mtshungs kyang kha cig me tog tha dad pa mthong ste sngon po dang cig shos kyi ku su ma'i zhva mo lta bu'o //
translated: Thus, although the forms are the same, some see the flowers as different, like the blue and the other lotus petals.

original: la lar 'bras bu'i sgo nas gzhan pa cig shos kyi karko ta lta bu'o //üîΩla lar ro'i sgo nas gzhan pa dang cig shos kyi ga gon lta bu'o //
analyzed: la lar 'bras bu'i sgo nas gzhan pa cig shos kyi karko ta lta bu'o // la lar ro'i sgo nas gzhan pa dang cig shos kyi ga gon lta bu'o //
translated: Some see them as different in terms of fruit, like the karƒ´ra fruit.üîΩSome see them as different in terms of taste, like the mango and the other mango.

original: la lar dri'i sgo nas shing dang cig shos las byung ba'i tsam pa ka lta bu'o //
analyzed: la lar dri'i sgo nas shing dang cig shos las byung ba'i tsam pa ka lta bu'o //
translated: Some see them as different in terms of smell, like the sandalwood and the other sandalwood.

original: la lar nus pa'i sgo nas reg pa dang zos pa las 'khru ba'i aa ru ra lta bu'o //
analyzed: la lar nus pa'i sgo nas reg pa dang zos pa las 'khru ba'i aa ru ra lta bu'o //
translated: Some see them as different in terms of potency, like the myrobalan that causes purgation when touched or eaten.

original: de'i phyir rnam pa mtshungs pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis gang la de nyid 'di yin no zhes ngo zhes pa skyed pa'i ba lang gi lci ba dang cig shos las skyes pa la autpalar nye bar rtog go //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam pa mtshungs pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis gang la de nyid 'di yin no zhes ngo zhes pa skyed pa'i ba lang gi lci ba dang cig shos las skyes pa la autpalar nye bar rtog go //
translated: Therefore, because of the similarity of form, one thinks that the blue lotus is the same as the other blue lotus that is born from the cow dung.

original: de bzhin du mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i tshogs pa las skyes pa de dag rigs tha dad pa nyid du rtogs par bya ste rigs gcig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i tshogs pa las skyes pa de dag rigs tha dad pa nyid du rtogs par bya ste rigs gcig pa ma yin no //
translated: Likewise, one should understand that those produced from a collection of dissimilar characteristics are of different types, not of one type.

original: de nyid kyi phyir ngo shes pa ni 'khrul pa nyid des de dang 'dra bar brtags pa ni brdzun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ngo shes pa ni 'khrul pa nyid des de dang 'dra bar brtags pa ni brdzun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, recognition is just mistaken, because that which is imagined to be similar to it is false.üîΩIf, from cow dung and other things,

original: gal te ba lang gi lci ba dang cig shos la sogs pa las skyes pa'i @282a * //
analyzed: gal te ba lang gi lci ba dang cig shos la sogs pa las skyes pa'i @282a * //
translated: lotus flowers and so on arise,

original: autpala la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: autpala la sogs pa'am /
translated: or if smoke and so on arise from fire,

original: me las skyes pa'i du ba la sogs pa la du ba ngo shes pa'i dbang gis mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i tshogs pa'i rgyu mtshan can yang mtshungs pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur ba la nyes pa ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: me las skyes pa'i du ba la sogs pa la du ba ngo shes pa'i dbang gis mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i tshogs pa'i rgyu mtshan can yang mtshungs pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur ba la nyes pa ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: then, because of the recognition of smoke, even that which has a dissimilar collection as its cause would have a similar nature. What is wrong with that?

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If it were not so,

original: gal te rigs mthun pa'i mtshan nyid can gang yin pa dang rkyen gzhan dang lhan cig pa'i tshogs pa rigs mthun pa la mi ltos pa'i ba lang gi lci ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo las /üîΩautpala la sogs pa 'am /
analyzed: gal te rigs mthun pa'i mtshan nyid can gang yin pa dang rkyen gzhan dang lhan cig pa'i tshogs pa rigs mthun pa la mi ltos pa'i ba lang gi lci ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo las / autpala la sogs pa 'am /
translated: If the nature of cow dung, etc., which has the characteristic of a homogeneous cause, were to produce lotus flowers, etc.,üîΩor if the nature of smoke, which has the characteristic of fire, fuel, etc., were to produce smoke, etc., from the head of Indra, etc., then,

original: du ba ni me dang bud shing la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can nam brgya byin gyi spyi bo la sogs pa'i ngo bo las du ba'i bdag nyid can yin pa de'i phyir mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i tshogs pa yang mtshan nyid med pas de dang 'dra ba'i 'bras
analyzed: du ba ni me dang bud shing la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can nam brgya byin gyi spyi bo la sogs pa'i ngo bo las du ba'i bdag nyid can yin pa de'i phyir mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i tshogs pa yang mtshan nyid med pas de dang 'dra ba'i 'bras
translated: since the collection of heterogeneous things would be without a characteristic, a homogeneous effect such as smoke would arise from it.

original: bu du ba dang autpala sogs pa skye ba yin na ni de'i tshe rgyu ni tshogs pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: bu du ba dang autpala sogs pa skye ba yin na ni de'i tshe rgyu ni tshogs pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: If that were so, then the cause would be the nature of the collection.

original: tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin pa dag las ni mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa med pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin pa dag las ni mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa med pa'o //
translated: But from a homogeneous and heterogeneous cause, there is neither a homogeneous nor a heterogeneous effect.

original: de dang rigs mthun pa dang rigs mi mthun pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i phyir sna tshogs par grub pa'i don thams cad kyi tshogs tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa dang / rigs mthun pa dang rigs mi mthun pa dag rgyu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dang rigs mthun pa dang rigs mi mthun pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i phyir sna tshogs par grub pa'i don thams cad kyi tshogs tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa dang / rigs mthun pa dang rigs mi mthun pa dag rgyu med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of being of a similar type and a dissimilar type, all things that are established as a variety‚Äîthe collection of different and non-different, similar and dissimilar types‚Äîwould arise without a cause.

original: de'i phyir gang la mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs yod pa de rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis gzugs mtshungs kyang rigs mi mthun pa'i 'bras bu kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang la mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs yod pa de rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis gzugs mtshungs kyang rigs mi mthun pa'i 'bras bu kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, whatever has a dissimilar type, even if it is similar in some way, is only a dissimilar type.

original: gal te me dang bud shing la sogs pa'i tshogs pa tha dad kyang du ba la rigs tha dad pa med par mtshungs par mkhas pas de ma yin pa'i ngo bo dang gzhan la gnas pa gnyi ga la yang mtshungs par rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te me dang bud shing la sogs pa'i tshogs pa tha dad kyang du ba la rigs tha dad pa med par mtshungs par mkhas pas de ma yin pa'i ngo bo dang gzhan la gnas pa gnyi ga la yang mtshungs par rtogs so zhe na /
translated: If you say that although the collection of fire, fuel, and so on is different, since smoke is not a different type, the wise understand that it is similar, both in terms of its nature and in terms of its being based on something else,

original: skyon 'di ni med skad cig ma tha dad pa phra ba la brten pa la nang tshan gyi rigs tha dad kyang rgyun rags pa la brten pa ni rigs mi mthun pa las ldog par mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyon 'di ni med skad cig ma tha dad pa phra ba la brten pa la nang tshan gyi rigs tha dad kyang rgyun rags pa la brten pa ni rigs mi mthun pa las ldog par mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This fault does not exist, because the subtle, different moments are of the same type, but the gross continuum based on them is the same in being the opposite of dissimilar types.

original: khra mo la sogs pa nang tshan gyi rigs tha dad kyang ba lang ma yin pa las ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis ba lang gi rigs dang ba men bzhin no //
analyzed: khra mo la sogs pa nang tshan gyi rigs tha dad kyang ba lang ma yin pa las ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis ba lang gi rigs dang ba men bzhin no //
translated: Even though there are different types of cows, such as the cow with spots, they are the same type of cow because of being the opposite of non-cow.

original: du ba thams cad rigs gcig par rnam par 'jog pa ni nye bar len pa'i rgyu'i skad cig ma tha dad pa yang rnam pa gcig tu shes pa'i rgyu @282b mtshan gyis mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: du ba thams cad rigs gcig par rnam par 'jog pa ni nye bar len pa'i rgyu'i skad cig ma tha dad pa yang rnam pa gcig tu shes pa'i rgyu @282b mtshan gyis mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: All smoke is posited as the same type because of being the same in being the reason for the cognition of one type, even though there are different moments of the substantial cause.

original: gal te dang po 'di bud shing las byung ba ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dang po 'di bud shing las byung ba ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: If it is asked how the first is produced from fuel,

original: ma yin te du ba thams cad ni bud shing gi rigs kyi rjes su byed pas so //
analyzed: ma yin te du ba thams cad ni bud shing gi rigs kyi rjes su byed pas so //
translated: it is not, because all smoke conforms to the type of fuel.

original: de lta na aa ru ra dang ga pur dang tsandan la sogs pa'i rigs tha dad pa'i rjes su byed pa'i du ba de dang lud pa 'byin pa la sogs pa 'joms pa'i rdzas las byas pa'i reng bu'i du ba de ni tha dad pas de'i ro dang
analyzed: de lta na aa ru ra dang ga pur dang tsandan la sogs pa'i rigs tha dad pa'i rjes su byed pa'i du ba de dang lud pa 'byin pa la sogs pa 'joms pa'i rdzas las byas pa'i reng bu'i du ba de ni tha dad pas de'i ro dang
translated: Thus, the smoke that is the effect of a substance that is a different type, such as a≈õoka, camphor, sandalwood, etc., and the smoke that is the effect of a substance that is not a different type, such as a wick made of a substance that expels phlegm, etc., have different tastes,

original: nus pa dang smin pa'i 'bras bu'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nus pa dang smin pa'i 'bras bu'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: potencies, and ripening effects.

original: rigs mi mthun pa'i rgyu las byung ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa'i rgyu las byung ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It does not arise from a cause that is a different type.

original: gang gi phyir rnam pa tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi rigs mthun pa dang rigs mi mthun pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam pa tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi rigs mthun pa dang rigs mi mthun pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a cause that is a different type is neither a homogeneous cause nor a heterogeneous cause.

original: 'bras kyi myu gu la sogs pa de ni sa bon gyi rnam pa'i rjes su mi byed do //
analyzed: 'bras kyi myu gu la sogs pa de ni sa bon gyi rnam pa'i rjes su mi byed do //
translated: A rice sprout, etc., does not conform to the form of a seed,

original: de'i rigs de ni 'bras bu ma yin pa la sogs pa las ldog pa nyams su ma myong ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i rigs de ni 'bras bu ma yin pa la sogs pa las ldog pa nyams su ma myong ba yin no //
translated: because its type is not experienced as being different from a non-effect, etc.

original: de'i phyir bud shing rnams ni de'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu yin la me la sogs pa ni lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen las bye brag tu skyed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir bud shing rnams ni de'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu yin la me la sogs pa ni lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen las bye brag tu skyed do //
translated: Therefore fuel is the substantial cause of fire, and fire and so on are generated as specific effects from cooperative conditions.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i du ba dang myu gu la sogs pa'i 'bras bu tha dad par byas nas skyed pas zhar la byung bas chog go //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i du ba dang myu gu la sogs pa'i 'bras bu tha dad par byas nas skyed pas zhar la byung bas chog go //
translated: Since effects such as smoke and sprouts are generated as specific effects, this is sufficient for the present discussion.

original: 'o na ni gang gi tshe tshogs pa tha dad pas kyang 'bras bu tha mi dad pa de'i tshe rgyu tha dad pa yod kyang de med pas de rgyu med pa can du 'gyur na tha mi dad pa ga las 'ongs pa yin /üîΩdes na gnyi ga yang rgyu med pa can du brjod pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'o na ni gang gi tshe tshogs pa tha dad pas kyang 'bras bu tha mi dad pa de'i tshe rgyu tha dad pa yod kyang de med pas de rgyu med pa can du 'gyur na tha mi dad pa ga las 'ongs pa yin / des na gnyi ga yang rgyu med pa can du brjod pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: But if a different collection of causes generates a different effect, then even if the causes are different, the effect would not exist, and it would be causeless.üîΩTherefore, if both are said to be causeless, the treatise states, ‚ÄúIf a different collection of causes generates a different effect, then even if the causes are different, the effect would not exist, and it would be causeless.‚Äù

original: gal te tshogs pa tha dad pa yod kyang 'bras bu tha dad pa mi skye na de rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te tshogs pa tha dad pa yod kyang 'bras bu tha dad pa mi skye na de rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If a different collection of causes exists but a different effect is not generated, then it would be causeless.

original: de'i rgyur gyur pa med na res 'ga' zhig kyang rgyu dang ldan par 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i rgyur gyur pa med na res 'ga' zhig kyang rgyu dang ldan par 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: If it has no cause, it is not tenable that it sometimes has a cause.

original: de'i tshe thams cad kyi 'bras bu tha dad pa gang yin pa de yang rgyu tha dad pa las yin pa'i phyir tha dad pa med par skyes pa de yang rgyu dang ldan pa ga la yin /
analyzed: de'i tshe thams cad kyi 'bras bu tha dad pa gang yin pa de yang rgyu tha dad pa las yin pa'i phyir tha dad pa med par skyes pa de yang rgyu dang ldan pa ga la yin /
translated: And at that time, if the difference of the effect is due to the difference of the cause, then how could that which is produced without difference have a cause?

original: gal te rgyur gyur pa med pa ni rgyu dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te rgyur gyur pa med pa ni rgyu dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: If that which has no cause does not have a cause,

original: de ltar rgyu med kyang 'byung ba ni rgyu dang ldan par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de ltar rgyu med kyang 'byung ba ni rgyu dang ldan par ga la 'gyur /
translated: then how could that which is produced without a cause have a cause?

original: gal te rgyu tha dad pa nyid kyi tha mi dad pa rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rgyu tha dad pa nyid kyi tha mi dad pa rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not so because the difference of the cause is the reason for the difference,

original: de lta na tha dad pa 'di la la zhig dang ma 'brel par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na tha dad pa 'di la la zhig dang ma 'brel par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then this difference would not be related to something else.

original: 'bras bu dang rtsom la sogs pa @283a * //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang rtsom la sogs pa @283a * //
translated: And the beginning of the effect, etc.

original: yang rgyu tha dad pa'am tha mi dad pa nyid las rgyu mtshan gzhan pa'i khyad par brtag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang rgyu tha dad pa'am tha mi dad pa nyid las rgyu mtshan gzhan pa'i khyad par brtag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: would not be due to a cause, because it is not tenable that they are either different or non-different from the cause.

original: so sor snang ba tha dad pa 'ga' zhig gi 'khrul ba'i rgyu mtshan las don dam par nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so sor snang ba tha dad pa 'ga' zhig gi 'khrul ba'i rgyu mtshan las don dam par nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are ultimately indicated by the reason of the error of some individual appearances.

original: gal te de dag de dang 'dra ba las kyang 'dra ba 'byung bar 'dod pa gang yin pa de'i tha dad pa tha mi dad pa ni rgyu med pa can du 'dod la /
analyzed: gal te de dag de dang 'dra ba las kyang 'dra ba 'byung bar 'dod pa gang yin pa de'i tha dad pa tha mi dad pa ni rgyu med pa can du 'dod la /
translated: If you maintain that what is similar arises from what is similar, then what is different or non-different would be accepted as causeless.

original: dngos po kho na 'ba' zhig rgyu dang ldan pa yin no zhes 'dod do zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po kho na 'ba' zhig rgyu dang ldan pa yin no zhes 'dod do zhe na /
translated: You maintain that only entities possess a cause.üîΩIn response to that, it is said:

original: de la ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Apart from that, etc.

original: tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa las logs shig pa'i dngos po ngo bo ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pas de dag rgyu med pa can nyid kyang rgyu dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa las logs shig pa'i dngos po ngo bo ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pas de dag rgyu med pa can nyid kyang rgyu dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since an entity that is separate from what is different or non-different does not exist at all, those that are causeless would also possess a cause.

original: de ni de nyid dam gzhan nyid dam 'di tha dad pa'am tha mi dad pa'i rnam pa dang 'brel pa med par thal bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: de ni de nyid dam gzhan nyid dam 'di tha dad pa'am tha mi dad pa'i rnam pa dang 'brel pa med par thal bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: That is because it would follow that it would be unrelated to the aspects of sameness, difference, or neither.

original: de la 'brel pa gzhan zhig brtags na ni thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la 'brel pa gzhan zhig brtags na ni thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you examine another relation, then it would follow that there would be an infinite regress.

original: gzhan ma yin na yang tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo dag rang nyid kyi gnas skabs la phan mi 'dogs na gang las 'brel pa yin /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin na yang tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo dag rang nyid kyi gnas skabs la phan mi 'dogs na gang las 'brel pa yin /
translated: If they are not different, then if the entities of difference and non-difference do not benefit their own states, then from what are they related?

original: phan 'dogs par brtags na yang gal te dngos po'i rang bzhin la rang gi bdag nyid kyis tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa 'ga' yang skyed par mi 'dod pa de'i tshe de yod kyang rang bzhin las gzhan pa med pa la gang las tha dad pa
analyzed: phan 'dogs par brtags na yang gal te dngos po'i rang bzhin la rang gi bdag nyid kyis tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa 'ga' yang skyed par mi 'dod pa de'i tshe de yod kyang rang bzhin las gzhan pa med pa la gang las tha dad pa
translated: If you imagine that they benefit, then if you do not assert that the nature of an entity is produced by itself as either different or non-different, then even if it exists, since it is not different from the nature, from what is the entity of difference or non-difference?

original: dang tha mi dad pa'i dngos po'i ngo bor 'gyur na yang tha dad pa'i stobs kyis dngos po las tha dad pa dang tha mi dad par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dang tha mi dad pa'i dngos po'i ngo bor 'gyur na yang tha dad pa'i stobs kyis dngos po las tha dad pa dang tha mi dad par bstan pa'o //
translated: Even though it is taught that the entity is different or non-different by the power of difference, it is not different from the nature.

original: de yang gal te tha dad pa de'i tshe dngos po'i ngo bo'i gnas skabs kho na yin te de'i ngo bo la tha dad pa dang / tha mi dad pa 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang gal te tha dad pa de'i tshe dngos po'i ngo bo'i gnas skabs kho na yin te de'i ngo bo la tha dad pa dang / tha mi dad pa 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If they are different, then they are just the states of the entity‚Äôs nature, because the nature of that entity is neither different nor non-different.

original: slar yang de'i dbang gis tha dad pa dang tha mi dad par brtags pa'i dngos po de'i gnas skabs sam gnas skabs ma yin pa tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa dag go //
analyzed: slar yang de'i dbang gis tha dad pa dang tha mi dad par brtags pa'i dngos po de'i gnas skabs sam gnas skabs ma yin pa tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa dag go //
translated: Again, by the power of that, the entity is imagined to be different or non-different, and its states or non-states are different or non-different.

original: yang na tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa de'i tshe dngos po'i ngo bo tha dad pa dang tha mi dad par byas so zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa de'i tshe dngos po'i ngo bo tha dad pa dang tha mi dad par byas so zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Or, if they are different or non-different, then the entity‚Äôs nature is made different or non-different.

original: de'i ngo bo las gzhan pa'i rgyu mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo las gzhan pa'i rgyu mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible for a cause to be different from its nature.

original: de rgyu gzhan nyid las phyis byung ba ni /
analyzed: de rgyu gzhan nyid las phyis byung ba ni /
translated: If it arises later from another cause,

original: de las gzhan pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: it would be different from that.

original: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid kyi byed pa @283b ma yin te de'i rang gi rgyu nyid ldog pas so //
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid kyi byed pa @283b ma yin te de'i rang gi rgyu nyid ldog pas so //
translated: It is not the activity of the entity‚Äôs nature, because its own cause is stopped.

original: rang gi rgyu kho na las dngos po ngo bo res 'ga' zhig tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i bdag nyid du skye bar brtag na /
analyzed: rang gi rgyu kho na las dngos po ngo bo res 'ga' zhig tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i bdag nyid du skye bar brtag na /
translated: If you imagine that a thing arises from its own cause, sometimes as a different nature and sometimes as an undifferentiated nature,

original: tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa la ma gtogs pa ni don med do /
analyzed: tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa la ma gtogs pa ni don med do /
translated: then, apart from being different or undifferentiated, it is meaningless.

original: tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i blo yang de nyid kyis grub bo //
analyzed: tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i blo yang de nyid kyis grub bo //
translated: The cognition of difference and non-difference is established by that alone.

original: de'i phyir bye brag pa la sogs pas brtags pa'i tha dad pa dang / tha mi dad pa'i bye brag gi spyi'i bdag nyid ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bye brag pa la sogs pas brtags pa'i tha dad pa dang / tha mi dad pa'i bye brag gi spyi'i bdag nyid ni mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, the nature of the universal, which is imagined by the Vai≈õe·π£ikas and others as different or undifferentiated, is unreasonable.

original: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid kho na tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i sgrar brjod do //
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid kho na tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i sgrar brjod do //
translated: The nature of a thing itself is expressed by the words ‚Äúdifferent‚Äù and ‚Äúundifferentiated.‚Äù

original: de dag rgyu med pa nyid kyis dngos po'i ngo bo nyid rgyu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag rgyu med pa nyid kyis dngos po'i ngo bo nyid rgyu med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because they are causeless, the nature of a thing would be causeless.

original: de'i phyir dngos po rnams rgyu med pa can yin pa'i phyir rtag tu yod pa 'am med pa zhig tu 'gyur te rgyu med pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po rnams rgyu med pa can yin pa'i phyir rtag tu yod pa 'am med pa zhig tu 'gyur te rgyu med pa ni /
translated: Therefore, because things are without a cause, they would either always exist or never exist, because a causeless thing

original: gal te dngos po rnams res 'ga' zhig yod pa dus thams cad du yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te dngos po rnams res 'ga' zhig yod pa dus thams cad du yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If things sometimes exist, they would always exist.

original: yang na res 'ga' zhig med pa de yang dus thams cad du 'gyur gyi res 'ga' zhig yod pa ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: yang na res 'ga' zhig med pa de yang dus thams cad du 'gyur gyi res 'ga' zhig yod pa ni mi rigs so //
translated: Or, if they sometimes do not exist, they would always not exist. It is not reasonable that they sometimes exist.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: rgyur gyur pa la res 'ga' zhig kyang ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyur gyur pa la res 'ga' zhig kyang ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not reasonable that they sometimes depend on a cause.

original: gang gi phyir ltos pa ni rgyu yod na yod la med na med pa gang yin pa de ni ltos pa ste res 'ga' ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ltos pa ni rgyu yod na yod la med na med pa gang yin pa de ni ltos pa ste res 'ga' ba'o //
translated: Because that which exists when the cause exists and does not exist when the cause does not exist is dependent, that is, occasional.

original: res 'ga' ba'i dngos po ni rigs gzhan ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: res 'ga' ba'i dngos po ni rigs gzhan ni ma yin no ;
translated: An occasional thing is not a different type.

original: / de'i phyir mtshan nyid mi mthun pa las mtshan nyid mi mthun pa med pa'i 'bras bu skyed par khas blangs pa la ji skad bshad pa'i rigs pas rgyu med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / de'i phyir mtshan nyid mi mthun pa las mtshan nyid mi mthun pa med pa'i 'bras bu skyed par khas blangs pa la ji skad bshad pa'i rigs pas rgyu med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is accepted that a result that is not occasional arises from a cause that is not occasional. As explained, the consequence is that it would arise without a cause.

original: slar yang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs las mtshan nyid mi mthun pa med pa'i 'bras bu skyed pa'i skyon gzhan yang bsgrub par bya ba smos te /
analyzed: slar yang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs las mtshan nyid mi mthun pa med pa'i 'bras bu skyed pa'i skyon gzhan yang bsgrub par bya ba smos te /
translated: Again, another fault is established, that of the effect of the absence of the absence of the property of the subject being produced from the side that is not similar to the property of the subject.

original: so sor nges pa'i bsgrub par bya ba rnams ni bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: so sor nges pa'i bsgrub par bya ba rnams ni bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The individual objects to be established are such things as pots and cloth.

original: sgrub par byed pa ni 'jim pa la sogs pa rnams 'jig rten pa nye bar sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa ni 'jim pa la sogs pa rnams 'jig rten pa nye bar sbyor ba'o //
translated: The means of establishing them are such things as clay and so on, which are applied by the world.

original: bum pa la sogs pa don du gnyer ba 'jim pa'i gong bu la sogs pa de la nges par sbyor ro //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa don du gnyer ba 'jim pa'i gong bu la sogs pa de la nges par sbyor ro //
translated: Those who seek pots and so on are definitely applied to those such as lumps of clay.

original: snal ma las snam bu don du gnyer gyi snal ma yang ma yin 'jim pa'i gong bu yang ma yin pas der mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snal ma las snam bu don du gnyer gyi snal ma yang ma yin 'jim pa'i gong bu yang ma yin pas der mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They seek cloth from thread, not from thread and not from lumps of clay, so that would not occur.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rgyu'i nus pa zhes bya ba smos te tshogs pa gang gis nus pa'i bdag nyid du phul du byung @284a * //
analyzed: rgyu'i nus pa zhes bya ba smos te tshogs pa gang gis nus pa'i bdag nyid du phul du byung @284a * //
translated: It is said, ‚Äúthe power of the cause,‚Äù that is, the collection that is the nature of the power.

original: ba'i mtshan nyid de dang de ni so sor nges pa 'ga' zhig gi tshogs pa kha cig gis 'bras bu la nye bar sbyor gyi gzhan gyis ni de lta bu'i ngo bo ma yin no //
analyzed: ba'i mtshan nyid de dang de ni so sor nges pa 'ga' zhig gi tshogs pa kha cig gis 'bras bu la nye bar sbyor gyi gzhan gyis ni de lta bu'i ngo bo ma yin no //
translated: That is the definition of a cause. It is a collection of some particular things that are connected to the effect, not others that are not like that.

original: gang gi phyir sa la sogs pa cung zad cig gis bum ba la sogs pa 'ba' zhig sgrub par byed pas khyad par du byed kyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sa la sogs pa cung zad cig gis bum ba la sogs pa 'ba' zhig sgrub par byed pas khyad par du byed kyi /
translated: Because only a certain amount of earth, etc. is the cause of a vase, etc.

original: gzhan ni de dang mtshan nyid mthun pa snal ma la sogs pa las ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni de dang mtshan nyid mthun pa snal ma la sogs pa las ma yin no //
translated: It is not the other things that are similar to it, such as cotton.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'jim pa la sogs pa de nyid bum pa la sogs pa de la nus par rung ba'i phyir dang gzhan ni de kho na la mi nus so //
analyzed: 'jim pa la sogs pa de nyid bum pa la sogs pa de la nus par rung ba'i phyir dang gzhan ni de kho na la mi nus so //
translated: Because that very earth, etc. is suitable as the cause of that vase, etc. and the other is not.

original: gal te ci'i phyir de nyid kyis de la nus kyi gzhan gyis ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ci'i phyir de nyid kyis de la nus kyi gzhan gyis ma yin zhe na /
translated: If it is asked why only that is the cause of that and not the other,

original: de gnyis zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de gnyis zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it is said that those twoüîΩare mutually dependent.

original: sa la sogs pa dang snal ma la sogs pa de skyed pa'i ngo bo nyid bum pa la sogs pa skyed pa'i ngo bo nyid dang cig shos kyi ngo bo nyid kyis bum pa la sogs pa skyed pa tha dad pa'i phyir gzhan nyid ni med pas so
analyzed: sa la sogs pa dang snal ma la sogs pa de skyed pa'i ngo bo nyid bum pa la sogs pa skyed pa'i ngo bo nyid dang cig shos kyi ngo bo nyid kyis bum pa la sogs pa skyed pa tha dad pa'i phyir gzhan nyid ni med pas so
translated: Because the nature of the clay, etc., and the nature of the thread, etc., are different from the nature of the production of the pot, etc., and from the nature of the production of the other, the pot, etc., are not different.

original: // 'jim pa la sogs pa dang snal ma la sogs pa'i ngo bo de las gzhan pa des bskyed pa'i cig shos kyi ngo bo ma yin no //
analyzed: // 'jim pa la sogs pa dang snal ma la sogs pa'i ngo bo de las gzhan pa des bskyed pa'i cig shos kyi ngo bo ma yin no //
translated: The nature of the clay, etc., and the nature of the thread, etc., are not different from that which produces the other.

original: gang gi tshe tshogs pa phan tshun mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i nus pa so sor nges pa mi 'dod na mtshan nyid mi mthun pa las kyang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa med pa'i 'bras bu khas blangs pas de'i ngo bo ma yin pa mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba
analyzed: gang gi tshe tshogs pa phan tshun mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i nus pa so sor nges pa mi 'dod na mtshan nyid mi mthun pa las kyang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa med pa'i 'bras bu khas blangs pas de'i ngo bo ma yin pa mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba
translated: When one does not assert that the capacity of the collection is individually ascertained and has a different characteristic, then one accepts that even from a dissimilar characteristic there is a dissimilar effect. Therefore, even from a dissimilar nature,

original: las kyang 'du ba la sogs pa skyed pa'i ngo bor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las kyang 'du ba la sogs pa skyed pa'i ngo bor 'gyur ro //
translated: an effect with a similar nature would arise.

original: me dang bud shing la sogs pa'i rgyu'i tshogs pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i brgya byin gyis spyi bo la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: me dang bud shing la sogs pa'i rgyu'i tshogs pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i brgya byin gyis spyi bo la sogs pa'am /
translated: The definition of the collection of causes such as fire and fuel is not the same as the definition of Indra‚Äôs crown jewel, etc.

original: skad cig ma la brten pa'i du ba ni med dang bud shing gi tshogs pa las kyang byung yang du ba de'i skad cig ma skyed par 'dod na de skyed par nus pa nges pa med pa brjod par 'dod de /
analyzed: skad cig ma la brten pa'i du ba ni med dang bud shing gi tshogs pa las kyang byung yang du ba de'i skad cig ma skyed par 'dod na de skyed par nus pa nges pa med pa brjod par 'dod de /
translated: Or, even if smoke arises from the collection of fire and fuel, if you assert that the production of the moment of smoke is not from the collection of fire and fuel, then you assert that it is not certain that it is able to produce that.

original: du ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu skyed pa'i nus pa so sor nges pa med pas so //
analyzed: du ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu skyed pa'i nus pa so sor nges pa med pas so //
translated: Because there is no certainty in the ability to produce the effect such as smoke, etc.

original: pas zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir te ci yang rung ba'i 'bras bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pas zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir te ci yang rung ba'i 'bras bur 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means ‚Äúfor that reason,‚Äù and ‚Äúany effect‚Äù would arise.

original: rgyu gang yang rung ba las 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu gang yang rung ba las 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: It would arise from any cause whatsoever.

original: ji ltar mthong ba dang ji ltar ma mthong ba'i thams cad las thams cad skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar mthong ba dang ji ltar ma mthong ba'i thams cad las thams cad skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that everything would arise from everything, both what is seen and what is not seen.

original: de'i phyir nus @284b pa so sor nges pa'i rgyu rnams khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir nus @284b pa so sor nges pa'i rgyu rnams khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, you must accept that causes are individually restricted in their potency.

original: de'i phyir mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs las 'bras bu 'ga' zhig las mtshungs na ni 'dra ba'i nye bar mtshon pas kyang mi 'dra ba yin pas thams cad du de dang 'dra ba rnam pa de lta bu'i skye bar grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs las 'bras bu 'ga' zhig las mtshungs na ni 'dra ba'i nye bar mtshon pas kyang mi 'dra ba yin pas thams cad du de dang 'dra ba rnam pa de lta bu'i skye bar grub bo //
translated: Thus, if an effect arises from a collection of causes and conditions that are dissimilar in type, then even though the effect is similar to the cause that is similar to it, it is dissimilar to the cause that is dissimilar to it. Thus, it is established that the effect is like that cause in every way.

original: gal te mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i tshogs pa las kyang de'i 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid skyed par nus pa mtshungs pa'i phyir de'i 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i tshogs pa las kyang de'i 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid skyed par nus pa mtshungs pa'i phyir de'i 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If an effect arises from a collection of causes and conditions that are dissimilar in type, then the effect would be similar to the cause that is similar to it, because the potency to generate the effect is the same.

original: 'ga' zhig las de bzhin du 'byung ba ni ji skad bshad pa'i skyon gyi skabs su 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig las de bzhin du 'byung ba ni ji skad bshad pa'i skyon gyi skabs su 'gyur ro zhe na /
