translated: If the effect arises from a cause that is dissimilar to it, then the error stated previously would occur.

original: de skyed par nus pa mtshungs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de skyed par nus pa mtshungs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúThe potency to generate the effect is the same,‚Äù and so on.

original: re zhig 'dir phyogs snga mas du ba de ma yin pa las skye ba'i ngo bo ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i skyon khas blangs pa ni bshad zin to //üîΩci 'dra ba'i me'i lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen de la rag las ba ni bud shing gi 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin tha dad pa'i rgyu'i nus pa'i bdag nyid du phul du byung ba de 'dra ba'am brgya byin gyi spyi bo la sogs pa'o //üîΩgang gi tshe de'i tshogs pa las skye ba'i du ba mtshan nyid mi mthun pa las nus pa'i bdag nyid phul du byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu skyed pa yin pa de'i tshe de nus pa mtshungs pa ni de nyid yin pas me dang bud shing la
analyzed: re zhig 'dir phyogs snga mas du ba de ma yin pa las skye ba'i ngo bo ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i skyon khas blangs pa ni bshad zin to // ci 'dra ba'i me'i lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen de la rag las ba ni bud shing gi 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin tha dad pa'i rgyu'i nus pa'i bdag nyid du phul du byung ba de 'dra ba'am brgya byin gyi spyi bo la sogs pa'o // gang gi tshe de'i tshogs pa las skye ba'i du ba mtshan nyid mi mthun pa las nus pa'i bdag nyid phul du byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu skyed pa yin pa de'i tshe de nus pa mtshungs pa ni de nyid yin pas me dang bud shing la
translated: The opponent has already accepted the error that the arising of smoke is not from what is not fire, and so forth.üîΩThe nature of the fuel, etc., that is dependent on the conditions that are the simultaneous factors of fire is the nature of the cause that is the transformation of the fuel, etc., and is the nature of the effect that is the superior capacity.üîΩWhen smoke arises from the assembly of those factors, it is an effect that has a different nature from its cause, and it is an effect that has a superior capacity for its own nature.

original: sogs pa nyid las gzhan du brjod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sogs pa nyid las gzhan du brjod pa ma yin te /
translated: At that time, since the capacity of the cause is the same as that of the effect, it is not said that the effect is different from the cause, such as fire and fuel.

original: de dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa dang / de dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa med pa'i bdag nyid phul du byung ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa dang / de dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa med pa'i bdag nyid phul du byung ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is impossible for there to be an entity that is not similar to that and that is not dissimilar to that.

original: de nyid me dang bud shing la sogs pa'i 'gyur ba las dang po du ba skyed pa ma yin te de yang bud shing gang me la rag las pa'i 'gyur bas du ba rang gi rigs kyi rjes su byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid me dang bud shing la sogs pa'i 'gyur ba las dang po du ba skyed pa ma yin te de yang bud shing gang me la rag las pa'i 'gyur bas du ba rang gi rigs kyi rjes su byed pa yin te /
translated: That itself is not the cause of smoke, etc., because it is not the cause of the initial production of smoke, etc. Moreover, that fuel which is dependent on fire is transformed by the transformation of the fire and conforms to its own class.

original: gal te brgya byin gyi spyi bo la sogs pa yang de lta bu'i ngo bor khas blangs pa de'i tshe 'ba' zhig la rtsod pa med par 'gyur ba'i don du khas blang bar bya ba de bzhin du brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te brgya byin gyi spyi bo la sogs pa yang de lta bu'i ngo bor khas blangs pa de'i tshe 'ba' zhig la rtsod pa med par 'gyur ba'i don du khas blang bar bya ba de bzhin du brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If you accept that the head of Indra, etc., are also of that nature, then you should accept that there is no dispute about that, because you have stated that it is just so.

original: gang gi phyir de lta bas na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir te du ba la sogs pa 'bras bur lan cig mthong ba mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag gis nges pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta bas na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir te du ba la sogs pa 'bras bur lan cig mthong ba mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag gis nges pa ste /
translated: Because of that, therefore, the cause of smoke, etc., is not just that, because the cause of smoke, etc., is ascertained by direct perception and non-apprehension of the mere occasional seeing of smoke, etc., as the effect.

original: de ma yin pa'i ngo bo las ldog pa'i @285a * //
analyzed: de ma yin pa'i ngo bo las ldog pa'i @285a * //
translated: But there is no error in the case of a cause that is the nature of something other than that,

original: bdag nyid kyi rgyu bud shing la sogs pa'i rgyun la ltos pa'am skad cig ma la ltos pa la 'khrul pa med de /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi rgyu bud shing la sogs pa'i rgyun la ltos pa'am skad cig ma la ltos pa la 'khrul pa med de /
translated: because it is not related to the continuum of fuel, etc., as a cause, nor is it related to the moment.

original: de dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not similar to that.

original: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa nges par grub pa'i phyir gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa nges par grub pa'i phyir gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: The pervasion and the counter-pervasion are established by the inference of effect, so it is not otherwise.

original: gtan tshigs thigs pa'i 'grel pa bram ze aa tsa tas rnam par sbyar ba 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi dbang du byas ba le'u gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: gtan tshigs thigs pa'i 'grel pa bram ze aa tsa tas rnam par sbyar ba 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi dbang du byas ba le'u gnyis pa'o /
translated: This is the second chapter of the commentary on the Tattva·π≠ƒ´kƒÅ composed by the brahmin A≈õvajit, which is based on the inference of effect.

original: // / de ltar 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs de ni gang dang gang las lhan cig skye bar mngon sum dang mi dmigs pas mthong ba de dang dra bar thams cad du yin gyi /
analyzed: // / de ltar 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs de ni gang dang gang las lhan cig skye bar mngon sum dang mi dmigs pas mthong ba de dang dra bar thams cad du yin gyi /
translated: Thus, that effect-inferential reason is in all cases where co-arising is seen by direct perception and non-apprehension,

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i skye ba rigs mi mthun pa las kyang 'bras bu gsal bar mi byed do //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i skye ba rigs mi mthun pa las kyang 'bras bu gsal bar mi byed do //
translated: but it does not clarify the effect even from a dissimilar type of arising.

original: dngos po 'ga' zhig la khyab pa mthong bas rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa grub pa yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: dngos po 'ga' zhig la khyab pa mthong bas rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa grub pa yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: It is shown that by seeing the pervasion of some things, the positive and negative concomitance is established.

original: mi dmigs pa yang ji skad bshad pa'i rgyu mtshan gzhan med par bstan pa dang 'brel pas rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa la log par rtog pa med do //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa yang ji skad bshad pa'i rgyu mtshan gzhan med par bstan pa dang 'brel pas rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa la log par rtog pa med do //
translated: And since non-apprehension is related to the teaching of the absence of other reasons as they have been explained, there is no misconception of the positive and negative concomitance.

original: 'dir rang gi ngo bo nyid las gzhan dag log par rtog pa de lta na yang dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa'i dngos po cam mi dmigs pas ni med par 'gag pa'i bdag nyid tshad ma gzhan gyis rtogs par bya bar dbang 'phyug sde la sogs pa khaüîΩcig 'dod do //
analyzed: 'dir rang gi ngo bo nyid las gzhan dag log par rtog pa de lta na yang dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa'i dngos po cam mi dmigs pas ni med par 'gag pa'i bdag nyid tshad ma gzhan gyis rtogs par bya bar dbang 'phyug sde la sogs pa kha cig 'dod do //
translated: Here, although there is a misconception of otherness from the intrinsic reality, still, some, such as the V·πõ·π£alƒ´s, assert that the mere non-apprehension of an entity that is the object of apprehension is to be understood by another valid cognition that has the nature of a negation.

original: gzhan yang dgag bar bya ba'i yul gyi shes pa'i ngo bo yongs su gyur pa'i bdag nyid dam /
analyzed: gzhan yang dgag bar bya ba'i yul gyi shes pa'i ngo bo yongs su gyur pa'i bdag nyid dam /
translated: Moreover, some assert that it is the nature of the transformation of the consciousness that has the object of negation.

original: de las gzhan pa'i dngos po yul can gyi rnam par shes pa nyid las med par rtogs pa ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gi tshad ma las gzhan du dpyad ba brjod do //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i dngos po yul can gyi rnam par shes pa nyid las med par rtogs pa ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gi tshad ma las gzhan du dpyad ba brjod do //
translated: It is said that apart from the consciousness that has an object that is a different entity from itself, there is no other valid knowledge, such as perception and inference, that analyzes whether or not it exists.

original: dngos po gzhan pa'i yul can gyi rnam par shes pa ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas med par rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po gzhan pa'i yul can gyi rnam par shes pa ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas med par rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: A consciousness that has an object that is a different entity from itself is not understood to be nonexistent by perception and inference.

original: de ni dngos po'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni dngos po'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it has an object that is a thing.

original: dngos po med pa dang ldan pa dang med do zhes shes pa skyed pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po med pa'i tshad mar brjod pa 'thob ste /
analyzed: dngos po med pa dang ldan pa dang med do zhes shes pa skyed pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po med pa'i tshad mar brjod pa 'thob ste /
translated: That which generates the cognition ‚ÄúIt does not exist‚Äù in regard to something that possesses nonexistence is said to be the valid knowledge of nonexistence.

original: dper na dbang po rang gi yul rtogs pa skyed par byed pa nyid kyis mngon sum du brjod pa de bzhin du gzhan gyi dngos po'i mtshan nyid dam shes pa'i @285b mtshan nyid mi dmigs pas med pa kho na sgrub par byed par smra'i /
analyzed: dper na dbang po rang gi yul rtogs pa skyed par byed pa nyid kyis mngon sum du brjod pa de bzhin du gzhan gyi dngos po'i mtshan nyid dam shes pa'i @285b mtshan nyid mi dmigs pas med pa kho na sgrub par byed par smra'i /
translated: For example, just as the sense faculties are said to be perception because they generate the understanding of their own objects, in the same way, it is said that nonapprehension establishes the mere nonexistence of the characteristic of another thing or the characteristic of consciousness.

original: med pa'i tha snyad ni ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa'i tha snyad ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the term ‚Äúnon-existent.‚Äù

original: mi dmigs pa'i rtags kyis dngos po med pa grub pas rang nyid kho na tha snyad la 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i rtags kyis dngos po med pa grub pas rang nyid kho na tha snyad la 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Since the non-existence of something is established by the evidence of non-apprehension, the term ‚Äúnon-existent‚Äù is used only in that sense.

original: rig pa can yang med pa 'ba' zhig shes ba kho na yin gyi yul la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i shes pa de ma thag tu byung ba'i mngon sum ni gzhan med pa la tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: rig pa can yang med pa 'ba' zhig shes ba kho na yin gyi yul la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i shes pa de ma thag tu byung ba'i mngon sum ni gzhan med pa la tshad ma yin te /
translated: The NaiyƒÅyikas say that the cognition of non-existence alone is the means of valid knowledge, but the direct perception that immediately precedes the cognition of the object, etc., is not a means of valid knowledge.

original: ci yang ma yin par yongs su bcad pa'i bdag nyid du brjod de de nyid bum pa la sogs pa dgag pa'i mi dmigs pa'i sgras brjod pa la 'gal ba med do zhe na /
analyzed: ci yang ma yin par yongs su bcad pa'i bdag nyid du brjod de de nyid bum pa la sogs pa dgag pa'i mi dmigs pa'i sgras brjod pa la 'gal ba med do zhe na /
translated: They say that it is the means of valid knowledge that determines the nature of something as being nothing at all, and that it is that which is expressed by the term ‚Äúnon-apprehension‚Äù that is the negation of a pot, etc.

original: de nyid mi dmigs pa las tha dad par gyur pa'i blo yis rgol ba na /
analyzed: de nyid mi dmigs pa las tha dad par gyur pa'i blo yis rgol ba na /
translated: When the NaiyƒÅyikas argue that non-apprehension is different from the mind,

original: de tshar gcad pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin gyi ngo bo bstan pa ni dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa'i mi dmigs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de tshar gcad pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin gyi ngo bo bstan pa ni dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa'i mi dmigs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: in order to refute them, the nature of non-apprehension is taught: ‚ÄúThe non-apprehension of what is apprehensible . . .‚Äù

original: dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur ba ni dmigs pa'i rkyen gzhan te /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur ba ni dmigs pa'i rkyen gzhan te /
translated: The other condition, the objective condition, is that which becomes the objective support of the cognition.

original: rgyu dang de ma thag pa dang bdag po'i rkyen gyi ming can ma lus pa dang dmigs pa'i rkyen rang bzhin khyad par can yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang de ma thag pa dang bdag po'i rkyen gyi ming can ma lus pa dang dmigs pa'i rkyen rang bzhin khyad par can yin no //
translated: All the conditions, the causal condition, the immediately preceding condition, and the dominant condition, and the objective condition, which is a special nature, are included in this.

original: rang bzhin gang yin pa de yod la dmigs pa'i rkyen gzhan yang yod na mngon sum kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gang yin pa de yod la dmigs pa'i rkyen gzhan yang yod na mngon sum kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the nature exists and the other objective condition exists, then it is just direct perception.

original: de lta bu'i ngo bo la bstan bcos byed pa gzhan rig pa can la sogs pas bshad pa'i log par rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir de dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa smos so //
analyzed: de lta bu'i ngo bo la bstan bcos byed pa gzhan rig pa can la sogs pas bshad pa'i log par rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir de dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa smos so //
translated: In order to eliminate the false conceptions of other philosophers, such as the NaiyƒÅyikas, who explain the nature of direct perception in this way, he says, ‚Äúthat which becomes the objective support of the cognition.‚Äù

original: chen po nyid dang du ma'i rdzas dang ldan pa dang gzugs can gyi rdzas rnams su smra ba dang / chen po du ma'i rdzas dang ldan pa nyid kyi ngo bo med pa ni dmigs su rung bar brjod pa de ltar na dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa las mi dmigs pa yod kyang dngos po srid pas na med pa'i tha snyad sgrub pa las ma nges par
analyzed: chen po nyid dang du ma'i rdzas dang ldan pa dang gzugs can gyi rdzas rnams su smra ba dang / chen po du ma'i rdzas dang ldan pa nyid kyi ngo bo med pa ni dmigs su rung bar brjod pa de ltar na dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa las mi dmigs pa yod kyang dngos po srid pas na med pa'i tha snyad sgrub pa las ma nges par
translated: and it is said that the great elements are substances that possess many parts, and that the physical substances are substances that possess many parts.üîΩBut the nonexistence of the nature of the great elements that possess many parts is not a suitable object of apprehension. Thus, although there is nonapprehension of what is suitable to appear, it is possible that things exist. Therefore, it is said that the nonexistence of the great elements is not ascertained by the proof of the term nonexistence.

original: brjod do // dmigs kyang gzhan gyi chen po nyid dang du ma'i rdzas nyid dang gzugs ni dmigs par rung ba ma yin pa dang yod pa ma yin pas de tsam gyi mi dmigs pas kyang med pa'i tha snyad du de la byed par mi nus so //
analyzed: brjod do // dmigs kyang gzhan gyi chen po nyid dang du ma'i rdzas nyid dang gzugs ni dmigs par rung ba ma yin pa dang yod pa ma yin pas de tsam gyi mi dmigs pas kyang med pa'i tha snyad du de la byed par mi nus so //
translated: Even though the great elements are apprehended, the existence of the nature of the many parts and the physical form is not suitable to appear. Since it does not exist, the mere nonapprehension of that cannot be said to be the proof of the term nonexistence.

original: bshad pa byed pas gang smras pa rjes su dpag pas dmigs par bya ba dang mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa'i gtan tshigs kyi dngos po med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bshad pa byed pas gang smras pa rjes su dpag pas dmigs par bya ba dang mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa'i gtan tshigs kyi dngos po med pa ma yin te /
translated: The author of the commentary says that the object of inference is not nonexistent, because it is a reason that is perceptible and nonapprehended.

original: dbang bo nyid dang @286a * //
analyzed: dbang bo nyid dang @286a * //
translated: The great elements are not nonexistent, because they are the cause of the sense faculties.

original: pags pa la sogs pa bzhin du mig dang rjes su dpag pas thob par byed pa ni /
analyzed: pags pa la sogs pa bzhin du mig dang rjes su dpag pas thob par byed pa ni /
translated: Just like skin, etc., the eye is established by inference.

original: mig gi 'od zer du nye bar dmigs pa de ni mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa yin na ji ltar med pa'i tha snyad sgrub par byed pa yin /
analyzed: mig gi 'od zer du nye bar dmigs pa de ni mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa yin na ji ltar med pa'i tha snyad sgrub par byed pa yin /
translated: The light rays of the eye are perceived, and that is direct perception. How can it establish the term ‚Äúnonexistent‚Äù?

original: de dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa'i mi dmigs pa med pa'i tha snyad du byed pa la ma nges par rigs pa can brjod de dgag pa'i phyir dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa'i phyin ci ma log pa bstan bcos mdzad pas bstan pas gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa'i mi dmigs pa med pa'i tha snyad du byed pa la ma nges par rigs pa can brjod de dgag pa'i phyir dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa'i phyin ci ma log pa bstan bcos mdzad pas bstan pas gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The logicians say that the nonperception of that which is perceptible is uncertain, and in order to refute that, the author of the treatise teaches the nonperception of that which is perceptible without error.

original: de lta na dmigs pa'i rkyen gzhan mtha' dag dang / rang bzhin khyad par can ji skad bshad pa ni dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur par brjod do //
analyzed: de lta na dmigs pa'i rkyen gzhan mtha' dag dang / rang bzhin khyad par can ji skad bshad pa ni dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur par brjod do //
translated: Thus, all other conditions of perception and the special nature, as previously explained, are said to be perceptible.

original: du ma'i rdzas dang ldan pa nyid la sogs pa med pa de srid du 'khrul pa'i go skabs ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: du ma'i rdzas dang ldan pa nyid la sogs pa med pa de srid du 'khrul pa'i go skabs ga la 'gyur /
translated: As long as there is no substance with many parts, how can there be an opportunity for error?

original: dngos po yod pa la de mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa la de mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible for an existent thing to be so.

original: chen po nyid la sogs pa ni mi srid par dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa'i sgrar brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: chen po nyid la sogs pa ni mi srid par dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa'i sgrar brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: And it is not tenable that ‚Äúgreatness‚Äù and so on are the observed objects of a non-existent consciousness.

original: gzugs la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i rdzas de'i snang bas dben pa'i rnam pa gzhan rang gi shes pa la snang ba med do //üîΩsnang ba med pa ma yin pa ni bdag nyid kyi ngo bo ma yin pas tha dad pa'i ngo bor mngon sum gyis nyams su myong bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir de'i yod pa dang chen po nyid la sogs pa 'di srid pa ga la yin /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i rdzas de'i snang bas dben pa'i rnam pa gzhan rang gi shes pa la snang ba med do // snang ba med pa ma yin pa ni bdag nyid kyi ngo bo ma yin pas tha dad pa'i ngo bor mngon sum gyis nyams su myong bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir de'i yod pa dang chen po nyid la sogs pa 'di srid pa ga la yin /
translated: The substance that is different from form and so on is not perceived in a different aspect in one‚Äôs consciousness, for it is devoid of appearance.üîΩSince it is not non-apparent, it is not a different entity from the nature of consciousness itself. It follows that it would be directly perceived, and so how could its existence and greatness and so on be possible?

original: rang gi ngo bos chen po dang de dang 'brel pas kyang 'di'i chen po'am gzhan gyi ngo bor 'dzin pa med na ji ltar 'khrul pa'i shes pa de ma 'khrul pa yin de'i phyir chen po dang rdzas dang dmigs par byed pa po ngo bo de yang rang
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos chen po dang de dang 'brel pas kyang 'di'i chen po'am gzhan gyi ngo bor 'dzin pa med na ji ltar 'khrul pa'i shes pa de ma 'khrul pa yin de'i phyir chen po dang rdzas dang dmigs par byed pa po ngo bo de yang rang
translated: If one does not apprehend it as great by virtue of its own nature nor as great by virtue of its relation to that, nor as a different entity, how could that mistaken consciousness be non-mistaken? Therefore, the substance that is great, the substance that is the observed object, and the substance that is the observer are all

original: gi ngo bo 'dzin pa med de /
analyzed: gi ngo bo 'dzin pa med de /
translated: It does not have the nature of grasping,

original: rdzas bdag nyid shin tu lkog tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas bdag nyid shin tu lkog tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the nature of substance is extremely hidden.

original: rdzas kyi ngo bo tha dad pa yang nye bar mi rtogs pas de bzhin du 'dzin par byed pa po'am chen po'i ngo bo med de /
analyzed: rdzas kyi ngo bo tha dad pa yang nye bar mi rtogs pas de bzhin du 'dzin par byed pa po'am chen po'i ngo bo med de /
translated: Nor does it have the nature of a great one, because it is not perceived to be a different entity from substance.

original: gang gi phyir rdzas kyi yon tan 'du ba'i rgyu yin par 'dod pas rdzas skye ba'i dus khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rdzas kyi yon tan 'du ba'i rgyu yin par 'dod pas rdzas skye ba'i dus khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is accepted that substance is the cause of the aggregation of qualities, and because it is accepted that substance arises at the time of the first moment.

original: de yang dmigs pa'i bdag nyid kho nar de bzhin du nyams su myong bas na skad cig ma dang bo'i rdzas dang yon tan kho na skad cig ma gnyis pa na snga ma'i ngo bor 'dor ba las ngo bo gzhan du gyur pa ni med do //
analyzed: de yang dmigs pa'i bdag nyid kho nar de bzhin du nyams su myong bas na skad cig ma dang bo'i rdzas dang yon tan kho na skad cig ma gnyis pa na snga ma'i ngo bor 'dor ba las ngo bo gzhan du gyur pa ni med do //
translated: And because it is experienced in that way only as the nature of an object, the substance and qualities of the first moment are not transformed into another nature in the second moment, except by the loss of the previous nature.

original: gang las sngar chen po nyid la sogs pa'i rten gyi dngos por @286b rtogs nas phyis yon tan gyi rten du 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang las sngar chen po nyid la sogs pa'i rten gyi dngos por @286b rtogs nas phyis yon tan gyi rten du 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is understood as the basis of greatness, etc., and later becomes the basis of qualities.

original: skyed par byed mi byed na rten ma yin te skyed par byed pa ni skad cig ma nyid kyis don byed pa mi 'gal bas skad cig ma ma yin pa de las 'du ba'i rgyu srid par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: skyed par byed mi byed na rten ma yin te skyed par byed pa ni skad cig ma nyid kyis don byed pa mi 'gal bas skad cig ma ma yin pa de las 'du ba'i rgyu srid par ga la 'gyur /
translated: If it does not generate, it is not a basis, because it is not contradictory for something that is momentary to perform a function. Therefore, how could a cause of collection be possible from that which is not momentary?

original: gang gi phyir rang gis skyed pa'i 'bras bu skye bar de bzhin du bstan pa de yang skad cig ma ma yin pa la sngar rten ma yin pa la phyi nas brten pa'i dngos po ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang gis skyed pa'i 'bras bu skye bar de bzhin du bstan pa de yang skad cig ma ma yin pa la sngar rten ma yin pa la phyi nas brten pa'i dngos po ma yin no //
translated: Because it is taught that the effect that is generated by itself arises in that way, it is not the case that that which is not momentary is not a basis previously and is a basis later.

original: 'du ba'i rgyu mi srid pa nyid dang du ma'i rdzas dang ldan pa nyid kyang mi srid do //
analyzed: 'du ba'i rgyu mi srid pa nyid dang du ma'i rdzas dang ldan pa nyid kyang mi srid do //
translated: It is not possible that the cause of collection is not possible, and it is not possible that it possesses many substances.

original: gang gi phyir du ma'i rdzas kyis bskyed pa 'du ba'i rgyu'i bdag nyid du yod pa gang yin pa de ni de ltar bstan pa'i rdzas med pa dang du ma'i rdzas dang ldan pa ni ma yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir du ma'i rdzas kyis bskyed pa 'du ba'i rgyu'i bdag nyid du yod pa gang yin pa de ni de ltar bstan pa'i rdzas med pa dang du ma'i rdzas dang ldan pa ni ma yin la /
translated: Because that which is generated by many substances exists as the nature of the cause of collection, that which is taught is not a substance that does not exist and does not possess many substances.

original: chen po nyid la sogs pa yod pa yang 'dir dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa ni ma yin par kho bo cag mngon par 'dod la khyed kyang 'dod do //
analyzed: chen po nyid la sogs pa yod pa yang 'dir dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa ni ma yin par kho bo cag mngon par 'dod la khyed kyang 'dod do //
translated: And we also accept that the existence of greatness and so on is not a perceptible object.

original: de dag dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa las mi dmigs pas med pa'i tha snyad du grub pa ma nges pa ma yin no zhes bstan bcos byed pas bstan par 'gyur ba dang dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur ba las mi dmigs pa'i rgyu dang khyab par byed pa
analyzed: de dag dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa las mi dmigs pas med pa'i tha snyad du grub pa ma nges pa ma yin no zhes bstan bcos byed pas bstan par 'gyur ba dang dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur ba las mi dmigs pa'i rgyu dang khyab par byed pa
translated: The treatise-writer will demonstrate that it is not indefinite, that is, that it is established as a reason for the expression of nonexistence, because of the nonperception of what is perceptible.üîΩThe other, which is the cause of the nonperception of what is perceptible, or the pervasion,

original: bkag pas gzhan gang yin pa de 'bras bu dang khyab par bya ba med pa'i gtan tshigs te med pa'i tha snyad kyi gtan tshigs so//
analyzed: bkag pas gzhan gang yin pa de 'bras bu dang khyab par bya ba med pa'i gtan tshigs te med pa'i tha snyad kyi gtan tshigs so//
translated: is the reason for the expression of nonexistence, that is, the reason for the expression of absence of effect and absence of pervaded.

original: gang yang dgag pa ni dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa las mi dmigs pas med pa'i tha snyad kyi gtan tshigs yin no zhes 'am gyi sgras bstan to //
analyzed: gang yang dgag pa ni dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa las mi dmigs pas med pa'i tha snyad kyi gtan tshigs yin no zhes 'am gyi sgras bstan to //
translated: The word ‚Äúor‚Äù indicates that the negation is a reason for the expression of nonexistence, because of the nonperception of what is perceptible.

original: mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir ra  ba mi dmigs pa ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa ldog pa'i mtshan nyid de ni the tshom gyi rgyu yin te /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir ra  ba mi dmigs pa ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa ldog pa'i mtshan nyid de ni the tshom gyi rgyu yin te /
translated: The non-observation of the non-observation of the characteristic is the cause of doubt, because even though the valid cognition has ceased, the object is not established as non-existent, because there is no reason.

original: tshad ma log kyang don med par mi 'grub ste rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir yod pa'i tha snyad 'gog pa'i rgyu yin no zhes khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: tshad ma log kyang don med par mi 'grub ste rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir yod pa'i tha snyad 'gog pa'i rgyu yin no zhes khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that it is the cause of negating the convention of existence.üîΩIn that regard, if one asserts that mere non-observation is non-observation, it is said to be either consciousness or another entity.

original: de la re zhig gang dmigs pa med pa tsam mi dmigs par 'dod na ni rnam par shes pa'am gzhan pa'i dngos po yin no zhes brjod pas de'i gzhan pa'i dngos po'am rnam par shes pa kho na dgag pa'i don du shes pa dang shes bya'i mtshan nyid
analyzed: de la re zhig gang dmigs pa med pa tsam mi dmigs par 'dod na ni rnam par shes pa'am gzhan pa'i dngos po yin no zhes brjod pas de'i gzhan pa'i dngos po'am rnam par shes pa kho na dgag pa'i don du shes pa dang shes bya'i mtshan nyid
translated: Therefore, in order to negate that other entity or consciousness itself, it is taught that the non-observation of the characteristic of the cognized and cognizer

original: kyi chos mi dmigs par ston par byed pas dmigs pa nyid rnam pa gnyis su bstan pa ni de la dmigs pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: kyi chos mi dmigs par ston par byed pas dmigs pa nyid rnam pa gnyis su bstan pa ni de la dmigs pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: is the non-observation of the object. Thus, the observation is taught to be twofold.

original: dmigs pa'i ngag gis dmigs par thos te @287a * //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i ngag gis dmigs par thos te @287a * //
translated: By the word observation, observation is heard.

original: bya ba'i ngo bo nyid de ni gang gi tshe byed pa po la ltos pa de'i tshe de'i dmigs pa ni byed pa po'i chos nyid la ltos la /
analyzed: bya ba'i ngo bo nyid de ni gang gi tshe byed pa po la ltos pa de'i tshe de'i dmigs pa ni byed pa po'i chos nyid la ltos la /
translated: When the nature of action itself depends on the agent, then its object depends on the nature of the agent.

original: de'i shes pa ni rten ba'am dmigs pa ste shes ba gang yin pa de dmigs par brjod pa dang / dmigs ba ni blo dang dbang po dang lus kyi tshogs pa kho na skad cig ma snga ma bzung nas nye bar dmigs ba skyed bar byed par brjod do //
analyzed: de'i shes pa ni rten ba'am dmigs pa ste shes ba gang yin pa de dmigs par brjod pa dang / dmigs ba ni blo dang dbang po dang lus kyi tshogs pa kho na skad cig ma snga ma bzung nas nye bar dmigs ba skyed bar byed par brjod do //
translated: And its consciousness is the support or object. That consciousness is called the object, and the object is said to be the collection of mind, sense faculty, and body, which, having apprehended the previous moment, generates the arising of the object.

original: de bzhin du dmigs pa skyed par byed pa'am rten pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du dmigs pa skyed par byed pa'am rten pa'am /
translated: Similarly, others say that the object is the producer or support

original: byed pa por gzhan dag brjod pa dang / dbang po la sogs ba las gzhan gyis skyed bar byed pa nyid du mi srid de gang gi phyir rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tha snyad byed pa de yang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag dbang po
analyzed: byed pa por gzhan dag brjod pa dang / dbang po la sogs ba las gzhan gyis skyed bar byed pa nyid du mi srid de gang gi phyir rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tha snyad byed pa de yang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag dbang po
translated: or agent. And it is impossible for the object to be produced by something other than the sense faculty, because the convention of cause and effect is made on the basis of positive and negative concomitance.

original: la sogs pa las gzhan la mi srid pa'i phyir dang dbang po la sogs pa yod pa rnams las nges par dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: la sogs pa las gzhan la mi srid pa'i phyir dang dbang po la sogs pa yod pa rnams las nges par dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is impossible for it to be other than those, and because it is definitely observed in the presence of the faculties and so on.

original: gang gi tshe dbang po la sogs pa rnams yod kyang res 'ga' zhig dmigs pa mi skye ba de'i tshe rgyu gzhan yod pa rnams kyi nus ba las 'bras bu mi skyed de rgyu gzhan ma tshang ba bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe dbang po la sogs pa rnams yod kyang res 'ga' zhig dmigs pa mi skye ba de'i tshe rgyu gzhan yod pa rnams kyi nus ba las 'bras bu mi skyed de rgyu gzhan ma tshang ba bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When the faculties and so on are present, but the object is not sometimes produced, then the other cause is not present, because the other cause is incomplete.

original: de las tha dad pa'i rgyu gzhan yongs su bstan na ni bdag kyang yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de las tha dad pa'i rgyu gzhan yongs su bstan na ni bdag kyang yod pa ma yin la /
translated: If a cause other than that is taught, then the self does not exist.

original: de ji ltar bdag nyid las skye ba yin /
analyzed: de ji ltar bdag nyid las skye ba yin /
translated: How could it be self-arisen?

original: rgyu mtshan med par khas blangs na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan med par khas blangs na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is asserted without reason, it would lead to absurd consequences.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: gang zhig yod na gang 'byung ba //
analyzed: gang zhig yod na gang 'byung ba //
translated: If something arises when this exists,

original: de las gzhan ni brtags na ni //
analyzed: de las gzhan ni brtags na ni //
translated: if it is imagined to be other than that,

original: de rgyu nyid kyis thams cad du //
analyzed: de rgyu nyid kyis thams cad du //
translated: then by that cause itself,

original: rgyu rnams thug pa med par 'gyur //üîΩzhes bshad do //
analyzed: rgyu rnams thug pa med par 'gyur //üîΩzhes bshad do //
translated: causes would be infinite.

original: rten pa nyid kyang skyed par byed pa kho na yin te de yang de'i bdag nyid du srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rten pa nyid kyang skyed par byed pa kho na yin te de yang de'i bdag nyid du srid pa ma yin no //
translated: And that which is the support is only that which generates, and that is not possible in the nature of that which is permanent.

original: gal te 'jig par byed pa'i phyir rten yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'jig par byed pa'i phyir rten yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is the support because it causes destruction,

original: skad cig ma ma yin pa yang 'jig pa med pas gnas pa med do //
analyzed: skad cig ma ma yin pa yang 'jig pa med pas gnas pa med do //
translated: then that which is not momentary would not be supported because it would not be destroyed.

original: 'di ltar mi 'jig par dmigs pa kho na gnas pa zhes brjod kyi lci ba med pa'i phyir ltung ba med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar mi 'jig par dmigs pa kho na gnas pa zhes brjod kyi lci ba med pa'i phyir ltung ba med do //
translated: Thus, that which is observed as not being destroyed is said to be supported, but it does not fall because it is not heavy.

original: gal te ldan pa med pa ni lci ba'i phyir ltung ba yin no zhes gzhan dag brjod de ldan pa la brten pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ldan pa med pa ni lci ba'i phyir ltung ba yin no zhes gzhan dag brjod de ldan pa la brten pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Others say that it is heavy because it is not associated with the elements and therefore it falls.

original: 'o na de yang rten dang brten pa'i 'byung ba rnams yod par 'dod pas mi ltung ba'i chos kyi rten du dmigs pa ni ci yang med do //
analyzed: 'o na de yang rten dang brten pa'i 'byung ba rnams yod par 'dod pas mi ltung ba'i chos kyi rten du dmigs pa ni ci yang med do //
translated: But if it is supported by association, then since the elements that are the support and the supported are accepted as existing, there is nothing at all that is observed as the support of a phenomenon that does not fall.

original: 'du ba rten ba yin na ni gzhan la yang thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'du ba rten ba yin na ni gzhan la yang thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If the support is the collection of elements, then it would follow that other things are also supported.

original: @287b de'i bdag nyid thams cad la mtshungs pa'i phyir dang 'di gcig pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir dang / rim dang cig car gyi don gyi byed pa 'gal ba 'di ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: @287b de'i bdag nyid thams cad la mtshungs pa'i phyir dang 'di gcig pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir dang / rim dang cig car gyi don gyi byed pa 'gal ba 'di ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: because it is the same in all its aspects, because you accept that it is one, and because the activity of the object, whether sequential or simultaneous, is not possible.

original: de'i phyir skyed par byed pa nyid dang rten par byed pa ga la yin /
analyzed: de'i phyir skyed par byed pa nyid dang rten par byed pa ga la yin /
translated: So how can it be a producer or a basis?

original: 'di dag btags ba la 'thag par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag btags ba la 'thag par byed pa yin no //
translated: You are just spinning out fabrications!

original: de ltar dmigs pa bstan nas mi dmigs pa bstan pa ni ma yin par zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ltar dmigs pa bstan nas mi dmigs pa bstan pa ni ma yin par zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Having thus taught the object of perception, he now teaches the non-object of perception:

original: bzar mi rung ba ni bzar mi rung bar rjod par 'dod pa de ni bza' ba las gzhan yin ba'i phyir grong gi khyim bya bzar mi rung ba las gzhan pa ni bzar rung bar yang brjod do //
analyzed: bzar mi rung ba ni bzar mi rung bar rjod par 'dod pa de ni bza' ba las gzhan yin ba'i phyir grong gi khyim bya bzar mi rung ba las gzhan pa ni bzar rung bar yang brjod do //
translated: The inedible is said to be the non-edible, because it is other than the edible. The edible is also said to be the inedible, because it is other than the inedible.

original: reg tu mi rung ba bzhin zhes bya ba ni reg tu rung ba dang 'gal bar brjod par 'dod pa'i reg tu rung ba las gzhan yin pa'i phyir reg tu mi rung ba don la sogs pa de las gzhan pa ni reg par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: reg tu mi rung ba bzhin zhes bya ba ni reg tu rung ba dang 'gal bar brjod par 'dod pa'i reg tu rung ba las gzhan yin pa'i phyir reg tu mi rung ba don la sogs pa de las gzhan pa ni reg par bya ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúLike what is not suitable to be touched‚Äù means that what is suitable to be touched is the opposite of what is not suitable to be touched. Therefore, what is not suitable to be touched, such as objects, is suitable to be touched.

original: de ni dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa'i mi dmigs pa 'dod par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa'i mi dmigs pa 'dod par bya'o //
translated: You should accept that this is a non-observation that is an observed object.

original: gal te ma yin pa ni dgag pa'i yul la yin pa'i phyir ji ltar dngos po'i ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ma yin pa ni dgag pa'i yul la yin pa'i phyir ji ltar dngos po'i ma yin zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not so, because the object of negation is an existent, how can it be a non-entity?

original: ma yin par 'jug pas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ma yin par 'jug pas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúBecause it engages in non-existence.‚Äù

original: ma yin pa dgag pa'i don spangs nas khyad par gyi don la 'jug pa de la dgag pa gzung bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: ma yin pa dgag pa'i don spangs nas khyad par gyi don la 'jug pa de la dgag pa gzung bar mi bya ste /
translated: Having abandoned the object of negation, the meaning of non-existence, it engages in the meaning of a distinction. In that, the negation should not be apprehended.

original: dgag ba ni dngos po'i yul can yin te /
analyzed: dgag ba ni dngos po'i yul can yin te /
translated: Because the negation has an existent object.

original: gang la sgrub pa gtso bos dgag pa'i don bzung nas /
analyzed: gang la sgrub pa gtso bos dgag pa'i don bzung nas /
translated: When the meaning of an affirmation is primary, the meaning of a negation is apprehended.

original: rang gi tshig gi sgrub par ston pa'i ngag gcig pa de la ma yin par dgag pa 'jug pa dang sgrub pa gtso bor brjod pas dmigs pa ni gzhan dmigs pa yin pa de ltar ngag gis gzhan dmigs par brjod do //
analyzed: rang gi tshig gi sgrub par ston pa'i ngag gcig pa de la ma yin par dgag pa 'jug pa dang sgrub pa gtso bor brjod pas dmigs pa ni gzhan dmigs pa yin pa de ltar ngag gis gzhan dmigs par brjod do //
translated: The negation is applied to the single statement that presents the proof by one‚Äôs own words. Since the affirmation is the primary expression, the referent is the referent of another. Thus, the statement expresses the referent of another.

original: gzhan dmigs par brjod pa na shugs kyis mi dmigs pa kho na brjod par 'dod do //
analyzed: gzhan dmigs par brjod pa na shugs kyis mi dmigs pa kho na brjod par 'dod do //
translated: When the referent of another is expressed, non-observation is implicitly expressed.

original: dgag par rtog pa brjod par 'dod pa ni dmigs pa ldog pa med na de la ltos nas gzhan du brjod par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgag par rtog pa brjod par 'dod pa ni dmigs pa ldog pa med na de la ltos nas gzhan du brjod par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The desire to express the conception of negation is because, if the negation of the referent is not reversed, it is not reasonable to express it as another in dependence on that.

original: rang gi tshig gis dgag pa dang sgrub pa la brten par ma brjod pa de lta na 'on te sgra yis ma yin pa la brten pa sgra gzhan nyid kyi ngag gis rab tu sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi tshig gis dgag pa dang sgrub pa la brten par ma brjod pa de lta na 'on te sgra yis ma yin pa la brten pa sgra gzhan nyid kyi ngag gis rab tu sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If one does not express the negation and affirmation in one‚Äôs own words, then it is not so. Rather, it is because the statement is applied by another sound that is based on non-sound.

original: gzhan dmigs pa'i mi dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dmigs pa'i mi dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the non-observation of the observation of another.

original: dgag pa ni sub kyi mtha' yin la /
analyzed: dgag pa ni sub kyi mtha' yin la /
translated: The negation is the end of the syllable ‚Äúsup,‚Äù

original: ti'i mtha' ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ti'i mtha' ni ma yin te /
translated: not the end of ‚Äúti.‚Äù

original: ngag gcig pa nyid dmigs pa med pa mi @288a * //
analyzed: ngag gcig pa nyid dmigs pa med pa mi @288a * //
translated: The non-apprehension of the non-apprehension of an object is the non-apprehension of a non-existent object.

original: dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The non-apprehension of the non-apprehension of an object is the non-apprehension of a non-existent object.

original: med par dgag pa ni 'di dag las kyang bzlog par rig bar bya'o //
analyzed: med par dgag pa ni 'di dag las kyang bzlog par rig bar bya'o //
translated: The negation of non-apprehension should be understood as the opposite of these.

original: de la dgag pa ni gtso bo yin la sgrub pa ni shugs kyis go bar bya ba dag tha dad pa yin la /
analyzed: de la dgag pa ni gtso bo yin la sgrub pa ni shugs kyis go bar bya ba dag tha dad pa yin la /
translated: In this regard, negation is primary, and affirmation is to be understood by implication.

original: rang gi tshig gis dgag ba la brten pa mi slu ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi tshig gis dgag ba la brten pa mi slu ba'o //
translated: The non-deceptive [cognition] that is based on negation is [called] the cognition of non-apprehension.

original: de ltar de'i shes pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid kyi mi dmigs pa bshad nas shes par bya ba'i chos kyi mtshan nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir dmigs par bya ba'i chos nyid yin na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ltar de'i shes pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid kyi mi dmigs pa bshad nas shes par bya ba'i chos kyi mtshan nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir dmigs par bya ba'i chos nyid yin na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Having explained the characteristic of the cognition of non-apprehension in terms of the object, in order to teach the characteristic of the object of cognition, he says, If it is the nature of the object of cognition...

original: gang gi tshe las la gnas pa'i bya ba la ltos pa na dmigs par bya ba'i dngos po'i chos dmigs par brjod par 'dod pa de'i tshe yul gyi rang bzhin gyi dmigs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe las la gnas pa'i bya ba la ltos pa na dmigs par bya ba'i dngos po'i chos dmigs par brjod par 'dod pa de'i tshe yul gyi rang bzhin gyi dmigs par rig par bya'o //
translated: When the action that is based on the object depends on the action, and the nature of the object that is to be apprehended is expressed as the apprehension, then at that time, the object that is the nature of the object should be understood as the apprehension.

original: gal te yul gyi ngo bo ci 'dra ba zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yul gyi ngo bo ci 'dra ba zhig yin zhe na /
translated: If one asks, ‚ÄúWhat is the nature of the object?‚Äù

original: rang gi yul zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rang gi yul zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: [The root text] states, ‚ÄúThe object itself, etc.‚Äù

original: bum pa la sogs pa dgag par bya ba'i bdag nyid kyi yul can gyi rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni skyed par rung ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa dgag par bya ba'i bdag nyid kyi yul can gyi rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni skyed par rung ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The consciousness that has as its object the nature of the object of negation, such as a pot, is the definition of what is suitable to appear.

original: yul gyi ngo bo la dmigs pa'i sgra brjod do //
analyzed: yul gyi ngo bo la dmigs pa'i sgra brjod do //
translated: The nature of the object is expressed by the word ‚Äúsound.‚Äù

original: gal te yul gyi ngo bo ji ltar dmigs su rung ba'i mtshan nyid yin /
analyzed: gal te yul gyi ngo bo ji ltar dmigs su rung ba'i mtshan nyid yin /
translated: If one asks, ‚ÄúHow is the nature of the object suitable to appear?‚Äù

original: chos dang chos can ni tha dad pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: chos dang chos can ni tha dad pa yin zhe na /
translated: [The root text] states, ‚ÄúThe property and the possessor of the property are different.‚Äù

original: rung ba'i nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs ba smos te /üîΩrung ba ni don dam par na dngos po'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: rung ba'i nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs ba smos te / rung ba ni don dam par na dngos po'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: [The root text] states, ‚ÄúSuitability itself, etc.‚ÄùüîΩSuitability is, in reality, the nature of an entity.

original: dngos po'i ngo bo las tha dad pa ni med do //
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo las tha dad pa ni med do //
translated: There is no difference between the nature of an entity and the entity itself.

original: de lta ma yin na dngos po'i rung ba nyid du mi 'gyur ba dang / rung ba 'di yin no zhes dngos po dang 'brel par yang mi 'gyur ba dang / 'brel pa can brtags na yang thug pa med par 'gyur ro zhes lan mang du bshad zin to //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na dngos po'i rung ba nyid du mi 'gyur ba dang / rung ba 'di yin no zhes dngos po dang 'brel par yang mi 'gyur ba dang / 'brel pa can brtags na yang thug pa med par 'gyur ro zhes lan mang du bshad zin to //
translated: Otherwise, it would not be suitable for a thing, and it would not be related to a thing, saying ‚Äúthis is suitable,‚Äù and if one investigates the relation, there would be an infinite regress.

original: de nyid dmigs par bya ba yul gyi chos su bstan pa na mi dmigs pa rtog pa yin par de las gzhan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid dmigs par bya ba yul gyi chos su bstan pa na mi dmigs pa rtog pa yin par de las gzhan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: When that very object is taught to be the observed object, the domain of the object, he says, ‚Äúit is imagined to be non-apprehended,‚Äù and so on.

original: de'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa dgag par bya ba yul can gyi rnam par shes pa skyed par rung ba las gzhan pa dmigs par skyed bar rung ba nyid de las phyin ci log pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa dgag par bya ba yul can gyi rnam par shes pa skyed par rung ba las gzhan pa dmigs par skyed bar rung ba nyid de las phyin ci log pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the suitability of generating the consciousness that is the apprehender of the object of negation, such as a pot, is different from the suitability of generating the apprehension of that object. It is not the opposite of that.

original: bum pa'i rang bzhin gyis dben pa'i phyogs kyi ngo bo de nyid la 'dir mi dmigs pa'i sgras brjod do //
analyzed: bum pa'i rang bzhin gyis dben pa'i phyogs kyi ngo bo de nyid la 'dir mi dmigs pa'i sgras brjod do //
translated: The nature of the place that is empty of the nature of a pot is what is referred to here by the term non-apprehension.

original: snga ma nyid kyi rigs pa tsam 'dir bstan pa ni snga ma bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs @288b pa smos te /
analyzed: snga ma nyid kyi rigs pa tsam 'dir bstan pa ni snga ma bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs @288b pa smos te /
translated: The mere reasoning of the former is taught here, and it is said ‚Äúas before,‚Äù and so on.

original: brjod par 'dod pa'i dmigs pa las gzhan yin pa'i phyir bzar mi rung ba dang reg tu mi rung ba bzhin du ma yin par dgag pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa'i dmigs pa las gzhan yin pa'i phyir bzar mi rung ba dang reg tu mi rung ba bzhin du ma yin par dgag pa la 'jug go //
translated: Because it is different from the object of expression, it is like what is not suitable to be eaten or touched, and it is engaged as an implicative negation.

original: ji ltar dgag pa yang gzhan gyi don la 'jug pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar dgag pa yang gzhan gyi don la 'jug pa yin /
translated: How is negation also engaged for the sake of others?

original: thun mong ba'i bum pa yod pas dben pa'i phyogs kyi shes pa'am sa phyogs te bum pas dben pa'i mi dmigs pa 'di ma yin par dgag pa 'jug par rab tu btags pa yin gyi /
analyzed: thun mong ba'i bum pa yod pas dben pa'i phyogs kyi shes pa'am sa phyogs te bum pas dben pa'i mi dmigs pa 'di ma yin par dgag pa 'jug par rab tu btags pa yin gyi /
translated: The cognition of a place that is empty of an existing common pot, or the place that is empty of a pot, is this non-observation that is an implicative negation.

original: khyad par med par 'di dag thams cad kyang gzhan gyi sgras brjod par mi bya'o snyam nas gang du gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: khyad par med par 'di dag thams cad kyang gzhan gyi sgras brjod par mi bya'o snyam nas gang du gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Thinking that without distinction all of these should not be expressed by the word ‚Äúother,‚Äù ‚Äúwhere‚Äù and so on is stated.

original: gang du ni yul dang dus dang gnas skabs bar du mchod pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: gang du ni yul dang dus dang gnas skabs bar du mchod pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: Where is a place characterized by a distant location, time, or situation.

original: gang zhig ni sa phyogs kyi ngo bo la sogs pa dmigs par bya'o //
analyzed: gang zhig ni sa phyogs kyi ngo bo la sogs pa dmigs par bya'o //
translated: What is to be perceived is the nature of the place, etc.

original: nges par ni gdon mi za ba'o //
analyzed: nges par ni gdon mi za ba'o //
translated: Certainly means without doubt.

original: don gzhan bum pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don gzhan bum pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The meaning of the other is that the nature of the pot, etc. is perceived.

original: de ni bum pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo de dang 'dre ba des nas phyogs la sogs pa'i ngo bo dang 'dre ba'o //
analyzed: de ni bum pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo de dang 'dre ba des nas phyogs la sogs pa'i ngo bo dang 'dre ba'o //
translated: That is, the nature of the pot, etc. is mixed with that, and then it is mixed with the nature of the place, etc.

original: gal te gcig la dmigs par bya ba yang ji ltar gzhan la nges par dmigs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gcig la dmigs par bya ba yang ji ltar gzhan la nges par dmigs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it is an object of perception of one, how can it be certainly perceived as another?

original: rung ba nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rung ba nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no difference in suitability.

original: sa phyogs kyi bum pa'i ngo bo dag ni rang gi yul can gyi rnam par shes pa skyed par rung bar mtshungs so //
analyzed: sa phyogs kyi bum pa'i ngo bo dag ni rang gi yul can gyi rnam par shes pa skyed par rung bar mtshungs so //
translated: The nature of the place and the pot are the same in being suitable to produce consciousness that has them as its object.

original: gang gi tshes phyogs kyi ngo bo bar du chod pa'i skal ba la sogs pa spangs pa ni rnam par shes pa la rang gi rnam par 'jog pa yin pa de'i tshe bum pa'i ngo bo yang de la de bzhin du rang gi rnam pa gtod par 'gyurüîΩba nyid do //
analyzed: gang gi tshes phyogs kyi ngo bo bar du chod pa'i skal ba la sogs pa spangs pa ni rnam par shes pa la rang gi rnam par 'jog pa yin pa de'i tshe bum pa'i ngo bo yang de la de bzhin du rang gi rnam pa gtod par 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: At that time, the nature of the pot is also cast upon it in the same way.

original: gal te rung ba de dang de ni rang rang gi ngo bo la gnas pa yin ji ltar de dang 'dre ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rung ba de dang de ni rang rang gi ngo bo la gnas pa yin ji ltar de dang 'dre ba yin zhe na /
translated: If the object exists in its own nature, how can it be mixed with consciousness?

original: shes pa gcig dang 'dre ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa gcig dang 'dre ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is mixed with a single consciousness.

original: shes pa gcig la de gnyis kyang de dag gi rnam pa'i sgo nas 'dre ba ni dngos su ma yin pas de'i rnam par shes pa don gyi rnam pa gnyis skyes ba dag gi bdag nyid 'dre bar bstan to //
analyzed: shes pa gcig la de gnyis kyang de dag gi rnam pa'i sgo nas 'dre ba ni dngos su ma yin pas de'i rnam par shes pa don gyi rnam pa gnyis skyes ba dag gi bdag nyid 'dre bar bstan to //
translated: Although the two are mixed in a single consciousness, it is not directly. Therefore, the consciousness that arises in the form of those two objects is taught to be mixed in the sense that it has the nature of both.

original: ci de'i shes pa la don gyi rnam pa gnyis gdon mi za bar yang 'gyur ram /
analyzed: ci de'i shes pa la don gyi rnam pa gnyis gdon mi za bar yang 'gyur ram /
translated: Is it that the object's form necessarily becomes two in its consciousness?

original: gang gis de gnyis shes pa'i sgo nas 'dre ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis de gnyis shes pa'i sgo nas 'dre ba yin zhe na /
translated: By what means are the two mixed in consciousness?

original: de gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩde dag mtshungs par rung ba'i ngo bo gang yin ba de dag gang gi tshe yod par @289a * //
analyzed: de gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / de dag mtshungs par rung ba'i ngo bo gang yin ba de dag gang gi tshe yod par @289a * //
translated: The root text says, ‚ÄúIf those two . . .‚Äù

original: gyur pa de'i tshe rnam pa gcig nges par rtogs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gyur pa de'i tshe rnam pa gcig nges par rtogs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If those two are of a suitable nature, then when they exist, a single aspect is not ascertained.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible.

original: 'di dag yod par srid na mtshungs par rung ba'i ngo bo gnyis las gcig kho na snang ba ma yin te gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag yod par srid na mtshungs par rung ba'i ngo bo gnyis las gcig kho na snang ba ma yin te gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: If they exist, then from two suitable natures, only one appears, not the other.

original: de lta na rung bar khyad par med pa'i phyir cis na de la rang gi rnam pa gtod par mi byed de cig car snang bar yang nyams su myong bas grub bo //
analyzed: de lta na rung bar khyad par med pa'i phyir cis na de la rang gi rnam pa gtod par mi byed de cig car snang bar yang nyams su myong bas grub bo //
translated: In that case, since there is no difference in suitability, why does it not project its own aspect? It is experienced as appearing simultaneously.

original: nyams su myong ba dang 'gal bar mi mkhas pa yis brjod pa la gnod pa med pas brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba dang 'gal bar mi mkhas pa yis brjod pa la gnod pa med pas brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: Since it contradicts experience, the unwise should not speak of it, for it is invalidated.

original: gal te mgyogs par 'byung ba'i phyir cig car snyam du sems so zhen ;
analyzed: gal te mgyogs par 'byung ba'i phyir cig car snyam du sems so zhen ;
translated: If you think that they appear simultaneously because they arise quickly,

original: ma yin te gnod par byed pa'i rkyen spangs pas 'khrul par brtag par mi rigs pas thams cad du de bzhin du dngos po med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te gnod par byed pa'i rkyen spangs pas 'khrul par brtag par mi rigs pas thams cad du de bzhin du dngos po med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because it is not logical to think that the conditions that cause error are eliminated, because it follows that everything would be nonexistent in that way.

original: gal te rgyu'i chos 'di kho na gang gi tshe las su bya ba gcig sgrub pa du ma mi byed la dbang po de las du mar rtogs pa'i rgyu byed pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rgyu'i chos 'di kho na gang gi tshe las su bya ba gcig sgrub pa du ma mi byed la dbang po de las du mar rtogs pa'i rgyu byed pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúThis is the nature of causes, in that when one action is accomplished, many are not done, and that sense faculty does not cause many to be understood,‚Äù

original: ji ltar mar me la sogs pas rtogs par byed pa mang po rnams la du ma skyed par byed pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar mar me la sogs pas rtogs par byed pa mang po rnams la du ma skyed par byed pa yin /
translated: then how is it that many things that are to be understood, such as lamps, are produced by many?

original: byed pa po tha dad pa sa skyon med do zhe na /
analyzed: byed pa po tha dad pa sa skyon med do zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúThere is no error because the agents are different,‚Äù

original: byed pa po gcig yin pa'i phyir bya ba dang las gcig yin pas ji ltar rgyu'i chos yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod pa ni bslang ba yin no //
analyzed: byed pa po gcig yin pa'i phyir bya ba dang las gcig yin pas ji ltar rgyu'i chos yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod pa ni bslang ba yin no //
translated: then why do you say, ‚ÄúHow can it be the nature of a cause if the action and object are the same because the agent is the same‚Äù?

original: dngos po rnams skad cig ma re re so sor gyes ba la don dam par med pas so //
analyzed: dngos po rnams skad cig ma re re so sor gyes ba la don dam par med pas so //
translated: Because things that are momentary are destroyed in each instant, they do not exist ultimately.

original: byed pa po dang byed pa po la sogs pa'i dngos po'am bya ba 'ga' zhig kyang mi rigs so //
analyzed: byed pa po dang byed pa po la sogs pa'i dngos po'am bya ba 'ga' zhig kyang mi rigs so //
translated: It is not logical that any entity or action, such as an agent or action, exists.

original: thams cad kyi byed pa po dang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i 'bras bu 'ga' zhig phul du byung ba yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: thams cad kyi byed pa po dang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i 'bras bu 'ga' zhig phul du byung ba yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no effect whatsoever that is the agent of all and that conforms with and reverses from all.

original: gang gis 'di byed pa po dag dang byed par rig pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzhan gyis yongs su brtags pa de'i phyir rung ba de nyid du khyad par med do //
analyzed: gang gis 'di byed pa po dag dang byed par rig pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzhan gyis yongs su brtags pa de'i phyir rung ba de nyid du khyad par med do //
translated: Since it is imagined by others that ‚Äúthis is the agent of that‚Äù and so on, that is suitable, but there is no difference in reality.

original: ga las she na /
analyzed: ga las she na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gcig gi ngo bo nges par rtogs pa srid pa'i phyir shes pa gcig la tshogs par grub pa dang / rung ba'i ngo bo nyid du mtshungs pa 'di dag nyid rtags yin no //
analyzed: gcig gi ngo bo nges par rtogs pa srid pa'i phyir shes pa gcig la tshogs par grub pa dang / rung ba'i ngo bo nyid du mtshungs pa 'di dag nyid rtags yin no //
translated: Because it is possible to ascertain the nature of a single thing, the proof of the collection in a single cognition and the similarity of the nature of the suitable are the reasons.

original: rung ba'i ngo bo nyid du med pa dang mtshungs pas cig car dbang po las skyes pa'i shes pa las so sor snang ba ni gzugs dang ro bzhin du mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rung ba'i ngo bo nyid du med pa dang mtshungs pas cig car dbang po las skyes pa'i shes pa las so sor snang ba ni gzugs dang ro bzhin du mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since they are not of the nature of a single thing, it is impossible for them to appear separately to a consciousness that arises from a single sense faculty, as do form and taste.

original: de la gang dag bde bar @289b gshegs pa rnams kyis skye mched gcig gi gzung ba ma yin par 'di bstan to //
analyzed: de la gang dag bde bar @289b gshegs pa rnams kyis skye mched gcig gi gzung ba ma yin par 'di bstan to //
translated: In this regard, the Sugata has taught that they are not the objects of a single sense faculty.

original: du ma la yang dbang po'i shes pa gcig skye ba'i phyir de dag shes pa gcig la tshogs pa ni gtso bo kho na yin no //
analyzed: du ma la yang dbang po'i shes pa gcig skye ba'i phyir de dag shes pa gcig la tshogs pa ni gtso bo kho na yin no //
translated: Since many objects can produce a single sense consciousness, it is only the principal object that is the basis for the single consciousness.

original: de la yang don re re tha dad pa nyid dbang po gcig gi rgyu mtshan las gzhan pa dus gcig pa gang yin pa de'i yul rnams cig car nye ba na rang gi shes pa la nus pa khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang don re re tha dad pa nyid dbang po gcig gi rgyu mtshan las gzhan pa dus gcig pa gang yin pa de'i yul rnams cig car nye ba na rang gi shes pa la nus pa khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, each object is distinct from the other, and when the objects of a single sense faculty are present simultaneously, there is no difference in the potency of the consciousness that arises from them.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'jig rten pas gcig tu mngon par zhen pa'i shes pa skyed pa yin no zhes brjod de /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'jig rten pas gcig tu mngon par zhen pa'i shes pa skyed pa yin no zhes brjod de /
translated: Therefore, it is said that the consciousness that arises from them is conceived of as a single entity by ordinary people.

original: de dag dbang po gcig las skyes pa yin pa dang skye mched gcig gi yul yin pas dus gcig pa rnams la 'jig rten pas de bzhin du nges pas gcig gi tha snyad du byed pa ni btags pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag dbang po gcig las skyes pa yin pa dang skye mched gcig gi yul yin pas dus gcig pa rnams la 'jig rten pas de bzhin du nges pas gcig gi tha snyad du byed pa ni btags pa yin no //
translated: Since they arise from a single sense faculty and are the object of a single sense base, worldly people ascertain them as simultaneous and apply the convention of one to them.

original: gal te de ltar shes pa gcig la tshogs pa de ni 'dre ba yin pa de lta na yang thun mong du thams cad la gzhan pa'i bdag nyid du ci ste dgag par mi rtogs she na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar shes pa gcig la tshogs pa de ni 'dre ba yin pa de lta na yang thun mong du thams cad la gzhan pa'i bdag nyid du ci ste dgag par mi rtogs she na /
translated: If that is so, and that collection is mixed in a single cognition, then why is it not understood that they are all mutually different in a general way?

original: de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, etc.

original: gang gi phyir rung ba nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir rung ba nyid ni ji skad bshad pa'i rnam pas shes pa gcig la gnyis gang yang tshogs pa de'i phyir rung ba nyid kyi ngo bo khyad par med pa can gang dang gang yin pa de nyid
analyzed: gang gi phyir rung ba nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir rung ba nyid ni ji skad bshad pa'i rnam pas shes pa gcig la gnyis gang yang tshogs pa de'i phyir rung ba nyid kyi ngo bo khyad par med pa can gang dang gang yin pa de nyid
translated: Since there is no difference in suitability, suitability is as explained above. Since two things are collected in a single cognition, therefore, whatever is the nature of suitability that is not different,

original: las shes pa gcig la tshogs ba de dag yin pa de'i phyir de dag de lta bu'i ngo bo phan tshun ltos pa kho na yin gyi gzhan pa tshig gi don thams cad la ltos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: las shes pa gcig la tshogs ba de dag yin pa de'i phyir de dag de lta bu'i ngo bo phan tshun ltos pa kho na yin gyi gzhan pa tshig gi don thams cad la ltos pa ma yin no //
translated: These are the only things that are mutually dependent in the way that you claim. They are not dependent on any other object.

original: gzhan pa nyid ni 'dir mi dmigs pa la 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: gzhan pa nyid ni 'dir mi dmigs pa la 'gyur ba med do //
translated: The otherness of things is not at all affected by the non-apprehension of something else.

original: gal te 'jig rten pa yang don gzhan pa ma lus pa la ltos nas gzhan pa nyid khyab pa'i rigs pa la brten nas la lar dgag pa brjod do //
analyzed: gal te 'jig rten pa yang don gzhan pa ma lus pa la ltos nas gzhan pa nyid khyab pa'i rigs pa la brten nas la lar dgag pa brjod do //
translated: If you worldly people, on the basis of the principle that otherness is pervaded by the dependence on other things, sometimes make statements that are negations, then in some cases you should also make statements that are affirmations.

original: de lta na yang de ni 'dir gzung bar mi bya'i nye ba'i rigs pa la brten nas shes pa gcig la tshogs pa'i mtshan nyid ni nye ba'i rigs pa la brten nas tshad mar bsam pa la 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: de lta na yang de ni 'dir gzung bar mi bya'i nye ba'i rigs pa la brten nas shes pa gcig la tshogs pa'i mtshan nyid ni nye ba'i rigs pa la brten nas tshad mar bsam pa la 'gyur ba med do //
translated: But in this case, you should not rely on the principle of proximity, for the definition of the collection of things in a single cognition is based on the principle of proximity. There is no change in the idea that this is a valid cognition.

original: de lta ma yin na mi dmigs pa ma nges pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na mi dmigs pa ma nges pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the non-apprehension would not be conclusive.

original: de'i phyir de kho na nyid sems pas rnam pa de lta bu'i gzhan pa nyid la brten nas mi dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan la 'khrul pa med pa gang yin pa de yang ji skad bshad pa bzhin du dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de kho na nyid sems pas rnam pa de lta bu'i gzhan pa nyid la brten nas mi dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan la 'khrul pa med pa gang yin pa de yang ji skad bshad pa bzhin du dgongs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, when one analyzes reality, the reason for non-observation is not erroneous, as explained above, in dependence on the difference between the two.

original: de ltar na de ni shes pa gcig la tshogs pa la ltos @290a * //
analyzed: de ltar na de ni shes pa gcig la tshogs pa la ltos @290a * //
translated: Thus, in dependence on the collection in one cognition, the difference is understood.

original: nas gzhan pa nyid du rtogs pa ni mi dmigs par bstan pas ni de 'ba' zhig la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: nas gzhan pa nyid du rtogs pa ni mi dmigs par bstan pas ni de 'ba' zhig la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The explanation of non-observation in ‚Äúonly that‚Äù and so on is as follows:

original: de nyid gang gi tshes phyogs 'ba' zhig ji ltar bshad pa'i bum pa la ltos pa de'i phyir gzhan zhes brjod pa de'i tshe bum pas dben pa'i sa phyogs sam shes pa la mi dmigs pa yin /
analyzed: de nyid gang gi tshes phyogs 'ba' zhig ji ltar bshad pa'i bum pa la ltos pa de'i phyir gzhan zhes brjod pa de'i tshe bum pas dben pa'i sa phyogs sam shes pa la mi dmigs pa yin /
translated: When only that side is as explained, in dependence on the pot, it is called different. At that time, in dependence on the pot, the side devoid of pot or the cognition is not observed.

original: dper na dbang phyug sdes bsams pa'i dmigs pa med pa tsam gyis mi dmigs pa bzhin du ma yin te /
analyzed: dper na dbang phyug sdes bsams pa'i dmigs pa med pa tsam gyis mi dmigs pa bzhin du ma yin te /
translated: For example, it is not like the non-observation by ƒ™≈õvarak·πõ·π£·πáa, which is mere non-observation.

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i skyon dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i skyon dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has the fault that will be explained.

original: bum pas dben pa'i phyogs kyi ngo bo ni des dben pa'i shes pa nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bum pas dben pa'i phyogs kyi ngo bo ni des dben pa'i shes pa nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: The nature of a place devoid of a pot is not the consciousness of that place devoid of a pot.

original: ji ltar gzhon nu ma len gyi rnam par shes pa'am gzhan pa'i dngos po gzhan du ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhon nu ma len gyi rnam par shes pa'am gzhan pa'i dngos po gzhan du ma yin te /
translated: Just as the consciousness of a young woman is not the consciousness of another thing, another person.

original: ji ltar gzhan gyi dngos po'i yul gyi rnam par shes pa nyams su myong ba rnams dang mi mthun pa'i dran pa ltos pa med pa'i tha snyad du byed pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa de lta na des dben pa'i sa phyogs kyang yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan gyi dngos po'i yul gyi rnam par shes pa nyams su myong ba rnams dang mi mthun pa'i dran pa ltos pa med pa'i tha snyad du byed pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa de lta na des dben pa'i sa phyogs kyang yin no //
translated: Just as the memory of the experience of a consciousness of an object that is another thing is not dependent on that other thing, so too is the place devoid of a pot.

original: de lta na rtogs par byed pa 'ga' zhig gis gang gi phyir phyogs 'ba' zhig gi rnam pa nyid kyi shes pa'i bdag nyid du rigs pa yin gyi bum pa'i rnam pa ma yin pa de'i phyir 'dir bum pa med do zhes bya ba de bzhin du medüîΩpa'i shes pa skyed pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na rtogs par byed pa 'ga' zhig gis gang gi phyir phyogs 'ba' zhig gi rnam pa nyid kyi shes pa'i bdag nyid du rigs pa yin gyi bum pa'i rnam pa ma yin pa de'i phyir 'dir bum pa med do zhes bya ba de bzhin du medüîΩpa'i shes pa skyed pa yin no //
translated: In that case, some who understand would say, ‚ÄúBecause the form of the place alone is the nature of the consciousness, not the form of a pot, therefore a pot does not exist there.‚ÄùüîΩIn that case, the consciousness that produces the understanding of nonexistence would be the same as the consciousness that produces the understanding of existence.

original: gang gi phyir 'ga' zhig gis phyogs 'ba' zhig mthong ba gang yin pa ni bum pa dang lhan cig pa ma yin pa de'i phyir 'dir bum pa zhes bya ba de ltar yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'ga' zhig gis phyogs 'ba' zhig mthong ba gang yin pa ni bum pa dang lhan cig pa ma yin pa de'i phyir 'dir bum pa zhes bya ba de ltar yin no //
translated: Because it is not the case that something is seen in one place and the vase is not seen together with it, therefore, it is like this: that which is called a vase.

original: de'i phyir med pa'i shes pa skyed pa'i nus pa mtshungs pa'i gnyi ga yang mi dmigs par rnam par gzhag par rigs so//üîΩdel gang gi tshe de shes pa yin pa de'i tshe shes pa nyid kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid ni mi dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir med pa'i shes pa skyed pa'i nus pa mtshungs pa'i gnyi ga yang mi dmigs par rnam par gzhag par rigs so// del gang gi tshe de shes pa yin pa de'i tshe shes pa nyid kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid ni mi dmigs pa ste /
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable to posit that both are not apprehended when they have the same capacity to produce knowledge of nonexistence.

original: byed pa po la gnas pa'i bya ba la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa po la gnas pa'i bya ba la ltos pa'o //
translated: When it is knowledge, then the characteristic of the known is not apprehended, which is dependent on the action that resides in the agent.

original: gang gi tshe de'i ngo bo yin pa de'i tshe shes par bya ba'i chos kyi mtshan nyid ni las la gnas pa'i bya ba la ltos pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de'i ngo bo yin pa de'i tshe shes par bya ba'i chos kyi mtshan nyid ni las la gnas pa'i bya ba la ltos pa yin no //
translated: When it is its nature, then the characteristic of the object of knowledge is dependent on the action that resides in the object.

original: de ltar mi dmigs pa ni ma yin par dgag pa la 'jug pa'i rnam par gzhag pa'i bsgrub par bya ba 'di yang bstan pa ni de med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ltar mi dmigs pa ni ma yin par dgag pa la 'jug pa'i rnam par gzhag pa'i bsgrub par bya ba 'di yang bstan pa ni de med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The statement of the probandum in this context is ‚Äúthe absence of that,‚Äù etc.

original: thams cad du gzhan dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pas dben pa'i phyogs la sogs pa yang snang ba yin la /
analyzed: thams cad du gzhan dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pas dben pa'i phyogs la sogs pa yang snang ba yin la /
translated: In all cases, the place, etc., devoid of the other object of apprehension appears.

original: gang la bum pa la sogs pa @290b zla bo gzhan med pa rnams kyis 'di dran par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang la bum pa la sogs pa @290b zla bo gzhan med pa rnams kyis 'di dran par 'gyur te /
translated: And it is remembered by those who do not have the other, such as a pot, etc.

original: de ni med pa'am med pa'i tha snyad sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni med pa'am med pa'i tha snyad sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: That is the proof of non-existence or the expression of non-existence.

original: rgyu dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa ni med pa dang med pa'i tha snyad sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: rgyu dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa ni med pa dang med pa'i tha snyad sgrub par byed do //
translated: The non-apprehension of a cause or a pervader proves non-existence or the expression of non-existence.

original: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa ni med pa'i tha snyad du byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa ni med pa'i tha snyad du byed pa nyid do //
translated: The non-apprehension of a nature is the expression of non-existence.

original: med pa dang med pa'i tha snyad du byed pa ni shes pa dang rjod par byed pa dang rab tu 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: med pa dang med pa'i tha snyad du byed pa ni shes pa dang rjod par byed pa dang rab tu 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The expression of non-existence or the expression of non-existence is characterized by cognition, expression, and engagement.

original: de la 'di na bum pa med do zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rnam pa'i shes pa dang / rnam ba de lta bu'i dngos po brjod pa ni rjod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'di na bum pa med do zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rnam pa'i shes pa dang / rnam ba de lta bu'i dngos po brjod pa ni rjod par byed pa'o //
translated: The cognition of the form There is no pot here and the expression of such a thing are the expression.

original: dogs pa med par phyogs de la 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'i mtshan nyid ni rab tu 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: dogs pa med par phyogs de la 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'i mtshan nyid ni rab tu 'jug pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of going and coming in that place without hesitation is the engagement.

original: 'dis dbang phyug sde dang gzhon nu ma len gyis tshig gi go skabs su dogs pa la grub pa'i mtha' yas rnam par gzhag pa byed pa ni de'i 'dod ba bsal nas yang gzhan su na dbyung ba'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dis dbang phyug sde dang gzhon nu ma len gyis tshig gi go skabs su dogs pa la grub pa'i mtha' yas rnam par gzhag pa byed pa ni de'i 'dod ba bsal nas yang gzhan su na dbyung ba'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to eliminate the belief of the followers of Isvara and Kumarila that the occasion of the word is established by the theory of the logicians, and in order to refute another who might argue thus, he says:

original: ji ltar na gzhan yod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar na gzhan yod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: How can the existence of one thing be the non-existence of another?

original: dbang phyug sde'i 'dod pa ni 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs dag yod pa'i ngo bo las mi dmigs pas tha dad par byed pas gdon mi za bar 'di med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: dbang phyug sde'i 'dod pa ni 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs dag yod pa'i ngo bo las mi dmigs pas tha dad par byed pas gdon mi za bar 'di med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: The belief of the followers of Isvara is that the existence of the effect and the existence of the cause are differentiated by non-apprehension, so they are certainly different entities.

original: de lta ma yin na tha dad par byas pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na tha dad par byas pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, then the distinction would be pointless.
