original: khyod kyis kyang gzhan bkag pas dben pa'i sa phyogs sam de'i shes pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid du ni dmigs par bstan te /
analyzed: khyod kyis kyang gzhan bkag pas dben pa'i sa phyogs sam de'i shes pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid du ni dmigs par bstan te /
translated: You also have acknowledged that the object is perceived as the nature of the absence of the other, i.e., the absence of the cognition of the other.

original: 'di yod pa la de med pa de ni nyung ste gang gis de ltar brjod par bya ba 'di dag mi rigs so //
analyzed: 'di yod pa la de med pa de ni nyung ste gang gis de ltar brjod par bya ba 'di dag mi rigs so //
translated: The existence of this is the nonexistence of that, and it is not proper to say that this is the case.

original: yod pa dang med te /
analyzed: yod pa dang med te /
translated: Existence and nonexistenceüîΩThe two aspects of existence and nonexistence are different by nature.

original: yong ba dang med pa'i cha chos kyi ngo bos tha dad pa yod / gzhon nu ma len yang 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: yong ba dang med pa'i cha chos kyi ngo bos tha dad pa yod / gzhon nu ma len yang 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Kumarila thinks as follows:

original: gang dag gang shes par byed pa dang shes par bya ba'i chos kyi mtshan nyid rnam pa gnyis mi dmigs pa'i ngo bor yod par khyed kyis brjod de /
analyzed: gang dag gang shes par byed pa dang shes par bya ba'i chos kyi mtshan nyid rnam pa gnyis mi dmigs pa'i ngo bor yod par khyed kyis brjod de /
translated: You have stated that the two aspects of the object of knowledge and the means of knowledge exist in the nature of nonapprehension.

original: de med pa ni med pa nying shes pa'i sgrub par byed pa yod de /
analyzed: de med pa ni med pa nying shes pa'i sgrub par byed pa yod de /
translated: The nonexistence of that is the existence of the means of knowledge.

original: 'on kyang de nyid ni gzhan dgag par bya bas dben pa ni dngos po dgag par bya ba'i shes pa'am gzhan pa ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang de nyid ni gzhan dgag par bya bas dben pa ni dngos po dgag par bya ba'i shes pa'am gzhan pa ste /
translated: But that is the cognition of the negation of an entity that is separate from the negation of another.

original: de'i shes pa gang yod pa dang med pa'i cha de ji ltar med par dgag par bya ba'am shes pa yin /
analyzed: de'i shes pa gang yod pa dang med pa'i cha de ji ltar med par dgag par bya ba'am shes pa yin /
translated: How could the part that exists and the part that does not exist be the negation or cognition of non-existence?

original: ji ltar med pa'i cha la sbyor ba ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar med pa'i cha la sbyor ba ma yin te /
translated: How could one not apply the part that does not exist?

original: yong ba dang med pa'i cha chos kyi ngo bos tha dad pa yod kyang chos can gyi ngo bo la tha dad @291a * //üîΩpa med do /
analyzed: yong ba dang med pa'i cha chos kyi ngo bos tha dad pa yod kyang chos can gyi ngo bo la tha dad @291a * // pa med do /
translated: Although the part that exists and the part that does not exist are different by the nature of phenomena, they are not different by the nature of the subject.

original: gal te de dag yod pa dang med pa dag gzung ba dang gzung ba ma yin par rnam par gnas te /
analyzed: gal te de dag yod pa dang med pa dag gzung ba dang gzung ba ma yin par rnam par gnas te /
translated: If they are apprehended as existent and non-existent, and as existent and non-existent,

original: ji skad du /üîΩchos can tha dad med na yang //
analyzed: ji skad du / chos can tha dad med na yang //
translated: as it is said:üîΩEven if the subject is not different,

original: chos dag tha dad med na yang //
analyzed: chos dag tha dad med na yang //
translated: even if the phenomena are not different,

original: chos dag tha dad 'dod pa na //
analyzed: chos dag tha dad 'dod pa na //
translated: if phenomena are asserted to be different,

original: yod dang med pa'i tha dad phyir //
analyzed: yod dang med pa'i tha dad phyir //
translated: because of the difference between existence and non-existence,

original: 'dzin pa rnam par gnas pa yin //üîΩzhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'dzin pa rnam par gnas pa yin //üîΩzhes bshad do //
translated: apprehension is established.

original: lan bshad zin pa 'di bstan pa ni 'dir ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: lan bshad zin pa 'di bstan pa ni 'dir ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The reply that has already been given is indicated by the words ‚ÄúHere, how?‚Äù

original: ji ltar ma yin par 'jug pa la ltos pa'i sgo nas ni dgag pa dag ni de shes pa la ltos nas des dben pa'i don dang shes pa med pa dag mi dmigs par brjod par bya ba'i phyir dbang phyug sde'i lan btab pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar ma yin par 'jug pa la ltos pa'i sgo nas ni dgag pa dag ni de shes pa la ltos nas des dben pa'i don dang shes pa med pa dag mi dmigs par brjod par bya ba'i phyir dbang phyug sde'i lan btab pa yin no //
translated: The refutations are the reply to the argument of B·πõhaspati, because they are stated in order to show that the non-observation of the object and the cognition that is devoid of that is a non-observation that depends on the cognition of that.

original: med par dgag pa kho na 'ba' zhig dgag pa'i don ma yin gyi /
analyzed: med par dgag pa kho na 'ba' zhig dgag pa'i don ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not the case that the meaning of negation is only a non-affirming negation.

original: 'on kyang ma yin par dgag pa yang yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang ma yin par dgag pa yang yin no //
translated: However, it is also an affirming negation.

original: de'i phyir gzhan yod la gzhan med pa'i gtan tshigs dang mi dmigs pa tha dad par byed pa ni rtogs par byed pa po'i bsam pa'i dbang gis yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan yod la gzhan med pa'i gtan tshigs dang mi dmigs pa tha dad par byed pa ni rtogs par byed pa po'i bsam pa'i dbang gis yin no //
translated: Therefore, the distinction of the reason of the existence of another and the non-observation of the existent is made in accordance with the intention of the one who understands.

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs rtogs pas dngos po khong du chud par nges pa dang / mi dmigs pa yis dngos po med pa rtogs par nges pa yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs rtogs pas dngos po khong du chud par nges pa dang / mi dmigs pa yis dngos po med pa rtogs par nges pa yin no //
translated: The understanding of an existent thing is ascertained by the understanding of a reason of nature, and the understanding of a nonexistent thing is ascertained by the understanding of non-observation.

original: don dam par dgag pa ni med pa'i tha snyad du rung ba'i dngos por gyur pa nyid kyi phyogs bsgrub par bya ba yin pas rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs ma yin gyi rang bzhin mi dmigs par rigs par bya'o //
analyzed: don dam par dgag pa ni med pa'i tha snyad du rung ba'i dngos por gyur pa nyid kyi phyogs bsgrub par bya ba yin pas rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs ma yin gyi rang bzhin mi dmigs par rigs par bya'o //
translated: In the ultimate, the negation is not a reason of nature, because it is the position that is to be established as a thing that is suitable as a convention of non-existence. It should be understood as a reason of the non-observation of a nature.

original: gang yang ltos pa med pa'i don gzhan pa'i tshogs pa dgag pa tsam ni mi par byed pa ni par byed pa ni dgag pa tsam ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang yang ltos pa med pa'i don gzhan pa'i tshogs pa dgag pa tsam ni mi par byed pa ni par byed pa ni dgag pa tsam ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: As for the mere negation of a collection that is a different object without dependence, that is not established, because the mere negation is not established.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i sgrub par byed pa ma grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i sgrub par byed pa ma grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause its proof is not established,‚Äù and so on.

original: dngos po med pa nus pa thams cad kyis stong pa'i mtshan nyid can du sgrub par byed pa 'grub pa'i gtan tshigs mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: dngos po med pa nus pa thams cad kyis stong pa'i mtshan nyid can du sgrub par byed pa 'grub pa'i gtan tshigs mi 'grub bo //
translated: The reason that establishes a non-thing that is characterized by being empty of all abilities is not established.

original: nus pa thams cad kyis stong pa de yang mi rigs pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: nus pa thams cad kyis stong pa de yang mi rigs pa'i phyir ram /
translated: That which is empty of all abilities is also not feasible.

original: gtan tshigs nyid ni nus pa dang 'brel pa'am /
analyzed: gtan tshigs nyid ni nus pa dang 'brel pa'am /
translated: Or, the reason itself is connected with ability.

original: dngos po'i ngo bo'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir dngos po'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir dngos po'o //
translated: It is a thing because it is the characteristic of the entity of a thing.

original: dngos po med pa'i ni lhan cig byed pa la ltos pa med par rag las pa'i phul du byung ba med pas med do zhes pa'i @291b shes pa skyed pa na de rtag tu skyed par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ni lhan cig byed pa la ltos pa med par rag las pa'i phul du byung ba med pas med do zhes pa'i @291b shes pa skyed pa na de rtag tu skyed par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the non-thing does not have a special dependence that is independent of its cooperating conditions, it is non-existent. When the cognition of non-existence is produced, it would follow that it would always be produced.

original: de'i phyir sgrub par byed pa dang ma 'brel pas med pa'i tha snyad mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir sgrub par byed pa dang ma 'brel pas med pa'i tha snyad mi 'grub bo //
translated: Therefore, since it is not related to a proof, the convention of non-existence is not established.

original: yang na med par dgag pa'i bdag nyid dmigs pa med pa'i sgrub par byed pa cung zad cig kyang mi 'grub ste de ni med pa nyid las gzhan pa'i dmigs pa med pas bsgrub par bya bar 'gyur la de la yang gzhan yin pas thug par 'gyur ro
analyzed: yang na med par dgag pa'i bdag nyid dmigs pa med pa'i sgrub par byed pa cung zad cig kyang mi 'grub ste de ni med pa nyid las gzhan pa'i dmigs pa med pas bsgrub par bya bar 'gyur la de la yang gzhan yin pas thug par 'gyur ro
translated: Or, if the nature of a negation is not established, there is no proof of the non-existence of an object. That would be established as the object of negation, since it is not different from non-existence. But since it would be different from that, there would be an infinite regress.

original: // dbang po bzhin du dgag pa'i shes pa'i rgyu rtag tu nye bas lhan cig byed pa la de nyid mi ltos pas de rtag tu skyed par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: // dbang po bzhin du dgag pa'i shes pa'i rgyu rtag tu nye bas lhan cig byed pa la de nyid mi ltos pas de rtag tu skyed par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Like a sense faculty, the cause of the cognition of negation would always be present. Since it does not depend on cooperating conditions, it would follow that it would always be produced.

original: don rnam pa gnyis bo 'di ji ltar med pa yin ;
analyzed: don rnam pa gnyis bo 'di ji ltar med pa yin ;
translated: How is it that these two kinds of objects do not exist?üîΩHow is it that some are understood and some are not understood?

original: 'ga' zhig rtogs dang rtogs pa'i rgyu de yang ji ltar rtogs pa yin zhes bya ba gzhung 'di'i nang du slob dpon rnag nyid kyis rnam par 'byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig rtogs dang rtogs pa'i rgyu de yang ji ltar rtogs pa yin zhes bya ba gzhung 'di'i nang du slob dpon rnag nyid kyis rnam par 'byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: The master himself will analyze this in the text.

original: yang gzhon nu ma len gyi lan ni de'i zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: yang gzhon nu ma len gyi lan ni de'i zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Kumarila‚Äôs response is stated in the line ‚ÄúThat which is . . .‚Äù

original: 'di zla bo dngos po gzhan dang 'dre ba'i ngo bo 'di dngos po gzhan dang 'dre ba med pa khyed kyi mngon par 'dod pa grub pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di zla bo dngos po gzhan dang 'dre ba'i ngo bo 'di dngos po gzhan dang 'dre ba med pa khyed kyi mngon par 'dod pa grub pa yin te /
translated: The essence of this is that the existence of the other entity that is mixed with it is established by your assertion.

original: yod pa'i cha nyid kyi med pa'i cha'i ngo bo rigs so zhes 'dod pa /
analyzed: yod pa'i cha nyid kyi med pa'i cha'i ngo bo rigs so zhes 'dod pa /
translated: It is reasonable that the essence of the part that exists is the part that does not exist.

original: de lta na yang med pa'i cha yang gzhan pa'i ngo bo dang mi 'dre ba nyid kyis med pa bstan gyi de lta ma yin na de mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de lta na yang med pa'i cha yang gzhan pa'i ngo bo dang mi 'dre ba nyid kyis med pa bstan gyi de lta ma yin na de mi 'thad do //
translated: Even so, the part that does not exist is shown to be nonexistent because it is not mixed with the essence of another entity. If it were not so, it would not be tenable.

original: de yang dngos po'i cha la yang mtshungs pa'i phyir de nyid med pa'i rgyu mtshan dang mtshungs pa'i phyir ci gzhan pa med pa'i cha khas blang bar bya /
analyzed: de yang dngos po'i cha la yang mtshungs pa'i phyir de nyid med pa'i rgyu mtshan dang mtshungs pa'i phyir ci gzhan pa med pa'i cha khas blang bar bya /
translated: Since it is similar in terms of the aspect of existence, why do you accept the aspect of nonexistence as the reason for the nonexistence of that?

original: de nyid kyi phyir ma 'dres pa'i ngo bo khyad par can yin na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ma 'dres pa'i ngo bo khyad par can yin na /
translated: Therefore, if it has a distinct, unmixed nature,üîΩthen why do you say that it is not different from that?

original: gang gi phyir de lta bas na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir gzhan yod pa ni gzhan gyi dngos po'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta bas na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir gzhan yod pa ni gzhan gyi dngos po'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSince it is like that‚Äù means ‚Äúfor that reason.‚Äù Therefore, the existence of another is the state of being other.

original: yod pa yang khyed mngon par 'dod do ;
analyzed: yod pa yang khyed mngon par 'dod do ;
translated: You assert that it exists.

original: / yod pa'i cha 'ba' zhig kyang ma yin gyi /
analyzed: / yod pa'i cha 'ba' zhig kyang ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not just the aspect of existence,

original: med pa'i cha khyed 'dod pas med pa yin no zhes tha snyad 'dogs so //
analyzed: med pa'i cha khyed 'dod pas med pa yin no zhes tha snyad 'dogs so //
translated: but you assert the aspect of nonexistence, so it is designated as ‚Äúnonexistent.‚Äù

original: kho bo cag ni des na yod pa'i cha'i med pa ngo bo brjod par gyur pa la 'gal ba ci yang med do //
analyzed: kho bo cag ni des na yod pa'i cha'i med pa ngo bo brjod par gyur pa la 'gal ba ci yang med do //
translated: Therefore, for us, there is no contradiction in saying that the nonexistence of the aspect of existence is its nature.

original: ji skad du shes par byed pa dang / shes par bya ba'i chos kyi mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin mi dmigs pas med pa'i tha snyad sgrub par byed pa yin gyi med pa ni ma yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: ji skad du shes par byed pa dang / shes par bya ba'i chos kyi mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin mi dmigs pas med pa'i tha snyad sgrub par byed pa yin gyi med pa ni ma yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: As it is said, ‚ÄúThe non-apprehension of the nature of the characteristics of the phenomena that are to be known and the means of knowing them establishes the convention of non-existence, but it is not non-existence.‚Äù

original: gzhan bsal ba'i phyir gang yang dag pa can ni mi dmigs pa de sgrub par byed par mi 'grub bo zhes bshad zin to //üîΩbshad pa gnyis pa ni dgag pa tsam gyis @292a * //
analyzed: gzhan bsal ba'i phyir gang yang dag pa can ni mi dmigs pa de sgrub par byed par mi 'grub bo zhes bshad zin to // bshad pa gnyis pa ni dgag pa tsam gyis @292a * //
translated: In order to eliminate another interpretation, it is said, ‚ÄúThat non-apprehension which is the property of the real is not established as the proof.‚ÄùüîΩThe second explanation is the demonstration that non-apprehension is not the proof of mere negation.

original: mi dmigs pa sgrub par byed pa ma yin par bstan pa ni gzhan yod pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa sgrub par byed pa ma yin par bstan pa ni gzhan yod pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúThe characteristic of the existence of another,‚Äù etc.,

original: 'jig rten pa ni 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa ni 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: is for the purpose of showing that the world thinks as follows:

original: sa phyogs dag pa mthong nas bum pa med par thog mar rtogs pa'am sa phyogs nyi tshe shes pas nyams su myong ba'i sgo nas bum pa med pa'i rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: sa phyogs dag pa mthong nas bum pa med par thog mar rtogs pa'am sa phyogs nyi tshe shes pas nyams su myong ba'i sgo nas bum pa med pa'i rtogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving seen a clean place, one first realizes that there is no pot, or one realizes that there is no pot by the experience of merely knowing the place.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir bum pa med pa'i tha snyad du byed pa nges na 'jig rten pa'i shes pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas dgag par byed pa'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir bum pa med pa'i tha snyad du byed pa nges na 'jig rten pa'i shes pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas dgag par byed pa'am /
translated: Therefore, when one makes the convention ‚Äúthere is no pot,‚Äù there are two kinds of cognition that negate: one that follows mundane cognition,

original: gzhan sa phyogs la dgag par bya ba'i shes pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhan sa phyogs la dgag par bya ba'i shes pa gnyis te /
translated: and the other that negates in a place where there is no pot.

original: de shes pa dag yod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po med par ro //
analyzed: de shes pa dag yod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po med par ro //
translated: Those two cognitions are the characteristics of the non-existence of an entity.

original: rang gi tshad mas ni dbang po'i mngon sum dang rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis dngos su 'am brgyud pas ji lta ba'i rim pas sgrub pa gang yin pa de yang bum pa med pa'i tha snyad byed pa yin no zhes de ltar rnam par gzhag par rigs
analyzed: rang gi tshad mas ni dbang po'i mngon sum dang rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis dngos su 'am brgyud pas ji lta ba'i rim pas sgrub pa gang yin pa de yang bum pa med pa'i tha snyad byed pa yin no zhes de ltar rnam par gzhag par rigs
translated: That which is established by one‚Äôs valid cognition, either directly or indirectly, by the direct perception of the sense faculties or the direct perception of reflexive awareness, is also the convention of the non-existence of a pot. It is reasonable to posit it in that way.

original: so// de ltar rnam par bzhag kyang khyed kyi phyogs nyams pa ci yang med do //
analyzed: so// de ltar rnam par bzhag kyang khyed kyi phyogs nyams pa ci yang med do //
translated: Even if it is posited in that way, there is no fault in your position.

original: de lta na brgyud pas kyang mi dmigs par khas blangs pa gang yin pa de grub pa des na de nyid kyis grub par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta na brgyud pas kyang mi dmigs par khas blangs pa gang yin pa de grub pa des na de nyid kyis grub par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is like that, then whatever is accepted as non-apprehension even indirectly is established by that, and therefore it is established by that alone.

original: dgag pa tsam gyi mi dmigs pa de nyid de sgrub par byed par bstan pa 'di'i dgongs pa ni ji ltar khyed shes par byed pa dang / shes par bya ba'i chos kyi mtshan nyid kyi dngos po ngo bo rnam pa gnyis mi dmigs pa de lta na kho bo yang shes par byed pa dang /üîΩshes par bya ba'i chos kyi mtshan nyid dmigs pa med pa dang mi dmigs pa'i ming can rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dgag pa tsam gyi mi dmigs pa de nyid de sgrub par byed par bstan pa 'di'i dgongs pa ni ji ltar khyed shes par byed pa dang / shes par bya ba'i chos kyi mtshan nyid kyi dngos po ngo bo rnam pa gnyis mi dmigs pa de lta na kho bo yang shes par byed pa dang / shes par bya ba'i chos kyi mtshan nyid dmigs pa med pa dang mi dmigs pa'i ming can rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: The intention of this statement that the non-observation of the mere negation is the proof is as follows: Just as you have the non-observation of the two kinds of entity that are the characteristics of the object of knowledge and the means of knowing, in the same way, we also have the two kinds of non-observation that are called ‚Äúnon-observation of the object of knowledge and the means of knowing‚Äù and ‚Äúobservation of the non-observation of the object of knowledge and the means of knowing.‚Äù

original: de la shes par bya ba'i chos kyi mtshan nyid ni gzhan yod pa mngon sum gyis grub pa dgag par bya ba med pa ni shes par bya ba'i mtshan nyid dmigs pa med pa'i ngo bo mi dmigs pa med pa'i ming can du grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la shes par bya ba'i chos kyi mtshan nyid ni gzhan yod pa mngon sum gyis grub pa dgag par bya ba med pa ni shes par bya ba'i mtshan nyid dmigs pa med pa'i ngo bo mi dmigs pa med pa'i ming can du grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: The characteristics of the object of knowledge are established by the direct perception of the existence of something else. The negation of the object of negation is the characteristic of the object of knowledge. The non-observation of the entity that is the non-observation of the object of knowledge is established as having the name ‚Äúnon-observation.‚Äù

original: shes par byed pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid dang gzhan yod pa ni sa phyogs dag pa shes pa'i bdag nyid rang rig pas grub pa dang / shes par byed pa'i chos dgag par bya ba'i shes pa med pa'i ngo bo mi dmigs par mtshungs par bshad pa grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes par byed pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid dang gzhan yod pa ni sa phyogs dag pa shes pa'i bdag nyid rang rig pas grub pa dang / shes par byed pa'i chos dgag par bya ba'i shes pa med pa'i ngo bo mi dmigs par mtshungs par bshad pa grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: The characteristics of the phenomenon that causes knowledge and the existence of another are established by reflexive awareness, which is the nature of the knowledge of a pure place, and the non-observation of the object of negation, the entity of the non-existent knowledge that causes knowledge, is explained as being the same.

original: des na gang las thug pa med par 'gyur /
analyzed: des na gang las thug pa med par 'gyur /
translated: So how could there be an infinite regress?

original: gang gis na sgrub par @292b byed pa mi 'grub par 'gyur ba de la gzhan yod pa'i mtshan nyid dgag par bya ba dang / de'i shes pa ni gzhan dgag par bya bas dben pa'i sa phyogs dang de'i shes pa de'i bdag nyid med pa brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gis na sgrub par @292b byed pa mi 'grub par 'gyur ba de la gzhan yod pa'i mtshan nyid dgag par bya ba dang / de'i shes pa ni gzhan dgag par bya bas dben pa'i sa phyogs dang de'i shes pa de'i bdag nyid med pa brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By what means would the proof not be established? It is because of the desire to state the existence of another, the object of negation, and the absence of the knowledge of that, the pure place devoid of the object of negation, and the absence of the nature of the knowledge of that.

original: yod pa dgag par bya ba dang de'i shes pa gzhan mi dmigs par khyed 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa dgag par bya ba dang de'i shes pa gzhan mi dmigs par khyed 'dod pa'o //
translated: You assert the non-observation of another, the object of negation, and the knowledge of that.

original: rang nyid ni rang gi ngo bo tshad ma ste dbang po'i mngon sum dang rang rig mngon sum gyis grub bo //
analyzed: rang nyid ni rang gi ngo bo tshad ma ste dbang po'i mngon sum dang rang rig mngon sum gyis grub bo //
translated: One‚Äôs own nature is established by valid cognition, by direct perception of the sense faculties and by direct perception of reflexive awareness.

original: de ni de dgag pa ni med pa'i tha snyad kyi shes pa'i rjod par byed pa 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sgrub par byed pa 'grub pa'am /
analyzed: de ni de dgag pa ni med pa'i tha snyad kyi shes pa'i rjod par byed pa 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sgrub par byed pa 'grub pa'am /
translated: If you assert that the negation of that is the establishment of the proof that has the characteristic of engaging the cognition that expresses the term nonexistence,

original: de 'grub pas de gzhan pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid kyi med par ji skad bshad pas grub pa'am /
analyzed: de 'grub pas de gzhan pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid kyi med par ji skad bshad pas grub pa'am /
translated: then that is established by the establishment of that, and the characteristic of the nonexistence of other things is established as explained.

original: de med par grub pa'am /
analyzed: de med par grub pa'am /
translated: Or, if the establishment of that nonexistence

original: de dgag par bya ba de shes pa ni med pa zhes bya ba de ltar 'dod na /
analyzed: de dgag par bya ba de shes pa ni med pa zhes bya ba de ltar 'dod na /
translated: is the cognition of the object of negation, then it is called nonexistence.

original: khyed mngon par 'dod pa'i mi dmigs pa dang kho bo cag mngon par 'dod pa'i mi dmigs pa la khyad par 'ga' yang med na kho bo cag gi lta ba cis na spong bar byed /
analyzed: khyed mngon par 'dod pa'i mi dmigs pa dang kho bo cag mngon par 'dod pa'i mi dmigs pa la khyad par 'ga' yang med na kho bo cag gi lta ba cis na spong bar byed /
translated: If there is no difference at all between the nonobservation that you assert and the nonobservation that we assert, then why do you reject our view?

original: 'o na ni khyad par yod par 'dod de gzhan yod pa'i mtshan nyid mi dmigs pa dang cig shos bar du ma chod pa'o //
analyzed: 'o na ni khyad par yod par 'dod de gzhan yod pa'i mtshan nyid mi dmigs pa dang cig shos bar du ma chod pa'o //
translated: Well, you assert that there is a difference, because the nonobservation that has the characteristic of the existence of another is not obstructed by the other.

original: de med pa'i tha snyad sgrub par byed pa yin no snyam nas de la khyad par med de zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de med pa'i tha snyad sgrub par byed pa yin no snyam nas de la khyad par med de zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Thinking that the non-existence of that is established by the convention, he says, ‚ÄúThere is no difference.‚Äù

original: khyad par med na gang gis na mi dmigs pa med pa'i ngo bo dngos po dang 'brel pa spong bar kho bo cag mngon par 'dod pa'i med pa'i tha snyad du sgrub pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur /
analyzed: khyad par med na gang gis na mi dmigs pa med pa'i ngo bo dngos po dang 'brel pa spong bar kho bo cag mngon par 'dod pa'i med pa'i tha snyad du sgrub pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur /
translated: If there is no difference, then by what is the non-existence of the non-observation of the nature of the thing related to the thing refuted? It would contradict our assertion that the non-existence of the thing is established by the convention.üîΩAlso, because the difference of the other exists, there is no contradiction. Therefore, it is exactly the same as non-existence.

original: gzhan gyi khyad par yod pa la yang gnod pa med pa'i phyir med par mtshungs pa kho na'o / de skad du de'i sgrub par byed pa med pas med pa'i tha snyad mi 'grub par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad zin to zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi khyad par yod pa la yang gnod pa med pa'i phyir med par mtshungs pa kho na'o / de skad du de'i sgrub par byed pa med pas med pa'i tha snyad mi 'grub par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad zin to zhe na /
translated: It has been explained that it follows that the convention of non-existence is not established because there is no proof of it.

original: de yang mi bden te /
analyzed: de yang mi bden te /
translated: That is also not correct.

original: gang gi phyir de nyid khyod mngon par 'dod pa'i gzhan yod pa dgag par bya bas dben pa'i sa phyogs bdag nyid de'i yul dmigs pas mi dmigs par 'dod pa dang de med pa'i mi dmigs par kho bo cag 'dod pa'i dgag par bya ba med pa dang
analyzed: gang gi phyir de nyid khyod mngon par 'dod pa'i gzhan yod pa dgag par bya bas dben pa'i sa phyogs bdag nyid de'i yul dmigs pas mi dmigs par 'dod pa dang de med pa'i mi dmigs par kho bo cag 'dod pa'i dgag par bya ba med pa dang
translated: Because you assert that the mere object that is the domain of the perception of that very place that is devoid of the existence of something else that you assert is the nonobservation of that, and we assert that the nonobservation of that is the nonexistence of the object of negation.

original: / de dmigs pas med pa ci'i phyir na sgrub par byed pa'i rtags su cis na mi 'dod /
analyzed: / de dmigs pas med pa ci'i phyir na sgrub par byed pa'i rtags su cis na mi 'dod /
translated: Why do you not assert that the nonexistence of the object of negation and the nonobservation of that are the evidence that proves the nonexistence of the object of negation?

original: de lta na yod par 'jig rten pa la grags pa'i rjes su 'brang bar 'gyur na /üîΩci'i phyir gzhan yod par rnam pa @293a * //
analyzed: de lta na yod par 'jig rten pa la grags pa'i rjes su 'brang bar 'gyur na / ci'i phyir gzhan yod par rnam pa @293a * //
translated: In that case, you would follow what is renowned in the world as existent.üîΩWhy do you not assert that the establishment of the existence of something else in two ways is the establishment of its nonexistence?

original: gnyis su grub pa nyid de med par grub na de'i bsgrub par bya ba gzhan 'ga' zhig yod par 'gyur zhes kho bo cag 'dod pa'i 'jig rten pa las shin tu 'das pa mi 'dod do zhes bya ba phyogs snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: gnyis su grub pa nyid de med par grub na de'i bsgrub par bya ba gzhan 'ga' zhig yod par 'gyur zhes kho bo cag 'dod pa'i 'jig rten pa las shin tu 'das pa mi 'dod do zhes bya ba phyogs snga ma bzhin no //
translated: If that is established, then the object of negation would be something that exists. We do not assert that you transcend the world in the way that you think you do.

original: 'dir so sor ma grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'dir so sor ma grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Here BhƒÅviveka says, ‚ÄúBecause it is not individually established.‚Äù

original: gzhan yod pa 'dis med pa'i rtags dang rtags can ga la yin /
analyzed: gzhan yod pa 'dis med pa'i rtags dang rtags can ga la yin /
translated: How could the existence of another be a reason and a property-possessor of non-existence?

original: de bzhin du 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ni gzhan yod pas de med pa'i rtags dang rtags can ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ni gzhan yod pas de med pa'i rtags dang rtags can ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, because of the absence of a relation, the existence of another is not a reason and a property-possessor of non-existence.

original: thog mar re zhig rgyu'i 'brel pa ni gzhan yod pa'i zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: thog mar re zhig rgyu'i 'brel pa ni gzhan yod pa'i zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: First of all, the relation of cause is stated as ‚Äúthe existence of another,‚Äù etc.

original: de dben pa'i sa phyogs kyis bdag nyid de ni sgrub par byed pa ma yin la dgag par bya ba med pa'i rtags ma yin te dmigs pa yang de med pa'i sgrub par byed pa ma yin par phyi mas bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de dben pa'i sa phyogs kyis bdag nyid de ni sgrub par byed pa ma yin la dgag par bya ba med pa'i rtags ma yin te dmigs pa yang de med pa'i sgrub par byed pa ma yin par phyi mas bshad par bya'o //
translated: That is not an affirming negative, nor is it a reason for the non-existence of the object of negation, nor is the non-perception of that a proof of its non-existence, as will be explained later.

original: de'i don ni re zhig gi sgra'o //
analyzed: de'i don ni re zhig gi sgra'o //
translated: The meaning of that is stated by the word ‚Äúfirst of all.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir gzhan yod pa sgrub byed ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gzhan yod pa sgrub byed ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is the existence of another not a proof?

original: gang zhig grub na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gang zhig grub na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is stated: ‚ÄúWhen something is established,‚Äù etc.

original: dngos po la grub par grags pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po la grub par grags pa'o //
translated: An entity is established by what is well known.

original: gang gzhan gyi dngos po mi 'grub pa ni ma grags pa'o //
analyzed: gang gzhan gyi dngos po mi 'grub pa ni ma grags pa'o //
translated: The non-establishment of another entity is not well known.

original: de'i dngos po de ni dngos po don dngos po'i rtags can du 'gyur ro zhes 'dir rtags dang rtags kyi rigs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dngos po de ni dngos po don dngos po'i rtags can du 'gyur ro zhes 'dir rtags dang rtags kyi rigs pa'o //
translated: That entity of it is the entity of the sign of the entity of the object.

original: 'dir dben ni me dang du ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'dir dben ni me dang du ba lta bu'o //
translated: Here, the example is like fire and smoke.

original: ji ltar gang gi tshe du ba rtogs pa me mi rtogs pa de'i tshe de dag rtags dang rtags can gyi dngos por 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar gang gi tshe du ba rtogs pa me mi rtogs pa de'i tshe de dag rtags dang rtags can gyi dngos por 'gyur te /
translated: Just as when smoke is perceived, fire is not perceived, at that time they are the entity of the sign and the possessor of the sign.

original: du ba rtogs pa'i dus su mi rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: du ba rtogs pa'i dus su mi rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that when smoke is perceived, fire is not perceived.

original: gal te de lta na des ci ste zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na des ci ste zhe na /
translated: If it is like that, then what is the point of it?

original: gzhan zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It says other.

original: yod pa ni dngos po'i ngo bo gang yin pa der grub pa nyid de rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa ni dngos po'i ngo bo gang yin pa der grub pa nyid de rtogs pa'o //
translated: That which exists is the nature of the entity, which is established as just that, the realization.

original: de med pa ni dgag par bya ba de med pa'o //
analyzed: de med pa ni dgag par bya ba de med pa'o //
translated: That non-existence is the non-existence of the object of negation.

original: grub pa ni rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: grub pa ni rtogs pa'o //
translated: Establishment is realization.

original: gzhan yod pa nyid de med pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir de grub pa nyid kyis de grub pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan yod pa nyid de med pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir de grub pa nyid kyis de grub pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The existence of the other is the nature of non-existence, because by establishing that, it has the characteristic of establishing that.

original: rigs pa can yang dgag par bya ba ni med par dgag pa'i bdag nyid can med pa'i ngo bo yin pa de ni ji ltar gzhan yod pa'i ngo bo yod pa dang med pa dag 'gal ba med par 'gyur /
analyzed: rigs pa can yang dgag par bya ba ni med par dgag pa'i bdag nyid can med pa'i ngo bo yin pa de ni ji ltar gzhan yod pa'i ngo bo yod pa dang med pa dag 'gal ba med par 'gyur /
translated: The object of negation is a non-implicative negation, which is a non-existent entity. How can it be that the entity of the existence of another is both existent and non-existent without contradiction?

original: ji ltar gzhan yod par grub pa nyid kyis de med par grub par 'gyur snyam du sems na de las zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan yod par grub pa nyid kyis de med par grub par 'gyur snyam du sems na de las zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúHow can the establishment of the existence of another be the establishment of its non-existence?‚Äù then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says, ‚ÄúFrom that.‚Äù

original: de med pa'i phyogs kyi mtshan nyid yin @293b pa de'i phyir gzhan dgag par bya ba bum pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyogs kyi mtshan nyid yin @293b pa de'i phyir gzhan dgag par bya ba bum pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Since that is the defining characteristic of the category of non-existence, the object of negation is a pot and so on.

original: ma 'dres pa'i ngo bo ni spangs pa'i bdag nyid nyi tshe dgag par bya bas stong pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa'i ngo bo ni spangs pa'i bdag nyid nyi tshe dgag par bya bas stong pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The unmixed entity is the mere negation that is the nature of emptiness.

original: 'dis ni sa phyogs nyi tshe yang med par dgag pa'i bdag nyid du smra na ni ji ltar yod pa ci yang ma yin pa'i ngo bo ni rang bzhin dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'dis ni sa phyogs nyi tshe yang med par dgag pa'i bdag nyid du smra na ni ji ltar yod pa ci yang ma yin pa'i ngo bo ni rang bzhin dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that the mere place is the nature of a non-implicative negation, then how could the nature of what exists be nothing at all? It would be contradictory to its nature.

original: gzhan gyi ngo bos de yang ci yang ma yin pa'i ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo bos de yang ci yang ma yin pa'i ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nature of the other is not the nature of that which is not anything at all.üîΩSince there is no other entity that is not dependent on something else, there is nothing at all that is the nature of a negation, emptiness, or the appearance of conceptual thought.

original: ji lta ba'i ltos pa med pa'i dngos po gzhan med par dgag pa dang stong pa dang rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba dgag par bya ba ci yang med pa'i ngo bo dang de'i ngo bo spangs pa ni de lta bu de ni gzhan yod kyang dgag par
analyzed: ji lta ba'i ltos pa med pa'i dngos po gzhan med par dgag pa dang stong pa dang rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba dgag par bya ba ci yang med pa'i ngo bo dang de'i ngo bo spangs pa ni de lta bu de ni gzhan yod kyang dgag par
translated: The nature of that which is excluded from that is the nature of the exclusion of that which is to be negated.

original: bya ba dang ma 'dres pa'i ngo bo yin pa de'i phyir ji ltar 'di dgag par bya ba med pa'i ngo bo phan tshun gyi bdag nyid can du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bya ba dang ma 'dres pa'i ngo bo yin pa de'i phyir ji ltar 'di dgag par bya ba med pa'i ngo bo phan tshun gyi bdag nyid can du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since it is the nature of the exclusion of that which is to be negated, how could it follow that it is the nature of the mutual identity of that which is to be negated?

original: de'i phyir ngo bo yin gyi gzhan gyi ngo bos ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir ngo bo yin gyi gzhan gyi ngo bos ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is the nature of that, not the nature of the other.

original: de lta ma yin na ji ltar gzhan yod pa 'di gzhan pa'am de la med par 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ji ltar gzhan yod pa 'di gzhan pa'am de la med par 'gyur /
translated: Otherwise, how could the existence of the other be the other or not exist in that?

original: gang dang gang med par mi 'gyur ba de nyid 'di yin te /
analyzed: gang dang gang med par mi 'gyur ba de nyid 'di yin te /
translated: That which does not not exist is this.

original: de'i ngo bo bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo bzhin no //
translated: It is like the nature of that.

original: de'i phyir 'gro ba thams cad phan tshun gyi bdag nyid can du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gro ba thams cad phan tshun gyi bdag nyid can du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it follows that all things would have the nature of each other.

original: de'i phyir dngos po thams cad gzhan gyi ngo bo med par yin la rang gi ngo bos ngo bo nyid la gnod pa med do ;
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po thams cad gzhan gyi ngo bo med par yin la rang gi ngo bos ngo bo nyid la gnod pa med do ;
translated: Therefore, all things are without the nature of another, and the nature of self is not impaired.

original: / de lta na ci ste med par dgag pa dang ma yin par dgag pa tha dad pa yin /
analyzed: / de lta na ci ste med par dgag pa dang ma yin par dgag pa tha dad pa yin /
translated: If that is so, why are there two kinds of negation, nonaffirming negation and affirming negation?

original: ci yang ma yin no //
analyzed: ci yang ma yin no //
translated: There is no reason at all.

original: ltos pa med pa 'ba' zhig ngo bo gzhan med pa tsam ni med par dgag pa yin no zhes 'jig rten pa brjod la ngo bo gzhan la gzhan gyi ngo bos stong pa ni ma yin par dgag pa'o //
analyzed: ltos pa med pa 'ba' zhig ngo bo gzhan med pa tsam ni med par dgag pa yin no zhes 'jig rten pa brjod la ngo bo gzhan la gzhan gyi ngo bos stong pa ni ma yin par dgag pa'o //
translated: The world speaks of nonaffirming negation as the mere absence of another nature, without any implication, and of affirming negation as the absence of the nature of another in another nature.

original: ngo bo gzhan ma yin la gzhan gyi ngo bo med pa tsam ma yin te /
analyzed: ngo bo gzhan ma yin la gzhan gyi ngo bo med pa tsam ma yin te /
translated: It is not that there is no mere absence of another nature in another nature,

original: ngo bo gzhan la de'i ngo bos stong par nyams su myong ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo gzhan la de'i ngo bos stong par nyams su myong ba kho na yin no //
translated: but it is experienced as the absence of that nature in another nature.

original: ji ltar de med par dgag pa'i bdag nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar de med par dgag pa'i bdag nyid du 'gyur /
translated: How could it be nonaffirming negation?

original: gzhan gyi ngo bo'i shugs kyis de las de rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo bo'i shugs kyis de las de rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But it is understood from the force of the other‚Äôs nature that it is that.

original: ma yin te rgyu rtogs pa med na shugs mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te rgyu rtogs pa med na shugs mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because without understanding the cause, the force is not possible.

original: de'i bdag nyid du med pa'i med par dgag du ba'i 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid du med pa'i med par dgag du ba'i 'brel pa yin no //
translated: The negation of nonexistence, which does not exist in the nature of that, is the relation of smoke.

original: 'du ba dan yur par rtogs kyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //üîΩde 'dir ma 'dres pa'i ngo bo can gang yin pa de nyid dgag par bya ba med pa ci yang ma yin pa'i ngo bo rnam par 'jog par byed pa'i tshad @294a * //
analyzed: 'du ba dan yur par rtogs kyi gzhan du ni ma yin no // de 'dir ma 'dres pa'i ngo bo can gang yin pa de nyid dgag par bya ba med pa ci yang ma yin pa'i ngo bo rnam par 'jog par byed pa'i tshad @294a * //
translated: The relation is understood as the combination of the two, not otherwise.

original: ma mngon sum gyi ngo bo de kho nas de dus phyis 'byung ba ma yin pa'i bum pa 'di na med do zhes brtags pas de gzung ba la 'dzin pa'i dran pa tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir gzhan bum pa la sogs pa rnam par gcod pas med
analyzed: ma mngon sum gyi ngo bo de kho nas de dus phyis 'byung ba ma yin pa'i bum pa 'di na med do zhes brtags pas de gzung ba la 'dzin pa'i dran pa tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir gzhan bum pa la sogs pa rnam par gcod pas med
translated: Here, that which has the nature of nonmixture is the nature of the object of negation, which is nothing at all. The nature of direct perception, which is the valid knowledge that posits that, is the nature of direct perception. By the mere appearance of that, the later arising of that is not a vase here. The conception is that it is not. The memory that apprehends that is not a valid knowledge. Therefore, the vase, which is other than that, is excluded.

original: pa grub ste /
analyzed: pa grub ste /
translated: Nonexistence is established.

original: de med pa'i bdag nyid kyi sa phyogs des bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med pa'i bdag nyid kyi sa phyogs des bzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the place that has the nature of the nonexistence of that is apprehended by that.

original: sa phyogs dang / bum pa dang ma 'dres pa'i rnam pa gnyis po 'di ngo bo 'di yang ldog pa'i ngo bo yin no //
analyzed: sa phyogs dang / bum pa dang ma 'dres pa'i rnam pa gnyis po 'di ngo bo 'di yang ldog pa'i ngo bo yin no //
translated: The two aspects of the place and the pot are not mixed.

original: de'i phyir gzhan pa'am bum pa 'ba' zhig kyang ma yin pa bum par rtogs pa'i rten yod pa des na rnam pa gnyis mngon sum gyis 'dzin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan pa'am bum pa 'ba' zhig kyang ma yin pa bum par rtogs pa'i rten yod pa des na rnam pa gnyis mngon sum gyis 'dzin te /
translated: Therefore, since the basis for the cognition of the pot is the existence of the pot itself, which is neither something other nor the pot itself, the two aspects are apprehended by direct perception.

original: bum pa las gzhan pa nyid dang bum pas stong ba 'dzin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bum pa las gzhan pa nyid dang bum pas stong ba 'dzin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the pot is apprehended as being different from something other and as being empty of the pot.

original: dngos po ma 'dres pa grub par bya ba'i phyir ram 'di med do zhes bya ba de lta bu'i phyir tshad ma gzhan pa rtsam pa ma yin phyi nas 'di rgyas par 'chad par 'gyur bas re zhig gzhag go //
analyzed: dngos po ma 'dres pa grub par bya ba'i phyir ram 'di med do zhes bya ba de lta bu'i phyir tshad ma gzhan pa rtsam pa ma yin phyi nas 'di rgyas par 'chad par 'gyur bas re zhig gzhag go //
translated: In order to establish the non-mixture of entities, or because of the absence of that, another valid cognition is not required. This will be explained in detail later, so for now it is left as it is.

original: gang gi phyir gzhan yod par 'grub pa nyid de med par bshad pa'i rigs pas grub pa de'i phyir gzhan yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhan yod par 'grub pa nyid de med par bshad pa'i rigs pas grub pa de'i phyir gzhan yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Since the establishment of the existence of something other is explained as the non-existence of that, it is established by reasoning. Therefore, something other does not exist.

original: dgag par bya ba med pa'i rtags gnyis pa'i rgyu brjod pa ni 'brel pa med pa'i yang phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dgag par bya ba med pa'i rtags gnyis pa'i rgyu brjod pa ni 'brel pa med pa'i yang phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The reason for the second, the nonexistence of the object of negation, is stated by ‚Äúbecause there is no relation.‚Äù

original: gzhan yod pa dang de med pa dag la 'brel ba cung zad cig kyang yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir gang las rtags can gyi dngos po yin /
analyzed: gzhan yod pa dang de med pa dag la 'brel ba cung zad cig kyang yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir gang las rtags can gyi dngos po yin /
translated: The existence of something else and the nonexistence of that do not have even the slightest relation. Therefore, how could the existence of something else be the evidence for the nonexistence of that?

original: de yang na ma zhig tshe brjod par bya na /
analyzed: de yang na ma zhig tshe brjod par bya na /
translated: If you say that the nonexistence of that is expressed when it disintegrates,

original: gang gi tshe de med pa'i ngo bo nyid gzhan yod pa'i ngo bor khas blangs pa la ltos pa de'i tshe gzhan yod pa las tha dad pa de med pa ci yang ma yin pa'i ngo bo gzhan 'dod pa na yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de med pa'i ngo bo nyid gzhan yod pa'i ngo bor khas blangs pa la ltos pa de'i tshe gzhan yod pa las tha dad pa de med pa ci yang ma yin pa'i ngo bo gzhan 'dod pa na yin no //
translated: then at that time, when the nature of the nonexistence of that is accepted as the nature of the existence of something else, it is dependent. At that time, when the existence of something else is asserted as a different nature, the nonexistence of that is not asserted as a different nature that is nothing at all.

original: de lta ma yin na gzhan yod pa nyid de med pa'i ngo bo nyid bshad pa'i rigs pas de'i bdag nyid yin na ji ltar 'brel pa med pa yin /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gzhan yod pa nyid de med pa'i ngo bo nyid bshad pa'i rigs pas de'i bdag nyid yin na ji ltar 'brel pa med pa yin /
translated: If that were not so, then the existence of something else would be the nature of the nonexistence of that. It would be reasonable to explain that. If it is the same nature, how could there be no relation?

original: mngon sum gyis grub pa de nyid phyogs gzhan gyis byed par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis grub pa de nyid phyogs gzhan gyis byed par mi 'gyur te /
translated: That is established by direct perception. It is not the case that it is not established by other positions.

original: de dang de zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ltos pa'i sgo nas 'brel pa ni gcig la 'du ba zhes bya ba gzhan gyi gzhung gis bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de dang de zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ltos pa'i sgo nas 'brel pa ni gcig la 'du ba zhes bya ba gzhan gyi gzhung gis bshad pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat and that‚Äù and so on. The other school explains that ‚Äúrelation‚Äù is ‚Äúinclusion in one.‚Äù

original: gzhan ni rigs pa can la sogs pas byas pa dang mi rtag par brjod pa tha dad pa'i chos chos can gcig la 'du bas byas pa dang mi rtag pa dag chos can gcig la 'du ba'i 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni rigs pa can la sogs pas byas pa dang mi rtag par brjod pa tha dad pa'i chos chos can gcig la 'du bas byas pa dang mi rtag pa dag chos can gcig la 'du ba'i 'brel pa yin no //
translated: The other school says that the relation is the inclusion of the two, produced and impermanent, in one substratum, because the two different properties, produced and impermanent, are expressed in relation to one substratum.

original: 'du ba dang 'brel pa'i dpe gzhan ni @294b 'dir don gcig la 'du ba'i phyir yang dag par ldan pa nyid la 'du ba'i sgras brjod do //
analyzed: 'du ba dang 'brel pa'i dpe gzhan ni @294b 'dir don gcig la 'du ba'i phyir yang dag par ldan pa nyid la 'du ba'i sgras brjod do //
translated: The other example of relation is that the relation is called ‚Äúinclusion‚Äù because the two are included in one object.

original: ldan pa dang 'du ba dag ni rtag pa'i phyir tha dad par bshad pa la gus par mi byed do //
analyzed: ldan pa dang 'du ba dag ni rtag pa'i phyir tha dad par bshad pa la gus par mi byed do //
translated: Since relation and inclusion are permanent, they are explained as different, but one should not respect that.

original: pha rol pos me dang du ba dag rang gi yan lag can la 'du ba yin gyi de gnyis don gcig la ni 'du ba ma yin te /
analyzed: pha rol pos me dang du ba dag rang gi yan lag can la 'du ba yin gyi de gnyis don gcig la ni 'du ba ma yin te /
translated: The opponent says that fire and smoke are included in their own wholes, but those two are not included in one object.

original: me dang du ba gzhan gyi lugs kyis rten dang brten pa'i dngos po yin no zhes 'jig rten pas 'brel par bshad do //
analyzed: me dang du ba gzhan gyi lugs kyis rten dang brten pa'i dngos po yin no zhes 'jig rten pas 'brel par bshad do //
translated: In the system of others, fire and smoke are related as the container and the contained.

original: bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i 'brel pas byas pa'o //
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i 'brel pas byas pa'o //
translated: The relationship of the produced and the producer is based on ultimate reality.

original: 'o na ni don dam par me ni skyed par byed pa'i phyir cig shos ni bskyed par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: 'o na ni don dam par me ni skyed par byed pa'i phyir cig shos ni bskyed par bya ba yin na /
translated: If fire is the producer and smoke is the produced, then in ultimate reality,

original: dbang phyug sde dang lhan cig dpyad pa byas zin pa de rigs pa yu mtshan du brjod pa'am /
analyzed: dbang phyug sde dang lhan cig dpyad pa byas zin pa de rigs pa yu mtshan du brjod pa'am /
translated: the analysis of the relationship of the produced and the producer is the same as the analysis of the relationship of the master and the servant.

original: snang gzhan yod na de med pa dgal mi srid na ci ste brjod pa yin /
analyzed: snang gzhan yod na de med pa dgal mi srid na ci ste brjod pa yin /
translated: If the existence of one is not possible without the existence of the other, why do you say that?

original: bden te zhar la byung bas de'i 'dod pa yang dgag pa'i phyir bshad do //
analyzed: bden te zhar la byung bas de'i 'dod pa yang dgag pa'i phyir bshad do //
translated: It is true that this is a digression, but it is explained in order to refute the assertion of the opponent.

original: sngar gzhan yod pa mngon sum gyis grub pa'i phyir dgag par bya ba med pa de'i don la mngon sum las gzhan brtags na ni shin tu thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngar gzhan yod pa mngon sum gyis grub pa'i phyir dgag par bya ba med pa de'i don la mngon sum las gzhan brtags na ni shin tu thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the existence of another is established by direct perception, the nonexistence of the object of negation is also established by direct perception. If you imagine that there is something other than direct perception, then there is a great fallacy.

original: zhar la byung ba bshad nas da ni 'di brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: zhar la byung ba bshad nas da ni 'di brjod par bya ste /
translated: Having explained the ancillary topic, now this will be discussed.

original: gang gi tshe gzhan yod par 'dzin par mngon sum gyis grub pa de med par mi 'gyur ba de'i tshe mngon sum las gzhan pas bum pa med do zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rnam pa khyad par dang khyad par du bya ba yod pa'i mtshan nyid dangüîΩnye ba la sogs pa 'dod par 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe gzhan yod par 'dzin par mngon sum gyis grub pa de med par mi 'gyur ba de'i tshe mngon sum las gzhan pas bum pa med do zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rnam pa khyad par dang khyad par du bya ba yod pa'i mtshan nyid dang nye ba la sogs pa 'dod par 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: When the existence of another is established by direct perception, then that which is not established as existent by direct perception, such as the absence of a vase, would not be established as nonexistent by direct perception.üîΩIf you think that at that time, the absence of a vase would be established as nonexistent by another valid cognition different from direct perception, then the aspect of that valid cognition would be the definition of the existence of a particular and that which is particularized, and the object would be the object of that valid cognition.

original: 'brel pa med na gzhan yod na de med pa dag khyad par dang khyad par du bya ba'i dngos po mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'brel pa med na gzhan yod na de med pa dag khyad par dang khyad par du bya ba'i dngos po mi rigs te /
translated: If there is no relation, then the existence of another and the absence of that would not be suitable as the thing that is particularized and that which particularizes.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir gang las de'i mtshan nyid dang nye ba de med na mngon sum du 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir gang las de'i mtshan nyid dang nye ba de med na mngon sum du 'gyur ba yin /
translated: Because of that, it is untenable that the definition and the object of that valid cognition would be established by direct perception.

original: de ltar 'brel pa'i rang gi ngo bo bshad pa de 'dir mi srid pa ni dngos po yod pa dang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ltar 'brel pa'i rang gi ngo bo bshad pa de 'dir mi srid pa ni dngos po yod pa dang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúIf things existed‚Äù is a response to that.

original: ji lta ba'i byas pa dang mi rtag pa dang me dang du ba dag don gcig tu 'du ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa ni yod pa dang med pa dag la de lta bu 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: ji lta ba'i byas pa dang mi rtag pa dang me dang du ba dag don gcig tu 'du ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa ni yod pa dang med pa dag la de lta bu 'ga' yang med do //
translated: The relation of identity, for example, is found in the case of the produced and impermanent, and fire and smoke, but not in the case of existence and nonexistence.

original: 'brel pa dag ni de med pa gzhan yod pa la sgrub par byed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa dag ni de med pa gzhan yod pa la sgrub par byed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And relations cannot establish the existence of one thing in the absence of another.

original: de lta na don gcig pa'i chos can la gnas pa gnas pa gang yin pa de dag don gcig la 'du ba yin te /
analyzed: de lta na don gcig pa'i chos can la gnas pa gnas pa gang yin pa de dag don gcig la 'du ba yin te /
translated: Thus, those things that are located in a single locus are located in a single thing.

original: gzhan la yod pa ni sa phyogs su bshad do //
analyzed: gzhan la yod pa ni sa phyogs su bshad do //
translated: The existence of something else is explained as the existence of a part of a place.

original: @295a * // rang gi yan lag can la gnas pa des na de la bum pa med pa'o //
analyzed: @295a * // rang gi yan lag can la gnas pa des na de la bum pa med pa'o //
translated: The pot is not located in its parts, because it is not located in each of its parts individually.

original: de lta nas phyogs kyi cha chas la bum pa med do zhes bya ba ni sa phyogs ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta nas phyogs kyi cha chas la bum pa med do zhes bya ba ni sa phyogs ma yin no //
translated: The pot is not located in the parts of a part, because it is not located in the parts of the parts.

original: sa phyogs kyi yan lag can ni rtsom pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sa phyogs kyi yan lag can ni rtsom pa ma yin te /
translated: The pot is not located in the place, because it is not located in the parts of the place.üîΩThe pot is not located in the possessor of the place, because the possessor of the place is not a real entity.

original: de rdzas kyi bdag nyid ni rdzas las gzhan pa nyid kyis rtsom pas bum pa'i med pa ni rdzas ni rnam pa dgur 'dod do //üîΩbya ba dang ldan pa la sogs pa rdzas kyi mtshan nyid yin na de lta yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de rdzas kyi bdag nyid ni rdzas las gzhan pa nyid kyis rtsom pas bum pa'i med pa ni rdzas ni rnam pa dgur 'dod do // bya ba dang ldan pa la sogs pa rdzas kyi mtshan nyid yin na de lta yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The substance of non-existence is not a substance, because it is not different from a substance.üîΩThe substance of non-existence is not a substance, because it is not different from a substance.

original: yon tan gyi ngo bos de la 'jug pa med do //üîΩyon tan ni nyi shu rtsa bzhi nyid du 'dod pa 'di de dag las gzhan pa ma yin no//üîΩlas kyi ngo bo rnam pa lnga ni ma yin te rang gi las dang rang gi de ma thag tu 'byung bas de'i mtshan nyid spangs pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan gyi ngo bos de la 'jug pa med do // yon tan ni nyi shu rtsa bzhi nyid du 'dod pa 'di de dag las gzhan pa ma yin no// las kyi ngo bo rnam pa lnga ni ma yin te rang gi las dang rang gi de ma thag tu 'byung bas de'i mtshan nyid spangs pa'o //
translated: The substance of non-existence is not a substance, because it is not different from a substance.üîΩThe substance of non-existence is not a substance, because it is not different from a substance.üîΩThe substance of non-existence is not a substance, because it is not different from a substance.üîΩThe substance of non-existence is not a substance, because it is not different from a substance.üîΩThe substance of non-existence is not a substance, because it is not different from a substance.

original: rdzas gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa de'i mtshan nyid rnams so //
analyzed: rdzas gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa de'i mtshan nyid rnams so //
translated: The substance of non-existence is not a substance, because it is not different from a substance.üîΩThe substance of non-existence is not a substance, because it is not different from a substance.üîΩThe substance of non-existence is not a substance, because it is not different from a substance.üîΩThe substance of non-existence is not a substance, because it is not different from a substance.üîΩThe substance of non-existence is not a substance, because it is not different from a substance.üîΩThe substance of non-existence is not a substance, because it is not different from a substance.üîΩThe substance of non-existence is not a substance, because it is not different from a substance.üîΩThe substance of non-existence is not a substance, because it is not different from a substance.üîΩThe substance of non-existence is not a substance, because it is not different from a substance.üîΩThe substance of non-existence is not a substance, because it is not different from a substance.üîΩThe substance of non-existence is not a substance, because it is not different from a substance.üîΩThe substance of non-existence is not a substance, because it is not different from a substance.üîΩThe substance of non-existence is not a substance, because it is not different from a substance.üîΩThe substance of non-existence is not a substance, because it is not different from a substance.üîΩThe substance of non-existence is not a substance, because it is not different from a substance.

original: de dang de dag med pa ni mi srid pa yin no //üîΩspyi la sogs pa'i ngo bos kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: de dang de dag med pa ni mi srid pa yin no // spyi la sogs pa'i ngo bos kyang ma yin te /
translated: The substance of non-existence is not a substance, because it is not different from a substance.

original: de'i ngo bo spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The substance of non-existence is not a substance, because it is not different from a substance.üîΩThe substance of non-existence is not

original: gzhan yod pa'i de med pa dag las me dang du ba dag bzhin du ldan pa ni med de /
analyzed: gzhan yod pa'i de med pa dag las me dang du ba dag bzhin du ldan pa ni med de /
translated: But they are not related as existent and nonexistent, like fire and smoke,

original: rdzas nyid du de khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas nyid du de khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not accepted as substantial entities.

original: de med pa ni rdzas yin no zhes ma bshad do //
analyzed: de med pa ni rdzas yin no zhes ma bshad do //
translated: It is not said that nonexistence is a substantial entity.

original: rten dang brten pa'i dngos po yang med de snod 'di la rgya shug yod pa bzhin du gang gi phyir de yang ldan pa'i rgyu mtshan du brjod pa'am /
analyzed: rten dang brten pa'i dngos po yang med de snod 'di la rgya shug yod pa bzhin du gang gi phyir de yang ldan pa'i rgyu mtshan du brjod pa'am /
translated: Nor is there a relation of support and supported, as in the case of the statement, ‚ÄúThere are jujubes in this container,‚Äù because that is stated as the reason for the relation.

original: snal ma 'di rnams la snam bu'i zhes bya ba ni 'du ba'i rgyu mtshan yin no //
analyzed: snal ma 'di rnams la snam bu'i zhes bya ba ni 'du ba'i rgyu mtshan yin no //
translated: Or, as in the case of the statement, ‚ÄúThere is cloth in these threads,‚Äù it is stated as the reason for the collection.

original: med pa ni rdzas kyi bdag nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa ni rdzas kyi bdag nyid ma yin no //
translated: Nonexistence is not the nature of a substantial entity.

original: ldan pa ma lus pa yang 'du ba rnam pa lnga nyid kyis rdzas la sogs pa rnams la 'du bar 'dod kyi dngos po med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ldan pa ma lus pa yang 'du ba rnam pa lnga nyid kyis rdzas la sogs pa rnams la 'du bar 'dod kyi dngos po med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: All relations are accepted as collections of substantial entities, etc., but not as nonentities.

original: rnam pa lnga ni rang gi nang du 'dus pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa lnga ni rang gi nang du 'dus pa yin te /
translated: The five kinds of collections are included in the following five:

original: de'i bdag nyid la phan 'dogs pa med pa'i yod pa ni rten du tha snyad gdags pa mi srid do //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid la phan 'dogs pa med pa'i yod pa ni rten du tha snyad gdags pa mi srid do //
translated: The existence that is not helpful to the nature of the other is not possible as a conventional designation of support.

original: phan 'dogs par byed pa ni bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i dngos por 'gyur na de med pa bskyed bar bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: phan 'dogs par byed pa ni bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i dngos por 'gyur na de med pa bskyed bar bya ba ma yin te /
translated: If it were to benefit, it would be the entity that generates and that which is generated, but that which does not exist is not that which is generated,

original: 'bras bu thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because the consequence would be that an effect would be generated.

original: 'bras bu yang 'dir mi srid de gang las rang gi rgyu dang 'dra ba'am yod pa dang 'dra ba 'bras bus brjod na /
analyzed: 'bras bu yang 'dir mi srid de gang las rang gi rgyu dang 'dra ba'am yod pa dang 'dra ba 'bras bus brjod na /
translated: Also, an effect is not possible here. If you describe an effect as similar to its cause or as existing,üîΩyou say that the place is not the cause because something else exists.

original: khyed gzhan yod pas sa phyogs su bshad pa rgyu ma yin gyi 'di ltar rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: khyed gzhan yod pas sa phyogs su bshad pa rgyu ma yin gyi 'di ltar rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The three types of nonexistence are as follows:

original: rdzas dang yon tan dang las @295b rnams kyis rdzas dgur 'dod do //
analyzed: rdzas dang yon tan dang las @295b rnams kyis rdzas dgur 'dod do //
translated: They assert that nonexistence is nine types of substance: substance, quality, and action.

original: med pa ni rdzas kyi mtshan nyid ma yin pas yod pa'i 'du ba yang shes pa yod pa'i yul de med par 'gyur na med pa ni shes pa'i yul ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa ni rdzas kyi mtshan nyid ma yin pas yod pa'i 'du ba yang shes pa yod pa'i yul de med par 'gyur na med pa ni shes pa'i yul ma yin no //
translated: Since nonexistence is not the characteristic of substance, the collection of existent things would be the object of the cognition of existent things. But if it were nonexistent, it would not be the object of cognition.

original: sa phyogs yod pa la yang bum pa med pa srid pas de 'bras bur ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: sa phyogs yod pa la yang bum pa med pa srid pas de 'bras bur ga la 'gyur /
translated: Since it is possible that a pot does not exist in an existent place, how could that be an effect?

original: de'i yul tha dad pa ni med de rnam pa gcig pa'i shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: de'i yul tha dad pa ni med de rnam pa gcig pa'i shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro /
translated: But they do not have different objects, because they are objects of a single cognition.

original: 'brel pa tha dad pas ni tha dad pa nyid ni spyi la yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa tha dad pas ni tha dad pa nyid ni spyi la yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If they were different because of a difference in relation, then difference would also follow for universals.

original: 'du ba yang de ma thag tu sun phyung bas rang gi rgyu yod pa las 'byung ba'i ngo bo'i 'bras bu de med par ga la 'gyur 'dis ni bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i dngos po yang bsal to //
analyzed: 'du ba yang de ma thag tu sun phyung bas rang gi rgyu yod pa las 'byung ba'i ngo bo'i 'bras bu de med par ga la 'gyur 'dis ni bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i dngos po yang bsal to //
translated: And since the combination has been refuted just previously, how could the effect that arises from the existence of its cause not exist? This also refutes the entities that are produced and the producer.

original: des na rnam pa thams cad du 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar gzhan yod pas de med pa'i sgrub par byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: des na rnam pa thams cad du 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar gzhan yod pas de med pa'i sgrub par byed par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, since there is no relation in any way, how could the existence of one thing establish the nonexistence of another?

original: 'brel pa gzhan bstan pa'i phyir gal te yul dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'brel pa gzhan bstan pa'i phyir gal te yul dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate another relation, he says, ‚ÄúIf the object . . . ‚Äù and so on.

original: dper na don ni yul lo //
analyzed: dper na don ni yul lo //
translated: For example, the object is the object-field.

original: sgra ni yul can no //
analyzed: sgra ni yul can no //
translated: The sound is the subject.

original: yul dang yul can gyi dngos po de dag 'brel pa bzhin du gzhan yod pas de med pa dag kyang yul dang yul can gyi dngos po'i 'brel pa las 'byung "bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul dang yul can gyi dngos po de dag 'brel pa bzhin du gzhan yod pas de med pa dag kyang yul dang yul can gyi dngos po'i 'brel pa las 'byung "bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as the things that are the object and subject are related, so too, the non-existence of one thing due to the existence of another is related to the things that are the object and subject.

original: sa phyogs su snang ba gzhan yod pas bum pa med par shes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma'i dogs pa'o //
analyzed: sa phyogs su snang ba gzhan yod pas bum pa med par shes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma'i dogs pa'o //
translated: The opponent‚Äôs position is that the non-existence of a pot is known due to the existence of the appearance of a place.

original: sgra dang don dag 'brel par 'gyur ro zhe mngon par 'brel pa'i ngo bo ci zhig yin /
analyzed: sgra dang don dag 'brel par 'gyur ro zhe mngon par 'brel pa'i ngo bo ci zhig yin /
translated: ‚ÄúThe word and the object would be related‚Äù ‚Äî what is the nature of the relation?

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The nature of the relation is that of cause and effect.

original: yang ji ltar don gyi 'bras bur sgra 'gyur /
analyzed: yang ji ltar don gyi 'bras bur sgra 'gyur /
translated: How is the word the effect of the object?

original: de ston pa ni don ston pa'i bsam pa yod pa la rjod par 'dod pa yod par sgra'i sbyor bas sgra brjod pa des na don rjod par 'dod pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: de ston pa ni don ston pa'i bsam pa yod pa la rjod par 'dod pa yod par sgra'i sbyor bas sgra brjod pa des na don rjod par 'dod pa la 'jug go //
translated: The word is used by the speaker who has the intention to indicate the object. The word is uttered with the desire to express the object.

original: sgra ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa ni med do //
analyzed: sgra ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa ni med do //
translated: The word does not have a relation that is characterized by cause and effect.

original: gal te na yang sgra dang don dag gi spyi'i ngo bo la blos yongs su brtags pa de lta na yang so sor snang ba'i rjod par 'dod pa'i sgra'i spyi las rtog pa dang 'brel pa'i sgra ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyis kun nas bslang ba'i sgo nas
analyzed: gal te na yang sgra dang don dag gi spyi'i ngo bo la blos yongs su brtags pa de lta na yang so sor snang ba'i rjod par 'dod pa'i sgra'i spyi las rtog pa dang 'brel pa'i sgra ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyis kun nas bslang ba'i sgo nas
translated: Even if the mind investigates the general nature of the word and its meaning, the word that is related to the thought is the general word that is desired to be expressed, which is produced by its own characteristics.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bur brjod do //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bur brjod do //
translated: It is said to be the cause and effect.

original: med na mi 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid yin par gzhan la rab tu grags par brjod do /
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid yin par gzhan la rab tu grags par brjod do /
translated: It is said to be well known to others that it has the characteristic of not occurring without the other.

original: gzhan ni med na mi 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi sgra dang don dag la 'brel @296a * //
analyzed: gzhan ni med na mi 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi sgra dang don dag la 'brel @296a * //
translated: Others say that the word and its meaning have the characteristic of not occurring without the other.

original: to zhes tha snyad byed do //
analyzed: to zhes tha snyad byed do //
translated: They make the convention that they are related.

original: des na 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan yin no //
analyzed: des na 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is the reason for the relation.

original: gal te nyan pa po dang 'chad pa po dag yod pa'i ngo bo'i yul dang yul can gyi ngo bor rigs kyi /
analyzed: gal te nyan pa po dang 'chad pa po dag yod pa'i ngo bo'i yul dang yul can gyi ngo bor rigs kyi /
translated: If the listener and the speaker exist, the object and subject exist.

original: de med pa'i gzhan yod pa dag kyang de bzhin du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de med pa'i gzhan yod pa dag kyang de bzhin du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If they do not exist, the other that exists would also be like that.

original: rnam pa 'di yang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rnam pa 'di yang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthis aspect‚Äù is stated.

original: rnam pa 'di ni de med pa gzhan yod pa las mi srid do zhes bshad ma thag pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di ni de med pa gzhan yod pa las mi srid do zhes bshad ma thag pa yin no //
translated: This aspect is not possible without the existence of something else, which is the absence of that.

original: bum pa med par bstan pa'i bsam pa la yod pa'i sa phyogs kyi mtshan nyid gzhan yod par rab tu sbyor bas grub pa med do //
analyzed: bum pa med par bstan pa'i bsam pa la yod pa'i sa phyogs kyi mtshan nyid gzhan yod par rab tu sbyor bas grub pa med do //
translated: Since the existence of the place where the pot does not exist is applied to the intention to indicate the nonexistence of the pot, it is not established.

original: bum pa med par ston pa'i bsam pa'i snga rol du sa phyogs rang gi rgyu kho na las grub po //
analyzed: bum pa med par ston pa'i bsam pa'i snga rol du sa phyogs rang gi rgyu kho na las grub po //
translated: Prior to the intention to indicate the nonexistence of the pot, the place exists by its own cause alone.

original: de'i bsam pa yongs su zin kyang gzhan yod pa dang de med pa de yang ji ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po de'i sgo nas sam med na mi 'byung ba las 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i bsam pa yongs su zin kyang gzhan yod pa dang de med pa de yang ji ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po de'i sgo nas sam med na mi 'byung ba las 'gyur /
translated: Even though it is grasped by that intention, how could the existence of something else and the absence of that be the relation of cause and effect or the relation of invariable concomitance?

original: gang gis na yul dang yul can gyi dngos por brtag par bya ba yin /
analyzed: gang gis na yul dang yul can gyi dngos por brtag par bya ba yin /
translated: By what means could it be imagined to be the relation of object and object-possessor?

original: gal te ji ltar sgra dang don dag bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa'i rgyu mtshan yul dang yul can gyi dngos po yin pa de ltar gzhan yod pa dang de med pa dag kyang re zhig de tsam gyi sgra dang don dag gi dpe yinüîΩno zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ji ltar sgra dang don dag bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa'i rgyu mtshan yul dang yul can gyi dngos po yin pa de ltar gzhan yod pa dang de med pa dag kyang re zhig de tsam gyi sgra dang don dag gi dpe yin no zhe na /
translated: If you think that just as sound and meaning are the reasons for the probandum and the proof, respectively, in the same way, the existence of another and the nonexistence of that are the examples of just those sound and meaning, respectively,

original: grub na ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: grub na ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: then in response to that, it is said, ‚ÄúIf they are established.‚Äù

original: sgra dang don dag ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'i rgyu mtshan gyis bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: sgra dang don dag ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'i rgyu mtshan gyis bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: Sound and meaning are the probandum and the proof, respectively, by the reason of the state of cause and effect.

original: de lta ma yin na don gzhan pa nyid ni der mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na don gzhan pa nyid ni der mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If that were not so, it would not be tenable that they are different objects.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang de med pa dang gzhan yod pa dag bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa'i dngos por 'grub par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang de med pa dang gzhan yod pa dag bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa'i dngos por 'grub par 'gyur na /
translated: In the same way, here too, if the nonexistence of that and the existence of another were established as the state of the probandum and the proof,

original: de'i tshe de'i sgo nas ni bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i sgo nas ni bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: then at that time, by means of that, they would be the probandum and the proof.

original: yul dang yul can gyi dngos por 'gyur na /
analyzed: yul dang yul can gyi dngos por 'gyur na /
translated: They would be the state of object and object possessor.

original: ji srid du de nyid bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed kyi dngos po'i 'brel pa med na rgyu dang 'bras bus dngos po gang gis 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji srid du de nyid bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed kyi dngos po'i 'brel pa med na rgyu dang 'bras bus dngos po gang gis 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: As long as there is no connection between the probandum and the proof, by what means would the effect be established by the cause?

original: thams cad bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that everything would be the probandum and the proof.

original: gal te ji ltar dbang po rang gi yul du 'grub pa'i rgyu mtshan yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ji ltar dbang po rang gi yul du 'grub pa'i rgyu mtshan yin zhe na /
translated: If it is asked how the sense faculty is the reason for establishing its object,

original: phan tshun nye bar 'gro ba la sogs pa brten pa'i rkyen gyi khyad par la sogs pa'i dbang po dang yul dag rnam par shes pa gcig bskyed par nus pas @296b skyed pa'i tha snyad 'dogs pa de bzhin du 'dir ma yin te /
