analyzed: phan tshun nye bar 'gro ba la sogs pa brten pa'i rkyen gyi khyad par la sogs pa'i dbang po dang yul dag rnam par shes pa gcig bskyed par nus pas @296b skyed pa'i tha snyad 'dogs pa de bzhin du 'dir ma yin te /
translated: the sense faculty and the object are able to produce a single consciousness, based on the special conditions of mutual approach and so forth, and the convention of production is designated in that way. But it is not so in this case.

original: gzhan yod pa dang de med ba dag de mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan yod pa dang de med ba dag de mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the existence of one and the nonexistence of the other are illogical.

original: rtags dang rtags can gyi dngos po'i mtshan nyid kyi bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa rnal ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rtags dang rtags can gyi dngos po'i mtshan nyid kyi bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa rnal ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the probandum and the proof are the real characteristics of the relationship between the evidence and the property possessor.

original: de la yang 'brel pa gzhan pa mi rigs so //
analyzed: de la yang 'brel pa gzhan pa mi rigs so //
translated: And in that case, another relation is not possible.

original: 'brel pa gzhan pa'i rgyu mtshan ni gzhan yod pa dang de med pa la med do //
analyzed: 'brel pa gzhan pa'i rgyu mtshan ni gzhan yod pa dang de med pa la med do //
translated: The reason for another relation is not in the existence of the other and in its non-existence.

original: gal te bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa'i dngos po yang yul dang yul can gyi dngos po'i rgyu mtshan kho na yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa'i dngos po yang yul dang yul can gyi dngos po'i rgyu mtshan kho na yin no zhe na /
translated: If the relation of probandum and probans is only the reason for the relation of object and subject,

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: then he says, ‚ÄúIf it were not so,

original: 'brel pa gzhan mi 'dod kyi 'on kyang yul dang yul can yin pas bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa'i dngos po yin pa de'i phyir yul dang yul can gyi dngos po yin pa des 'di gcig la gcig brten pa yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa gzhan mi 'dod kyi 'on kyang yul dang yul can yin pas bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa'i dngos po yin pa de'i phyir yul dang yul can gyi dngos po yin pa des 'di gcig la gcig brten pa yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: we would not accept another relation, but rather the relation of probandum and probans is due to the relation of object and subject. Therefore, by that relation of object and subject, there would be mutual dependence.

original: de lta na yang gcig ma grub pas gnyi ga yang ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang gcig ma grub pas gnyi ga yang ma grub pa yin no //
translated: But even so, since one is not established, both are not established.‚ÄùüîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / gzhan yod par gyur pa rtags las so //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gzhan yod par gyur pa rtags las so //
translated: the existence of the other is from the reason.

original: med pa ni rtags can no //
analyzed: med pa ni rtags can no //
translated: The non-existence is the characterized.

original: rjes su dpog par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpog par 'dod pa'o //
translated: The desire to infer is the inferential mark.

original: 'di spyi bsgrub par bya bar 'gyur na gzhan yod pas de med pa 'ba' zhig nyid sgrub pa'i phyir dang / 'ba' zhig pa la 'brel pa med pa ma yin pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa'i dngos po mi rigs so //
analyzed: 'di spyi bsgrub par bya bar 'gyur na gzhan yod pas de med pa 'ba' zhig nyid sgrub pa'i phyir dang / 'ba' zhig pa la 'brel pa med pa ma yin pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa'i dngos po mi rigs so //
translated: If the universal is to be established, then the mere non-existence of the other is established, and the relation of the probandum and probans is not tenable, because the mere thing is not unrelated.

original: spyi yang khyad par du bya ba dang khyad par byed pa la brten pa'i chos dang chos can mtshan nyid bsgrub par bya bar 'dod pas de med pa la skyon du yang 'gyur bas kyang smos pa yin no //
analyzed: spyi yang khyad par du bya ba dang khyad par byed pa la brten pa'i chos dang chos can mtshan nyid bsgrub par bya bar 'dod pas de med pa la skyon du yang 'gyur bas kyang smos pa yin no //
translated: And the universal is also asserted to be the probandum, the property of the subject, and the property of the reason, which are based on the particular. Therefore, the fault also applies to the non-existence of that.

original: gal te thams cad kyi spyi bsgrub par bya bar mi 'dod do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te thams cad kyi spyi bsgrub par bya bar mi 'dod do zhe na /
translated: If it is not asserted that the universal is to be established,

original: de lta na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de lta na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then it is said, ‚ÄúIn that case, etc.‚Äù

original: chos tsam yang rang rgyud pa'i bsgrub par bya bar khas blangs pa de las gzhan yod pa'i phyir bum pa med do zhes bya ba de lta bu'i ngo bo bum pa yul thams cad dang thams cad kyi tshe med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos tsam yang rang rgyud pa'i bsgrub par bya bar khas blangs pa de las gzhan yod pa'i phyir bum pa med do zhes bya ba de lta bu'i ngo bo bum pa yul thams cad dang thams cad kyi tshe med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of the existence of something other than the mere property, it follows that the pot does not exist, and that the pot, which is the entity of that, does not exist in all places and at all times.

original: chos can la la'i chos kyi yon tan du gyur pa sgrub par byed par de nyid la de'i tshe kho na yod par rigs te gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chos can la la'i chos kyi yon tan du gyur pa sgrub par byed par de nyid la de'i tshe kho na yod par rigs te gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: It is reasonable that the property, which is a quality of a particular subject, exists at that time and in that place, and not elsewhere.

original: thams cad du spyi bsgrub par bya bar khas blangs pas chos 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no snyam na gzhan gyi 'dir ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: thams cad du spyi bsgrub par bya bar khas blangs pas chos 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no snyam na gzhan gyi 'dir ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If you think that the universal is the property to be established, and not the mere property, then the opponent says, ‚ÄúIt is not so in the case of the other, etc.‚Äù

original: spyi bsgrub par bya ba la gzhan yod na de med pa 'brel pa med pa ga la @297a * //
analyzed: spyi bsgrub par bya ba la gzhan yod na de med pa 'brel pa med pa ga la @297a * //
translated: If the universal is the property to be established, how can it be unrelated to the existence of something else?

original: yin ; phyogs la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: yin ; phyogs la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: With ‚Äúthe direction, etc.,‚Äù he says:

original: sa phyogs 'di la bum pa med do zhes bya ba de bzhin du bum pa med pa'i sa phyogs la sogs pa chos can khyad par du byed pa yin te /
analyzed: sa phyogs 'di la bum pa med do zhes bya ba de bzhin du bum pa med pa'i sa phyogs la sogs pa chos can khyad par du byed pa yin te /
translated: Just as one says, ‚ÄúThere is no pot on this ground,‚Äù so too, the subject, the ground devoid of a pot, and so on, is specified.

original: bum pa dang bcas pa'i phyogs la sogs pa tha dad par rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir de'i khyad par gyis thob pa yin no //
analyzed: bum pa dang bcas pa'i phyogs la sogs pa tha dad par rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir de'i khyad par gyis thob pa yin no //
translated: Because it is posited as distinct from a place that has a pot, it is obtained by its specification.

original: bsgrub par bya ba ni bum pa med do zhes bya ba de lta bu 'ba' zhig ma yin par chos can 'ga' zhig la yon tan yod par ston pa de'i phyir spyi bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir gang gis ni de'i skyon 'byung bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba ni bum pa med do zhes bya ba de lta bu 'ba' zhig ma yin par chos can 'ga' zhig la yon tan yod par ston pa de'i phyir spyi bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir gang gis ni de'i skyon 'byung bar mi 'gyur /
translated: The probandum is not just ‚ÄúThere is no pot,‚Äù but rather, it is the demonstration that a certain subject has a property. Therefore, because the general is the probandum, how could the fault arise?

original: kho bo cag gi phyogs la ni rtags dang rtags can gzhan pa'i bdag nyid ma yin la phyogs la sogs pa'i chos can la 'brel pa med par thal ba'i skyon du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kho bo cag gi phyogs la ni rtags dang rtags can gzhan pa'i bdag nyid ma yin la phyogs la sogs pa'i chos can la 'brel pa med par thal ba'i skyon du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In our system, the reason and the property to be proven are not of different natures, and the subject, such as a place, is not subject to the fault of having no relation.

original: gzhan yod pa gang zhig yin snyam na bum pas dben pa'i sa phyogs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid phyogs kyi chos can dang de'i bdag nyid kyi 'brel pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan yod pa gang zhig yin snyam na bum pas dben pa'i sa phyogs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid phyogs kyi chos can dang de'i bdag nyid kyi 'brel pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: What is that other? It is the subject, the property possessor, such as the place devoid of pot, because it is related to the property of being the nature of that.üîΩIn the same way, you assert that the property possessor, such as sound, is related to the property of being impermanent by the definition of being its nature. In the same way, here too, existence is related to the property possessor, such as the place devoid of pot, by the definition of being its nature.

original: de lta na sgra la sogs pa'i chos can la byas pa nyid de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi 'brel par khyed 'dod pa de bzhin du 'dir yang yod pa yin no zhes bsams nas de yang 'brel pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba mi rigs pa bshad do
analyzed: de lta na sgra la sogs pa'i chos can la byas pa nyid de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi 'brel par khyed 'dod pa de bzhin du 'dir yang yod pa yin no zhes bsams nas de yang 'brel pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba mi rigs pa bshad do
translated: Thinking that, he explains that it is illogical to say, ‚ÄúBecause it is related to that.‚ÄùüîΩIf you think that, the proponent of the tenets would also not be related to the sign that is the definition of the property of the thesis, such as the absence of a pot and the existence of another, because they do not exist in the subject explained earlier.

original: snyam du sems na grub pa'i mtha' smra bas kyang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi mtshan nyid kyi rtags can bum pa med pa dang / gzhan yod pa'i rtags dang 'brel pa med pa ma yin na sngar bshad pa'i chos can la med pa des na lan 'di dag la 'brel pa ci zhig yod snyam du dgongs nas /
analyzed: snyam du sems na grub pa'i mtha' smra bas kyang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi mtshan nyid kyi rtags can bum pa med pa dang / gzhan yod pa'i rtags dang 'brel pa med pa ma yin na sngar bshad pa'i chos can la med pa des na lan 'di dag la 'brel pa ci zhig yod snyam du dgongs nas /
translated: Thinking that, he says, ‚ÄúWhat is the connection of these responses?‚Äù

original: gzhan yod par bshad pa dang chos can 'brel pa med par bstan pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba smos te rtags dang rtags can gyi 'brel pa med pa ma yin te zhes bya ba smras pa ma yin te zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhan yod par bshad pa dang chos can 'brel pa med par bstan pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba smos te rtags dang rtags can gyi 'brel pa med pa ma yin te zhes bya ba smras pa ma yin te zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: It is not that there is no relation between the reason and the property possessor, as stated by it is not that there is no relation between the reason and the property possessor. It is not that there is no relation between the reason and the property possessor is connected to it is not that there is no relation between the reason and the property possessor.

original: de ltar spyi sgrub par byed pa ma yin pas 'on kyang rtags dang rtags can gyi 'brel pa med pa nyid dang spyi sgrub pa med par de bzhin du brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar spyi sgrub par byed pa ma yin pas 'on kyang rtags dang rtags can gyi 'brel pa med pa nyid dang spyi sgrub pa med par de bzhin du brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, since the general is not established, it is said that there is no relation between the reason and the property possessor and that the general is not established.

original: chos can du rnam par gzhag pa ni gzhan yod pa yin pa'i phyir gzhan yod pa'i mtshan nyid rtags yin na phyogs la sogs pa ga la yin /
analyzed: chos can du rnam par gzhag pa ni gzhan yod pa yin pa'i phyir gzhan yod pa'i mtshan nyid rtags yin na phyogs la sogs pa ga la yin /
translated: Since the property possessor is posited as the existence of something else, how can the existence of something else be the reason, since it is the definition of the property possessor?

original: 'di dag bstan pa ni phyogs gang kho na @297b la chos can du khyed kyi brtags pa la bum pa la sogs pa med do zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'di dag bstan pa ni phyogs gang kho na @297b la chos can du khyed kyi brtags pa la bum pa la sogs pa med do zhes brjod do //
translated: These are taught because it is said that wherever you posit the property possessor, there is no pot, etc.

original: 'jig rten pas phyogs la sogs pa de nyid la bum pa la sogs pa de dang 'dre ba med pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pas phyogs la sogs pa de nyid la bum pa la sogs pa de dang 'dre ba med pa ste /
translated: The world accepts that very direction, etc., as the reason for the cognition that a pot does not exist there, because it is not mixed with a pot.

original: tshogs pas byas pa spangs pa'i gzhan yod pa rtags su 'dod ba las gzhan ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: tshogs pas byas pa spangs pa'i gzhan yod pa rtags su 'dod ba las gzhan ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: There is no other reason than the existence of something else, which is the negation of the pot‚Äôs being in the collection.

original: gang gi phyir de mthong ba kho nas ni bum pa dang ma 'dres pa'i phyogs la sogs pa mthong ba kho nas rtogs par byed pa pos 'di na bum pa med do snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pa rtags can gyi shes pa de dag khas blangs pa de
analyzed: gang gi phyir de mthong ba kho nas ni bum pa dang ma 'dres pa'i phyogs la sogs pa mthong ba kho nas rtogs par byed pa pos 'di na bum pa med do snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pa rtags can gyi shes pa de dag khas blangs pa de
translated: Because when one sees just that direction, etc., not mixed with a pot, the one who understands thinks, ‚ÄúThere is no pot here,‚Äù and that conceptual cognition with a reason is accepted.

original: nyid kyi phyir gzhan yod ba'o //
analyzed: nyid kyi phyir gzhan yod ba'o //
translated: For that very reason, it is the existence of something else.

original: gang kho na mthong ba rnams rtags kyi shes pa skyed pa de kho na rtags su brjod do //
analyzed: gang kho na mthong ba rnams rtags kyi shes pa skyed pa de kho na rtags su brjod do //
translated: That which is seen produces the cognition with a reason, and that alone is called the reason.

original: bum pa dang ma 'dres pa'i phyogs la sogs pa kho na yin pa de'i phyir gzhan yod pa'i mtshan nyid de nyid rtags su khas blangs pa des na ji ltar de kho na gzhan yod pa la ldog pa yin du zin kyang rtags dang rtags can gyi dngos
analyzed: bum pa dang ma 'dres pa'i phyogs la sogs pa kho na yin pa de'i phyir gzhan yod pa'i mtshan nyid de nyid rtags su khas blangs pa des na ji ltar de kho na gzhan yod pa la ldog pa yin du zin kyang rtags dang rtags can gyi dngos
translated: Because it is only the aspect that is not mixed with the vase, therefore, since you accept that the definition of the existence of another is the reason, how could that which is the opposite of the existence of another be the reason?

original: po ste rtags nyid dang rtags can nyid tha dad par 'gyur /
analyzed: po ste rtags nyid dang rtags can nyid tha dad par 'gyur /
translated: Even if it were, the entity of the reason and the property of the subject would be different.

original: chos can du gyur pa rtags nyid du 'os pa ma yin te /
analyzed: chos can du gyur pa rtags nyid du 'os pa ma yin te /
translated: The property of the subject is not suitable to be the reason.

original: chos rtogs pa nyid las bsgrub bya rtogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba la sogs pa'i rjes su 'brang bar mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos rtogs pa nyid las bsgrub bya rtogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba la sogs pa'i rjes su 'brang bar mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not suitable to be the consequence of the realization of the property of the subject, such as the realization of the probandum.

original: de las gzhan pa'i chos can med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i chos can med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no property of the subject other than that.

original: ji ltar gzhan yod pa'i bdag nyid de rtags sam spyi bsgrub byar sbyar bar bya /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan yod pa'i bdag nyid de rtags sam spyi bsgrub byar sbyar bar bya /
translated: How could the nature of the existence of another be applied to the reason or the property of the subject?

original: sgra dang byas pa nyid kyang don dam par na de'i bdag nyid yin du zin kyang ldog pa tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan yod pa nyid kyis tha dad do //
analyzed: sgra dang byas pa nyid kyang don dam par na de'i bdag nyid yin du zin kyang ldog pa tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan yod pa nyid kyis tha dad do //
translated: Sound and product, even though they are ultimately of the same nature, are different because they have different contradistinctions.

original: des na sgra la sogs pa chos can du rtogs la mi rtags pa la sogs pa yang rtogs par byas pa nyid la sogs pa de bsgrub byar 'gyur ba ni rigs so //
analyzed: des na sgra la sogs pa chos can du rtogs la mi rtags pa la sogs pa yang rtogs par byas pa nyid la sogs pa de bsgrub byar 'gyur ba ni rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable that when sound is understood as the subject, product, etc., which are understood as the predicate, are the probandum.

original: gal te spyi dang bye brag tu brtags nas rtags dang rtags can du yang 'gyur ro snyam du sems so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te spyi dang bye brag tu brtags nas rtags dang rtags can du yang 'gyur ro snyam du sems so zhe na /
translated: If you think that they are the reason and the property-possessor when they are examined as the universal and the particular,

original: gang gis na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gang gis na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says, ‚ÄúBy what means?‚Äù

original: 'dir gzhan yod pa'i rang bzhin la spyi dang bye brag gi dngos por brtag pa yang mi srid de gang gis na spyi dang khyad par du brtags nas spyi ni gtan tshigs su 'gyur la khyad par ni chos can du 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: 'dir gzhan yod pa'i rang bzhin la spyi dang bye brag gi dngos por brtag pa yang mi srid de gang gis na spyi dang khyad par du brtags nas spyi ni gtan tshigs su 'gyur la khyad par ni chos can du 'gyur ba yin /
translated: Here it is not possible to examine the nature of the existence of something else as the universal and the particular, by means of which the universal would be the reason and the particular would be the property-possessor when they are examined as the universal and the particular.

original: spyi bsgrub par bya ba'i de rtags dang rtags can du 'brel par @298a * //
analyzed: spyi bsgrub par bya ba'i de rtags dang rtags can du 'brel par @298a * //
translated: The universal is related to the sign and the property-possessor in the proof of the probandum.

original: 'gyur ro // gang gis na mi srid pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'gyur ro // gang gis na mi srid pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it impossible?

original: de khyad par rtogs ba kho nas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de khyad par rtogs ba kho nas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause it is only the specific property that is understood.‚Äù

original: bum pas dben pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par de kho na de med pa ste bum pa med par rtogs pa'i phyir dang / gang gi phyir khyad par kho na bum pa med par rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa de'i phyir ci de la spyir rtogs par byed pa ni /
analyzed: bum pas dben pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par de kho na de med pa ste bum pa med par rtogs pa'i phyir dang / gang gi phyir khyad par kho na bum pa med par rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa de'i phyir ci de la spyir rtogs par byed pa ni /
translated: Because the specific property of the place devoid of pot is understood to be the absence of pot, the absence of pot. And because the specific property alone is the reason for understanding the absence of pot, therefore, how could it be that the cognition of the absence of pot is the cognition of the universal?

original: gal te de nyid kyi khyad par gzhan la 'jug pas spyi'i ngo bor rtogs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de nyid kyi khyad par gzhan la 'jug pas spyi'i ngo bor rtogs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it is argued that ‚Äúit becomes the cognition of the universal because it engages with the specific property of that,‚Äù

original: bum pas dben pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par de yang gzhan rigs mthun pa la rjes su 'gro ba dang rjes su 'jug pa med pa'i phyir gang las spyi'i bdag nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: bum pas dben pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par de yang gzhan rigs mthun pa la rjes su 'gro ba dang rjes su 'jug pa med pa'i phyir gang las spyi'i bdag nyid du 'gyur /
translated: then how could that specific property of the place devoid of pot be a universal, because it does not pervade or engage with other similar things?

original: 'di yul dang dus dang gnas skabs nges pa'i bye brag rnams ni gzhan gyi rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di yul dang dus dang gnas skabs nges pa'i bye brag rnams ni gzhan gyi rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the particulars of place, time, and situation are not pervasive of others.

original: 'di nyid kyi gtan tshigs lhag par bstan pa ni dam bca' ba'i don zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi gtan tshigs lhag par bstan pa ni dam bca' ba'i don zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The special reason for this is stated in the passage beginning ‚ÄúThe meaning of the thesis . . .‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe bum pas dben pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par gyi chos de kho na gtan tshigs su 'dod pa de'i tshe dam bca' don chos dang chos can gyi spyi yin la de'i phyogs gcig chos can gyi mtshan nyid gtan tshigs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe bum pas dben pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par gyi chos de kho na gtan tshigs su 'dod pa de'i tshe dam bca' don chos dang chos can gyi spyi yin la de'i phyogs gcig chos can gyi mtshan nyid gtan tshigs su 'gyur ro //
translated: When the property of a specific place that is devoid of a pot is asserted as the reason, then the meaning of the thesis is the universal of the property and the subject. One part of that is the definition of the subject, which becomes the reason.

original: dam bca' ba'i don gyi phyogs gcig ldog pa yin yang tha dad par nyams su ma myong bas gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: dam bca' ba'i don gyi phyogs gcig ldog pa yin yang tha dad par nyams su ma myong bas gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no //
translated: Even though the meaning of the thesis is a negation, since it is not experienced as being different, the reason is not established.

original: 'on te de dag gi skyon du ma gyur cig snyam nas bum pas dben pa'i phyogs kyi bye brag gtan tshigs su mi 'dod na bum pas dben pa'i bye brag spangs pa'i phyogs tsam yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te de dag gi skyon du ma gyur cig snyam nas bum pas dben pa'i phyogs kyi bye brag gtan tshigs su mi 'dod na bum pas dben pa'i bye brag spangs pa'i phyogs tsam yin no zhe na /
translated: But if one does not assert a specific place that is devoid of a pot as the reason, thinking that one should not commit those errors, then it is a mere place that is devoid of a specific pot.

original: gang na phyogs tsam yod pa de la bum pa med pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gang na phyogs tsam yod pa de la bum pa med pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: But it is not the case that where there is a mere place, there is no pot.

original: bum pa dang bcas pa'i phyogs kyang phyogs tsam la yod pas gtan tshigs ma nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bum pa dang bcas pa'i phyogs kyang phyogs tsam la yod pas gtan tshigs ma nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: Also, the position that is together with the pot would be a mere position, and so the reason would be indefinite.

original: pha rol gyis spyi dang bye brag gi dngos bo de lta ma yin par bstan pa ni de dang 'dra ba ci 'dra ba ci 'dra ba'i bum pas dben pa 'ba' zhig pa 'di'o //
analyzed: pha rol gyis spyi dang bye brag gi dngos bo de lta ma yin par bstan pa ni de dang 'dra ba ci 'dra ba ci 'dra ba'i bum pas dben pa 'ba' zhig pa 'di'o //
translated: The opponent teaches that the entity of the universal and the particular are not like that: ‚ÄúThis is a mere exclusion of a pot that is similar to that.‚Äù

original: phyogs ni mdun na gnas pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs ni mdun na gnas pa'o //
translated: The position is in front.

original: de dang 'dra ba'i phyogs thams cad la bum pa med pa kho na yin pas gang gis ma nges par 'gyur /
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba'i phyogs thams cad la bum pa med pa kho na yin pas gang gis ma nges par 'gyur /
translated: Since there is no pot at all in all positions that are similar to that, what would be indefinite?

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i phyogs kyi bye brag rtogs pa nyid bum pa med pa rtogs pa yin pa de'i phyir gzhan yod pa na de med pa dag rtags dang rtags can du mi 'thad pa nye bar @298b bstan pa ni de ni 'ba' zhig ces bya baüîΩla sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i phyogs kyi bye brag rtogs pa nyid bum pa med pa rtogs pa yin pa de'i phyir gzhan yod pa na de med pa dag rtags dang rtags can du mi 'thad pa nye bar @298b bstan pa ni de ni 'ba' zhig ces bya baüîΩla sogs pa smos te /
translated: The mere cognition of a particular position of that kind is the cognition of the absence of a pot. Therefore, the demonstration of the untenability of the existence of something else and the nonexistence of that being a reason and a property-possessor is stated in ‚ÄúThat is a mere exclusion of that.‚Äù

original: gang 'ba' zhig ba ni 'di phyogs kyi bye brag gi chos can du rnam par gzhag pa de 'ba' zhig gang yin pa de ni 'ba' zhig pa zhes bya ba khyod kyis bye brag tu brjod pa 'dis bum pa spangs pa 'di nyid bum pa med pa yinüîΩno zhes smras pa yin no //
analyzed: gang 'ba' zhig ba ni 'di phyogs kyi bye brag gi chos can du rnam par gzhag pa de 'ba' zhig gang yin pa de ni 'ba' zhig pa zhes bya ba khyod kyis bye brag tu brjod pa 'dis bum pa spangs pa 'di nyid bum pa med pa yin no zhes smras pa yin no //
translated: That which is only is that which is posited as the subject that has the property of being a part of this side. That which is only is called ‚Äúonly‚Äù by you. By this expression of distinction, you say, ‚ÄúThis exclusion of pot is nonpot.‚Äù

original: de yang bum pa spangs pa rtags su gyur pa 'ba' zhig pa'i phyogs rtogs pa kho na'i tshe grub pa yin gyi dus phyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang bum pa spangs pa rtags su gyur pa 'ba' zhig pa'i phyogs rtogs pa kho na'i tshe grub pa yin gyi dus phyis ni ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, that which is only is established only when the reason, the exclusion of pot, is realized, not at a later time.

original: de'i phyir rnam pa gzhan kho na'i sgo nas du ba la sogs pa'i me bsgrub par bya ba yin pa des na rtogs pa las bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pa yin ;
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam pa gzhan kho na'i sgo nas du ba la sogs pa'i me bsgrub par bya ba yin pa des na rtogs pa las bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pa yin ;
translated: Therefore, since fire is established by smoke and so on in a different way, the object to be established is realized from the realization of the reason.

original: rtags dang rtags can ni 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rtags dang rtags can ni 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The reason and the property to be proven do not exist at all,

original: shes par 'dod pa la bum pa med pa grub na gang 'ga' zhig ni shes par mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes par 'dod pa la bum pa med pa grub na gang 'ga' zhig ni shes par mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because if the nonexistence of pot were established with respect to what is desired to be known, then it would not be desired to be known by anyone.

original: phyogs 'ga' zhig pa rtogs pa nyid dang / bum pa spangs pa rtogs pa gang yin pa 'di dag dus phyis gang dang gang phyogs 'ba' zhig pa de dang de ni bum pa spangs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i rjes su 'gro ba smos pa'i rjes su 'brang ba don med de bsgrub par bya ba dang
analyzed: phyogs 'ga' zhig pa rtogs pa nyid dang / bum pa spangs pa rtogs pa gang yin pa 'di dag dus phyis gang dang gang phyogs 'ba' zhig pa de dang de ni bum pa spangs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i rjes su 'gro ba smos pa'i rjes su 'brang ba don med de bsgrub par bya ba dang
translated: The realization of a mere part and the realization of the abandonment of a pot are later on, whatever is a mere part is the abandonment of a pot.

original: por rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: por rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement of the concomitance is pointless because the probandum is realized first.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar de lta bas na gzhan yod pa 'ba' zhig sa phyogs kyi mtshan nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa bye brag med pas dngos po med pa sgrub pa ma yin pa de ltar na spyi bsgrub par bya ba de
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar de lta bas na gzhan yod pa 'ba' zhig sa phyogs kyi mtshan nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa bye brag med pas dngos po med pa sgrub pa ma yin pa de ltar na spyi bsgrub par bya ba de
translated: Since it is so, the mere existence of something other is not the definition of a place, because there is no difference between the probandum and the proof. Thus, the general probandum is not established.

original: yang rtags dang rtags can gyi 'brel pa bstan pas gzhan gyi phyogs la sogs pa'i chos can gyi khyad par la med pa sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes gang bshad pa la de tha dad par ma grub pa'i phyir sun 'byin pas bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: yang rtags dang rtags can gyi 'brel pa bstan pas gzhan gyi phyogs la sogs pa'i chos can gyi khyad par la med pa sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes gang bshad pa la de tha dad par ma grub pa'i phyir sun 'byin pas bsal ba yin no //
translated: Also, because the relation between the reason and the property to be established is taught, it is said that the subject, such as the other side, is established as nonexistent.

original: yul dang yul can du gyur pa'i 'brel pa yang bsal bas pha rol po bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa la 'brel pa gzhan ston pa ni gal te 'gal ba'i zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: yul dang yul can du gyur pa'i 'brel pa yang bsal bas pha rol po bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa la 'brel pa gzhan ston pa ni gal te 'gal ba'i zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The relation between object and subject is also refuted. Therefore, in order to teach another relation between the probandum and the proof, he says, ‚ÄúIf there is contradiction,‚Äù and so on.

original: gzhan yod pa dang de med pa dag la 'gal ba'i 'brel pa yod par bshad pa de'i 'brel pa yod pas gzhan yod pa las dngos po med par gyur par 'dod ce na /
analyzed: gzhan yod pa dang de med pa dag la 'gal ba'i 'brel pa yod par bshad pa de'i 'brel pa yod pas gzhan yod pa las dngos po med par gyur par 'dod ce na /
translated: The relation of contradiction exists between the existence of one thing and the nonexistence of another. Since that relation exists, one thing‚Äôs existence is asserted to be another thing‚Äôs nonexistence.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa dag la 'gal ba mi srid pas gang zhig gang dang 'gal zhes gang zhig @299a * //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa dag la 'gal ba mi srid pas gang zhig gang dang 'gal zhes gang zhig @299a * //
translated: The Proponent of the Middle Way says that since contradiction is impossible between the probandum and the proof, it is not tenable to say, ‚ÄúIf there is contradiction, then the probandum and the proof are contradictory.‚Äù

original: dris pa'o // sgrub par byed pa dang bsgrub par bya ba dag la 'dir 'gal ba mi srid do zhes bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: dris pa'o // sgrub par byed pa dang bsgrub par bya ba dag la 'dir 'gal ba mi srid do zhes bsams pa yin no //
translated: The thought is that there is no contradiction possible here between the proof and the probandum.

original: gzhan 'gal bar mngon par 'dod pa mi shes pas ston pa ni gzhan med pa'i phyogs 'ba' zhig gi bdag nyid dang zla bo ni gang med pa'o ;
analyzed: gzhan 'gal bar mngon par 'dod pa mi shes pas ston pa ni gzhan med pa'i phyogs 'ba' zhig gi bdag nyid dang zla bo ni gang med pa'o ;
translated: The demonstration of the other‚Äôs desire for contradiction, which is not understood, is: ‚ÄúThe absence of another is the very nature of the one, and the absence of the opponent.‚Äù

original: /'jal bar 'dod pas bum pa la sogs pa de yin no zhes pha rol pos de ltar smras pa ni ma 'brel par brjod par bstan pa ni ci zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: /'jal bar 'dod pas bum pa la sogs pa de yin no zhes pha rol pos de ltar smras pa ni ma 'brel par brjod par bstan pa ni ci zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The opponent says, ‚ÄúThat is the pot, etc., which is to be measured,‚Äù but the statement is not related. The statement ‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù shows that.

original: zla bor 'dod pa'i bum pa la sogs pa 'jal bar 'dod par gang gis zla bo gzhal bar bya ba nyid kyis rtags dang rtags can la 'gal ba'i 'brel pa brjod pa ni med do //
analyzed: zla bor 'dod pa'i bum pa la sogs pa 'jal bar 'dod par gang gis zla bo gzhal bar bya ba nyid kyis rtags dang rtags can la 'gal ba'i 'brel pa brjod pa ni med do //
translated: The one who desires to measure the pot, etc., which is asserted as the opponent, does not have a reason and a property-possessor that are related by the relation of the probandum and the means of knowing the probandum.

original: gal te zla bo 'jal bar byed par 'dod pa ni ma yin te 'on kyang de med pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te zla bo 'jal bar byed par 'dod pa ni ma yin te 'on kyang de med pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If one says, ‚ÄúI do not desire to measure the opponent, but rather its absence,‚Äù

original: dngos po med pa'i zla bo zhes bya ba smos te bsgrub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i zla bo zhes bya ba smos te bsgrub par bya ba'o //
translated: The response is: ‚ÄúThe non-existence of an entity, which is the counter-correlate of that.‚Äù

original: de dang gzhan yod pa dang 'gal ba med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de dang gzhan yod pa dang 'gal ba med pa nyid do //
translated: The non-existence of an entity and the existence of another are not mutually exclusive.

original: gang las she na lhan cig gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang las she na lhan cig gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is that? Because they coexist.

original: zla bo dngos po med pa dang gzhan yod pa dag lhan cig gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zla bo dngos po med pa dang gzhan yod pa dag lhan cig gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The non-existence of an entity and the existence of another coexist.

original: 'di gang gzhan gyi 'dod pa la ltos nas brjod pa yin gyi de lta ma yin na gang kho na'i phyogs 'ba' zhig de kho na bum pa med pa yin no zhes bstan pas gang zhig gang dang lhan cig gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di gang gzhan gyi 'dod pa la ltos nas brjod pa yin gyi de lta ma yin na gang kho na'i phyogs 'ba' zhig de kho na bum pa med pa yin no zhes bstan pas gang zhig gang dang lhan cig gnas pa yin te /
translated: This is stated in dependence on the assertion of others, but if that were not so, then in the case of the statement ‚Äúonly in this place is there the non-existence of a vase,‚Äù what would coexist with what?

original: de la gzhan yod pa dang lhan cig gnas pa'i de med pa'i gzhal bar bya ba la rtags dang rtags can dag ji ltar 'gal ba yin /
analyzed: de la gzhan yod pa dang lhan cig gnas pa'i de med pa'i gzhal bar bya ba la rtags dang rtags can dag ji ltar 'gal ba yin /
translated: In that case, how could the existence of another and the non-existence of that which coexists with it be mutually exclusive in the object of evaluation?

original: rnam pa 'ga' zhig kyang ma yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa 'ga' zhig kyang ma yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: It is not in any way.

original: 'brel pa med pa nyid de dag yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa nyid de dag yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are unrelated.

original: 'dir yang 'gal ba'i 'brel pa la ltos nas gzhan yod pa ni rtags yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir yang 'gal ba'i 'brel pa la ltos nas gzhan yod pa ni rtags yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Here, too, the existence of something else is the reason, in reliance on the relation of contradiction.

original: gzhan pa'i chos can mi srid pas spyi med pa sgrub par byed pa'i gnas skabs la gang sngar gyi skyon de dang der byung ba so na 'dug ste yongs su spangs pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan pa'i chos can mi srid pas spyi med pa sgrub par byed pa'i gnas skabs la gang sngar gyi skyon de dang der byung ba so na 'dug ste yongs su spangs pa med do //
translated: Since it is impossible for there to be a subject that is something other than that, the previously mentioned faults still occur and have not been completely avoided.

original: 'di ltar pha rol gyis 'brel pa med par rnam par gzhag pa'i gzhan yod par rtogs pas de med pa'i rtog pa grub pa'i mtha' la mi srid par gzhan gyis bstan pa ni med pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar pha rol gyis 'brel pa med par rnam par gzhag pa'i gzhan yod par rtogs pas de med pa'i rtog pa grub pa'i mtha' la mi srid par gzhan gyis bstan pa ni med pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In this way, the opponent‚Äôs position that the existence of something else is understood without any relation is untenable. The opponent‚Äôs claim that the conception of nonexistence is impossible in a philosophical system is addressed in the following:

original: gzhan yod par rtogs pa nyid las de med par rtogs pa'i phyir rtags dang rtags can gyi @299b dngos po rnam par 'byed pa ni gang dang gang gzhan yod par rtogs pa las de med par rtogs par sngar bshad pa de yang gzhan yod pas de med pa
analyzed: gzhan yod par rtogs pa nyid las de med par rtogs pa'i phyir rtags dang rtags can gyi @299b dngos po rnam par 'byed pa ni gang dang gang gzhan yod par rtogs pa las de med par rtogs par sngar bshad pa de yang gzhan yod pas de med pa
translated: Since the conception of nonexistence is understood from the conception of the existence of something else, the distinction between the reason and the property-possessor is untenable.

original: dag la 'brel pa yod par gyur na yin gyi /
analyzed: dag la 'brel pa yod par gyur na yin gyi /
translated: If there were a connection between them, it would be so.

original: rtags dang rtags can 'ba' zhig pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rtags dang rtags can 'ba' zhig pas ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not so, because of the mere presence of the reason and the property to be established.

original: de'i phyir khyed kyis gdon mi za ba de dag la 'brel pa 'ga' zhig 'dod par bya dgos na de nyid kho bo yang 'dod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir khyed kyis gdon mi za ba de dag la 'brel pa 'ga' zhig 'dod par bya dgos na de nyid kho bo yang 'dod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, you must certainly accept that there is some connection between them, and I also accept that.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas 'brel pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas 'brel pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The proponent of tenets says, ‚ÄúWhat is called a connection . . .

original: 'brel pa gang las cung zad cig 'brel pa la brten pa gzhan yod pas de med pa shes par byed par mi 'dod kyi /
analyzed: 'brel pa gang las cung zad cig 'brel pa la brten pa gzhan yod pas de med pa shes par byed par mi 'dod kyi /
translated: We do not assert that the mere presence of something else that is connected to something is the cause for knowing that the other is absent.

original: 'on kyang kho bo ni gzhan phyogs 'ba' zhig yod pa kho na de gzhan bum pa la sogs pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang kho bo ni gzhan phyogs 'ba' zhig yod pa kho na de gzhan bum pa la sogs pa med pa yin no //
translated: However, we do assert that the mere presence of something else is the absence of another, such as a pot.

original: gzhan yod pa las gzhan du gyur pa ci yang ma yin pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir zhes sngar 'di dag bshad zin to //
analyzed: gzhan yod pa las gzhan du gyur pa ci yang ma yin pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir zhes sngar 'di dag bshad zin to //
translated: The nature of that which is different from the presence of something else is nothing at all. This was explained earlier.

original: gzhan yod pa la yang de med pa yin no zhes tha snyad btags pa ni 'dir rigs pa can sun 'byin pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yod pa la yang de med pa yin no zhes tha snyad btags pa ni 'dir rigs pa can sun 'byin pa yin no //
translated: The mere presence of something else is the absence of that other thing. The use of the term is as follows. This is the refutation of the logicians.

original: gang gi tshe de lta yin pa de'i tshe de gzhan yod ba dang gzhan bum pa la sogs pa dang ma 'dres pa ni lhan cig pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de ltar ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de lta yin pa de'i tshe de gzhan yod ba dang gzhan bum pa la sogs pa dang ma 'dres pa ni lhan cig pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de ltar ni ma yin no //
translated: But when it is like that, then it is not the case that it is the nature of co-existence, which is the existence of something else and the non-mixture of that with something else, such as a pot.

original: gzhan ma yin pa dang 'dre ba'i ngo bo 'di dag nyid ston pa ni 'ba' zhig pa zhes bya ba ni nyi tshe ba nyid du brjod do //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa dang 'dre ba'i ngo bo 'di dag nyid ston pa ni 'ba' zhig pa zhes bya ba ni nyi tshe ba nyid du brjod do //
translated: The nature of non-difference and mixture is shown by the words ‚Äúalone‚Äù and ‚Äúonly.‚Äù

original: bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin du rnam par gnas pa yin te de'i bdag nyid gzhan dang lhan cig pa ma yin pa'i bdag nyid du'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin du rnam par gnas pa yin te de'i bdag nyid gzhan dang lhan cig pa ma yin pa'i bdag nyid du'o //
translated: It is the nature of existing as one‚Äôs own nature, not as the nature of something else that co-exists with it.

original: de'i nus pa las byung ba de'i ngo bo nyid du rjes su byed pa'i mngon sum gyis yongs su gcod pa de nyid gzhan bum pa la sogs pa de la yod pa rnam par gcod do //
analyzed: de'i nus pa las byung ba de'i ngo bo nyid du rjes su byed pa'i mngon sum gyis yongs su gcod pa de nyid gzhan bum pa la sogs pa de la yod pa rnam par gcod do //
translated: The direct perception that arises from its capacity, which conforms to its nature, excludes that very thing from existing in something else, such as a pot.

original: rnam par mi gcod par med pa rtogs pa yin na ni gang gis na gzhan yod pas de med pa dag go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa'i dngos po yin /
analyzed: rnam par mi gcod par med pa rtogs pa yin na ni gang gis na gzhan yod pas de med pa dag go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa'i dngos po yin /
translated: If it does not exclude, but understands non-existence, then by what means is there the relation of the understood and the means of understanding, where the existence of one thing is the non-existence of another?

original: gang gi phyir de dag 'brel pa yin par kho bo 'dod do /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag 'brel pa yin par kho bo 'dod do /
translated: Because we accept that they are related.

original: gzhon nu ma len gyis bsam pa yod pa'i cha las tha dad pa 'di nyid med pa'i cha yin pa de'i phyir gzhan yod pa de med pa ma yin pa ji ltar de rtogs pa yin /
analyzed: gzhon nu ma len gyis bsam pa yod pa'i cha las tha dad pa 'di nyid med pa'i cha yin pa de'i phyir gzhan yod pa de med pa ma yin pa ji ltar de rtogs pa yin /
translated: Kumarila thinks that the part of existence is different from the part of nonexistence, and therefore, the existence of one thing is not the nonexistence of another. How can it be understood?

original: 'di ltar 'di med pa dang / snga na med pa la sogs pa tha dad pas tha dad pa ni dngos po med pa las tha dad pa mi srid pas 'di dngos po'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di med pa dang / snga na med pa la sogs pa tha dad pas tha dad pa ni dngos po med pa las tha dad pa mi srid pas 'di dngos po'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, nonexistence, prior nonexistence, and so on are different from difference, and difference is impossible as different from nonthing. Therefore, it is the nature of a thing.

original: ji skad du @300a * //
analyzed: ji skad du @300a * //
translated: As it is said:

original: dngos po med la 'di mi 'gyur //
analyzed: dngos po med la 'di mi 'gyur //
translated: It is not nonexistence.

original: tha dad des na 'di dngos yin //
analyzed: tha dad des na 'di dngos yin //
translated: Because of its difference, it is a thing.

original: zhes smras so //
analyzed: zhes smras so //
translated: Thus he says.

original: dngos po'i cha ni dngos po med pa'i char mi rung ngo //
analyzed: dngos po'i cha ni dngos po med pa'i char mi rung ngo //
translated: The part of a thing is not suitable as the part of a nonthing.

original: de dbang po dang ldan pa'i 'brel pa'i stobs kyis rtogs kyi /
analyzed: de dbang po dang ldan pa'i 'brel pa'i stobs kyis rtogs kyi /
translated: It is understood by the power of the relation of possessing a sense faculty.

original: cig shos rtogs pa yang de dang 'brel pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cig shos rtogs pa yang de dang 'brel pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The understanding of the other is not a cause of that relation.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: 'brel de yod pas de bzhin du //
analyzed: 'brel de yod pas de bzhin du //
translated: Because of the existence of that relation, it is like this.

original: yod pa'i ngo bor rtogs pa yin //
analyzed: yod pa'i ngo bor rtogs pa yin //
translated: It is the nature of existence.

original: 'di la 'di dang 'dir de med //
analyzed: 'di la 'di dang 'dir de med //
translated: Here, this is not that,

original: 'brel med pa yi rgyu can yin //
analyzed: 'brel med pa yi rgyu can yin //
translated: and it is not related to that.

original: zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bshad do //
translated: This is what is explained.

original: de ji ltar de rtogs pa nyid las gzhan rnam par gcod pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar de rtogs pa nyid las gzhan rnam par gcod pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that the exclusion of other is just the realization of that?

original: de sun dbyung ba'i phyir de las gzhan pa rtogs pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de sun dbyung ba'i phyir de las gzhan pa rtogs pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to refute that, he says, ‚Äúthe realization of that which is other than that.‚Äù

original: phyogs 'ba' zhig pa'i bdag nyid gcig pu lhan cig pa med pa de nyid gzhan zla bo bum pa la sogs pa ma tshang ba med pa yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs 'ba' zhig pa'i bdag nyid gcig pu lhan cig pa med pa de nyid gzhan zla bo bum pa la sogs pa ma tshang ba med pa yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is the nature of a single part, alone, without a companion, is itself the other, the counterpart, the complete vase, and so on.

original: de'i phyir gzhan gyi yod pa kho na la khyod dngos po'i cha'i ngo bor mngon par 'dod pa'i zla bo dngos po med pa ni de ma yin te tha dad par gyur pa'i chos gzhan yin no zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan gyi yod pa kho na la khyod dngos po'i cha'i ngo bor mngon par 'dod pa'i zla bo dngos po med pa ni de ma yin te tha dad par gyur pa'i chos gzhan yin no zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, the non-existence of the other, which you assert as the nature of the part of an entity, is not that, but is said to be a different, separate attribute.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i sras rnams ni de las kyang de rtogs pa nyid de de las gzhan pa yod pa rtogs pa nyid da med par rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i sras rnams ni de las kyang de rtogs pa nyid de de las gzhan pa yod pa rtogs pa nyid da med par rtogs pa yin no //
translated: The sons of the Sugata understand that it is not so, that it is the understanding of the non-existence of something other than that.

original: de mi rtogs pa ni de'i zla bo mi rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: de mi rtogs pa ni de'i zla bo mi rtogs pa ste /
translated: The non-understanding of that is the non-understanding of its opposite.

original: med pa mi rtogs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: med pa mi rtogs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the non-existence is not understood.

original: 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: This is what is thought:

original: gang dang gang med pa'i cha dang yod pa'i cha dag tha dad par gyur pa'i dngos po med pa'i chos su yongs su brtags pa la bum pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa med pa'i bdag nyid de'i ngo bo ni ma tshang ba nyid nyams su myong ba'i
analyzed: gang dang gang med pa'i cha dang yod pa'i cha dag tha dad par gyur pa'i dngos po med pa'i chos su yongs su brtags pa la bum pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa med pa'i bdag nyid de'i ngo bo ni ma tshang ba nyid nyams su myong ba'i
translated: In the case of a thing that is a different part of existence and non-existence, in the imagined dharma of non-existence, the nature of that which has a pot, etc., is the experience of incompleteness.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not otherwise.

original: de yang de'i ngo bo ma tshang ba gzhan pa'i dngos po'i yod pa'i cha la yang yod na de med pa yin te de las gzhan pa'i dngos po 'dor bar 'gyur bas gang dang gang gi ngo bo ma tshang ba ma yin pa de dang de ni gzhan
analyzed: de yang de'i ngo bo ma tshang ba gzhan pa'i dngos po'i yod pa'i cha la yang yod na de med pa yin te de las gzhan pa'i dngos po 'dor bar 'gyur bas gang dang gang gi ngo bo ma tshang ba ma yin pa de dang de ni gzhan
translated: If the aspect of existence of other things that is incomplete in its nature also exists, then it would not exist, because it would be discarded as a thing that is different from that.

original: pa nyid du rigs par mi 'gyur te dper na rang gi ngo bo bzhin no //
analyzed: pa nyid du rigs par mi 'gyur te dper na rang gi ngo bo bzhin no //
translated: Whatever is not incomplete in its nature is not suitable to be different from that, just like its own nature.üîΩSince the aspect of nonexistence is not established as that, it follows that all varieties are a single substance, and therefore it follows that they would arise simultaneously and so on, and everything would be connected to everything.

original: med pa'i cha yang der mi 'grub pas sna tshogs pa thams cad kyang rdzas gcig tu thal bar 'gyur ba dang / des na lhan cig tu skye ba la sogs pa thal bar 'gyur ba dang / thams cad thams cad la sbyor bar 'gyur ba'i phyir gdon mi za bar gzhan pa'i dngos po yod pa'i ngo bo nyid @300b de gzhan med pa'i bdag nyid kho na yin pa de bzhin du rtogs pa nyid de /
analyzed: med pa'i cha yang der mi 'grub pas sna tshogs pa thams cad kyang rdzas gcig tu thal bar 'gyur ba dang / des na lhan cig tu skye ba la sogs pa thal bar 'gyur ba dang / thams cad thams cad la sbyor bar 'gyur ba'i phyir gdon mi za bar gzhan pa'i dngos po yod pa'i ngo bo nyid @300b de gzhan med pa'i bdag nyid kho na yin pa de bzhin du rtogs pa nyid de /
translated: Thus, without a doubt, the nature of the existence of other things is only the nature of the absence of other things.

original: de las gzhan pa'i yod pa rtogs pa ni dbang po dang 'brel pa kho nas yin la de med pa ni ma 'brel pa las so zhes bya bas ci zhig brjod ce na /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i yod pa rtogs pa ni dbang po dang 'brel pa kho nas yin la de med pa ni ma 'brel pa las so zhes bya bas ci zhig brjod ce na /
translated: What is the point of saying that the realization of existence is only in connection with the sense faculties, and the realization of nonexistence is in nonconnection with them?

original: 'di la 'di dang 'dir de med de /
analyzed: 'di la 'di dang 'dir de med de /
translated: In this case, it is said in dependence on the conceptual thought that it does not exist here and there,üîΩand that it is not connected with a cause.

original: rgyu dang 'brel pa med pa yin zhes bya ba rnam par rtog pa la ltos nas brjod pa yin no zhe na ni de dang de la gnod pa med de mngon sum gyis de'i rnam par skyes nas gzhan med pa de'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po'i ngo bor
analyzed: rgyu dang 'brel pa med pa yin zhes bya ba rnam par rtog pa la ltos nas brjod pa yin no zhe na ni de dang de la gnod pa med de mngon sum gyis de'i rnam par skyes nas gzhan med pa de'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po'i ngo bor
translated: If you say that, there is no contradiction, because having arisen in the aspect of that by direct perception, it is realized in the nature of the entity of the nonexistence of another.

original: rtogs pa'i phyi nas ji ltar 'dzin pa'i mngon par brjod pa'i rnam par rtog pa khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i phyi nas ji ltar 'dzin pa'i mngon par brjod pa'i rnam par rtog pa khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Subsequently, you accept the conceptual thought of the verbalization that apprehends it.

original: rgyas par tshad ma gnyis su bsgrub pa'i gzhung gi dngos po med pa rnam par dpyad pa de dngos po med pa'i gzhal bya dang tshad ma rnam par dpyad pa byas zin pas de nyid du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgyas par tshad ma gnyis su bsgrub pa'i gzhung gi dngos po med pa rnam par dpyad pa de dngos po med pa'i gzhal bya dang tshad ma rnam par dpyad pa byas zin pas de nyid du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The extensive analysis of the nonexistence of things in the treatise proving the two valid cognitions should be seen in that very text, because the object of comprehension and the valid knowledge of nonexistence have already been analyzed.

original: gdon mi za bar de las gzhan yod par rtogs pa nyid de med par rtogs pa yin pa de'i phyir dngos po ma 'khrul pa sgrub pa'i don dang 'di la 'di med do zhes bya ba med pa'i tha snyad kyi don du med pa'i tshad ma brtag paüîΩni mi rigs pa yin no zhes bstan pa ni de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar de las gzhan yod par rtogs pa nyid de med par rtogs pa yin pa de'i phyir dngos po ma 'khrul pa sgrub pa'i don dang 'di la 'di med do zhes bya ba med pa'i tha snyad kyi don du med pa'i tshad ma brtag pa ni mi rigs pa yin no zhes bstan pa ni de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is definitely the realization of something other than that which is the realization of its nonexistence. Therefore, it is illogical to analyze the valid knowledge that is the means of ascertaining the meaning of nonexistence, the meaning of the expression ‚Äúthis does not exist in that,‚Äù and the meaning of establishing a non mistaken thing.

original: gang gi tshe de rtogs pa nyid de med par rtogs par mi 'dod pa de'i tshe de las gzhan pa'i dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo yongs su de las gzhan pa de ma yin pa'i ngo bo rnam par gcod pas de dngos po med par rtogs pa mi
analyzed: gang gi tshe de rtogs pa nyid de med par rtogs par mi 'dod pa de'i tshe de las gzhan pa'i dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo yongs su de las gzhan pa de ma yin pa'i ngo bo rnam par gcod pas de dngos po med par rtogs pa mi
translated: If you do not accept that the realization of that is the realization of its nonexistence, then the nature of a thing that is other than that would not be eliminated by the exclusion of the nature that is not that other thing.

original: sel na de yongs su gcod pa nyid du mi 'gyur te de las gzhan pa'i dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo rtogs pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sel na de yongs su gcod pa nyid du mi 'gyur te de las gzhan pa'i dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo rtogs pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, the ascertainment of that would not occur, and the realization of the nature of a thing that is other than that would not occur.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de dang de ma yin pa'i ngo bo ni de dang de las gzhan pa'i ngo bor rtogs par nges so //üîΩkhams gsum po ma lus pa'i mtshan nyid mi mthun pa gang yin pa de ma yin pa'i ngo bo de'i ngo bor mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dang de ma yin pa'i ngo bo ni de dang de las gzhan pa'i ngo bor rtogs par nges so // khams gsum po ma lus pa'i mtshan nyid mi mthun pa gang yin pa de ma yin pa'i ngo bo de'i ngo bor mi 'gyur te /
translated: The nature of that which is not that is ascertained as the nature of that which is other than that.

original: gzhan gyi ngo bo de dag rnam par ma phye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo bo de dag rnam par ma phye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The nature of that which is not that is not the nature of that, because the natures of those other than that are not distinguished.

original: rnam par ma phye bas rnam par dbye ba rnam par ma bzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par ma phye bas rnam par dbye ba rnam par ma bzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not distinguished, the distinctions are not established.

original: ma 'chol ba rab tu ma bsgrub pa'i phyir gzhan ma lus pa'i ngo bo mi 'chol ba de'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: ma 'chol ba rab tu ma bsgrub pa'i phyir gzhan ma lus pa'i ngo bo mi 'chol ba de'i ngo bo'o //
translated: Because they are not established, the nature of that which is not that is not the nature of that which is other than that.

original: gal te de dang de las byung ba'i mngon sum gyis de bzhin du rjes su mi byed de 'ba' zhig ba las grol ba'i rnam pa nyid skyes na ni de'i @301a * //
analyzed: gal te de dang de las byung ba'i mngon sum gyis de bzhin du rjes su mi byed de 'ba' zhig ba las grol ba'i rnam pa nyid skyes na ni de'i @301a * //
translated: If direct perception that arises from that does not function in that way, but arises in the aspect of being liberated from that alone,

original: tshe ji ltar des de yongs su gcod par 'gyur /
analyzed: tshe ji ltar des de yongs su gcod par 'gyur /
translated: then at that time, how could it comprehend that?

original: gang gi ngo bo'am gang gi dngos po de'i rjes su mi byed pa'i shes pas de yongs su gcod par mi rigs te /
analyzed: gang gi ngo bo'am gang gi dngos po de'i rjes su mi byed pa'i shes pas de yongs su gcod par mi rigs te /
translated: It is not reasonable that a cognition that does not conform to the essence or entity of something determines that.

original: dper na dung dkar po'i rjes su mi byed pas mig ser gyis dung ser por snang ba'i shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na dung dkar po'i rjes su mi byed pas mig ser gyis dung ser por snang ba'i shes pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the cognition of a conch appearing as yellow to one with jaundice, because it does not conform to the white conch.

original: so sor nges pa'i rjes su byed pa na de ma yin pa yongs su gcod pa nyid ji ltar gzhan rnam par mi gcod pa yin /
analyzed: so sor nges pa'i rjes su byed pa na de ma yin pa yongs su gcod pa nyid ji ltar gzhan rnam par mi gcod pa yin /
translated: If it conforms to each object, how could it determine that which is not that?

original: des na so sor nges pa de'i ngo bo de'i rjes su mi byed na /
analyzed: des na so sor nges pa de'i ngo bo de'i rjes su mi byed na /
translated: Therefore, if it does not conform to the essence of that,

original: de las gzhan pa rnam par mi gcod de de lta na yang de yongs su gcod pa med do zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa rnam par mi gcod de de lta na yang de yongs su gcod pa med do zhes bya'o //
translated: it does not determine that which is other than that.

original: do ltar yin na de las nyes pa ci zhig tu 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: do ltar yin na de las nyes pa ci zhig tu 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If that is so, what fault arises?

original: la lar 'ga' zhig ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: la lar 'ga' zhig ces bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIn some cases, some‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: skye bo thams cad kyis rtogs pa'i me la sogs pa 'ga' zhig gi dngos po yul la lar mthong nas de dang 'brel pa thob pa'i phyir dang mthong ba des ma mthong ba yongs su spangs pa'i phyir 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i mtshan nyid du mi 'gyur te
analyzed: skye bo thams cad kyis rtogs pa'i me la sogs pa 'ga' zhig gi dngos po yul la lar mthong nas de dang 'brel pa thob pa'i phyir dang mthong ba des ma mthong ba yongs su spangs pa'i phyir 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i mtshan nyid du mi 'gyur te
translated: Because all people see some things, such as fire, in some places, and they obtain the connection with that seeing, and because they completely avoid what is not seen, engagement and withdrawal would not be characterized.

original: / ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩni zhes bya ba gang gi phyir te /
analyzed: / ci'i phyir zhe na / ni zhes bya ba gang gi phyir te /
translated: Why is that?

original: me ni mthong yang 'di rtogs pas de dang de ma yin pa'i ngo bo 'dres par snang ba ni mngon sum gyis so //
analyzed: me ni mthong yang 'di rtogs pas de dang de ma yin pa'i ngo bo 'dres par snang ba ni mngon sum gyis so //
translated: ‚Äú Because‚Äù means that although fire is seen, the nature of that and that which is not that are mixed and appear, and that is by direct perception.

original: de lta ma yin na mthong ba'i ngo bo nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na mthong ba'i ngo bo nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were not so, the nature of what is seen would be impaired.

original: de lta na ma 'dres pa'i ngo bo ma mthong na 'dres pa yang gal te mi mthong bas de'i tshe bong ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa lta bu 'ga' zhig gis 'di dag ji ltar mthong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta na ma 'dres pa'i ngo bo ma mthong na 'dres pa yang gal te mi mthong bas de'i tshe bong ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa lta bu 'ga' zhig gis 'di dag ji ltar mthong bar 'gyur /
translated: If the unmixed nature is not seen, then if the mixed is also not seen, then at that time, like the aspect of a clod of earth, how could one see these?

original: de ltar gyur pa de ni 'dres par mthong ba dang ldan pa'i me nyid mthong ba na chu la sogs pa ni ma yin par rtogs so //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa de ni 'dres par mthong ba dang ldan pa'i me nyid mthong ba na chu la sogs pa ni ma yin par rtogs so //
translated: In that case, when one sees fire, which is seen as mixed, one realizes that it is not water, etc.

original: 'on kyang 'dres pa'i ngo bos dngos por snang ba'i shes pa des ji ltar chu don du gnyer ba me'i yul de la 'jug par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'dres pa'i ngo bos dngos por snang ba'i shes pa des ji ltar chu don du gnyer ba me'i yul de la 'jug par mi 'gyur /
translated: However, how could the consciousness to which things appear as mixed and real cause one who desires water to engage in the domain of fire?

original: rang gzhan gyi tshig gis dogs pa'i go skabs ni gal te mi dmigs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rang gzhan gyi tshig gis dogs pa'i go skabs ni gal te mi dmigs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The opportunity for doubt about the words of ourselves and others is stated in the passage beginning ‚ÄúIf it is said that nonapprehension . . . ‚Äù

original: mi snang ba'i shes pa la me'i rang gi ngo bo nyid rtogs kyi chu med pa gang yin pa de ni chu de la mi dmigs pa'i shes pa yin pa des na shes pa gnyis de dang de ma yin pa'i ngo bo dag rnam par 'byed pas 'jig
analyzed: mi snang ba'i shes pa la me'i rang gi ngo bo nyid rtogs kyi chu med pa gang yin pa de ni chu de la mi dmigs pa'i shes pa yin pa des na shes pa gnyis de dang de ma yin pa'i ngo bo dag rnam par 'byed pas 'jig
translated: The consciousness to which fire appears does not realize the nature of fire itself, but the absence of water. That is the consciousness that does not apprehend water. Therefore, the two consciousnesses are distinguished by their natures as being and not being that.

original: rten pa 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i mtshan nyid so sor nges pa'i tha snyad grub pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rten pa 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i mtshan nyid so sor nges pa'i tha snyad grub pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Thus, the conventions of engagement and avoidance, which are characterized by the determination of the particular, are established.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas mi dmigs pa @301b zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ces bya ba smos so //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas mi dmigs pa @301b zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ces bya ba smos so //
translated: The proponent of tenets says, ‚ÄúWhat is this so-called non-apprehension?‚Äù

original: gzhan gyis smras ba res 'ga' zhig chu dmigs pa spangs pa tsam yin no snyam nas gal te chu'i dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis smras ba res 'ga' zhig chu dmigs pa spangs pa tsam yin no snyam nas gal te chu'i dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Someone else says, ‚ÄúSometimes the apprehension of water is merely abandoned.‚Äù Thinking that, he says, ‚ÄúIf the apprehension of water . . .‚Äù and so on.

original: gzhon nu ma len gyis chu'i dmigs pa ldog pa tsam ci yang ma yin pa'i ngo bo dngos po med pa'i tshad ma ni mngon par 'dod kyi /
analyzed: gzhon nu ma len gyis chu'i dmigs pa ldog pa tsam ci yang ma yin pa'i ngo bo dngos po med pa'i tshad ma ni mngon par 'dod kyi /
translated: KumƒÅrila asserts that the mere reversal of the apprehension of water is a non-entity that is not anything at all, and that is the valid knowledge of non-entity.

original: mngon sum la sogs pa ma skyes pas tshad ma dngos po med par brjod ces bya ba 'am /
analyzed: mngon sum la sogs pa ma skyes pas tshad ma dngos po med par brjod ces bya ba 'am /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúSince direct perception and so on are not produced, the valid knowledge of non-entity is stated.

original: de'i bdag nyid yongs su ma gyur pa'am rnam par shes pa med pa ste dngos po gzhan du brjod do //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid yongs su ma gyur pa'am rnam par shes pa med pa ste dngos po gzhan du brjod do //
translated: Or, since its nature is not transformed, or since consciousness does not exist, it is stated to be a different entity.‚Äù

original: 'on kyang de'i bdag nyid bkag pa'i dngos po gang snang ba'i shes pa'i bdag nyid yongs su ma gyur pa de dang de las gzhan pa'i dngos po snang ba'i shes pa dang lhan cig tu rgyu bar khas blang bar bya ste 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no zhes
analyzed: 'on kyang de'i bdag nyid bkag pa'i dngos po gang snang ba'i shes pa'i bdag nyid yongs su ma gyur pa de dang de las gzhan pa'i dngos po snang ba'i shes pa dang lhan cig tu rgyu bar khas blang bar bya ste 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no zhes
translated: However, the nature of that thing that is refuted is not the nature of the consciousness that appears as that thing. It is not a transformation of that consciousness. It is to be accepted that it is concomitant with the consciousness that appears as a thing that is different from that. It is not alone.

original: gzhan gyis khas blang ba'i ched du 'di nye bar dgod do //
analyzed: gzhan gyis khas blang ba'i ched du 'di nye bar dgod do //
translated: This is presented for the sake of the opponent‚Äôs acceptance.

original: de lta na yang gzhan pa'i dngos po rnam par shes pa nyid dngos po med pa'i tshad ma yin pa bla'i /
analyzed: de lta na yang gzhan pa'i dngos po rnam par shes pa nyid dngos po med pa'i tshad ma yin pa bla'i /
translated: Even so, it is better to say that the consciousness of another thing is the valid knowledge of the nonexistence of a thing.

original: ci tshad ma med pa'i bdag nyid yongs su ma gyur par bshad pa'i chos yongs su brtags na ni de las gzhan pa'i dngos po rnam par shes pa yongs su gyur pa las gzhan pa nyid yongs su ma gyur pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ci tshad ma med pa'i bdag nyid yongs su ma gyur par bshad pa'i chos yongs su brtags na ni de las gzhan pa'i dngos po rnam par shes pa yongs su gyur pa las gzhan pa nyid yongs su ma gyur pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But if the phenomenon that is explained as not being a valid knowledge of a nature that exists is analyzed, then it is not the case that the consciousness of another thing that is different from that is not a transformation of that.

original: khyed dngos po las gzhan pa nyid kyi dngos po med par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyed dngos po las gzhan pa nyid kyi dngos po med par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because you accept that a thing that is different from a thing is a nonthing.

original: nus pa mtshungs pa'i ngo bo shes pa gcig la tshogs pa ni gzhan pa'i dngos po rnam par shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: nus pa mtshungs pa'i ngo bo shes pa gcig la tshogs pa ni gzhan pa'i dngos po rnam par shes pa rnams so //
translated: The collection of the consciousnesses of the same capacity is the other entity.

original: de bzhin thabs gzhan med pas de shes pa las gzhan zla bo med par grub pa yin gyi gzugs shes pas /
analyzed: de bzhin thabs gzhan med pas de shes pa las gzhan zla bo med par grub pa yin gyi gzugs shes pas /
translated: In the same way, since there is no other method, the non-existence of the other is established by the knowledge of that, not by the knowledge of form.

original: ro la sogs pa med par rtogs pa'am shin tu yul la sogs pas bskal pa ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ro la sogs pa med par rtogs pa'am shin tu yul la sogs pas bskal pa ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable to understand the non-existence of taste, etc. by the knowledge of form, or to understand the non-existence of the object, etc. by the knowledge of the object, etc.

original: gzhan pa'i dngos po rnam par shes pa so sor nges pa'i ngo bo so sor snang ba nyid las dngos po gzhan du snang ba de chu la sogs pa dmigs pa med pa kho nar mi 'grub kyi /
analyzed: gzhan pa'i dngos po rnam par shes pa so sor nges pa'i ngo bo so sor snang ba nyid las dngos po gzhan du snang ba de chu la sogs pa dmigs pa med pa kho nar mi 'grub kyi /
translated: The other entity, the consciousness of the specific object, is the appearance of the specific nature. Apart from that, the appearance of the other entity is not established as the non-apprehension of water, etc.

original: de ltar zla bo med pa ni mngon sum gyis nges pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar zla bo med pa ni mngon sum gyis nges pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, the non-existence of the other is ascertained by perception itself.

original: de med pa'i tha snyad du kho bo cag mngon par 'dod pas mi dmigs pa las 'ongs pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa 'dis nye bar dgod do //
analyzed: de med pa'i tha snyad du kho bo cag mngon par 'dod pas mi dmigs pa las 'ongs pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa 'dis nye bar dgod do //
translated: This is stated by the statement We do not accept the non-existence of that which is not apprehended.

original: de la gang gi tshe chu dmigs su med pa ci yang ma yin pa'i ngo bo mi @302a * //
analyzed: de la gang gi tshe chu dmigs su med pa ci yang ma yin pa'i ngo bo mi @302a * //
translated: If water is not observed, then the non-observation of anything at all is the nature of non-existence.

original: dmigs pa yin pa de'i tshe med pa de ji ltar 'ga' zhig gis rtogs pa yongs su gcod pa yin /
analyzed: dmigs pa yin pa de'i tshe med pa de ji ltar 'ga' zhig gis rtogs pa yongs su gcod pa yin /
translated: But how can that non-existence be ascertained by anyone?

original: ji srid du yongs su gcod pa ni shes pa'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji srid du yongs su gcod pa ni shes pa'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the object of knowledge is a phenomenon.

original: yang na de rtogs pa'i ngo bor mi 'dod kyi 'on kyang de'i phyir rgyur yod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yang na de rtogs pa'i ngo bor mi 'dod kyi 'on kyang de'i phyir rgyur yod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Or, if you don‚Äôt assert that it is the nature of the realization of that, but rather that it exists as the cause of that,

original: rtogs pa'i rgyu 'am zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i rgyu 'am zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains: What is the cause of the realization of that?

original: nus pa thams cad kyis stong pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po med pa ni rtogs pa'am rtogs pa'i rgyur yod par mi rigs so //
analyzed: nus pa thams cad kyis stong pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po med pa ni rtogs pa'am rtogs pa'i rgyur yod par mi rigs so //
translated: It is not tenable that a non-thing that is empty of all ability exists as the realization of that or as the cause of the realization of that.

original: chu'i dngos po nyid yin na lhan cig byed pa la de ltos pa med pa'i phyir de rtag tu shes pa skyed pas dngos po med pa'i shes pa gcig pu kho na rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: chu'i dngos po nyid yin na lhan cig byed pa la de ltos pa med pa'i phyir de rtag tu shes pa skyed pas dngos po med pa'i shes pa gcig pu kho na rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: If it were the thing that is water, then since it would not rely on the cooperating conditions, it would always generate consciousness. Therefore only the consciousness of the non-thing would be realized.

original: shes pa gzhan gyi go skabs med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pa gzhan gyi go skabs med par 'gyur ro //
translated: There would be no opportunity for any other consciousness.

original: shes pa med pa ni med pa nyid shes par rigs so zhe na /
analyzed: shes pa med pa ni med pa nyid shes par rigs so zhe na /
translated: If you say that the absence of consciousness is the cognition of nonexistence,

original: de yang zhes bya ba smos te chu dmigs pa med par ji ltar rtogs /
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba smos te chu dmigs pa med par ji ltar rtogs /
translated: then we reply: how can you imagine that water is not perceived?

original: yang na chu 'di dmigs pa med pa ni de 'dir rtogs pa med pa kho na chu med par rtogs pa de'i tshe res 'ga' skye ba yin no //
analyzed: yang na chu 'di dmigs pa med pa ni de 'dir rtogs pa med pa kho na chu med par rtogs pa de'i tshe res 'ga' skye ba yin no //
translated: Or else, this water is not perceived, and the cognition of its absence is produced only when there is no cognition of it.

original: de skad du yang de'i chu dmigs su med pa'am de la chu las gzhan pa me la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa gzhan pa'i dngos po yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de skad du yang de'i chu dmigs su med pa'am de la chu las gzhan pa me la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa gzhan pa'i dngos po yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: Thus, it is said that the water is not perceived or that the cognition of something else, such as fire, is produced.

original: des na bdag nyid yongs su ma gyur pa ni tha dad pa rnam par gzhag pa'am de la yang de khas len pas na bdag nyid yongs su gyur pa de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir de las tha dad par rnam par gzhag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: des na bdag nyid yongs su ma gyur pa ni tha dad pa rnam par gzhag pa'am de la yang de khas len pas na bdag nyid yongs su gyur pa de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir de las tha dad par rnam par gzhag par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, when the self is not transformed, it is either posited as different or it is accepted as that, but when the self is transformed, it is not posited as different because it is of the same nature as that.

original: de yang de'am gzhan pa yang rung res 'ga' zhig kyang rtogs pa med kyang gang gi tshe chu la sogs pa dngos po med par rtogs na de'i tshe gnyid log pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na yang gnyid log kyang chu la sogs pa dngos po med pa
analyzed: de yang de'am gzhan pa yang rung res 'ga' zhig kyang rtogs pa med kyang gang gi tshe chu la sogs pa dngos po med par rtogs na de'i tshe gnyid log pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na yang gnyid log kyang chu la sogs pa dngos po med pa
translated: Moreover, even if one does not sometimes realize that it is that or something else, when one realizes that water and so on is not a thing, then at that time, even when one is asleep and so on, one would realize that water and so on is not a thing,

original: cis na mi rtogs /
analyzed: cis na mi rtogs /
translated: why would one not realize it?üîΩOne would realize that it does not exist.

original: des kyang de med par rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes tshad ma rnam par nges bas de rnam par dpyad pas de nyid du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: des kyang de med par rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes tshad ma rnam par nges bas de rnam par dpyad pas de nyid du blta bar bya'o //
translated: This should be examined in the same way as it is analyzed in the Ascertainment of Valid Knowledge.

original: bar du chod pa la sogs pa smos pa ni 'di dag bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: bar du chod pa la sogs pa smos pa ni 'di dag bstan pa yin te /
translated: The statement ‚Äúobstructed and so on‚Äù teaches this.

original: gzhan pa'i dngos po yang gzhan pa nyid dang mtshungs par rung ba'i ngo bo la ltos par khas ma blangs so //
analyzed: gzhan pa'i dngos po yang gzhan pa nyid dang mtshungs par rung ba'i ngo bo la ltos par khas ma blangs so //
translated: Other things are not accepted as relying on a nature that is suitable to be the same as another.

original: de ltar na kho bo cag gis nye bar brjod pa mi dmigs pa grub pas so //
analyzed: de ltar na kho bo cag gis nye bar brjod pa mi dmigs pa grub pas so //
translated: Thus, we have established the nonobservation of something that should be observed.

original: gang gi tshe ji skad du bshad pa'i @302b mi dmigs pa'i rnam pas chu med par rtogs pa la mi sbyor ba dang mer snang ba'i shes pa so sor nges pa'i rnam pa khas blang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe ji skad du bshad pa'i @302b mi dmigs pa'i rnam pas chu med par rtogs pa la mi sbyor ba dang mer snang ba'i shes pa so sor nges pa'i rnam pa khas blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: When one does not apply the non-apprehension of the sort explained to the understanding of the absence of water, and when one does not accept the cognition that appears as fire to have a determinate aspect,

original: de lta bas na 'dis me mthong bar rtogs pa na me mthong yang shes pa la 'dres pa'i ngo bor snang bas /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dis me mthong bar rtogs pa na me mthong yang shes pa la 'dres pa'i ngo bor snang bas /
translated: then, when one understands that one sees fire, one sees fire, but the cognition appears as a mixed entity.

original: 'di na me yin gyi chu ma yin no zhes mi nges pas mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di na me yin gyi chu ma yin no zhes mi nges pas mi shes pa'o //
translated: So, one does not ascertain that ‚Äúthis is fire, not water,‚Äù and therefore one does not know.

original: chu rang gi ngo bor snang yang de don du gnyer ba ni 'dug pa la 'jug par mi bya /
analyzed: chu rang gi ngo bor snang yang de don du gnyer ba ni 'dug pa la 'jug par mi bya /
translated: Even though water appears as its own entity, one who seeks it does not enter the water that is present.

original: 'gro bar mi bya ba ni chu don du gnyer ba la 'jug par mi bya ba'o //
