analyzed: 'gro bar mi bya ba ni chu don du gnyer ba la 'jug par mi bya ba'o //
translated: One does not enter the water that is present, but one does not enter the water that is sought.

original: de ltar na chu zhes brjod pa gang yin pas gdung ba bgrod par dka' ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar na chu zhes brjod pa gang yin pas gdung ba bgrod par dka' ba ste /
translated: Thus, that which is called ‚Äúwater‚Äù is difficult to traverse, since it is hot.

original: de'am gzhan pa'i ngo bo ma lus pa ma 'dres pa so sor nges pa'i rnam par shes pa la snang ba yin na 'di'am gzhan pa nyid 'dren ma'i ngo bor yang cis na snang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de'am gzhan pa'i ngo bo ma lus pa ma 'dres pa so sor nges pa'i rnam par shes pa la snang ba yin na 'di'am gzhan pa nyid 'dren ma'i ngo bor yang cis na snang bar 'gyur /
translated: If the nature of that or something else appears in consciousness, which is individually and distinctly ascertained without confusion, why would the nature of a mixture of that or something else appear?

original: des kyang 'jug pa dang ldog pa dag 'gal bas cig car nyams su blang bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des kyang 'jug pa dang ldog pa dag 'gal bas cig car nyams su blang bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because engagement and disengagement are mutually exclusive, it is impossible to practice them simultaneously.

original: rgol bar dka' ba ni nyon mongs shing rtogs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rgol bar dka' ba ni nyon mongs shing rtogs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is difficult to argue with this, because it is vexing and confusing.

original: 'dir gzhan gyi dogs pa smra ba'i go skabs ni gal te gcig mthong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dir gzhan gyi dogs pa smra ba'i go skabs ni gal te gcig mthong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Here, the opportunity to speak of the doubts of others is stated in ‚ÄúIf one sees one thing, etc.‚Äù

original: kho bo ni chu la dmigs pa ldog pa tsam ci yang ma yin pa'i ngo bo de med par rtogs pa ni mi brjod do //
analyzed: kho bo ni chu la dmigs pa ldog pa tsam ci yang ma yin pa'i ngo bo de med par rtogs pa ni mi brjod do //
translated: We do not say that one understands the nonexistence of that which is the mere cessation of the object of consciousness of water, which is not anything at all.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: Because the previously explained error would ensue.

original: 'on kyang 'di gcig pu 'ba' zhig pa'i me mthong ba gang yin pa de nyid las gzhan pa yin te de la chu snang ba med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'am rnam par shes pa la gzhan pa'i dngos por brjod do //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di gcig pu 'ba' zhig pa'i me mthong ba gang yin pa de nyid las gzhan pa yin te de la chu snang ba med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'am rnam par shes pa la gzhan pa'i dngos por brjod do //
translated: But the mere seeing of fire alone is different from that, and one realizes that there is no appearance of water in that place, or one expresses the nonexistence of water as an object of consciousness.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas ji ltar gcig mthong bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas ji ltar gcig mthong bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The proponent of tenets says, ‚ÄúHow is it that one sees fire and so on?‚Äù

original: ci de gcig mthong ba'i shugs kyis kyang gzhan med par rtogs par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: ci de gcig mthong ba'i shugs kyis kyang gzhan med par rtogs par 'gyur ram /
translated: Does the mere force of seeing one thing cause one to realize that another does not exist?

original: de lta na mthong ba de'i tshe de nyid yod do zhes khong du chud par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de lta na mthong ba de'i tshe de nyid yod do zhes khong du chud par 'gyur la /
translated: If that were the case, at the time of seeing fire, one would understand that fire exists,

original: de las gzhan med do zhes cis na nges par 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: de las gzhan med do zhes cis na nges par 'gyur ba yin /
translated: but how would one ascertain that water does not exist?

original: me la sogs pa 'ba' zhig pa de nyid yongs su mthong ba na chu dang ma 'dres par mthong bas me shes pa la so sor snang ba na chu med do zhes shes pa skye ba yin no //
analyzed: me la sogs pa 'ba' zhig pa de nyid yongs su mthong ba na chu dang ma 'dres par mthong bas me shes pa la so sor snang ba na chu med do zhes shes pa skye ba yin no //
translated: When one sees only fire and so on, one sees that it is not mixed with water. Therefore when fire appears to the consciousness that knows fire, the knowledge that there is no water arises.

original: de lta na me bzhin du chu yang gang gis de las 'byung bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe me bzhin du de mthong ba'i shes pa la snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na me bzhin du chu yang gang gis de las 'byung bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe me bzhin du de mthong ba'i shes pa la snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, just as fire, so water would also appear to the consciousness that sees it, since it would arise from that.

original: de dag gi rang gi shes pa khyad @303a * //üîΩpar can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag gi rang gi shes pa khyad @303a * // par can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because their own consciousnesses are distinctive,

original: gcig snang bar rung ba yin par rigs so //
analyzed: gcig snang bar rung ba yin par rigs so //
translated: it is reasonable that one is suitable to appear.

original: de'i phyir gcig snang ba gzhan med pa ni mi 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir gcig snang ba gzhan med pa ni mi 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because the non-appearance of one is the non-appearance of another,

original: gzhan pa'i yod pa'i shes pa skye ba na gzhan pa'i dngos po'i rnam par shes pa med do//
analyzed: gzhan pa'i yod pa'i shes pa skye ba na gzhan pa'i dngos po'i rnam par shes pa med do//
translated: when the consciousness of the existence of another arises, there is no consciousness of the entity of another.

original: zhes bya ba'i shes pa skye ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i shes pa skye ba'o //
translated: This is the arising of the consciousness that says, ‚ÄúThere is no other entity.‚Äù

original: gzhan gyi dngos po de yang gzhan dang ma 'dres pa'i rang bzhin de nyid kyis de med par rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po de yang gzhan dang ma 'dres pa'i rang bzhin de nyid kyis de med par rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu yin no zhe na /
translated: And that other entity, by its very nature unmixed with another, is the cause of the conception of its absence.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas 'di nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas 'di nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The proponent of the tenets says ‚ÄúThis very thing‚Äù and so on.

original: 'on te kho bo cag gis 'di dag kyang de dag yod pa na gcig gi ngo bor nges pa rtogs pa mi srid pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'on te kho bo cag gis 'di dag kyang de dag yod pa na gcig gi ngo bor nges pa rtogs pa mi srid pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis sngar bshad zin to //
translated: But we have already explained above with such statements as, ‚ÄúIf they existed, it would be impossible to realize their nature as singular.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir gzhan dang ma 'dres pa 'ba' zhig pa snang ba gang yin pa de las gzhan med pa yang yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan dang ma 'dres pa 'ba' zhig pa snang ba gang yin pa de las gzhan med pa yang yin no //
translated: Therefore, the appearance of something that is not mixed with other things is not something that does not exist.

original: de nyid 'ba' zhig de las gzhan med pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ram gzhan med pa'i cha ni sun phyung ba'i phyir dang / de ni mngon sum la snang ba'i phyir de med pa ni de'i stobs kyis phyis tha snyad 'jug par byed de gzugs med pa nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa skye ba yin no //
analyzed: de nyid 'ba' zhig de las gzhan med pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ram gzhan med pa'i cha ni sun phyung ba'i phyir dang / de ni mngon sum la snang ba'i phyir de med pa ni de'i stobs kyis phyis tha snyad 'jug par byed de gzugs med pa nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa skye ba yin no //
translated: Because that alone is the nature of something that is not other than itself, or because the aspect of something that is not other is refuted, and because that is the appearance of direct perception, its nonexistence is later imputed by the power of that, and a conceptual consciousness arises that conceives of the absence of form.

original: des ma rtogs na cung zad cig kyang go bar bya bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: des ma rtogs na cung zad cig kyang go bar bya bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: If that were not realized, nothing would be understood at all.

original: gang gi phyir de gzhan gyi dngos po rnam par shes pa ni mngon sum gyi bdag nyid kyis kyang mi rtogs kyi de las gzhan med pa'i shes pa skye bas dngos po med pa'i tshad ma logs shig tu rnam par mi gzhag go //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de gzhan gyi dngos po rnam par shes pa ni mngon sum gyi bdag nyid kyis kyang mi rtogs kyi de las gzhan med pa'i shes pa skye bas dngos po med pa'i tshad ma logs shig tu rnam par mi gzhag go //
translated: Because that consciousness of another‚Äôs entity is not realized even by the nature of direct perception, but by the arising of a consciousness that is not different from that, the valid knowledge of non-existence is not posited separately.

original: de lta na de gzhan gyi rnam par stong pa myong ba kho na las de med par rig go //
analyzed: de lta na de gzhan gyi rnam par stong pa myong ba kho na las de med par rig go //
translated: In that case, that is known to be non-existent from the mere experience of it being empty of another aspect.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa yang de'i rnam pas stong ba'i ngo bor rigs pas de las gzhan med par rig pa ni med de /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa yang de'i rnam pas stong ba'i ngo bor rigs pas de las gzhan med par rig pa ni med de /
translated: Also, the conceptual consciousness is not known by reasoning to be the entity empty of that aspect, and not different from that.

original: 'ba' zhig pa 'di rnam par rtog pas 'byed do //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig pa 'di rnam par rtog pas 'byed do //
translated: This alone is distinguished by conceptual thought.

original: de'i phyir 'di ltar rtog pa med pa'i shes pa bzhin du la lar med par nges pa na 'di na me yod ces phyis nas rnam par rtog pa'i shes pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ltar rtog pa med pa'i shes pa bzhin du la lar med par nges pa na 'di na me yod ces phyis nas rnam par rtog pa'i shes pas /
translated: Therefore, when ascertaining the non-existence of something like a non-conceptual consciousness, later on, the conceptual consciousness thinks, ‚ÄúFire exists here.‚Äù

original: tha snyad rab tu 'jug pa tsam de las tha dad pa'i tshad ma ni med par sngar ji skad bshad pa de bzhin du med pa'i shes pa yang rnam par rtog pa de'i 'bras bu'i sgo nas gzhan pa'i dngos po rnam par shes pa'i mngon sum las @303b
analyzed: tha snyad rab tu 'jug pa tsam de las tha dad pa'i tshad ma ni med par sngar ji skad bshad pa de bzhin du med pa'i shes pa yang rnam par rtog pa de'i 'bras bu'i sgo nas gzhan pa'i dngos po rnam par shes pa'i mngon sum las @303b
translated: As explained earlier, apart from the mere engagement of conventions, there is no valid cognition.

original: dngos po med par grags pa'i tshad ma tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po med par grags pa'i tshad ma tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the same way, consciousness of nonexistence is also not a separate valid cognition of nonexistence, because it is the result of that conception.

original: de'i phyir kho bo cag gis bshad pa'i de las gzhan med par rtogs pa gang yin pa de nyid khyed kyis kyang bstan na ci'i phyir ma rangs par ston /
analyzed: de'i phyir kho bo cag gis bshad pa'i de las gzhan med par rtogs pa gang yin pa de nyid khyed kyis kyang bstan na ci'i phyir ma rangs par ston /
translated: Therefore, whatever we explain as the realization of nonexistence, you also teach. So why do you teach it with such hostility?

original: gang gi phyir dngos po med pa'i tshad mar bshad pa tha dad pa ni khas mi len pas khas len pa la bzhad gad ston pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po med pa'i tshad mar bshad pa tha dad pa ni khas mi len pas khas len pa la bzhad gad ston pa yin no //
translated: Since we do not accept a separate valid cognition of nonexistence, you are laughing at what you yourself accept.

original: de lta na khyed kyis da ltar thabs zad pas gzu bor gnas par brjod pa yin gyi de lta ma yin na 'di sngar yang cis na mi brjod /
analyzed: de lta na khyed kyis da ltar thabs zad pas gzu bor gnas par brjod pa yin gyi de lta ma yin na 'di sngar yang cis na mi brjod /
translated: In that case, you are now speaking honestly because you have exhausted your means. Otherwise, why did you not say this before?

original: cal col du brjod pas bdag dang gzhan nyon mongs pa yin no zhes mjug bsdu ba ni de lta bas na 'gram ma mthong ba'i bya bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩdper na grur zhugs pa'i tshong pa rnams kyis bya ba bkrol nas kyang 'gram mthong ba yin na de gang gi tshe 'gram du gnas la /
analyzed: cal col du brjod pas bdag dang gzhan nyon mongs pa yin no zhes mjug bsdu ba ni de lta bas na 'gram ma mthong ba'i bya bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / dper na grur zhugs pa'i tshong pa rnams kyis bya ba bkrol nas kyang 'gram mthong ba yin na de gang gi tshe 'gram du gnas la /
translated: The summary statement is: Therefore, like a bird who sees the shore,

original: mtha' ma rnyed pa de'i tshe ni gru nyid du phyir 'ong ba de bzhin du 'di la yang blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: mtha' ma rnyed pa de'i tshe ni gru nyid du phyir 'ong ba de bzhin du 'di la yang blta bar bya ste /
translated: For example, when merchants who have boarded a ship see the shore, they are relieved. But when they see the shore, they have not yet reached it. At that time, they must return to the ship. In the same way, this should be seen.

original: gang gis kyang gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya ba gang dang gang gi phyogs yin pa de bas na ma rig pa'i gting mi tshugs pa can gyi phyogs bsgrubs pa 'di la cung zad cig kyang dgos pa med do //
analyzed: gang gis kyang gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya ba gang dang gang gi phyogs yin pa de bas na ma rig pa'i gting mi tshugs pa can gyi phyogs bsgrubs pa 'di la cung zad cig kyang dgos pa med do //
translated: Since it is certain that one must accept something, and since it is certain that one must accept something, then in this system of establishing the position of the one who is not submerged in the depths of ignorance, there is no need for anything else.

original: de ltar na gzhan gyi gzhan yod pa de med pa dag rtags dang rtags can gyi dngos por 'dod pa la 'brel pa med pas 'di rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na gzhan gyi gzhan yod pa de med pa dag rtags dang rtags can gyi dngos por 'dod pa la 'brel pa med pas 'di rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, since there is no relationship between the existence of one thing and the nonexistence of another, this is not a correct logical reason.üîΩThe opponent argues that since the teaching of another is unrelated, one cannot understand nonexistence through understanding existence.

original: gzhan gyis bstan pa 'brel pa med pas gzhan yod par rtogs pas kyang med par rtogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes rtsod pa ni 'dir 'brel pa la sogs pa 'ga' zhig gis byas pa med kyi /
analyzed: gzhan gyis bstan pa 'brel pa med pas gzhan yod par rtogs pas kyang med par rtogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes rtsod pa ni 'dir 'brel pa la sogs pa 'ga' zhig gis byas pa med kyi /
translated: Here, the opponent does not argue that there is no relationship between existence and nonexistence, but rather that there is no relationship between the existence of one thing and the nonexistence of another.

original: de las gzhan pa kho na de med pa yin te /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa kho na de med pa yin te /
translated: The response to this is that the existence of one thing is itself the nonexistence of another,

original: gzhan med par rtogs pa nyid kyis de med par rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes rab tu bsgrubs so //
analyzed: gzhan med par rtogs pa nyid kyis de med par rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes rab tu bsgrubs so //
translated: because understanding the nonexistence of one thing is itself the understanding of the nonexistence of another.üîΩThe opponent‚Äôs argument that the meaning of nonexistence is some nonexistent thing and that the valid cognition of nonexistence is a nonvalid cognition is refuted incidentally.

original: gzhon nu ma len gyis yongs su brtags pa'i dngos po med pa'i don 'ga' zhig dang dngos po med pa'i tshad mas rtsod pa ni zhar la sun phyung nas da ltar ni dngos po 'khrul pa grub pa ni de'i tshad ma yang rten ces bya ba 'di dag
analyzed: gzhon nu ma len gyis yongs su brtags pa'i dngos po med pa'i don 'ga' zhig dang dngos po med pa'i tshad mas rtsod pa ni zhar la sun phyung nas da ltar ni dngos po 'khrul pa grub pa ni de'i tshad ma yang rten ces bya ba 'di dag
translated: Now, the opponent argues that the establishment of a mistaken thing is its valid cognition.

original: dngos su gsal bar byed pas phyogs snga ma kun nas bslang ba ni gal te de ltar gcig yongs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dngos su gsal bar byed pas phyogs snga ma kun nas bslang ba ni gal te de ltar gcig yongs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The opponent‚Äôs position is explicitly stated: ‚ÄúIf one were to ascertain something as being singular, then it would be impossible to ascertain it as being multiple.‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe gcig pu 'ba' zhig yongs su bcad pas gzhan rnam par bcad pa 'grub /üîΩde'i tshe khyad @304a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gcig pu 'ba' zhig yongs su bcad pas gzhan rnam par bcad pa 'grub / de'i tshe khyad @304a * //
translated: When one ascertains something as being singular, then it is established as excluding being other.

original: par gzhan thams cad kyi yul gang yin pa de la 'di gcig tu mthong ba de la med par 'grub par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: par gzhan thams cad kyi yul gang yin pa de la 'di gcig tu mthong ba de la med par 'grub par 'gyur bas /
translated: At that time, it would be established that whatever is the object of all other features does not exist in that which is seen as singular.

original: khyad par 'dzin par mtshungs par rang gi shes pa skyed par rung ba'i gnas skabs gang yin pa de nyid de /
analyzed: khyad par 'dzin par mtshungs par rang gi shes pa skyed par rung ba'i gnas skabs gang yin pa de nyid de /
translated: Therefore, it is the very state in which it is suitable to generate one‚Äôs own consciousness that apprehends the features that is the object of the singular cognition.

original: dper na 'di dang mtshungs par rung ba'i ngo bo'i don gyis dben pa'i ngo bo dmigs pa de las gcig tu nges pa'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa yin pa de bzhin du de dang mtshungs pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo'i don gyis dben pa'i bdag nyid la
analyzed: dper na 'di dang mtshungs par rung ba'i ngo bo'i don gyis dben pa'i ngo bo dmigs pa de las gcig tu nges pa'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa yin pa de bzhin du de dang mtshungs pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo'i don gyis dben pa'i bdag nyid la
translated: For example, just as the object that is empty of the entity that is suitable to be similar to this is observed, and the cognition that has the aspect of ascertaining it as singular is generated, in the same way, the object that is empty of the entity that is not suitable to be similar to that

original: yang yin no //
analyzed: yang yin no //
translated: is also like that.

original: des kyang des dben pa'i rnam pas /
analyzed: des kyang des dben pa'i rnam pas /
translated: And by the aspect of its absence,

original: de las gzhan yod pa sgrub par byed pa khyad par med pas sa phyogs kyi ngo bo shes pa'i bum pa med pa bzhin du ro la sogs pa med pa yang sgrub par byed pas bum pa med pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan yod pa sgrub par byed pa khyad par med pas sa phyogs kyi ngo bo shes pa'i bum pa med pa bzhin du ro la sogs pa med pa yang sgrub par byed pas bum pa med pa yang ma yin no //
translated: it proves the existence of something else. Since there is no difference, it proves the nonexistence of taste, etc., just as it does the nonexistence of a pot in the nature of a place. Therefore, it is not the case that it does not prove the nonexistence of a pot.

original: gzhan yang gang dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa las mi dmigs pas med pa sgrub par byed pa'i khyad par bshad pa yang brjod mi dgos so //
analyzed: gzhan yang gang dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa las mi dmigs pas med pa sgrub par byed pa'i khyad par bshad pa yang brjod mi dgos so //
translated: Moreover, it is unnecessary to explain the difference between the nonexistence that is proved by nonapprehension of something that is an object of apprehension and the nonexistence that is proved by nonapprehension of something that is not an object of apprehension.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩgang dang gang dmigs pa'i rig byar ma gyur pa de dag kyang yul de dang de dag la rnam pa gcig pa'i shes pas rnam par gcod par 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / gang dang gang dmigs pa'i rig byar ma gyur pa de dag kyang yul de dang de dag la rnam pa gcig pa'i shes pas rnam par gcod par 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: Why is this?üîΩThose things that are not objects of apprehension are also excluded by a consciousness that has the same aspect as the object.

original: de bzhin du ji lta ba'i dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa de'i rnam pa gcig pa'i shes pa la snang ba des kyang rnam par gcod pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du ji lta ba'i dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa de'i rnam pa gcig pa'i shes pa la snang ba des kyang rnam par gcod pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, those things that are objects of apprehension are also excluded by the appearance of a consciousness that has the same aspect as the object.

original: de bzhin du dmigs pa'i rig byar ma gyur pa'i mtshan nyid la yang yin na /
analyzed: de bzhin du dmigs pa'i rig byar ma gyur pa'i mtshan nyid la yang yin na /
translated: So too, if it is the characteristic of not being the observed object,üîΩthen what is the difference between being the observed object?

original: ci dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa'i khyad par 'dis yin nam zhes bya ba de lta na yang phyogs snga ma rnam par bzhag nas /
analyzed: ci dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa'i khyad par 'dis yin nam zhes bya ba de lta na yang phyogs snga ma rnam par bzhag nas /
translated: Even if it is like that, having posited the former position,

original: gal te de las gzhan pa rnam par gcod pa des tha dad par byed pa rnams gzhan gyis rnam par gzhag pa mngon par 'dod pa de khas blang bar bya ba kho na'o //
analyzed: gal te de las gzhan pa rnam par gcod pa des tha dad par byed pa rnams gzhan gyis rnam par gzhag pa mngon par 'dod pa de khas blang bar bya ba kho na'o //
translated: if it is differentiated by the exclusion of that which is other, then it is certainly to be accepted that it is posited by another.üîΩBut if it is not in its object and time, that is not tenable.üîΩThat which is the cause of the establishment of the object is the observed object.

original: 'on te de'i yul dang dus dag tu med pa de mi rigs so //
analyzed: 'on te de'i yul dang dus dag tu med pa de mi rigs so //
translated: That which is the cause of the establishment of the object is the observed object.üîΩThat which is the cause of the establishment of the object is the observed object.üîΩThat which is the cause of the establishment of the object is the observed object.üîΩThat which is the cause of the establishment of the object is the observed object.üîΩThat which is the cause of the establishment of the object is the observed object.üîΩThat which is the cause of the establishment of the object is the observed object.üîΩThat which is the cause of the establishment of the object is the observed object.üîΩThat which is the cause of the establishment of the object is the observed object.üîΩThat which is the cause of the establishment of the object is the observed object.üîΩThat which is the cause of the establishment of the object is the observed object.üîΩThat which is the cause of the establishment of the object is the observed object.üîΩThat which is the cause of the establishment of the object is the observed object.üîΩThat which is the cause of the establishment of the object is the observed object.üîΩThat which is the cause of the establishment of the object is the observed object.üîΩThat which is the cause of the establishment of the object is the observed object.üîΩThat which is the cause of the establishment of the object is the observed object.üîΩThat which is the cause of the establishment of the object is the observed object.üîΩThat which is the cause of the establishment of the object is the observed object.üîΩThat which is the cause of the establishment of the object is the observed object.üîΩThat which is the cause of the establishment of the object is the observed object.üîΩThat which is the cause of the establishment of the object is the observed object.üîΩThat which is the cause of the establishment of the object is the observed object.

original: gang gis nus pa mtshungs par rung ba'i ngo bo dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur ba las kyang med pa sgrub par byed pa yin la de dang nus pa mi mtshungs par rung ba'i ngo bo dmigs pa'i rig byar ma gyur pa la mi srid pa ma yin no
analyzed: gang gis nus pa mtshungs par rung ba'i ngo bo dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur ba las kyang med pa sgrub par byed pa yin la de dang nus pa mi mtshungs par rung ba'i ngo bo dmigs pa'i rig byar ma gyur pa la mi srid pa ma yin no
translated: That which is the cause of the establishment of the object is the observed object.üîΩThat which is the cause of the establishment of the object is the observed

original: // de dag yod pa la gcig tu nges par rtogs pa mi srid pa ma yin pas de ltar de med pa sgrub @304b bar byed do //
analyzed: // de dag yod pa la gcig tu nges par rtogs pa mi srid pa ma yin pas de ltar de med pa sgrub @304b bar byed do //
translated: Since it is not impossible to ascertain the existence of those as one, in that way, it is established that they do not exist.

original: 'di dag gzhan la yod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: 'di dag gzhan la yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: Since they do not exist in others,

original: rtogs par byed pas bdag nyid gcig yongs su bcad pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa nye bar bstan to //
analyzed: rtogs par byed pas bdag nyid gcig yongs su bcad pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa nye bar bstan to //
translated: the ascertainment of the nature of one is taught as ‚Äúthe exclusion of the nature of one.‚Äù

original: gang de'i mdun na gnas pa mngon sum la snang ba yin te /
analyzed: gang de'i mdun na gnas pa mngon sum la snang ba yin te /
translated: That which is present in front of it is the appearance in direct perception.

original: de'i gcig gi bdag nyid du nges pa de'i ngo bo yongs su bcad pas de'i rnam pas bskyed pa'i sgrub pa'i rnam par rtog pa skye'o //
analyzed: de'i gcig gi bdag nyid du nges pa de'i ngo bo yongs su bcad pas de'i rnam pas bskyed pa'i sgrub pa'i rnam par rtog pa skye'o //
translated: The ascertainment of its nature as one generates the conceptual cognition that is produced by its aspect.

original: de las gzhan ni de dag las gzhan te de las tha dad pa de thams cad do //
analyzed: de las gzhan ni de dag las gzhan te de las tha dad pa de thams cad do //
translated: ‚ÄúOther than that‚Äù means other than those, different from them, all of them.

original: gang bdag gi ngo bo de las rnam par gcod pa tha dad pa dang / logs shig tu byed pa dang gzhan pa nyid kyis sgrub par byed pas ma 'dres pa'i ngo bo'i shes pa rnams su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang bdag gi ngo bo de las rnam par gcod pa tha dad pa dang / logs shig tu byed pa dang gzhan pa nyid kyis sgrub par byed pas ma 'dres pa'i ngo bo'i shes pa rnams su 'gyur ro //
translated: The cognition of the nature of the self is the exclusion of the nature of that, the differentiation from that, the exclusion of that, and the establishment of that as different.

original: yang ji ltar gcig gi bdag nyid yongs su gcad pas gzhan pa'i bdag nyid rnam par gcod par mngon sum gyis byed pa yin no //
analyzed: yang ji ltar gcig gi bdag nyid yongs su gcad pas gzhan pa'i bdag nyid rnam par gcod par mngon sum gyis byed pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, how is it that perception determines the identity of one thing by excluding the identity of other things?

original: ji srid du mngon sum gyis mdun na gnas pa'i don gyi nus pa las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid du rtogs pa gang yin pa de las ldog pa ma lus pa'i don las skyes pa de'i bdag nyid du de'i mdun na gnas pa'o //
analyzed: ji srid du mngon sum gyis mdun na gnas pa'i don gyi nus pa las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid du rtogs pa gang yin pa de las ldog pa ma lus pa'i don las skyes pa de'i bdag nyid du de'i mdun na gnas pa'o //
translated: As long as perception understands the nature of an object that is present before one, it arises from the object that is present before one, and it excludes all other objects without exception.

original: ji ltar de rnam par gcod par byed pa dang de rnam par bcad pa'i don dngos po med pa'i tshad ma khas blang bar bya /
analyzed: ji ltar de rnam par gcod par byed pa dang de rnam par bcad pa'i don dngos po med pa'i tshad ma khas blang bar bya /
translated: How can one accept that perception determines the identity of an object and that the valid knowledge that determines the identity of an object is nonexistence?

original: gang gi phyir dngos po ma 'dris pa'i grub pa dang / de'i tshad ma la yang dag par brten pa yin no snyam nas de'i bdag nyid du nges par snang ba'i shes pa yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po ma 'dris pa'i grub pa dang / de'i tshad ma la yang dag par brten pa yin no snyam nas de'i bdag nyid du nges par snang ba'i shes pa yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because the establishment of an object that is not present is based on the valid knowledge of that object, the cognition that appears to ascertain the identity of that object is called ‚Äúthe cognition that is the valid knowledge of that object.‚Äù

original: gang mdun na gnas gcig dngos po la gzhan gyi ngo bo dang ma 'dres pa'i bdag nyid dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin ni rang rang gi ngo bo la gnas pa'i phyir dang gzhan gyi ngo bo dang ma 'dres pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang mdun na gnas gcig dngos po la gzhan gyi ngo bo dang ma 'dres pa'i bdag nyid dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin ni rang rang gi ngo bo la gnas pa'i phyir dang gzhan gyi ngo bo dang ma 'dres pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nature of all things is the nature of each individual thing, which is not mixed with the nature of anything else, and because it is not mixed with the nature of anything else.

original: de lta ma yin na ji ltar dngos po med pa'i chad mas kyang ma 'chol bar de dag grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ji ltar dngos po med pa'i chad mas kyang ma 'chol bar de dag grub par 'gyur /
translated: If it were not so, then how could the non-thing, which is a negation, be established without being confused with those things?

original: 'dres pa'i dngos po rnams ma 'chol bar sgrub par byed pa na 'khrul par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //üîΩde'i phyir gzhan gyi ngo bo dang ma 'dres pa'i rang bzhin kho na de'i bdag nyid du nges par snang ba na gzhan gyi ngo bo dang ma 'dres par snang ba kho na de'i don gcig gi nus pa las byung ba'i mngon sum ni gzhan gyi ngo bor
analyzed: 'dres pa'i dngos po rnams ma 'chol bar sgrub par byed pa na 'khrul par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // de'i phyir gzhan gyi ngo bo dang ma 'dres pa'i rang bzhin kho na de'i bdag nyid du nges par snang ba na gzhan gyi ngo bo dang ma 'dres par snang ba kho na de'i don gcig gi nus pa las byung ba'i mngon sum ni gzhan gyi ngo bor
translated: Because if it were to establish things that are confused without being confused, it would follow that it would be in error.

original: snang bar mi rigs @305a * //
analyzed: snang bar mi rigs @305a * //
translated: Therefore, when the nature of something is ascertained as just that nature which is not mixed with the nature of anything else, and it appears as just that nature which is not mixed with the nature of anything else, then the perception that arises from the capacity of that single object is not logically possible as the appearance of the nature of something else.

original: pas de 'khrul par gyur na ni mngon sum nyams pa yin no //
analyzed: pas de 'khrul par gyur na ni mngon sum nyams pa yin no //
translated: If it were mistaken, then perception would be impaired.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: de'i nus pa las skyes pa rnams de'i ngo bo'i rjes su byed pa la sogs pa de don med do zhes bya ba bshad do //
analyzed: de'i nus pa las skyes pa rnams de'i ngo bo'i rjes su byed pa la sogs pa de don med do zhes bya ba bshad do //
translated: ‚ÄúThe arising from its potential is meaningless, such as the subsequent activity of its nature.‚Äù

original: de dang de'i bdag nyid du nges par snang ba'i shes pa las rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis rig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang de'i bdag nyid du nges par snang ba'i shes pa las rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis rig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is known by reflexive awareness through direct perception of the consciousness that appears as ascertained in the nature of that [object].

original: de rig pa ni mngon sum gyis de'i ngo bo rnam par bcad pa dang so sor byed pa de'i stobs kyis dus phyis gzhan pa'i bdag nyid 'di ma yin no zhes ma 'dres par rnam par gnas pa shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa skye ste /
analyzed: de rig pa ni mngon sum gyis de'i ngo bo rnam par bcad pa dang so sor byed pa de'i stobs kyis dus phyis gzhan pa'i bdag nyid 'di ma yin no zhes ma 'dres par rnam par gnas pa shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa skye ste /
translated: The knowledge of that [object] is the elimination of its nature by direct perception, and by the power of that, later on, the conceptual cognition arises that distinguishes it as ‚Äúthis is not of the nature of that other.‚Äù

original: gzung ba la 'dzin pa des na sngon med pa cung zad cig kyang shes pa med kyi /
analyzed: gzung ba la 'dzin pa des na sngon med pa cung zad cig kyang shes pa med kyi /
translated: There is no knowledge of anything whatsoever that was not previously known by that apprehension of the object.

original: gzhan pa'i ngo bo dang ma 'dres pa'i bdag nyid kyi mngon sum de nyid kyi rnam pa'i rjes su byed pas yongs su gcod pa yin pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: gzhan pa'i ngo bo dang ma 'dres pa'i bdag nyid kyi mngon sum de nyid kyi rnam pa'i rjes su byed pas yongs su gcod pa yin pa'i phyir ro /
translated: Because the direct perception of the nature of the object, unmixed with the nature of other things, is a determinant because it conforms to the aspect of that object.

original: gal te de'i bdag nyid du nges par snang ba'i shes pa yin pa de lta na yang /
analyzed: gal te de'i bdag nyid du nges par snang ba'i shes pa yin pa de lta na yang /
translated: Even though the cognition that appears as if ascertaining that nature

original: ji ltar gzhan gyi bdag nyid las de logs shig tu byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan gyi bdag nyid las de logs shig tu byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: is like that, how is it that it is distinguished from the nature of other things?

original: de'i bdag nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response is ‚Äúbecause of the nature of that thing itself.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir de'i dngos po'i bdag nyid gang gzhan gyi ngo bo dang ma 'dres pa de gzhan ma lus pa'i dngos po'i bdag nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de'i dngos po'i bdag nyid gang gzhan gyi ngo bo dang ma 'dres pa de gzhan ma lus pa'i dngos po'i bdag nyid ma yin no //
translated: Because the nature of that thing itself, unmixed with the nature of other things, is not the nature of all other things.

original: thams cad de las gzhan pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad de las gzhan pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because everything has a nature that is different from that.

original: de lta ma yin na de nyid dam gzhan nyid nyams pa yin pas so //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na de nyid dam gzhan nyid nyams pa yin pas so //
translated: Otherwise, it would be neither that nor something else.

original: de'i phyir de'i bdag nyid du nges par snang ba'i shes pa nyid ni de'am gzhan pa rnams la ldog pa yin no /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i bdag nyid du nges par snang ba'i shes pa nyid ni de'am gzhan pa rnams la ldog pa yin no /
translated: Therefore, the cognition that appears as if ascertaining that nature is a determinant of that or other things.

original: shes pas don lag pas 'dzin pa ni ma yin gyi gzhan las ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: shes pas don lag pas 'dzin pa ni ma yin gyi gzhan las ldog pa yin no //
translated: It is not that consciousness apprehends an object with its hand, but rather that it is the exclusion of other.

original: gzhan gyi ngo bo dang ma 'dres pa 'ba' zhig gcig pu'i bdag nyid kyi rjes su byed pa nyid de gzhan las ldog par bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo bo dang ma 'dres pa 'ba' zhig gcig pu'i bdag nyid kyi rjes su byed pa nyid de gzhan las ldog par bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the mere, single nature that is not mixed with the nature of other, and it is explained as the exclusion of other.

original: yang na gzhan gyi bdag nyid rang gi yul las mi 'dogs pa de'i tshe rang gi yul la gzhan gyi bdag yongs su rnam par bcad do //
analyzed: yang na gzhan gyi bdag nyid rang gi yul las mi 'dogs pa de'i tshe rang gi yul la gzhan gyi bdag yongs su rnam par bcad do //
translated: Or, when the nature of other is not superimposed on its own object, then the nature of other is eliminated with regard to its own object.

original: bdag dang gzhan yang tha dad par rnam par gzhag pa ni de la yang yongs su bcad pa las 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan yang tha dad par rnam par gzhag pa ni de la yang yongs su bcad pa las 'gyur ro //
translated: The distinction between self and other is also established through elimination.

original: de lta ma yin na gzhan rnam par ma bcad pas 'di nyid gcig gi bdag nyid du yongs su bcad pa'i yongs su bcad pa'i bdag nyid de ldog ba'i ngo bor 'gyur @305b ro ;
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gzhan rnam par ma bcad pas 'di nyid gcig gi bdag nyid du yongs su bcad pa'i yongs su bcad pa'i bdag nyid de ldog ba'i ngo bor 'gyur @305b ro ;
translated: Otherwise, if other were not eliminated, then this would be the nature of a single thing, and the nature of elimination would be the nature of non-exclusion.

original: des kyang rnam par ma bcad pas gzhan gyi bdag nyid yongs su gcod par thal bar 'gyur ba dang 'jug pa dang ldog pa med pas snga ma bzhin du thal bar 'gyur ba ni me mthong yang me kho na ma mthong zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: des kyang rnam par ma bcad pas gzhan gyi bdag nyid yongs su gcod par thal bar 'gyur ba dang 'jug pa dang ldog pa med pas snga ma bzhin du thal bar 'gyur ba ni me mthong yang me kho na ma mthong zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: and since it is not excluded by that, it would follow that it excludes the nature of something else. And since there would be no engagement or exclusion, the absurd consequence would be as before, that even though one sees fire, one does not see fire.

original: 'ba' zhig pa de gzhan gyi bdag nyid las ldog pa yin na de'i bdag nyid la yang gzhan ma lus pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni yul dang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'ba' zhig pa de gzhan gyi bdag nyid las ldog pa yin na de'i bdag nyid la yang gzhan ma lus pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni yul dang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: If that alone is excluded from the nature of something else, then it is not the nature of all that is other than it.

original: de yang mdun na gnas pa'i yul dang dus dang ngo bo nyid dang gnas skabs su nges pa de las gzhan pa yul la sogs pa rnams las ldog pa'i bdag nyid ni rang gi rgyu rnams kho na las 'byung ba'i de'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de yang mdun na gnas pa'i yul dang dus dang ngo bo nyid dang gnas skabs su nges pa de las gzhan pa yul la sogs pa rnams las ldog pa'i bdag nyid ni rang gi rgyu rnams kho na las 'byung ba'i de'i bdag nyid do //
translated: That is to say, it is the nature of that which arises from its own causes alone, which is ascertained as the object, time, entity, and state that is present, and is excluded from all that is other than that, such as other objects and so on.

original: yul la sogs pa nges pa'i bdag nyid kyi rnam pa de lta bu'i ngo bo'i rjes su byed pa'i blos dmigs pa de kho na nyid 'pho ba med pa'o //
analyzed: yul la sogs pa nges pa'i bdag nyid kyi rnam pa de lta bu'i ngo bo'i rjes su byed pa'i blos dmigs pa de kho na nyid 'pho ba med pa'o //
translated: The reality of the object, etc., is the nature of the aspect that is ascertained. The mind that conforms to that nature perceives reality, which is not transferred.

original: yul dang dus dang ngo bo nyid dang gnas skabs kyi bdag nyid 'di rang gi yul la rnam par gcod pa ste tha dad du byed pa'o //
analyzed: yul dang dus dang ngo bo nyid dang gnas skabs kyi bdag nyid 'di rang gi yul la rnam par gcod pa ste tha dad du byed pa'o //
translated: The object, time, nature, and condition are the nature of the object, etc. The mind that is determined by those is the mind that is determined by its own object.

original: yang ci'i phyir gzhan gyi yul la sogs pa de las tha dad par rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir gzhan gyi yul la sogs pa de las tha dad par rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: Again, why is it that the object, etc., of another is determined as different from that?

original: de lta na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de lta na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In response, it is said:üîΩ‚ÄúIf it were not so, etc.‚Äù

original: na zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir ro //
analyzed: na zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIf it were not so‚Äù means ‚Äúbecause it is not so.‚Äù

original: gzhan gyi yul la sogs pa de las tha dad par byed pa gdod ma nas yul la sogs pa nges pa'i don yongs su gcod pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi yul la sogs pa de las tha dad par byed pa gdod ma nas yul la sogs pa nges pa'i don yongs su gcod pa yin te /
translated: The object, etc., of another is determined as different from that. From the beginning, the object, etc., is determined as having a definite meaning.

original: de'i ngo bo'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it conforms to that nature.

original: de lta ma yin na de la gzhan gyi yul la sogs pa de'i ngo bo'i rjes su mi byed na rnam par gcod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na de la gzhan gyi yul la sogs pa de'i ngo bo'i rjes su mi byed na rnam par gcod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, if the object, etc., of another did not conform to that nature, it would not be determined.

original: de kho na nyid kyang de'i yul la sogs pa nges pa nyid de'i tshe de kho na mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyang de'i yul la sogs pa nges pa nyid de'i tshe de kho na mthong ba yin no //
translated: and the object, etc., of that are ascertained, then that is seeing reality.

original: gzhan gyi yul la sogs pa ni gzhan ma yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi yul la sogs pa ni gzhan ma yin par 'dod do //
translated: The object, etc., of another are not accepted as being that.

original: gang gi phyir de lta na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of that, it is said, ‚Äúin that case.‚Äù

original: gzhan du gyur pas ni gzhan gyi yul la sogs pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du gyur pas ni gzhan gyi yul la sogs pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Having become different, one has the object, etc., of another.

original: de lta bur gyur pa ni de'i yul la sogs pa dang ldan pa rnam par gcod pa nyid ni rtogs par byed pa'o//
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa ni de'i yul la sogs pa dang ldan pa rnam par gcod pa nyid ni rtogs par byed pa'o//
translated: Having become like that, one has the object, etc., of that. Exclusion is the cause of understanding.

original: de yongs su gcod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni snga ma'i mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de yongs su gcod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni snga ma'i mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: The ascertainment of that is the conclusion of the previous.

original: de bas na de lta bur gyur pas gzhan du gyur pa nyid rnam par gcod pa nyid kyis mjug bsdu ba'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de lta bur gyur pas gzhan du gyur pa nyid rnam par gcod pa nyid kyis mjug bsdu ba'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: Therefore, the result of the conclusion is the exclusion of having become different by having become like that.

original: de skad du bshad pa'i rigs pa 'dis mngon sum ma ma rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma gcig 'jug @306a * //
analyzed: de skad du bshad pa'i rigs pa 'dis mngon sum ma ma rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma gcig 'jug @306a * //
translated: By this reasoning, which has been explained in that way, the valid cognition of direct perception and inference is engaged in one.

original: pa'o ; / de yang de bzhin du rang gi yul yongs su gcod pa'o //
analyzed: pa'o ; / de yang de bzhin du rang gi yul yongs su gcod pa'o //
translated: And that is the determination of its own object.

original: 'jug pa ni rab tu 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa ni rab tu 'jug pa'o //
translated: Engagement is the process of engaging.

original: dngos po thams cad phung po gnyis te de nyid dang gzhan nyid du rnam par 'jog par byed de //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad phung po gnyis te de nyid dang gzhan nyid du rnam par 'jog par byed de //
translated: All things are posited as either the same or different.

original: de bas na de yongs su gcod pa'i tshad ma'i stobs kyis ma 'dres par grub pa yin na /
analyzed: de bas na de yongs su gcod pa'i tshad ma'i stobs kyis ma 'dres par grub pa yin na /
translated: Therefore, by the power of the valid cognition that determines that, it is established as unique.

original: ci de don du gnyer ba yang med pa la rtogs par byed dam /
analyzed: ci de don du gnyer ba yang med pa la rtogs par byed dam /
translated: But if there is no one who seeks that, what is there to understand?

original: 'o na ni 'di dang 'di dag gzhan gyi bdag nyid ma yin la gzhan yang de'i bdag nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba rnam par rtog pa'i byed pa yin gyi mngon sum ni rtog pa med par 'dod na de ji ltar ma 'dres par de las grubüîΩpar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ni 'di dang 'di dag gzhan gyi bdag nyid ma yin la gzhan yang de'i bdag nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba rnam par rtog pa'i byed pa yin gyi mngon sum ni rtog pa med par 'dod na de ji ltar ma 'dres par de las grub par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Well, then, the function of conceptual thought is to think, ‚ÄúThis is not the nature of that, and that is not the nature of this,‚Äù but if it is held that perception is non-conceptual, how can it be established as unique?

original: de ni rjes su 'gro ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ni rjes su 'gro ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to this, Dharmakƒ´rti says, ‚ÄúIt is the process of engagement,‚Äù and so on.

original: mngon sum de ni sgrub pa dang dgag pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang gi tshe rang gi yul la skye ba de nyid 'di'i 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum de ni sgrub pa dang dgag pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang gi tshe rang gi yul la skye ba de nyid 'di'i 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: That direct perception is the result of the thought that affirms or negates when it arises with respect to its object.

original: de nyid kyang chad mar 'dod kyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyang chad mar 'dod kyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: It is also asserted to be momentary, but not anything else.

original: de nyid kyi phyir don gcig gi rang bzhin mngon sum gyi cha shas med par bdag nyid thams cad yongs su gcod kyang 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan yod par gyur pas skad cig ma la sogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i blo skyed par mi nus pas
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir don gcig gi rang bzhin mngon sum gyi cha shas med par bdag nyid thams cad yongs su gcod kyang 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan yod par gyur pas skad cig ma la sogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i blo skyed par mi nus pas
translated: Therefore, although the nature of a single object is completely ascertained without parts by direct perception, since the conditions for error exist, the mind that follows after or turns away from momentariness and so on is unable to arise.

original: de la tshad mar mi 'dod do snyam na /
analyzed: de la tshad mar mi 'dod do snyam na /
translated: Therefore it is not asserted to be valid knowledge.

original: gal te phung po gnyis su grub pa ni 'chol bar ma gyur cig snyam nas dngos po med pa'i tshad ma brtag pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te phung po gnyis su grub pa ni 'chol bar ma gyur cig snyam nas dngos po med pa'i tshad ma brtag pa yin te /
translated: If you think that the establishment of two types of objects is not mixed and that the valid knowledge of nonthings is investigated,

original: 'on kyang rnam gzhan med par 'gyur na de med par grub pa la mngon sum gyis byed pas cung zad kyang rtog pa med do zhes 'dod na zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang rnam gzhan med par 'gyur na de med par grub pa la mngon sum gyis byed pas cung zad kyang rtog pa med do zhes 'dod na zhe na /
translated: But if there is no other way, then since the nonexistence of that is established by direct perception, there is not the slightest bit of conceptual thought.

original: de la ma brtags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la ma brtags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To this, the root text states, ‚ÄúIf you say that it is not analyzed, etc.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir yongs su mthong ba las tha dad pa ma lus pa'i dngos po rnam par gcod pa ni de las logs shig tu byed pa gzhan pas khyab pa gang yin pa de /
analyzed: de'i phyir yongs su mthong ba las tha dad pa ma lus pa'i dngos po rnam par gcod pa ni de las logs shig tu byed pa gzhan pas khyab pa gang yin pa de /
translated: Therefore, the exclusion of all things that are different from what is completely seen is pervaded by the fact that it is done by something else, which is different from that.

original: sgrub pa kho nas rnam pa gzhan ni de nyid dam gzhan nyid las phyi rol du gyur pa med par grub pa yin no //
analyzed: sgrub pa kho nas rnam pa gzhan ni de nyid dam gzhan nyid las phyi rol du gyur pa med par grub pa yin no //
translated: It is established by the proof alone that there is no other mode that is external to that very thing or something else.

original: des na de'i don la yang dngos po med pa'i tshad ma brtag par mi rigs so //
analyzed: des na de'i don la yang dngos po med pa'i tshad ma brtag par mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable to analyze the nonexistence of a thing in that meaning.

original: yang na ma lus yongs su mthong ba dang blta bar bya ba las gzhan pa nyid ma khyab pa na mngon sum gyis grub par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na ma lus yongs su mthong ba dang blta bar bya ba las gzhan pa nyid ma khyab pa na mngon sum gyis grub par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Or, if the nonexistence of something that is not completely seen is not pervaded by something that is different from what is seen, then it is not established by direct perception.

original: de gang gis phung po gsum pa med par mngon sum nyid du gyur /
analyzed: de gang gis phung po gsum pa med par mngon sum nyid du gyur /
translated: How could it be that the third possibility does not exist?

original: @306b de las med pa'i tshad ma brtag pa don med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: @306b de las med pa'i tshad ma brtag pa don med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is meaningless to analyze the valid knowledge that is not one of those two,

original: de zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: we say:üîΩThat which is not ascertained by the valid knowledge that is a direct percept is not ascertained by any other valid knowledge.

original: phung po gsum par brtag par bya ba ni mthong ba dang de las gzhan pas ma khyab pa yin pa des na rang gi yul gyi don de mngon sum gyis rnam par ma bcad pas logs shig ma byas na de'i don gyi phung po gzhan brtag par byaüîΩba yin na /üîΩrang gi yul la rnam par ma bcad pa'i phyir yang dngos po yongs su ma bcad par thal bar 'gyur ba de ni de'i yul gzhan gyi ngo bo ma lus pa dang 'dres pa'i bdag nyid de gal te des bdag nyid yongs su mi gcod pa dang des
analyzed: phung po gsum par brtag par bya ba ni mthong ba dang de las gzhan pas ma khyab pa yin pa des na rang gi yul gyi don de mngon sum gyis rnam par ma bcad pas logs shig ma byas na de'i don gyi phung po gzhan brtag par bya ba yin na / rang gi yul la rnam par ma bcad pa'i phyir yang dngos po yongs su ma bcad par thal bar 'gyur ba de ni de'i yul gzhan gyi ngo bo ma lus pa dang 'dres pa'i bdag nyid de gal te des bdag nyid yongs su mi gcod pa dang des
translated: Therefore, if the object of that valid knowledge is not ascertained by direct perception, if it is not differentiated, then the object of that valid knowledge is something that is to be analyzed as a third possibility.üîΩIf the object of that valid knowledge is not ascertained by direct perception, then it follows that the object is not ascertained.

original: bdag nyid yongs su bcad pa nyid ji ltar de'am gzhan pas thams cad la khyab par ma bsgrub pa yin /
analyzed: bdag nyid yongs su bcad pa nyid ji ltar de'am gzhan pas thams cad la khyab par ma bsgrub pa yin /
translated: If the object is not ascertained, then it is not established that it is either that object or something other than that object.

original: de lta ma yin na gcig kyang de'am gzhan pa nyid du mi 'gyur te rgyu mtshan mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gcig kyang de'am gzhan pa nyid du mi 'gyur te rgyu mtshan mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were not so, then nothing would be either that or something else, because the reason is the same.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar de bas na dngos po 'ga' zhig la tshad ma mngon sum la sogs pa rab tu 'jug pa de'i dngos po so sor nges pa'i bdag nyid yongs su gcod pa na de las gzhan pa de'i ngo bo ma tshang ba rnam par gcodüîΩpa yin no //üîΩde 'am gzhan pa nyid kyi rnam par gzhag pa las rnam pag sum pa de nyid dag gzhan pa nyid las phyi rol du gyur pa rnam pa gzhan med par bstan te gzhan pas thams cad la khyab par bsgrub pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar de bas na dngos po 'ga' zhig la tshad ma mngon sum la sogs pa rab tu 'jug pa de'i dngos po so sor nges pa'i bdag nyid yongs su gcod pa na de las gzhan pa de'i ngo bo ma tshang ba rnam par gcod pa yin no // de 'am gzhan pa nyid kyi rnam par gzhag pa las rnam pag sum pa de nyid dag gzhan pa nyid las phyi rol du gyur pa rnam pa gzhan med par bstan te gzhan pas thams cad la khyab par bsgrub pa'i phyir ram /
translated: Therefore, when a valid cognition such as perception engages with some thing, it determines the thing‚Äôs nature as determinate, and thereby it excludes that thing‚Äôs being other than that, that is, as having a different nature.üîΩThe third alternative, that is, that it is neither that nor something else, is shown to be nonexistent apart from the categories of that and something else, because the other is established as all-pervasive,

original: de dang 'gal bas dngos po thams cad rnam pa gnyis su bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang 'gal bas dngos po thams cad rnam pa gnyis su bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: or because that and its opposite are established as all-pervasive.

original: de ltar tshad ma gcig gi bya ba 'di dag bshad ma thag pa de nyid kyi mjug bsdu ba bde blag tu rtogs par 'gyur ba bstan pa na 'di ltar zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ltar tshad ma gcig gi bya ba 'di dag bshad ma thag pa de nyid kyi mjug bsdu ba bde blag tu rtogs par 'gyur ba bstan pa na 'di ltar zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Thus, the function of a single valid cognition has been explained. In order to easily understand the conclusion of that, it is said, ‚ÄúIn this way.‚Äù

original: dngos po 'ga' zhig la mngon sum la sogs pa 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po 'ga' zhig la mngon sum la sogs pa 'jug pa'o //
translated: It engages in some object through direct perception and so forth.

original: de nyid kyi dngos po de las gzhan pa'i ngo bo rnam par gcod pa ste de las tha dad par byed pas so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi dngos po de las gzhan pa'i ngo bo rnam par gcod pa ste de las tha dad par byed pas so //
translated: It is the exclusion of the entity of something else from that very thing, because it makes it different from that.

original: de'i ngo bo ni ma 'dres pa'i ngo bor khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni ma 'dres pa'i ngo bor khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Its nature should be understood as an unmixed nature.

original: don dam par na de ni de'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir dang / ji lta ba'i dngos po'i mngon sum gyi ngo bos rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par na de ni de'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir dang / ji lta ba'i dngos po'i mngon sum gyi ngo bos rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the ultimate, it is that nature because it is the nature of that, and it conforms to the nature of direct perception of things as they are.

original: ci 'di gzhan gyi ngo bo rnam par gcod par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: ci 'di gzhan gyi ngo bo rnam par gcod par byed pa yin te /
translated: Does it exclude the nature of something else?

original: de nyid gzhan pa'i ngo bo ma tshang ba'i gcig gi ngo bo yongs su gcod pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin du gzhan pa nyid @307a * //
analyzed: de nyid gzhan pa'i ngo bo ma tshang ba'i gcig gi ngo bo yongs su gcod pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin du gzhan pa nyid @307a * //
translated: Because it is the exclusion of the nature of something else that is incomplete, it is the exclusion of the nature of something else that is complete.

original: de ni de las de snang ba las gzhan pa'i rnam par gcod pa'o //
analyzed: de ni de las de snang ba las gzhan pa'i rnam par gcod pa'o //
translated: It is the exclusion of that from that which appears as that.

original: ga las she na /
analyzed: ga las she na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de las de rang gi yul las so //
analyzed: de las de rang gi yul las so //
translated: From that, it is from its own object.

original: rang gi yul 'ba' zhig gzhan la rnam par gcod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi yul 'ba' zhig gzhan la rnam par gcod pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not that only its own object excludes others,

original: gzhan pa yang rang gi yul las yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan pa yang rang gi yul las yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: but also that which is other excludes from its own object.

original: 'di ga las she na /
analyzed: 'di ga las she na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzhan ni de las gzhan pa ste de la rnam par mi gcod do //
analyzed: gzhan ni de las gzhan pa ste de la rnam par mi gcod do //
translated: That which is other is other than that, and it does not exclude that.

original: gdon mi za bar yongs su bcad pa ni yongs su bcad pa las gzhan nyid yin no //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar yongs su bcad pa ni yongs su bcad pa las gzhan nyid yin no //
translated: Undoubtedly, exclusion is just other than what is excluded.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar de'i phyir tshad ma de nyid gcig gi dngos po yongs su gcod par byed pa na rnam pa gzhan med par sgrub par byed de dngos po med par bshad pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar de'i phyir tshad ma de nyid gcig gi dngos po yongs su gcod par byed pa na rnam pa gzhan med par sgrub par byed de dngos po med par bshad pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Because it is like that, therefore, when that valid cognition determines the entity of one, it establishes the absence of other aspects, but it does not explain the absence of entities.

original: 'di ga las she na /
analyzed: 'di ga las she na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de snang ba na dngos po min pa de las gzhan pa nyid kyis de las gzhan te rnam par gcod pa ni gzhan nyid do //
analyzed: de snang ba na dngos po min pa de las gzhan pa nyid kyis de las gzhan te rnam par gcod pa ni gzhan nyid do //
translated: When that appears, it is other than that which is not an entity, and it excludes from that which is other than that. Exclusion is just other.

original: de las gzhan pa nyid du snang ba ni de las gzhan pa nyid du snang ba ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa nyid du snang ba ni de las gzhan pa nyid du snang ba ste /
translated: The appearance as something other than that is the appearance as something other than that.

original: des na thams cad de las tha dad par rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na thams cad de las tha dad par rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, everything is posited as different from that.

original: de ma yin pa las gzhan du brjod pa gang yin pa ni gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: de ma yin pa las gzhan du brjod pa gang yin pa ni gzhan ma yin te /
translated: That which is expressed as other than that is not other,

original: mdun na gnas pa gzhan ma lus pa'i ngo bo las ldog pa las ldog pa de nyid de las snang ba'i rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: mdun na gnas pa gzhan ma lus pa'i ngo bo las ldog pa las ldog pa de nyid de las snang ba'i rnam par gzhag go //
translated: because the mere negation of the nature of all other things that exist in front is posited as the appearance of that.

original: rigs pa 'di nyid kyis gzhan la yang bstan pa ni 'dir rim pa dang rim pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rigs pa 'di nyid kyis gzhan la yang bstan pa ni 'dir rim pa dang rim pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: This very reasoning is also taught with respect to other things, such as the so-called order and disorder.

original: rigs pa gzhan pa 'dis don gcig tu nges pa'i ngo bo dang rjes su mthun pa'i blo skye ba na de las bzlog pa'i ngo bo thams cad rang gi yul las rnam par gcod pas na phung po gnyis yin la ;
analyzed: rigs pa gzhan pa 'dis don gcig tu nges pa'i ngo bo dang rjes su mthun pa'i blo skye ba na de las bzlog pa'i ngo bo thams cad rang gi yul las rnam par gcod pas na phung po gnyis yin la ;
translated: By this other reasoning, when a cognition arises that is in accordance with the nature of the ascertainment of a single object, all things that are the opposite of that nature are excluded from its object, and thus there are two classes.

original: gsum pa'i rnam pa gzhan med par sgrub par byed pa na gzhan gang yang rung ba 'ga' zhig rnam par gcod do //
analyzed: gsum pa'i rnam pa gzhan med par sgrub par byed pa na gzhan gang yang rung ba 'ga' zhig rnam par gcod do //
translated: When one proves that there is no other aspect of the third, one excludes any other whatsoever.

original: rim dang rim ma yin pas rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa de bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: rim dang rim ma yin pas rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa de bshad pa yin no //
translated: The permanent and the impermanent, etc., are explained in order and out of order.

original: de lta na 'bras bu rim pa la rkyen dang lhan cig ma yin pa nyid kyi blo de dang / rim ma yin pa'i 'bras bu gzhan dang lhan cig pa yin pa de'i phyir tha dad par byed do //
analyzed: de lta na 'bras bu rim pa la rkyen dang lhan cig ma yin pa nyid kyi blo de dang / rim ma yin pa'i 'bras bu gzhan dang lhan cig pa yin pa de'i phyir tha dad par byed do //
translated: Thus, the cognition of the effect not being simultaneous with the condition, and the other effect not being simultaneous with the other, they are distinguished.

original: rim dang rim ma yin pa'i ngo bo de las gnyis su grub pas rnam pa gsum pa srid pa bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: rim dang rim ma yin pa'i ngo bo de las gnyis su grub pas rnam pa gsum pa srid pa bkag pa yin no //
translated: Since the two are established from that nature of order and disorder, a third possibility is excluded.

original: rim pa'i dngos pos tha dad pa'i 'bras bu skyed pa thams cad ni de dang gzhan rnam pa @307b gnyis su rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rim pa'i dngos pos tha dad pa'i 'bras bu skyed pa thams cad ni de dang gzhan rnam pa @307b gnyis su rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all effects that are produced by the nature of order are posited in two ways: as that and as other.

original: de ltar skye ba dang 'jig pa ni skad cig mar brjod do zhes bya ba rnam bar 'jog ba kho na'i dus su blos de las bzlog pa'i ngo bo sa ni rang gi yul la phan mi 'dogs pas de las gzhan pa nyid kyi rnam pa gzhan du
analyzed: de ltar skye ba dang 'jig pa ni skad cig mar brjod do zhes bya ba rnam bar 'jog ba kho na'i dus su blos de las bzlog pa'i ngo bo sa ni rang gi yul la phan mi 'dogs pas de las gzhan pa nyid kyi rnam pa gzhan du
translated: At the very time of positing this, the mind does not benefit its object by a nature opposite to that, so it is posited as a different aspect from that.

original: 'jog pa'i phyir rdzas gzhan med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jog pa'i phyir rdzas gzhan med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not a different substance.

original: de ltar na tshang ma gcig gi rgyu mtshan gyis ma 'dres par grub pa'i mjug bsdu ba bstan pa ni de ltar bas na zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de ltar na tshang ma gcig gi rgyu mtshan gyis ma 'dres par grub pa'i mjug bsdu ba bstan pa ni de ltar bas na zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Thus, to show the conclusion that the aggregates are established as unmixed due to the reason of being one, it says ‚Äúthus.‚Äù

original: de skad du bshad pa'i rim pas gcig tu so sor nges pa'i bdag nyid du dmigs pas de'i dmigs par bya ba de las gzhan pa gang yin pa de dang mtshungs par rung ba'i ngo bo de las bzlog pa ni de'i ngo bo ma tshang ba de'i bdag
analyzed: de skad du bshad pa'i rim pas gcig tu so sor nges pa'i bdag nyid du dmigs pas de'i dmigs par bya ba de las gzhan pa gang yin pa de dang mtshungs par rung ba'i ngo bo de las bzlog pa ni de'i ngo bo ma tshang ba de'i bdag
translated: By observing that which is ascertained as one through the process explained in that way, that which is observed is excluded from being the same as that which is suitable to have the same nature as that.

original: nyid rnam par gcod pa ste tha dad par byed pa'o //
analyzed: nyid rnam par gcod pa ste tha dad par byed pa'o //
translated: That is the incompleteness of its nature, the exclusion of its identity, the differentiation from that.

original: de'i dmigs par bya ba mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin gyi ngo bo gzhan du snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dmigs par bya ba mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin gyi ngo bo gzhan du snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nature of the object of that is not perceived, it appears as something else.

original: de bzhin du de'i rang gi yul de las gzhan pa'i bdag nyid med pa gtso bo yin par bstan pas rnam par gcod pa yin lam 'dres par sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du de'i rang gi yul de las gzhan pa'i bdag nyid med pa gtso bo yin par bstan pas rnam par gcod pa yin lam 'dres par sgrub par byed do //
translated: In the same way, the exclusion of the principal, which is not different from its own object, is established as mixed.

original: des na gang gi tshe 'di dag gzhan thams cad dang bye brag med par de la med par grub par 'gyur ro zhes gang la mngon par 'dod pa de'i tshe grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: des na gang gi tshe 'di dag gzhan thams cad dang bye brag med par de la med par grub par 'gyur ro zhes gang la mngon par 'dod pa de'i tshe grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, when these are established as not different from everything else, then it is an establishment of what is already established, as to what is intended.

original: gang gi phyir thams cad bye brag med par de dang rnam pa gcig pa'i blo de ma yin pa'i ngo bo ma tshang ba ni rang gi yul las rnam par bcad par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir thams cad bye brag med par de dang rnam pa gcig pa'i blo de ma yin pa'i ngo bo ma tshang ba ni rang gi yul las rnam par bcad par bya ba yin te /
translated: Because, without distinction, everything is of the same aspect as that, the cognition that is incomplete with regard to that nature is to be excluded from its own object,

original: gzhan gyi ngo bo thams cad de la mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo bo thams cad de la mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the nature of everything else does not appear in it.

original: yang na de'i yul dang dus dag tu bzlog pa'i ngo bo thams cad med par rnam par gcad par bya bar 'dod pa de mi rigs so zhes ston pa ni de'i yul dang dus dag tu gang la 'di nges ba na khams gsum po ma lus pa dang
analyzed: yang na de'i yul dang dus dag tu bzlog pa'i ngo bo thams cad med par rnam par gcad par bya bar 'dod pa de mi rigs so zhes ston pa ni de'i yul dang dus dag tu gang la 'di nges ba na khams gsum po ma lus pa dang
translated: Or else, it is not correct to assert that the negation of all the aspects of the object and time of that is to be negated.

original: / mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i don du dmigs par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: / mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i don du dmigs par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: In that case, when this is ascertained, the three realms are not left out, and the object is not observed as having a different characteristic.

original: de la dngos po gzhan thams cad dang mtshungs bar rung ba'i ngo bo 'am cig shos rnam par gcod pa dang dgag pa yin no //
analyzed: de la dngos po gzhan thams cad dang mtshungs bar rung ba'i ngo bo 'am cig shos rnam par gcod pa dang dgag pa yin no //
translated: In that case, the negation is the exclusion or negation of the nature that is suitable as the same as all other things.

original: rgyu gang gis de mtshungs par rung ba'i ngo bo de la mi snang ba'i bkag pa de las de'i ngo bo gcig tu nges pa'i ngo bo sa rtogs ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu gang gis de mtshungs par rung ba'i ngo bo de la mi snang ba'i bkag pa de las de'i ngo bo gcig tu nges pa'i ngo bo sa rtogs ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the cause, that which is suitable as the same as that does not appear, and from that negation, the ascertainment of the nature of that as one nature is not possible.

original: de med na mi 'byung ba ni de la rag las pa de'i dgag pa go bar byed pa yin pas @308a * //
analyzed: de med na mi 'byung ba ni de la rag las pa de'i dgag pa go bar byed pa yin pas @308a * //
translated: That which does not occur without that depends on that, and the negation of that is understood.

original: de rgyu ma yin pa dang / dmigs pa 'di rigs byar ma gyur pa de dang mtshungs par rung ba'i ngo bo ni srid pa'i phyir ji ltar med pa 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: de rgyu ma yin pa dang / dmigs pa 'di rigs byar ma gyur pa de dang mtshungs par rung ba'i ngo bo ni srid pa'i phyir ji ltar med pa 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: It is not a cause, and it is possible that the nature of the object that is not a type of cognition is similar to that. How could it be established as nonexistent?

original: de dag gi mjug bsdu ba ni de lta bas na de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de dag gi mjug bsdu ba ni de lta bas na de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The summary of those is stated in the line ‚ÄúTherefore, that which is not of the nature of that . . .‚Äù

original: de las bzlog pa'i ngo bo gzhan thams cad de'i rnam pa gcig pa yul dang ngus su yang sgrub par byed par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa'i ngo bo gzhan thams cad de'i rnam pa gcig pa yul dang ngus su yang sgrub par byed par mi 'gyur la /
translated: All entities that are the opposite of that are the same in aspect. They are not established as the object and the time of that.

original: de'i snang ba gang dang gang yul dang dus de dang de dag tu yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i snang ba gang dang gang yul dang dus de dang de dag tu yang 'gyur ro //
translated: And the appearance of that is also the object and the time of that.

original: ci dang 'dra zhe na /
analyzed: ci dang 'dra zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: ro dang gzugs la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ro dang gzugs la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like taste, form, and so on.

original: gzugs so sor snang ba'i shes pas de'i ngo bo dang 'dra ba'i ro rang gi yul las tha dad par byed pa yang de dang ma 'dres par sgrub par byed pas kyang de'i yul dang dus dag med par sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: gzugs so sor snang ba'i shes pas de'i ngo bo dang 'dra ba'i ro rang gi yul las tha dad par byed pa yang de dang ma 'dres par sgrub par byed pas kyang de'i yul dang dus dag med par sgrub par byed do //
translated: A consciousness to which form appears establishes the nature of that as different from its object, taste, and it also establishes that as undifferentiated from that. It also establishes that as not the object and the time of that.

original: des na yang thams cad dang mtshungs par mi rung ba'i gnas skabs kyang de la med par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: des na yang thams cad dang mtshungs par mi rung ba'i gnas skabs kyang de la med par 'gyur ram /
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that there is no occasion for the non-apprehension of all things.

original: dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa'i bye brag rnams kyang brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa'i bye brag rnams kyang brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: Nor should one say that the particulars that are the objects of apprehension are not expressed.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar de bas na ji skad bshad pa'i mi dmigs pa kho na las res 'ga' la la zhig tu 'ga' zhig dngos po med par 'grub bo //üîΩdmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa'i de dang mtshungs par rung ba'i ngo bo dmigs pa'i bdag nyid de lta bu'i ngo bos yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar de bas na ji skad bshad pa'i mi dmigs pa kho na las res 'ga' la la zhig tu 'ga' zhig dngos po med par 'grub bo // dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa'i de dang mtshungs par rung ba'i ngo bo dmigs pa'i bdag nyid de lta bu'i ngo bos yin gyi /
translated: Since it is so, therefore, non-apprehension alone, as explained, establishes the non-existence of something somewhere on some occasion.

original: spyi yis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: spyi yis ni ma yin no //
translated: It is the apprehension of an entity that is the same as the object of apprehension, that is, an entity of that kind, and not a universal.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i pha rol po'i tshad ma lnga po gang la dngos po'i ngo bo las skyes ba ni dngos po yod pa rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i pha rol po'i tshad ma lnga po gang la dngos po'i ngo bo las skyes ba ni dngos po yod pa rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: As it has been said, ‚ÄúThe five valid cognitions of the opponent arise from the entity itself, because they realize the existence of the entity.‚Äù

original: de la med pa'i tshad ma yin pa de ni dmigs pa'i rigs byar ma gyur pa'i tshang ma lnga po rab tu mi 'jug pas kyang de med par 'grub bo //
analyzed: de la med pa'i tshad ma yin pa de ni dmigs pa'i rigs byar ma gyur pa'i tshang ma lnga po rab tu mi 'jug pas kyang de med par 'grub bo //
translated: The valid knowledge that is the non-existence of that is established as the non-existence of that by the non-engagement of the five valid knowledges that are the type of observation.

original: yod kyang de ni rang bzhin gyis bskal ba la sogs pa la tshad ma lnga po 'jug pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod kyang de ni rang bzhin gyis bskal ba la sogs pa la tshad ma lnga po 'jug pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even if it exists, it is impossible for the five valid knowledges to engage a nature that is distant in time and so on.

original: des na de ltar zhar la byung ba rdzogs nas gang bshad pa de nyid gzhan gyis smras pa /
analyzed: des na de ltar zhar la byung ba rdzogs nas gang bshad pa de nyid gzhan gyis smras pa /
translated: Having thus completed the digression, now the text will explain the response of others to that.

original: gzhan yod pa de'i yul can gyi dmigs pas de med par cis na sgrub par mi byed ce na /
analyzed: gzhan yod pa de'i yul can gyi dmigs pas de med par cis na sgrub par mi byed ce na /
translated: If the object of the valid knowledge that is the existence of another is the non-existence of that, why does it not establish the non-existence of that?

original: de la gzhan yod pas de med pa'i rtags ni sun phyung nas de'i yul la gang la nye bar dmigs pa bsal ba ni gzhan yod pa'i yul can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la gzhan yod pas de med pa'i rtags ni sun phyung nas de'i yul la gang la nye bar dmigs pa bsal ba ni gzhan yod pa'i yul can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to that, the object of the valid knowledge that is the existence of another is refuted, and the object of the valid knowledge that is the existence of another is refuted.

original: gang gzhan yod pa'i yul can gyi dmigs @308b pas de med pa cis na sgrub par mi byed ces yang bzlas nas bshad pa ni des de med par sgrub par byed par kho bo cag 'dod pa kho na yin gyi ji skad bshad pa 'di rtags nyid duüîΩni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gzhan yod pa'i yul can gyi dmigs @308b pas de med pa cis na sgrub par mi byed ces yang bzlas nas bshad pa ni des de med par sgrub par byed par kho bo cag 'dod pa kho na yin gyi ji skad bshad pa 'di rtags nyid du ni ma yin no //
translated: This is explained again, but we do assert that it establishes the nonexistence of that. However, this explanation is not the reason itself.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gis de la gzhan yod ba'i yul can gyi dmigs pa gang yin pa dngos po med pa logs shig pa gzhan yod pa dang mtshungs pa'i phyir de ni gzhan yod pa'i yul yin pa dang de /
analyzed: gang gis de la gzhan yod ba'i yul can gyi dmigs pa gang yin pa dngos po med pa logs shig pa gzhan yod pa dang mtshungs pa'i phyir de ni gzhan yod pa'i yul yin pa dang de /
translated: The object of the observation of the existence of something else is a nonentity that is separate from the other. Because it is similar to the existence of something else, it is the object of the existence of something else.

original: de med pa 'ga' zhig tu 'du ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo'i 'brel pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de med pa 'ga' zhig tu 'du ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo'i 'brel pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: However, it does not have a relationship with the nature of being a collection and so on of the nonexistence of that.

original: tha mi dad par grub pa 'di yang mtshungs so zhes bstan pa ni rtags 'byung ba'i dus su zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: tha mi dad par grub pa 'di yang mtshungs so zhes bstan pa ni rtags 'byung ba'i dus su zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: This is also similar to the establishment of the nondifference.

original: gang dang gang gzhan yod pa'i yul can nye bar dmigs pa rtags su 'dod pa de dang des dben pa'i phyogs kyi rnam pa 'byung ba'i dus kho na ni rtog pa skye ba'i dus kho nar ro //
