analyzed: gang dang gang gzhan yod pa'i yul can nye bar dmigs pa rtags su 'dod pa de dang des dben pa'i phyogs kyi rnam pa 'byung ba'i dus kho na ni rtog pa skye ba'i dus kho nar ro //
translated: The time when the aspect of the part devoid of that which is other appears is the time when the conception arises.

original: de med par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the establishment of the non-existence of that.

original: de lta na der snang bas dben pa'i gzhan yod par snang ba'i blos rig pa nyid de med par rigs pa yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta na der snang bas dben pa'i gzhan yod par snang ba'i blos rig pa nyid de med par rigs pa yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the cognition of the existence of that which is other, which appears as devoid of the appearance of that, is itself the cognition of the non-existence of that.

original: 'di dag nyid sgrub pa ni gzhan na des dben pa yod par rtogs par bya ba gdod nas rtogs pa ni dus phyis de rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag nyid sgrub pa ni gzhan na des dben pa yod par rtogs par bya ba gdod nas rtogs pa ni dus phyis de rtogs pa'o //
translated: The proof of these very things is as follows: The cognition of the existence of that which is other, which is devoid of that, is the prior cognition of the non-existence of that.

original: gzhan yod par rtogs pa de med pa ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag rab tu bsgrubs nas 'brel pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad mas de med pa rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yod par rtogs pa de med pa ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag rab tu bsgrubs nas 'brel pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad mas de med pa rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The cognition of the existence of that which is other is not the cognition of the non-existence of that which is established by the proof of the forward and reverse pervasion.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then how is it that the valid cognition which establishes the relation establishes the non-existence of that?

original: de las gzhan pa des dben pa'i ngo bo rtogs pa kho na de'i zla bo med pa rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa des dben pa'i ngo bo rtogs pa kho na de'i zla bo med pa rtogs pa yin te /
translated: The other, which is the opposite of that, is the realization of the nature of the absence of the pot.

original: de nyid de med pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid de med pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is the realization of the absence of the pot, because it is the nature of the absence of the pot.

original: 'di ltar bum pa dang bcas pa'i phyogs dang ma 'dres pa'i ngo bo 'ba' zhig gi phyogs snang ba nyid bum pa med bar snang ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar bum pa dang bcas pa'i phyogs dang ma 'dres pa'i ngo bo 'ba' zhig gi phyogs snang ba nyid bum pa med bar snang ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the appearance of the place devoid of the pot, which is not mixed with the place with the pot, is the appearance of the absence of the pot.

original: 'di na bum pa med pa'am /
analyzed: 'di na bum pa med pa'am /
translated: Here, the absence of the pot,

original: bum pa 'di dang ldan pa ma yin te bum pa dad bcas pa la gzhan yin dang / don la ni tha dad pa ci yang med do //
analyzed: bum pa 'di dang ldan pa ma yin te bum pa dad bcas pa la gzhan yin dang / don la ni tha dad pa ci yang med do //
translated: or the place not endowed with this pot, is not different from the place with the pot, because there is no difference in the object.

original: des na bum pa dang bcas pa las gzhan pa 'ba' zhig pa'i phyogs snang ba nyid bum pa med par snang ba yin pa'i phyir bum pa 'di na med do zhes shes pa ni gzung ba la 'dzin pas dran pa yin no //
analyzed: des na bum pa dang bcas pa las gzhan pa 'ba' zhig pa'i phyogs snang ba nyid bum pa med par snang ba yin pa'i phyir bum pa 'di na med do zhes shes pa ni gzung ba la 'dzin pas dran pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the appearance of the place devoid of the pot, which is other than the place with the pot, is the appearance of the absence of the pot. Thus, the cognition ‚ÄúThe pot does not exist here‚Äù is the memory of the object through the apprehension of the subject.

original: gal te ji ltar shes she na mthong ba can du rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid kyis bar du @309a * //
analyzed: gal te ji ltar shes she na mthong ba can du rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid kyis bar du @309a * //
translated: If it is asked how it is known, it is known by the characteristic of establishing concomitance and reversal.

original: chod pa med par 'di na bum pas dben pa'i phyogs kyi ngo bo yod do //
analyzed: chod pa med par 'di na bum pas dben pa'i phyogs kyi ngo bo yod do //
translated: The absence of a pot here is the nature of the place.

original: 'di na bum ba'i dngos po med de zhes phye nas rnam par rtog pa nyid kyis shes par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di na bum ba'i dngos po med de zhes phye nas rnam par rtog pa nyid kyis shes par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The non-existence of a pot here is distinguished and known by conceptualization.

original: des na 'di na yod do zhes bya ba rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa med do //
analyzed: des na 'di na yod do zhes bya ba rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa med do //
translated: Therefore, the statement it exists here does not follow concomitance and reversal.

original: gang yang / gzhan yod pa'i yul dmigs pa de med par sgrub pa ma yin te dpe ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang yang / gzhan yod pa'i yul dmigs pa de med par sgrub pa ma yin te dpe ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Also, the observation of an object that exists elsewhere does not establish its non-existence, because the example is not established.

original: 'di nyid ldog pa'i sgo nas bstan pa ni de ni gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di nyid ldog pa'i sgo nas bstan pa ni de ni gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: This is taught by way of reversal, stating what is that? and so on.

original: gal te 'di la yang rjes su 'gro ba yod do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'di la yang rjes su 'gro ba yod do zhe na /
translated: If it is asked whether there is also concomitance here,

original: 'di skad du yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'di skad du yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: it is stated in this way and so on.

original: ci'i phyir bstan par mi nus she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bstan par mi nus she na /
translated: Why is it not possible to teach that?

original: de dmigs pa gcig pu gzhan ma yin pa dang tshogs pa gcig par yod pa gang dmigs pa khyad par gyi ngo bo de ni gzhan gang na yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dmigs pa gcig pu gzhan ma yin pa dang tshogs pa gcig par yod pa gang dmigs pa khyad par gyi ngo bo de ni gzhan gang na yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that which is observed as the nature of the difference of the observed object does not exist anywhere else, as a single observed object that is not different.

original: 'on te des dben par nye bar dmigs pa thun mong ba'i gtan tshigs su brjod pa yin /
analyzed: 'on te des dben par nye bar dmigs pa thun mong ba'i gtan tshigs su brjod pa yin /
translated: But if you say that the reason is stated as the observation of the mere absence of that,

original: gang dang gang na bum pas dben pa'i sa gzhi dmigs pa de dang de na bum pa med de dper na sngar nyams su myong ba'i bum pas dben pa'i phyogs bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: gang dang gang na bum pas dben pa'i sa gzhi dmigs pa de dang de na bum pa med de dper na sngar nyams su myong ba'i bum pas dben pa'i phyogs bzhin no zhe na /
translated: then in whatever place the ground is observed to be devoid of a pot, a pot does not exist there, just as in a place previously experienced as devoid of a pot.

original: spyi rab tu bstan pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: spyi rab tu bstan pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The term ‚Äúteaching of the universal‚Äù is stated.

original: spyi rab tu bstan par byed pa'i dpe la yang sngar nyams su myong zin pa'i bum pas dben pa'i sa phyogs na bum pa med par sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma mngon sum la sogs pa gzhan ni gzhan yod pa'i yul la dmigs pa ni med do //
analyzed: spyi rab tu bstan par byed pa'i dpe la yang sngar nyams su myong zin pa'i bum pas dben pa'i sa phyogs na bum pa med par sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma mngon sum la sogs pa gzhan ni gzhan yod pa'i yul la dmigs pa ni med do //
translated: In the example that teaches the universal, there is no other valid knowledge such as direct perception that proves that a pot does not exist in a place devoid of a pot previously experienced, because it observes the object of the existence of another.

original: 'on kyang de kho na gzhan yod pa dmigs pa yin no //üîΩbsgrub par bya ba'i chos de med pa sgrub par byed pa de yang ji lta ba bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la de med par sgrub pa ni dpe la ltos pa yin na /
analyzed: 'on kyang de kho na gzhan yod pa dmigs pa yin no // bsgrub par bya ba'i chos de med pa sgrub par byed pa de yang ji lta ba bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la de med par sgrub pa ni dpe la ltos pa yin na /
translated: But it is the existence of something else that is perceived.

original: dpe yang de bzhin du gzhan de la yang ltos na ni thug pa med pa dang / dpe yang thug pa med pa'i phyir thams cad la de med par rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dpe yang de bzhin du gzhan de la yang ltos na ni thug pa med pa dang / dpe yang thug pa med pa'i phyir thams cad la de med par rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: And if the proof of the nonexistence of the probandum depends on the example, and if the example also depends on something else, then there is an infinite regress, and the nonexistence of the probandum is not established in any case, because the example is not established.

original: gang gi phyir de bas na rtags gang las kyang ni de las gzhan yod yod pa dmigs pa nyid las so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de bas na rtags gang las kyang ni de las gzhan yod yod pa dmigs pa nyid las so //
translated: Therefore, the existence of something else is perceived from any probative reason.

original: de med par mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: de med par mi 'grub bo //
translated: And the nonexistence of the probandum is not established.

original: gang gi tshe de las gzhan yod pa las de med par sgrub par mi byed do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de las gzhan yod pa las de med par sgrub par mi byed do //
translated: When the existence of something else does not establish the nonexistence of the probandum,

original: yang cis rtags kyis sgrub par byed pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang cis rtags kyis sgrub par byed pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: why is it not established by the probative reason?

original: mngon sum gyi zhes bya ba @309b smos te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi zhes bya ba @309b smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúBy perception.‚Äù

original: mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid brjod par 'dod pa'i dmigs pa gzhan pa mi dmigs ba yin pa'i phyir de'i mtshan nyid mi dmigs pas grub ste /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid brjod par 'dod pa'i dmigs pa gzhan pa mi dmigs ba yin pa'i phyir de'i mtshan nyid mi dmigs pas grub ste /
translated: The definition of perception is the non-apprehension of another object that is desired to be expressed, because it is established by the non-apprehension of its definition.

original: nyams su myong ba'i tha snyad sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i tha snyad sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it establishes the convention of experience.

original: las la gnas pa'i bya ba la ltos nas de gzhan pa yod pa mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las la gnas pa'i bya ba la ltos nas de gzhan pa yod pa mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the existence of another object in relation to the action that is based on the object is the nature of non-apprehension.

original: yang cis na 'di med pa'i tha snyad sgrub ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang cis na 'di med pa'i tha snyad sgrub ba yin zhe na /
translated: Why then is it that this establishes the convention of non-existence?

original: bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pa las te gang yul rtogs zin nas yul can la rmongs pa dran pa nyid kyis de med pa'i tha snyad du byed do //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pa las te gang yul rtogs zin nas yul can la rmongs pa dran pa nyid kyis de med pa'i tha snyad du byed do //
translated: From the realization of the probandum. When the object has already been cognized, the subject is confused. Memory itself makes the convention of non-existence.

original: mngon sum gyi rgyu mtshan kho na mi dmigs pa'i rtags ma yin no zhes gzhan legs par dpyad zin pas 'dir zhar la 'ongs pas chog go //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi rgyu mtshan kho na mi dmigs pa'i rtags ma yin no zhes gzhan legs par dpyad zin pas 'dir zhar la 'ongs pas chog go //
translated: The reason of non-apprehension is not just the sign of the non-existence of the object of perception. Since this has been well analyzed by others, it is enough to stop this digression here.

original: des na mi dmigs pa'i gtan tshigs kyi log bar rtogs pa ma lus ba bsal nas rang gi ngo bo rnam par gzhag pa'i dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na mi dmigs pa'i gtan tshigs kyi log bar rtogs pa ma lus ba bsal nas rang gi ngo bo rnam par gzhag pa'i dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach the classification of the establishment of its own nature, having eliminated all incorrect understandings of the reason of non-apprehension,

original: de 'dir ji skad bshad pa'i mi dmigs pa gsum ste zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de 'dir ji skad bshad pa'i mi dmigs pa gsum ste zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it says, ‚ÄúHere, it is the three types of non-apprehension as they have been explained.‚Äù

original: ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: How is it so?

original: sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma de yis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po grub bar gyur na rgyu mi dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma de yis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po grub bar gyur na rgyu mi dmigs pa yin no //
translated: When the valid cognition that establishes the thing is established, it is the non-apprehension of the cause.

original: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na dngos po med par grub pa'o //
analyzed: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na dngos po med par grub pa'o //
translated: What kind of thing? It is the establishment of the non-existence of the thing.

original: de bzhin du khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po grub pa yod na de sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma'i stobs kyis gzhan dngos po med par sgrub pa'i khyad par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po grub pa yod na de sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma'i stobs kyis gzhan dngos po med par sgrub pa'i khyad par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: Similarly, when the thing that is the pervaded and the pervader is established, it is the non-apprehension of the differentiator that establishes the other, the non-existence of the thing, by the power of the valid cognition that establishes it.

original: zhar la ji skad bshad pa'i rang bzhin mi dmigs par yang grub pas de ltar mi dmigs pa rnam pa gsum yin no //
analyzed: zhar la ji skad bshad pa'i rang bzhin mi dmigs par yang grub pas de ltar mi dmigs pa rnam pa gsum yin no //
translated: Since the nature that is mentioned as a non-apprehension is also established, there are these three types of non-apprehension.

original: yang ji ltar khyab par byed pa dag gis med pa'i tha snyad du 'grub /
analyzed: yang ji ltar khyab par byed pa dag gis med pa'i tha snyad du 'grub /
translated: Moreover, how do the cause and the pervader establish the term non-existent?

original: gang las de dag med par 'grub pa smos shig che na /
analyzed: gang las de dag med par 'grub pa smos shig che na /
translated: What is the reason that they establish non-existence?

original: de la rgyu dang khyab par dag gis kyang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de la rgyu dang khyab par dag gis kyang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In response to that, it is said, ‚ÄúThe cause and the pervader also . . .

original: 'ba' zhig ba dang yin pa dngos su mid pa'i tha snyad sgrub pa ma yin gyi rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i ngo bos med pa'i tha snyad 'grub po //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig ba dang yin pa dngos su mid pa'i tha snyad sgrub pa ma yin gyi rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i ngo bos med pa'i tha snyad 'grub po //
translated: ‚Äù It is not that the term non-existent is established by the mere absence of the object and the absence of the thing itself, but rather the term non-existent is established by the nature of the non-observation of the object.

original: gzhan des dben pa yod par 'grub pa gang yin pa de nyid med pa'i tha snyad 'grub pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir de skad du brjod do //
analyzed: gzhan des dben pa yod par 'grub pa gang yin pa de nyid med pa'i tha snyad 'grub pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir de skad du brjod do //
translated: The reason that it is said that the cause and the pervader also establish the term non-existent is that the mere existence of something else that is devoid of that is the reason that the term non-existent is established.

original: rgyu dang khyab par byed pa med pa de ni de ltar grub pa ni gzhan yod pa mngon sum gyi ngo bos grub na dngos po med par 'grub la la dngos po med pa'i tha snyad kyang @310a * //
analyzed: rgyu dang khyab par byed pa med pa de ni de ltar grub pa ni gzhan yod pa mngon sum gyi ngo bos grub na dngos po med par 'grub la la dngos po med pa'i tha snyad kyang @310a * //
translated: The non-existence of the cause and the pervader is established in that way. If the existence of something else is established by the nature of direct perception, then the non-existence of the thing itself is established.

original: 'grub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'grub pa yin no //
translated: The term non-existent is also established.

original: 'bras bu dang khyab par bya ba dag dgag ba ni gang gi tshe de dag dang mi mthun pa'i yul gyi khyad par de'i mi dmigs par mi 'grub pa de'i tshe dngos po med ba'am dngos po med pa'i tha snyad sgrub par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang khyab par bya ba dag dgag ba ni gang gi tshe de dag dang mi mthun pa'i yul gyi khyad par de'i mi dmigs par mi 'grub pa de'i tshe dngos po med ba'am dngos po med pa'i tha snyad sgrub par byed pa yin te /
translated: The refutation of the effect and the pervader is this: when the non-apprehension of those is not established as the specific object that is incompatible with them, then it establishes the non-existence of a thing or the expression of non-existence.

original: 'am gyi sgra ni bsdu ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'am gyi sgra ni bsdu ba'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúor‚Äù has the sense of ‚Äúand.‚Äù

original: ci 'on te rang bzhin mi dmigs pas kyang med par bsgrub par bya ba'i rtags su 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: ci 'on te rang bzhin mi dmigs pas kyang med par bsgrub par bya ba'i rtags su 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: But is it the case that the non-apprehension of intrinsic reality is a reason that establishes non-existence?

original: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe non-apprehension of intrinsic reality,‚Äù and so on.

original: tha snyad kho na med pa yang ma yin te de mngon sum gyis grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha snyad kho na med pa yang ma yin te de mngon sum gyis grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not just the absence of a convention, because that is established by direct perception.

original: 'dir gzhan gyis dogs pa'i skabs su brjod pa ni gal te rgyu dang khyab par byed pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'dir gzhan gyis dogs pa'i skabs su brjod pa ni gal te rgyu dang khyab par byed pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Here, in the context of the opponent‚Äôs qualm, he says, ‚ÄúIf the cause and the pervader,‚Äù and so on.

original: med pa'i tha snyad du grub pa gang dang gang yin pa de med pa yin na gang gis de gzhan rgyu dang khyab par byed pas dben pa'i mngon sum gyi bdag nyid kyis grub ba dang / de'i ngo bo dmigs pas gzhan 'bras bu dang khyab par bya ba dang dngos po med pa dang med pa'i tha snyad sgrub par byed do //üîΩde yang gzhan yod pa dmigs pas de dag gi rgyu dang khyab par byed pa dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa kho na yod pas med pa'i tha snyad du sgrub par byed kyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes 'dod par gyur na /
analyzed: med pa'i tha snyad du grub pa gang dang gang yin pa de med pa yin na gang gis de gzhan rgyu dang khyab par byed pas dben pa'i mngon sum gyi bdag nyid kyis grub ba dang / de'i ngo bo dmigs pas gzhan 'bras bu dang khyab par bya ba dang dngos po med pa dang med pa'i tha snyad sgrub par byed do // de yang gzhan yod pa dmigs pas de dag gi rgyu dang khyab par byed pa dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa kho na yod pas med pa'i tha snyad du sgrub par byed kyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes 'dod par gyur na /
translated: If the non-existence of something is established by the term non-existence, then the existence of that which is devoid of other causes and pervading entities is established by the nature of direct perception, and by observing its nature, the existence of other effects and pervaded entities and the term non-existence are established.

original: ji ltar de dag rgyu dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa lkog tu gyur pa'i don gyi yul la sbyor ba yin /
analyzed: ji ltar de dag rgyu dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa lkog tu gyur pa'i don gyi yul la sbyor ba yin /
translated: If it is accepted that the existence of something else is established by observing it, and that the existence of its cause and pervading entity is established by the observed object, then how can the non-observation of its cause and pervading entity be applied to a hidden object?

original: gang gi tshe 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi ldog pa'i sbyor ba byed pa ni gang dang gang na me med pa de dang de na du ba yang med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi ldog pa'i sbyor ba byed pa ni gang dang gang na me med pa de dang de na du ba yang med pa de bzhin du /
translated: When the reverse pervasion of the effect and nature reasonings is stated, it is stated in the form ‚ÄúWhere there is no fire, there is no smoke.‚Äù

original: gang dang gang na shing med pa'am /
analyzed: gang dang gang na shing med pa'am /
translated: Similarly, ‚ÄúWhere there is no tree, there is no oak tree.‚ÄùüîΩOr, ‚ÄúWhere there is no momentariness, there is no existence.‚Äù

original: skad cig ma med pa de dang de na shing sha pa'am yod pa med do zhes ma lus pa'i don yongs su bzung nas ldog pa'i sbyor bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: skad cig ma med pa de dang de na shing sha pa'am yod pa med do zhes ma lus pa'i don yongs su bzung nas ldog pa'i sbyor bar 'gyur na /
translated: When the reverse pervasion is stated in this way, it is stated in such a way that it includes all objects.

original: med dang shing dang skad cig ma nyid des dben pa'i don thams cad mngon sum ma yin pa de'i phyir na ji ltar des dben pa'i dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mi dmigs pa'i spyod pa nyid kyis dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa ni mi 'gyur po //
analyzed: med dang shing dang skad cig ma nyid des dben pa'i don thams cad mngon sum ma yin pa de'i phyir na ji ltar des dben pa'i dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mi dmigs pa'i spyod pa nyid kyis dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa ni mi 'gyur po //
translated: But since all objects devoid of fire, trees, and momentariness are not directly perceptible, how can the mere nonobservation of an object characterized by the absence of those three be a correct sign?

original: de lta na ni ltar ma lus pa bsdoms nas khyab par rgyu dang khyab pa dang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi ldog pa grub pa yin /
analyzed: de lta na ni ltar ma lus pa bsdoms nas khyab par rgyu dang khyab pa dang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi ldog pa grub pa yin /
translated: In this way, the reverse pervasion of the effect, nature, and nonobservation as the opposite of the observed object signs is established by the inclusion of all objects.

original: yang na de grub na ji ltar @310b 'dis go bar byed pa yin /
analyzed: yang na de grub na ji ltar @310b 'dis go bar byed pa yin /
translated: Or, if it is established, how does it cause understanding?

original: de'i phyir la lar ma mthong ba tsam las ldog pa dang de bzhin du mthong ba tsam las rjes su 'gro bar 'dod par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir la lar ma mthong ba tsam las ldog pa dang de bzhin du mthong ba tsam las rjes su 'gro bar 'dod par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, in some cases, one should assert that mere non-observation is the reverse pervasion and mere observation is the forward pervasion.

original: de lta na yang 'brel pa brjod pa don med do zhes gzhan dag sems na /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'brel pa brjod pa don med do zhes gzhan dag sems na /
translated: If others think that even so, stating the relation is pointless,

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas rtags ma nges pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas rtags ma nges pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: the proponent of tenets states, ‚ÄúThe reason is indefinite.‚Äù

original: lkog tu gyur pa'i don la rgyu dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba'i ldog pa bstan pa'i dus su tshad mas ma yin la rgyu dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'i tshad mar gyur pa kho nas sbyor ba ma yin te /
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa'i don la rgyu dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba'i ldog pa bstan pa'i dus su tshad mas ma yin la rgyu dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'i tshad mar gyur pa kho nas sbyor ba ma yin te /
translated: When teaching the reverse pervasion of the proof of non-observation of a cause or a pervader, it is not the case that the reason is only a valid cognition that is the non-observation of a cause or a pervader.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rgyu dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'i rtags kyi mtshan nyid ni de med pa'i mtshan nyid la ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'i rtags kyi mtshan nyid ni de med pa'i mtshan nyid la ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The definition of a reason that is the non-observation of a cause or a pervader is indefinite with regard to the definition of its absence.

original: de mi dmigs pa'i ngo bi la the tshom za ba'i phyir na de med pa nyid la yang the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mi dmigs pa'i ngo bi la the tshom za ba'i phyir na de med pa nyid la yang the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of doubting the entity of non-apprehension, one also doubts the non-existence of that.

original: de lta na ji ltar de'i tshe de dag la sbyor bar 'dod pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na ji ltar de'i tshe de dag la sbyor bar 'dod pa yin zhe na /
translated: In that case, how can one desire to apply them at that time?

original: rgyu dang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rgyu dang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The reason is stated:

original: rgyu dang khyab par byed pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po sgrub par byed pa dang khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa sgrub par byed pa sngar bshad pa'i de las byung ba dang de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pas grub par byed
analyzed: rgyu dang khyab par byed pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po sgrub par byed pa dang khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa sgrub par byed pa sngar bshad pa'i de las byung ba dang de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pas grub par byed
translated: The reason and the pervader are the reason and effect entity proof, and the pervaded and pervader proof, which were previously explained. The relation is established by the relation of origination from that and the relation of that nature.

original: pas 'brel pa grub pa yin na /
analyzed: pas 'brel pa grub pa yin na /
translated: Therefore, the relation is established.

original: gal te med pa gang dang gang la med par 'gyur bas gzhan dang 'bras bu dang khya par bya ba gdon mi za bar med par nges so //
analyzed: gal te med pa gang dang gang la med par 'gyur bas gzhan dang 'bras bu dang khya par bya ba gdon mi za bar med par nges so //
translated: If it is non-existent, then whatever is non-existent, the other, the effect, and the pervaded are certainly ascertained as non-existent.

original: de lta ma yin na ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / rang bzhin med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / rang bzhin med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were not so, it would follow that it is not so, and it would follow that it has no intrinsic nature.

original: de'i sgo nas 'brel pa grub par byed pa'i tshad mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i sgo nas 'brel pa grub par byed pa'i tshad mar 'gyur ro //
translated: It is a valid cognition that establishes the connection by means of that.

original: ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is it so?

original: 'dir de'i don bstan pa'i phyir rgyu dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa 'di rab tu sbyor ba 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: 'dir de'i don bstan pa'i phyir rgyu dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa 'di rab tu sbyor ba 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: Here, in order to show its meaning, it is only the non-observation of the cause and the pervader that is applied.

original: gang la mthong ba dang ma mthong ba'i stobs kyis sgrub pa ni gcig mthong ba na gzhan mthong la /
analyzed: gang la mthong ba dang ma mthong ba'i stobs kyis sgrub pa ni gcig mthong ba na gzhan mthong la /
translated: Where establishment by the power of seeing and not seeing is that when one is seen, the other is seen,

original: ma mthong ba nyid na mi mthong ba de nyid la de yod pa dang med pa nyid du 'gyur na ci'i phyir thams cad la 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: ma mthong ba nyid na mi mthong ba de nyid la de yod pa dang med pa nyid du 'gyur na ci'i phyir thams cad la 'gyur ba yin /
translated: and when not seen, it is not seen, then it would be existent and non-existent in that itself. Why would it be so in everything?

original: 'brel pa med pa'i bdag nyid ba lang dang rta la sogs pa rnams la lar de bzhin du yod par mthong yang thams cad la de bzhin du yod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa'i bdag nyid ba lang dang rta la sogs pa rnams la lar de bzhin du yod par mthong yang thams cad la de bzhin du yod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In things that are unrelated by nature, like cows and horses, etc., even though it is seen to exist in some places in that way, it does not exist in everything in that way.

original: skyes bus kyang thams cad kyi tshe 'ga' @311a * //
analyzed: skyes bus kyang thams cad kyi tshe 'ga' @311a * //
translated: And also with regard to persons, it is not the case that at all times, from the existence and nonexistence of something, the existence and nonexistence of something else is seen, as in the case of desire.

original: zhig tu gcig yod pa dang med pa dag las gzhan yod pa dang med pa mthong ba ni 'dod rgyal ba bzhin du mi slu ba ma yin 'brel pa med do //
analyzed: zhig tu gcig yod pa dang med pa dag las gzhan yod pa dang med pa mthong ba ni 'dod rgyal ba bzhin du mi slu ba ma yin 'brel pa med do //
translated: There is no connection.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: yul la sogs pa'i khyad par las //
analyzed: yul la sogs pa'i khyad par las //
translated: From the difference of object and so on,

original: rdzas la nus pa tha dad snang //üîΩde la gcig mtha' gzhan la ni //
analyzed: rdzas la nus pa tha dad snang // de la gcig mtha' gzhan la ni //
translated: the potency of the substance appears different.üîΩIn that, it is not reasonable that the end of one

original: de 'byung nges par rigs ma yin //
analyzed: de 'byung nges par rigs ma yin //
translated: is certain in the other.

original: zhes bya ba bshad de //
analyzed: zhes bya ba bshad de //
translated: This is explained.

original: de'i phyir gdon mi za bar 'brel pa las bsgrub par bya ba sgrub par byed par khas blang par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gdon mi za bar 'brel pa las bsgrub par bya ba sgrub par byed par khas blang par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one must certainly accept that the proof proves the probandum from a connection.

original: de nyid kyis rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gi sbyor ba bstan pa dang / 'di nyid kyis bstan pa med par khyab ba bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyis rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gi sbyor ba bstan pa dang / 'di nyid kyis bstan pa med par khyab ba bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By that very fact, the application of positive and negative concomitance is shown, and by this very fact, it is shown that pervasion cannot be shown without teaching.

original: gang dang gang na zhes bya ba ma lus pa'i don yongs su bzung nas khyab pa ni 'brel pa tshad mas grub par gyur na gdon mi za ba yin te /
analyzed: gang dang gang na zhes bya ba ma lus pa'i don yongs su bzung nas khyab pa ni 'brel pa tshad mas grub par gyur na gdon mi za ba yin te /
translated: If the pervasion is established by a valid cognition that comprehends the meaning of the entire subject, then it is certain.

original: gang dang gang na 'bras bu yod pa de dang de na rgyu yod pa dang / gang dang gang na de med pa den 'bras bu yang med pa yin gyi de lta ma yin na rgyu med kyang 'bras bu 'byung na ni rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang dang gang na 'bras bu yod pa de dang de na rgyu yod pa dang / gang dang gang na de med pa den 'bras bu yang med pa yin gyi de lta ma yin na rgyu med kyang 'bras bu 'byung na ni rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Wherever there is an effect, there is a cause; and wherever there is no cause, there is no effect. Otherwise, if an effect arose without a cause, it would be causeless.

original: des na rtag tu yod pa dang med pa la sogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na rtag tu yod pa dang med pa la sogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it would follow that it would always exist or not exist, and so on.

original: de bzhin du gang dang gang la gang gi rang bzhin yin pa de dang de la de'i rang bzhin yin gyi de lta ma yin na bdag nyid med par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: de bzhin du gang dang gang la gang gi rang bzhin yin pa de dang de la de'i rang bzhin yin gyi de lta ma yin na bdag nyid med par 'gyur bas so //
translated: Similarly, wherever there is the nature of something, there is that nature; and wherever there is not that nature, there is not that. Otherwise, it would be without a nature.

original: khyab pa nyid dang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog ba bstan pa ni 'brel pas khyab pa yin na nus kyi gzhan du na ma yin no zhes snga ma nyid du rgyu cher bstan zin te //
analyzed: khyab pa nyid dang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog ba bstan pa ni 'brel pas khyab pa yin na nus kyi gzhan du na ma yin no zhes snga ma nyid du rgyu cher bstan zin te //
translated: The demonstration of pervasion and concomitance is related to the pervasion by the reason, but not otherwise. This has been extensively explained above.

original: de ltar 'bras bu dang rang bzhin dang mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kho na'i phyogs kyi chos 'di dag gi rgyu sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma yod par gyur pas rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog par yod par gyur pa nyid yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin
analyzed: de ltar 'bras bu dang rang bzhin dang mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kho na'i phyogs kyi chos 'di dag gi rgyu sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma yod par gyur pas rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog par yod par gyur pa nyid yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin
translated: Thus, these properties of the subject that are characterized by effect, nature, and non-apprehension are established by the valid cognition that proves the reason, and they exist in terms of concomitance and non-concomitance, but not otherwise.

original: no zhes bstan pa'i mjug bsdu ba ni de lta bas na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: no zhes bstan pa'i mjug bsdu ba ni de lta bas na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The conclusion is stated with Therefore...

original: rang bzhin dang 'bras bu dang mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyogs kyi chos 'di dang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang ldan pa yin pas 'brel pa yod par gyur pa 'di dag nyid kyi rang bzhin dang 'bras bu dang mi dmigs pa'i mtshan gzhi yin
analyzed: rang bzhin dang 'bras bu dang mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyogs kyi chos 'di dang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang ldan pa yin pas 'brel pa yod par gyur pa 'di dag nyid kyi rang bzhin dang 'bras bu dang mi dmigs pa'i mtshan gzhi yin
translated: These properties of the subject that are characterized by nature, effect, and non-apprehension are related to concomitance and non-concomitance, and therefore they alone are the instances of nature, effect, and non-apprehension.

original: no // gang gi phyir de yang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog dang ldan pa'i 'brel pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma yod par gyur par rigs @311b pa bshad zin pa yin pa de'i phyir de'i chas khyab pa ste /
analyzed: no // gang gi phyir de yang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog dang ldan pa'i 'brel pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma yod par gyur par rigs @311b pa bshad zin pa yin pa de'i phyir de'i chas khyab pa ste /
translated: Because it has been explained that the valid cognition that establishes the relation of invariable concomitance exists, therefore, it is ascertained by the power of ascertaining the positive and negative concomitance.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges pa'i dbang gis de'i chas khyab pa nges pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges pa'i dbang gis de'i chas khyab pa nges pa yin no //
translated: The so-called pervasion by the mode of the probandum is ascertained by the power of ascertaining the positive and negative concomitance.

original: sngar ji skad du bshad pa'i de'i chas khyab pa zhes brjod pas mtshan nyid gsum dang tshul gsum dang rnam pa can gyi gtan tshigs go par byed pa yin gyi mtshan nyid gzhan ni med de /
analyzed: sngar ji skad du bshad pa'i de'i chas khyab pa zhes brjod pas mtshan nyid gsum dang tshul gsum dang rnam pa can gyi gtan tshigs go par byed pa yin gyi mtshan nyid gzhan ni med de /
translated: As previously explained, the term ‚Äúpervasion by the mode of the probandum‚Äù indicates the reason that has the three characteristics and the three modes, but there is no other characteristic.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gsum yod pa las gzhan pa ni don med pas so //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gsum yod pa las gzhan pa ni don med pas so //
translated: Because apart from the existence of the three modes as explained, there is no other meaning.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i tshul med na tshul gzhan brtags kyang ma 'khrul pa'i go bar byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i tshul med na tshul gzhan brtags kyang ma 'khrul pa'i go bar byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even if another mode is imagined when the explained modes do not exist, it is not a nonerroneous means of understanding.

original: de'i phyir tshul gsum po kho na can gyi rtags rnam pa gsum po kho na go bar byed pa yin gyi mtshan nyid gzhan gyis ma yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshul gsum po kho na can gyi rtags rnam pa gsum po kho na go bar byed pa yin gyi mtshan nyid gzhan gyis ma yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: Therefore, the three modes alone are the three characteristics that cause understanding, not any other characteristics.

original: rang gis bsgrub par bya ba la mi 'khrul pa'i phyir ro zhes mtshan nyid gsum kho na rang gis bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la mi 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gis bsgrub par bya ba la mi 'khrul pa'i phyir ro zhes mtshan nyid gsum kho na rang gis bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la mi 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is nonerroneous with regard to its own probandum. The three characteristics are nonerroneous with regard to the property to be established.

original: rang gis bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la mi 'khrul pa nyid go bar byed pa yin pas tshul gzhan brtags pa don med de /
analyzed: rang gis bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la mi 'khrul pa nyid go bar byed pa yin pas tshul gzhan brtags pa don med de /
translated: Because nonerroneous with regard to its own probandum is what causes understanding. Therefore it is pointless to posit other characteristics.

original: 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i tshul gzhan brtags na yang rang gis sgrub par bya ba'i chos la 'khrul pa des na 'dir rnam gsum nyid ces bya ba mtshan nyid gsum kho na'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i tshul gzhan brtags na yang rang gis sgrub par bya ba'i chos la 'khrul pa des na 'dir rnam gsum nyid ces bya ba mtshan nyid gsum kho na'o //
translated: Even if one posits other modes that are the reasons for the relation of following and reversing, they are erroneous with regard to the property to be established. Therefore, here, the three modes alone are the three characteristics.

original: gtan tshigs de ni med na mi 'byung ba yin pas rang gis bsgrub par bya ba la mi 'khrul pa'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs de ni med na mi 'byung ba yin pas rang gis bsgrub par bya ba la mi 'khrul pa'o //
translated: The reason is a necessary relation, and so it is nonerroneous with regard to what it proves.

original: nges ba ni gdon mi za bar yod par gyur pa'i 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan no //
analyzed: nges ba ni gdon mi za bar yod par gyur pa'i 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan no //
translated: Certainty is the reason for the relation that must exist.

original: de'i chas khyab par khas blangs pa nyid tshul gzhan du brtags pa yang gtan tshigs ltar snang de las gzhan no //
analyzed: de'i chas khyab par khas blangs pa nyid tshul gzhan du brtags pa yang gtan tshigs ltar snang de las gzhan no //
translated: The mere assertion of pervasion by a part of it is a fallacious reason, which is different from those.

original: gtan tshigs thigs pa'i 'brel pa bram ze aa tsa tas rnam par sbyar ba las mi dmigs pa'i gtan tshigs bshad pa ste gsum pa'o /
analyzed: gtan tshigs thigs pa'i 'brel pa bram ze aa tsa tas rnam par sbyar ba las mi dmigs pa'i gtan tshigs bshad pa ste gsum pa'o /
translated: This concludes the explanation of the reason of nonobservation, the third chapter of the Treatise on Validating Reason.

original: // / ji skad bshad pa'i mtshan nyid gsum las gzhan pa'i tshul gzhan gang yang rung par brtags pa ni gtan tshigs ltar snang ba'o //
analyzed: // / ji skad bshad pa'i mtshan nyid gsum las gzhan pa'i tshul gzhan gang yang rung par brtags pa ni gtan tshigs ltar snang ba'o //
translated: A reason that is different from the three characteristics as they have been explained is a fallacious reason.

original: med na mi 'byung ba'i rnag gi bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la mi 'khrul pa de rnams la med par bstan pa ni ji skad bshad pa'i mtshan nyid gsum kho na las gzhan ni mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir de la gzhan dag @312a * //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba'i rnag gi bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la mi 'khrul pa de rnams la med par bstan pa ni ji skad bshad pa'i mtshan nyid gsum kho na las gzhan ni mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir de la gzhan dag @312a * //
translated: The teaching that those which are non-erroneous with regard to the property to be established, the blood, and so on, are non-existent in the absence of the reason is because the three characteristics as they have been explained are the only characteristics, and other than those there are no characteristics.

original: gis log par rtogs pa bstan pa ni gzhan dag ni gtan tshigs mtshan nyid dug pa'o zhes zer te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gis log par rtogs pa bstan pa ni gzhan dag ni gtan tshigs mtshan nyid dug pa'o zhes zer te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The teaching of the misconceptions of others is ‚ÄúOthers say that the reason is the characteristic of the thesis.‚Äù

original: rigs pa can dang spyod pa la sogs pas bsam pa gtan tshigs gcig pu yod kyang tshul drug du 'dod pas gsum bo de dag dang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rigs pa can dang spyod pa la sogs pas bsam pa gtan tshigs gcig pu yod kyang tshul drug du 'dod pas gsum bo de dag dang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The NaiyƒÅyikas and the Mƒ´mƒÅ·πÉsakas and so on assert that although the reason is one, there are six modes.

original: phyogs kyi cho dang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs kyi cho dang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The teaching of the property of the subject and of the forward and reverse pervasions.

original: de bzhin du gnod pa med pa'i yul ni tshul bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnod pa med pa'i yul ni tshul bzhi pa'o //
translated: The non-deficiency of the object is the fourth mode.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de la tshad mas ma bsal ba ni gnod pa med pa ste /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de la tshad mas ma bsal ba ni gnod pa med pa ste /
translated: The non-deficiency is the non-elimination by valid knowledge of that which is the characteristic of the property to be established.

original: de yod pa de nyid las tshul gzhan no //üîΩrnam par de lta bu brjod par 'dod pa'i grangs gcig pa'i tshul gzhan ni grangs gcig pa gang gi gtan tshigs kyi rdzas de'i grangs gcig pa yin te /
analyzed: de yod pa de nyid las tshul gzhan no // rnam par de lta bu brjod par 'dod pa'i grangs gcig pa'i tshul gzhan ni grangs gcig pa gang gi gtan tshigs kyi rdzas de'i grangs gcig pa yin te /
translated: It is a different mode from that of its existence.üîΩThe other mode of the one-numerically-as-aspected is that of the one-numerically-as-aspected which is the substance of the reason.

original: brjod par 'dod pa'i grangs gcig pa'i gtan tshigs kyi rdzas la brten pa nyid gang gi gtan tshigs kyi spyi de'i brjod par 'dod pa'i grangs gcig pa ste de yod pa las gzhan pa'i tshul lo //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa'i grangs gcig pa'i gtan tshigs kyi rdzas la brten pa nyid gang gi gtan tshigs kyi spyi de'i brjod par 'dod pa'i grangs gcig pa ste de yod pa las gzhan pa'i tshul lo //
translated: The other mode from that of its existence is that of the one-numerically-as-aspected which is the universal of the reason, that is, the one-numerically-as-aspected which is the substance of the reason that is the basis of the one-numerically-as-aspected.

original: gal te grangs gcig pa yongs su bcad pas 'gran zla'i gtan tshigs spangs pa'i bsal ba'i gtan tshigs 'di gtan tshigs su srid pa de'i tshe go bar byed pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: gal te grangs gcig pa yongs su bcad pas 'gran zla'i gtan tshigs spangs pa'i bsal ba'i gtan tshigs 'di gtan tshigs su srid pa de'i tshe go bar byed pa nyid yin te /
translated: If the reason, the exclusion of a rival reason by the determination of the one-numerically-as-aspected, is possible as a reason, then it is a convincer.

original: 'gran zla'i gtan tshigs dang bcas pa'i grangs gnyis pa can yang mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gran zla'i gtan tshigs dang bcas pa'i grangs gnyis pa can yang mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not reasonable to have a second number, that of a reason with a rival reason.

original: gal te 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can gyi gtan tshigs gzhan pha rol pos bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gal te 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can gyi gtan tshigs gzhan pha rol pos bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the opponent has stated a reason that is nonerroneously contradictory.

original: de bzhin du shes pa nyid dang shes pa'i yul te /
analyzed: de bzhin du shes pa nyid dang shes pa'i yul te /
translated: Similarly, cognition itself and the object of cognition

original: mi shes pa nyid ni gtan tshigs ma yin la rang yod pa tsam gyis go bar byed par mi rigs so zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi shes pa nyid ni gtan tshigs ma yin la rang yod pa tsam gyis go bar byed par mi rigs so zhes bya'o //
translated: are not reasons. It is not reasonable that mere presence is understood.

original: de la ni de rnams la'o //
analyzed: de la ni de rnams la'o //
translated: In that case, they are those.

original: tshul gzhan pa gang yin pa de dag gnod pa med pa'i yul can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshul gzhan pa gang yin pa de dag gnod pa med pa'i yul can zhes bya'o //
translated: Those that are different modes are called ‚Äúhaving an unimpaired object.‚Äù

original: des na re zhig 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag med na mi 'byung bar 'gyur ba de las tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid gzhan ma yin te de'i bdag nyid du de brjod par 'dod pas bshad zin pas bshad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: des na re zhig 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag med na mi 'byung bar 'gyur ba de las tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid gzhan ma yin te de'i bdag nyid du de brjod par 'dod pas bshad zin pas bshad par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, first, if the reason for the connection is the forward and reverse pervasions, it is not a different characteristic from that, because it is stated to be of the nature of that. Since it is stated by the one who wishes to state it, it should not be stated.

original: ci'i phyir mtshan nyid tha dad par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mtshan nyid tha dad par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why would it not be a different characteristic?

original: gnod par byed pa dang med na mi 'byung ba dag 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa dang med na mi 'byung ba dag 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the impairment and the absence of the forward pervasion are contradictory.

original: @312b lhan cig mig nas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gal ba sgrub par byed pa ni med na mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: @312b lhan cig mig nas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gal ba sgrub par byed pa ni med na mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The proof of the contradiction of the property of the subject with a property that is concomitant with it is stated by ‚ÄúIf the property of the subject does not occur without the reason, then the reason is contradictory.‚Äù

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos gtan tshigs med na mi 'byung bar brjod pa la de la tshad mas gnod par gyur na /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos gtan tshigs med na mi 'byung bar brjod pa la de la tshad mas gnod par gyur na /
translated: If the property of the subject is stated as not occurring without the reason, then if it is undermined by a valid cognition,

original: gal te de yod pa kho na de la med pa'i yul can gyi tshad ma 'jug na de'i tshe de ni 'khrul pas tshad mar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir gnod pa ga la yin /
analyzed: gal te de yod pa kho na de la med pa'i yul can gyi tshad ma 'jug na de'i tshe de ni 'khrul pas tshad mar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir gnod pa ga la yin /
translated: then if it exists, it is a valid cognition that has a non-existent object. In that case, since it is mistaken, how could it be a valid cognition?

original: des na gtan tshig dang bcas pa de'i mtshan nyid kyi bsgrub par bya ba chos can la mi 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: des na gtan tshig dang bcas pa de'i mtshan nyid kyi bsgrub par bya ba chos can la mi 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: Therefore, the property of the subject that has the reason would not occur.

original: 'dir yang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos su ji ltar na mi 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dir yang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos su ji ltar na mi 'gyur /
translated: How could it be the property of the subject here?

original: gang gi phyir gnod par byed pa'i go skabs 'gyur ba de'i phyir med na mi 'byung ba dang tshad mas gnod pas lhan cig mi gnas pas med na mi 'byung bas nye bar gnas pas chos can la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos yod par tshad mas gnod pa
analyzed: gang gi phyir gnod par byed pa'i go skabs 'gyur ba de'i phyir med na mi 'byung ba dang tshad mas gnod pas lhan cig mi gnas pas med na mi 'byung bas nye bar gnas pas chos can la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos yod par tshad mas gnod pa
translated: Because there is an opportunity for refutation, therefore, since it is not possible for something that does not exist to be a basis, and since it is not possible for something that is refuted by valid knowledge to coexist with it, the property of the subject, the existence of the probandum, is refuted by valid knowledge.

original: nye bar 'jog pa yin no //
analyzed: nye bar 'jog pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the property of the subject is posited.

original: de dang de med pa chos can gcig la phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gal ba srid pa yin no //
analyzed: de dang de med pa chos can gcig la phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gal ba srid pa yin no //
translated: It is possible that the absence of that and that in one basis are mutually exclusive, that is, they are contradictory.

original: de nyid 'gal bar gsal bar byed pa'i zhar la bzhad gad byed pa ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid 'gal bar gsal bar byed pa'i zhar la bzhad gad byed pa ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to clarify that contradiction, he says, ‚ÄúDirect perception and inference,‚Äù and so on.

original: bsgrub par bya ba la gnod par byed pas mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa des chos can gyi mgul pa nas bzung nas rang gi gnas las bton nas gang gi phyir de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos yod pa kho nas de dang med na mi 'byung
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba la gnod par byed pas mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa des chos can gyi mgul pa nas bzung nas rang gi gnas las bton nas gang gi phyir de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos yod pa kho nas de dang med na mi 'byung
translated: Since the sign contradicts the probandum, direct perception and inference seize the neck of the subject and expel it from its abode.üîΩSince the probandum exists there, and the sign does not occur if the probandum does not exist, the existence of the sign is forcibly imposed on the subject, even though the probandum has been eliminated.

original: ba'i phyir gtan tshigs yod pa ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos bsal nas btsan thabs kyis gtan tshigs chos can de la 'jog par byed do zhes bya ba ni kye ma mchog tu bsgrub par bye ba'i chos kyi tshan nyid can gyi dngos po rnams rab tu nyamüîΩthag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ba'i phyir gtan tshigs yod pa ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos bsal nas btsan thabs kyis gtan tshigs chos can de la 'jog par byed do zhes bya ba ni kye ma mchog tu bsgrub par bye ba'i chos kyi tshan nyid can gyi dngos po rnams rab tu nyam thag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Alas! The entities that possess the nature of the probandum are utterly destroyed.

original: de lta na 'khrul 'khor gnyis kyi gtsor bas dbugs mi phyin pa 'chi ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na 'khrul 'khor gnyis kyi gtsor bas dbugs mi phyin pa 'chi ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, the two machines would be the principal cause of death, which is the cessation of breathing.

original: gzhan gyi gnod pa dang med na mi 'byung ba'i yul gyi dbye ba bstan pa ni gal te gzhan la zhes bya ba smos pa ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can yongs su spangs nas dpe'i chos can la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang med na mi 'byung
analyzed: gzhan gyi gnod pa dang med na mi 'byung ba'i yul gyi dbye ba bstan pa ni gal te gzhan la zhes bya ba smos pa ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can yongs su spangs nas dpe'i chos can la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang med na mi 'byung
translated: The explanation of the classifications of the object of refutation and the object of non-observation is as follows: ‚ÄúIf it is said that it is other . . .‚Äù is the proof that the object of refutation is the subject of the proposition, and the object of non-observation is the reason.

original: ba'i gtan tshig yin gyi yang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kho na la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ba'i gtan tshig yin gyi yang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kho na la ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that the object of refutation is the subject of the proposition and the reason is the object of refutation.

original: @313a * // des na gnod pa dang med na mi 'byung ba gzhan la 'gal ba ga la yin /
analyzed: @313a * // des na gnod pa dang med na mi 'byung ba gzhan la 'gal ba ga la yin /
translated: Therefore, how could the object of refutation and the object of non-observation be contradictory?

original: gnod pa'i chos can la bsgrub par bya ba med pa sgrub pas gtan tshigs gzhan gyis de yod par sgrub pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gnod pa'i chos can la bsgrub par bya ba med pa sgrub pas gtan tshigs gzhan gyis de yod par sgrub pa'i phyir //
translated: Because the object of refutation is established as nonexistent in the subject, the reason is established as existent by another proof.

original: de lta na rnam pa de lta bu'i med na mi 'byung ba yod kyang gnod pa yod pas gnod pa med pa'i yul can gyi tshul gzhan srid pa'i phyir rnam pa de lta bu'i med na mi 'byung ba khas len to //
analyzed: de lta na rnam pa de lta bu'i med na mi 'byung ba yod kyang gnod pa yod pas gnod pa med pa'i yul can gyi tshul gzhan srid pa'i phyir rnam pa de lta bu'i med na mi 'byung ba khas len to //
translated: Thus, although there is such a type of non-observation, because there is an object of refutation, it is possible that there is another mode that is not an object of refutation. Therefore, such a type of non-observation is accepted.

original: gnod pa med yul can la sogs pa'i tshul gzhan yod kyang gtan tshig ltar snang de las gzhan te tshul gzhan srid pa yin no zhes bstan to ;
analyzed: gnod pa med yul can la sogs pa'i tshul gzhan yod kyang gtan tshig ltar snang de las gzhan te tshul gzhan srid pa yin no zhes bstan to ;
translated: Although there are other ways of positing non-defective subject and so on, it is taught that there are other possibilities, other ways.

original: / gtan tshigs ltar snang ba de'i rnam par 'grel pha ni gzhan la bzhad gad byed pa sngon du 'gro ba ni de ci zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: / gtan tshigs ltar snang ba de'i rnam par 'grel pha ni gzhan la bzhad gad byed pa sngon du 'gro ba ni de ci zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The commentary on the form of the pseudo-reason is as follows: First, one should laugh at the other, saying, ‚ÄúWhat is this?‚Äù

original: 'di bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can no //
analyzed: 'di bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can no //
translated: This is the subject of the proposition.

original: nyon mongs ni dka' thub can no //
analyzed: nyon mongs ni dka' thub can no //
translated: The ascetic is the afflicted one.

original: ma ning dang 'khrig pa las te de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos sgrub par byed pa'i nus pa med pa'i gtan tshig yongs su bstan pas bsgrub par bya ba'i 'bras bu tshol bar byed dam /
analyzed: ma ning dang 'khrig pa las te de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos sgrub par byed pa'i nus pa med pa'i gtan tshig yongs su bstan pas bsgrub par bya ba'i 'bras bu tshol bar byed dam /
translated: The neuter and the one who is impotent, in regard to whom there is no capacity to establish the property to be established, is the reason that is taught. Does one seek the result of the proposition?

original: de dag nyid gsal bar byed pa ni gang zhig chos can la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos med par 'dod kyang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos med na mi 'byung bar gzhan la khas blangs pas rnam pa de lta bu'i bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can nye bar bstan
analyzed: de dag nyid gsal bar byed pa ni gang zhig chos can la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos med par 'dod kyang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos med na mi 'byung bar gzhan la khas blangs pas rnam pa de lta bu'i bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can nye bar bstan
translated: Even though one asserts that the property to be proven does not exist in the subject, if one accepts that the property to be proven does not occur without the subject, then the subject of the property to be proven is indicated in that way.

original: na ji ltar chos can la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang ldan par brjod /
analyzed: na ji ltar chos can la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang ldan par brjod /
translated: How can one say that the subject possesses the property to be proven?

original: rgya mtsho'i chu lan tshva med na mi 'byung ba yin du zin kyang de las tha dad pa'i chu lan tshva dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rgya mtsho'i chu lan tshva med na mi 'byung ba yin du zin kyang de las tha dad pa'i chu lan tshva dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: Even though the water of the ocean does not occur without salt, it does not possess salt that is different from it.

original: bsgrub par bya bar 'dod pa'i chu yod pa la yang lan tshva yod par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya bar 'dod pa'i chu yod pa la yang lan tshva yod par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the existence of salt is not established in the water that is the subject of the probandum.

original: gzhan gyi tshig gi go skabs su dogs pa ni gal te de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshig gi go skabs su dogs pa ni gal te de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Fearing that the opponent will have an opportunity to speak, he says, ‚ÄúIf you say that the reason is not established because the subject is not established,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di dag nyid rnam par 'grel pa ni 'di snyam du khyed kyi 'dod pa gang gi phyir gtan tshig gzhan du yang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos las gzhan pa'i chos can la yod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag nyid rnam par 'grel pa ni 'di snyam du khyed kyi 'dod pa gang gi phyir gtan tshig gzhan du yang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos las gzhan pa'i chos can la yod pa yin te /
translated: The following is an explanation of this passage: You assert that the reason is present in a subject that is different from the predicate of the probandum.

original: chu la sogs pa de bzhin du mthong ba'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba'i chos spangs kyang med na mi 'byung ba khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chu la sogs pa de bzhin du mthong ba'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba'i chos spangs kyang med na mi 'byung ba khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because, like water, etc., it is seen to exist in a subject that is different from the predicate of the probandum, even when the predicate of the probandum is eliminated, since the invariable concomitance is accepted.

original: de nyid kyi phyir tshad ma dag gis gnod pa med pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i @313b chos can du brjod pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir tshad ma dag gis gnod pa med pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i @313b chos can du brjod pa'o //
translated: For this very reason, the subject is said to possess a property that is not contradicted by any valid cognition.

original: gang gi tshe mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gis bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can gyi gtan tshigs kyi yul bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la mi gnas pa ni dper na chu la na tshva dang ldan pa nyid de'i tshe de go bar byed pa yin
analyzed: gang gi tshe mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gis bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can gyi gtan tshigs kyi yul bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la mi gnas pa ni dper na chu la na tshva dang ldan pa nyid de'i tshe de go bar byed pa yin
translated: When the reason does not reside in the subject of the probandum as it is perceived by direct perception and inference, as in the case of the presence of salt in water, then it is an example of the reason that is not established.

original: gyi gzhan du ma yin pa de'i phyir gzhan la med na mi 'byung ba tsam gyis bsgrub par bya ba grub par khas ma blangs pa'i phyir sngar bshad pa'i nyes pa me do zhe na /
analyzed: gyi gzhan du ma yin pa de'i phyir gzhan la med na mi 'byung ba tsam gyis bsgrub par bya ba grub par khas ma blangs pa'i phyir sngar bshad pa'i nyes pa me do zhe na /
translated: Because it is not in another, therefore, if it does not exist in another, the probandum is not established by mere non-existence in another.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas de da ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas de da ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The proponent of tenets says, ‚ÄúNow, then,‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe tshigs chos can la med na mi 'byung bas khas ma blangs las bsgrub bya 'grub par mi 'gyur bas de de grub pa'i tshul gzhan gnod pa med pa'i yul can du brjod do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe tshigs chos can la med na mi 'byung bas khas ma blangs las bsgrub bya 'grub par mi 'gyur bas de de grub pa'i tshul gzhan gnod pa med pa'i yul can du brjod do //
translated: because when it is not accepted that the probandum is established by non-existence in another, the subject, then the other mode of establishing that is said to be the subject that is not harmed.

original: de'i tshe gtan tshigs la nus pa cung zad cig kyang med na ci'i phyir gnod ba med pa'i gtan tshigs gzhan yang yin /
analyzed: de'i tshe gtan tshigs la nus pa cung zad cig kyang med na ci'i phyir gnod ba med pa'i gtan tshigs gzhan yang yin /
translated: At that time, if the reason has not the slightest ability, why is it also not harmed?

original: bsgrub par bya ba grub na gtan tshigs cung zad cig kyang byed pa med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba grub na gtan tshigs cung zad cig kyang byed pa med pa kho na'o //
translated: If the probandum is established, then the reason has not the slightest function.

original: de ltar na 'di rnam par rtogs pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de ltar na 'di rnam par rtogs pa gnyis te /
translated: Thus, there are two misconceptions.

original: gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma 'jug pa na bsgrub par bya ba med par nges par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma 'jug pa na bsgrub par bya ba med par nges par 'gyur ram /
translated: When a valid cognition that contradicts it is engaged, is the object of affirmation ascertained as nonexistent?

original: nges pa med pa yin /
analyzed: nges pa med pa yin /
translated: Or is it not ascertained?

original: de la gang gi tshe snga ma'i rnam par rtog pa yin pa de'i tshe bsgrub par bya ba'i chos med pa la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma 'jug par nges pas nges pas de nyid yod pas de med par mi 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la gang gi tshe snga ma'i rnam par rtog pa yin pa de'i tshe bsgrub par bya ba'i chos med pa la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma 'jug par nges pas nges pas de nyid yod pas de med par mi 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the first case, when it is a prior conception, at that time the valid cognition that contradicts it engages the object of affirmation as nonexistent, and it is ascertained. Therefore, since that very valid cognition exists, it is not nonexistent.

original: de'i phyir gnod pa med de gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma 'jug pa na med par bsgrub par bya ba med pa yang med pas bsgrub par bya ba grub par gyur pas gtan tshigs don med pa nyid kyis nye bar bkod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnod pa med de gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma 'jug pa na med par bsgrub par bya ba med pa yang med pas bsgrub par bya ba grub par gyur pas gtan tshigs don med pa nyid kyis nye bar bkod par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore there is no contradiction. When the valid cognition that contradicts it is engaged, the object of affirmation is not nonexistent. Since it is established, the reason is pointless and should not be stated.

original: de bas na su zhig la gnod pa'i yul nyid kyis tshul gzhan du 'gyur /
analyzed: de bas na su zhig la gnod pa'i yul nyid kyis tshul gzhan du 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, for whom is the object of contradiction itself transformed into another mode?

original: gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma 'jug pa med par gyur cig snyam nas gtan tshigs med par yin te /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma 'jug pa med par gyur cig snyam nas gtan tshigs med par yin te /
translated: It is not that the reason is nonexistent, thinking that the valid cognition that contradicts it should not be engaged.

original: gang gi tshe bsgrub par bya ba la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma chos can la 'jug pa na de'i gtan tshigs bsgrub bya sgrub par mi rung par 'gyur ro zhes 'dod na gnod pa med pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bsgrub par bya ba la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma chos can la 'jug pa na de'i gtan tshigs bsgrub bya sgrub par mi rung par 'gyur ro zhes 'dod na gnod pa med pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If you maintain that when a valid cognition that contradicts the probandum engages the subject, then the reason is not suitable to prove the probandum, then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says, ‚ÄúWhen there is no contradiction,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi tshe gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma 'jug pa de'i tshe yang des bsgrub par bya ba med par chos can la sgrub can tshangs pas kyang de med par byed par @314a * //üîΩmi nus pa'i phyir yang ci ro lta bu'i gtan nam /
analyzed: gang gi tshe gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma 'jug pa de'i tshe yang des bsgrub par bya ba med par chos can la sgrub can tshangs pas kyang de med par byed par @314a * // mi nus pa'i phyir yang ci ro lta bu'i gtan nam /
translated: Even when a valid cognition that contradicts the probandum engages the subject, the probandum does not exist.üîΩEven BrahmƒÅ himself cannot make it exist.

original: gang las sgrub par byed pa'i gtan tshigs su rung ba yin /
analyzed: gang las sgrub par byed pa'i gtan tshigs su rung ba yin /
translated: So how could the reason be suitable to prove the probandum?

original: de nyid kyi phyir byed kyis gnod pa med pa'o yul can gyi tshul gzhan smos pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir byed kyis gnod pa med pa'o yul can gyi tshul gzhan smos pa'o //
translated: For that very reason, the subject is not contradicted.

original: yang na gnas par byed pa'i tshad ma 'jug pas /üîΩbsgrub par bya ba med pa nges pa med na med par yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba tshogs gnyis pa 'dod na /
analyzed: yang na gnas par byed pa'i tshad ma 'jug pas /üîΩbsgrub par bya ba med pa nges pa med na med par yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba tshogs gnyis pa 'dod na /
translated: Or, when a valid cognition that establishes the probandum engages the subject,üîΩthe probandum is ascertained to exist.

original: de yang gnod pa med pa nus pas stong par bstan pa ni ma nges pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de yang gnod pa med pa nus pas stong par bstan pa ni ma nges pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Moreover, the demonstration that the non-deficient is empty of capacity is stated by ‚Äúuncertain.‚Äù

original: gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma 'jug pas bsgrub par bya ba med par 'dod par 'gyur na 'di thob ste /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma 'jug pas bsgrub par bya ba med par 'dod par 'gyur na 'di thob ste /
translated: If one accepts that the non-existence of the probandum is due to the engagement of a valid cognition that is a refutation, then this is obtained.

original: gnod par byas pa'i tshad ma rnams med par byas pa'i tshad ma rnams med par gyur kyang bsgrub par bya ba sgrub par byed pa la nus pa med na gnod pa med pa yod kyang bsgrub bya med pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod par byas pa'i tshad ma rnams med par byas pa'i tshad ma rnams med par gyur kyang bsgrub par bya ba sgrub par byed pa la nus pa med na gnod pa med pa yod kyang bsgrub bya med pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though the valid cognitions that are the refutations are non-existent, if the non-deficient is powerless to establish the probandum, then even if the non-deficient exists, the probandum may be non-existent.

original: de la sbyor na yang gtan tshigs ltar snang kho na yin no ;üîΩ/ ji skad bshad pa'i gnod pa med pa ni bsgrub bya 'grub pa la don med pa'i gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: de la sbyor na yang gtan tshigs ltar snang kho na yin no ; / ji skad bshad pa'i gnod pa med pa ni bsgrub bya 'grub pa la don med pa'i gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: When it is applied, it is only a seeming reason.üîΩThe non-deficient as it has been explained is a reason that is pointless for establishing the probandum.

original: de la gzhan du don la gnod pa med pa bstan pa'i gtan tshigs kyi nus pa bstan pa ni gnod pa med pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de la gzhan du don la gnod pa med pa bstan pa'i gtan tshigs kyi nus pa bstan pa ni gnod pa med pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The demonstration of the capacity of a reason that demonstrates the non-deficient in regard to the object in another way is stated by ‚Äúnon-deficient.‚Äù

original: gnod pa can med pa ma yin par pha rol po 'dod de /
analyzed: gnod pa can med pa ma yin par pha rol po 'dod de /
translated: But the opponent does not accept that there is no possibility of harm.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then does he accept?

original: gnod pa mi dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: gnod pa mi dmigs pa yin te /
translated: He accepts that there is no observation of harm.üîΩThe nonobservation of that and that is the incompleteness of the power to produce, even though harm is possible in the object.

original: de dang de mi dmigs pa ni yul lar gnod par byed pa srid kyang skyed pa'i nus pa ma tshang ba de'i phyir gnod par byed pa mi dmigs pa tsam gyis bsgrub bya 'grub par mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang de mi dmigs pa ni yul lar gnod par byed pa srid kyang skyed pa'i nus pa ma tshang ba de'i phyir gnod par byed pa mi dmigs pa tsam gyis bsgrub bya 'grub par mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, it is impossible to establish the probandum by the mere nonobservation of harm.

original: de grub pa ni gtan tshigs gdon mi za bar brjod dogs pas de ni gtan tshigs sbyor ba'i yul yin no //
analyzed: de grub pa ni gtan tshigs gdon mi za bar brjod dogs pas de ni gtan tshigs sbyor ba'i yul yin no //
translated: Since it is certain that the establishment of that is the statement of the reason, it is the domain of the application of the reason.

original: de lta na gtan tshigs rang gi bsgrub bya 'grub pa la ji ltar mi nus 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na gtan tshigs rang gi bsgrub bya 'grub pa la ji ltar mi nus 'gyur zhe na /
translated: In that case, how could the reason not be able to establish its own probandum?

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas gtan tshigs gnod pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas gtan tshigs gnod pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The proponent of the conclusion says, ‚ÄúThe reason is called ‚Äòharmful.‚Äô‚Äù

original: gtan tshigs gnod pa gang dmigs pa des 'jigs kyi slar gnod pas mi 'jigs ma ce na /
analyzed: gtan tshigs gnod pa gang dmigs pa des 'jigs kyi slar gnod pas mi 'jigs ma ce na /
translated: If the reason is observed to be harmful, then it is destroyed. But it is not destroyed by harm.

original: gang gis gnod pa yod du zin kyang khyad du bsad nas de mi dmigs pa yis yod pa la sbyor bar bya bar khyed 'dod //
analyzed: gang gis gnod pa yod du zin kyang khyad du bsad nas de mi dmigs pa yis yod pa la sbyor bar bya bar khyed 'dod //
translated: Even if there were any harm, you would disregard it and apply non-observation of that to existence.

original: brgyal pha rol na reg nod pa nyon mongs yod du zin kyang de la @314b dmigs pa nyid kyi srid pa la thabs ci byar yod /
analyzed: brgyal pha rol na reg nod pa nyon mongs yod du zin kyang de la @314b dmigs pa nyid kyi srid pa la thabs ci byar yod /
translated: The opponent says: Even if there is harm, the affliction, what can be done about existence that is observed in that?

original: de'i phyir de nyid las gtan tshigs 'jig pas de med par rab tu sbyor ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid las gtan tshigs 'jig pas de med par rab tu sbyor ba yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the reason is destroyed right there, so it is applied as non-existent.

original: de ltar na gtan tshigs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ltar na gtan tshigs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to that, it is said, In that case, the so-called reason...

original: de lta na 'on te don dam par na gcig gnod pa yod dam med kyang rung de la mi ltos kyi gnod pa mi dmigs pa la sbyar bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: de lta na 'on te don dam par na gcig gnod pa yod dam med kyang rung de la mi ltos kyi gnod pa mi dmigs pa la sbyar bar bya ba'am /
translated: In that case, whether ultimately there is harm or not, it does not depend on that, but should be applied to the non-observation of harm.

original: ci zhes bya ba ni dri ba'o //
analyzed: ci zhes bya ba ni dri ba'o //
translated: What? is a question.

original: brgya la gzhan dag na re 'di dag ni bshad zin pa ci'i phyir 'dri snyam nas /
analyzed: brgya la gzhan dag na re 'di dag ni bshad zin pa ci'i phyir 'dri snyam nas /
translated: If someone else thinks, Why ask about what has already been explained?

original: ci'i phyir sbyar par bya zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sbyar par bya zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Why should it be applied? is said.

original: gnod pa mi dmigs kyang de yod na bsgrub bya sgrub pa la sbyor ba'i phyir ro zhes bsams pa'o //üîΩgzhan gyis bsams pa ma rtogs bsgrub bya sgrub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gnod pa mi dmigs kyang de yod na bsgrub bya sgrub pa la sbyor ba'i phyir ro zhes bsams pa'o // gzhan gyis bsams pa ma rtogs bsgrub bya sgrub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The opponent thinks, ‚ÄúThe non-observation of a harm-doer does not prove the nonexistence of the harm-doer.üîΩ‚Äù

original: gnod par byed pa'i rkyen med na tshad ma 'dod pa'i phyir de las bsgrub bya sgrub pa la mi 'gal lo snyam du sems na /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa'i rkyen med na tshad ma 'dod pa'i phyir de las bsgrub bya sgrub pa la mi 'gal lo snyam du sems na /
translated: The Proponents of the Middle Way respond, ‚ÄúIf you assert that a valid cognition is a harm-doer, then it is contradictory to say that the nonexistence of a harm-doer‚Äôs conditions proves the probandum.üîΩ‚Äù

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas gnod pa yod pa de mi dmigs kyang bsgrub bya 'grub pa ni mi srid pas 'dod rgyal ba yin pa ni de la las gnod pa yin bzhin du yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas gnod pa yod pa de mi dmigs kyang bsgrub bya 'grub pa ni mi srid pas 'dod rgyal ba yin pa ni de la las gnod pa yin bzhin du yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The Proponents of the Middle Way say, ‚ÄúEven though the harm-doer is not observed, it is impossible for the probandum to be proven. Therefore your position is wishful thinking.üîΩ‚Äù

original: yang ci gtan tshigs 'di gnod pa yod du zin kyang bsgrub bya sgrub byed do zhes khyed brjod na gang gis na gnod pa med par nges par bya ba la 'bad pa dang gtan tshigs kyang sbyor bar mi byed dam /
analyzed: yang ci gtan tshigs 'di gnod pa yod du zin kyang bsgrub bya sgrub byed do zhes khyed brjod na gang gis na gnod pa med par nges par bya ba la 'bad pa dang gtan tshigs kyang sbyor bar mi byed dam /
translated: ‚ÄúEven if the reason is a harm-doer, the probandum is still proven,‚Äù you say.

original: gal te de dag de lta yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de dag de lta yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that they are like that,

original: de lta na yang gnod pa bzhin du yang bsgrub bya sgrub par nus par khas len par gyur na gnod pa med pa'i yul can gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyi ma yin te ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na yang gnod pa bzhin du yang bsgrub bya sgrub par nus par khas len par gyur na gnod pa med pa'i yul can gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyi ma yin te ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: then even though there is refutation, you accept that the probandum can be established.  In that case, the definition of a reason is not that it has an object that is not refuted. Why?

original: gnod pa yod ba zhin du yang 'dis nus pa'i phyir dang nus pa khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde la gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid du brjod na gang gis na bsgrub bya med na sgrub par byed par mi 'gyur /
