analyzed: gnod pa yod ba zhin du yang 'dis nus pa'i phyir dang nus pa khas blangs pa'i phyir ro // de la gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid du brjod na gang gis na bsgrub bya med na sgrub par byed par mi 'gyur /
translated: Because even though there is refutation, it is still able to establish the probandum, and because you accept that it is able to do so.üîΩIf you say that it is the definition of a reason that it is able to establish the probandum when there is no refutation,

original: gnod pa mi dmigs pa'i gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid don dam par na gnod pa med pa'i yul can ma yin no zhes 'dod na /
analyzed: gnod pa mi dmigs pa'i gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid don dam par na gnod pa med pa'i yul can ma yin no zhes 'dod na /
translated: then you are accepting that the definition of a reason that is the nonobservation of a pervader is not that it has an object that is not refuted ultimately.

original: de lta na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de lta na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to that, BhƒÅviveka says, ‚ÄúEven though there is refutation,‚Äù and so on.

original: de lta na gnod pa yod par 'gyur pa'i dngos po srid pa yang de khas blangs nas mi dmigs pa tsam gyis gtan tshigs kyi sbyor bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na gnod pa yod par 'gyur pa'i dngos po srid pa yang de khas blangs nas mi dmigs pa tsam gyis gtan tshigs kyi sbyor bar 'gyur te /
translated: Even though there is refutation, you accept that it is still possible for there to be an existent object that is refuted.  You then use mere nonobservation as a reason to establish that.

original: gang gi tshe gzhong pa khas blangs nas gtan @315a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gzhong pa khas blangs nas gtan @315a * //
translated: When one accepts the dish,

original: tshigs sbyor bar mngon par 'dod par gyur pa de mi dmigs pa tsam gyis gnod pa yod na yang the tshom yin te /
analyzed: tshigs sbyor bar mngon par 'dod par gyur pa de mi dmigs pa tsam gyis gnod pa yod na yang the tshom yin te /
translated: and then wishes to apply the reason, if there is an objection due to the mere non-observation of the dish, it is doubt.

original: res 'ga' zhig la mi dmigs pa srid pas the tshom can de'i gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba la 'jug pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: res 'ga' zhig la mi dmigs pa srid pas the tshom can de'i gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba la 'jug pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is possible that the dish is not observed sometimes, it is not suitable for one who has doubt to engage in the application of the reason.

original: de'i phyir the tshom gyi 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni yod par khas blangs pa yin na 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir the tshom gyi 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni yod par khas blangs pa yin na 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, if one engages in doubt, one must accept that the dish exists and then engage in the application of the reason.

original: de lta na yang ji lta ba'i gnod pa mi dmigs pa la khas blangs nas gtan tshigs sbyor ba de bzhin du de dmigs pa la yang sbyor bar bya'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang ji lta ba'i gnod pa mi dmigs pa la khas blangs nas gtan tshigs sbyor ba de bzhin du de dmigs pa la yang sbyor bar bya'o //
translated: Even so, just as one applies the reason on the basis of accepting the non-observation of an object of harm, one should also apply it to the observation of that object.

original: gnod pa'i dngos po yod par khas blangs par gyur pa na de dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa la khyad par med pas mi dmigs pa'i gnod pa nyid kyang gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid du sbyar bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: gnod pa'i dngos po yod par khas blangs par gyur pa na de dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa la khyad par med pas mi dmigs pa'i gnod pa nyid kyang gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid du sbyar bar mi rigs so //
translated: When one accepts that there is an object of refutation, then there is no difference between the observation and non-observation of that, and so it is not right to apply the non-observation of the refutation itself as the definition of the reason.

original: gnod pa'i rkyen spangs par 'gyur kyang 'brel pa'i tshad ma yod ba ga la yin /
analyzed: gnod pa'i rkyen spangs par 'gyur kyang 'brel pa'i tshad ma yod ba ga la yin /
translated: Even if the conditions of refutation are eliminated, how can there be a valid cognition of the relation?

original: gzhan gyi tshig gi dogs pa'i go skabs ni gal te gnod pa yod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshig gi dogs pa'i go skabs ni gal te gnod pa yod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The opportunity for doubt about the words of another is stated in ‚ÄúIf there is a refutation . . . ‚Äù and so forth.

original: gnod pa yod pa'i gtan tshigs kyi nus pa ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: gnod pa yod pa'i gtan tshigs kyi nus pa ni mi 'dod do //
translated: The power of a reason that has a refutation is not accepted.

original: des na ji ltar de dmigs kyang sbyor bar 'gyur /
analyzed: des na ji ltar de dmigs kyang sbyor bar 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, how can it be applied even if it is observed?

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas ni gal te de ltar zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas ni gal te de ltar zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The proponent of tenets says, ‚ÄúIf it is like that . . . ‚Äù and so forth.

original: gnod pa yod na gtan tshigs kyis mi nus par 'dod na gnod pa mi srid par de gtan lam phab par gtan tshigs gang yin pa de rnam pa de lta bu'i sbyor ba mi dmigs pa tsam gyis 'od pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gnod pa yod na gtan tshigs kyis mi nus par 'dod na gnod pa mi srid par de gtan lam phab par gtan tshigs gang yin pa de rnam pa de lta bu'i sbyor ba mi dmigs pa tsam gyis 'od pa ma yin no //
translated: If you maintain that a reason is unable to do so when there is an objection, then, since it is impossible for there to be an objection, you have established that a reason is not refuted by the mere non-observation of a specific instance of itself.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: gnod pa srid pa'i phyogs la sbyar kyang gtan tshigs kyis bsgrub bya sgrub par mi mus par 'gyur du 'ong bas so //üîΩphyogs snga mar smra bas gal te gnod pa mi dmigs na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gnod pa srid pa'i phyogs la sbyar kyang gtan tshigs kyis bsgrub bya sgrub par mi mus par 'gyur du 'ong bas so // phyogs snga mar smra bas gal te gnod pa mi dmigs na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is because it would follow, absurdly, that even if a reason were applied to a position where an objection is possible, the reason would be unable to establish its probandum.

original: gnod pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir dmigs pa'i rkyen yod par gyur na yod par gdon mi za ste /
analyzed: gnod pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir dmigs pa'i rkyen yod par gyur na yod par gdon mi za ste /
translated: The opponent might say, ‚ÄúIf there is no observation of an objection, then, because there is no observation of an objection, when the conditions for observation are present, it is without a doubt existent.

original: don rnams med pas gtan tshigs kyis nus pa yin no snyam du sems pa'o //
analyzed: don rnams med pas gtan tshigs kyis nus pa yin no snyam du sems pa'o //
translated: Therefore, because the object does not exist, the reason is able to do its job.‚Äù

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas dmigs bas gnod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas dmigs bas gnod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The proponent of the thesis replies, ‚ÄúThe observation of an object is not a reason for its existence.‚Äù

original: don rnams dmigs pa'i 'bras bur 'gyur ba'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i khyab pa yang med do //
analyzed: don rnams dmigs pa'i 'bras bur 'gyur ba'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i khyab pa yang med do //
translated: And there is no pervasion of cause and effect in the case of the object of perception.

original: rgyu rnams ni gdon mi za bar 'bras bu dang ldan pa ma yin te gags byed pa srid @315b pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu rnams ni gdon mi za bar 'bras bu dang ldan pa ma yin te gags byed pa srid @315b pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Causes do not necessarily have effects, because it is possible for there to be an obstruction.

original: ji ltar khyab par byed pa ma yin pa'i dmigs pa de log pas gnod pa ldog par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: ji ltar khyab par byed pa ma yin pa'i dmigs pa de log pas gnod pa ldog par 'gyur ram /
translated: How can the cessation of the object of a nonpervasive perception cause the cessation of the harm?

original: gang gi gtan tshigs la gnod pa srid par grub pa'i nus pa mi srid pa yin no zhes gzhan gyis kyang 'dod ba kho na'i tshad mas gnod ba ni skye bo'i dus su gnod pa mi dmigs pa dus gzhan na gnod pa rkyen gyis bskyed pas yod parüîΩtshad mas khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi gtan tshigs la gnod pa srid par grub pa'i nus pa mi srid pa yin no zhes gzhan gyis kyang 'dod ba kho na'i tshad mas gnod ba ni skye bo'i dus su gnod pa mi dmigs pa dus gzhan na gnod pa rkyen gyis bskyed pas yod par tshad mas khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The opponent accepts that it is impossible for a reason to have the power to establish the possibility of harm. The harm that is perceived at one time by valid cognition is produced by conditions at another time, and so it exists.

original: 'on te khyab par byed pa ma yin pa'i yang dmigs pa ldog pas gnod pa ldog cing 'gag pa ni phyin ci log gi skyod can gyi shes pa la 'bad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on te khyab par byed pa ma yin pa'i yang dmigs pa ldog pas gnod pa ldog cing 'gag pa ni phyin ci log gi skyod can gyi shes pa la 'bad pa yin no //
translated: But if the cessation of the object of a nonpervasive perception causes the cessation of the harm, then the cessation of the harm is due to the exertion of a mistaken cognition.

original: rigs pa 'di nyid kyis shes pa ldog pas gnod pa ldog pa med pa ni de lta na ni zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rigs pa 'di nyid kyis shes pa ldog pas gnod pa ldog pa med pa ni de lta na ni zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: This very reasoning is stated by ‚ÄúIf it were so,‚Äù in order to refute the non-reversal of the harm by the reversal of the cognition.

original: gtan tshigs don med pa yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs don med pa yin te /
translated: The reason is pointless.

original: ga las she na /
analyzed: ga las she na /
translated: Why?

original: gnod pa mi dmigs pa kho nas gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba spangs nas bsgrub bya 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod pa mi dmigs pa kho nas gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba spangs nas bsgrub bya 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the proof of the probandum is by the mere non-apprehension of the harm, after the application of the reason is abandoned.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mi dmigs na gnod pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi dmigs na gnod pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if there is no apprehension, the harm is impossible.

original: de lta na gang la gnod pa mi dmigs pa de la don dam par na de yod pa ma yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de lta na gang la gnod pa mi dmigs pa de la don dam par na de yod pa ma yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: If one thinks that way, then if there is no apprehension of harm, it is not ultimately existent.

original: gang la don dam par med pa de la bsgrub bya med pa yang don dam pa kho nar med pa yin te /
analyzed: gang la don dam par med pa de la bsgrub bya med pa yang don dam pa kho nar med pa yin te /
translated: If it is not ultimately existent, then the probandum is also not ultimately existent.

original: gzhan du don dam par med pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du don dam par med pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not reasonable for it to be ultimately non-existent in another way.

original: des kyang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos med na med par 'gyur ba la yod na yod par 'gyur pa'i bsgrub bya mi rtogs na gtan tshigs don med do //
analyzed: des kyang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos med na med par 'gyur ba la yod na yod par 'gyur pa'i bsgrub bya mi rtogs na gtan tshigs don med do //
translated: If the probandum is not apprehended as being absent when the property to be established is absent, and as being present when it is present, then the reason is pointless.

original: 'on te rigs pa dang 'gal bar ma gyur cig snyam na dmigs pa log pas gnod pa ldog par 'dod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'on te rigs pa dang 'gal bar ma gyur cig snyam na dmigs pa log pas gnod pa ldog par 'dod par mi bya'o //
translated: But if you think, ‚ÄúLet it not be contradictory to reasoning,‚Äù then you should not assert that the object of negation is refuted by the reversal of the object.

original: de la dmigs pa log kyang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa log kyang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In response to that, BhƒÅviveka says, ‚ÄúEven if the object is reversed . . .‚Äù

original: gnod pa yod pa mi ldog par 'dod pa ni gtan tshigs nus pa med pa gang yin pa de'i gnas skabs su gnod pa dmigs pa gang yin pa so na 'dug pas gtan tshigs sbyor ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gnod pa yod pa mi ldog par 'dod pa ni gtan tshigs nus pa med pa gang yin pa de'i gnas skabs su gnod pa dmigs pa gang yin pa so na 'dug pas gtan tshigs sbyor ba ma yin no //
translated: He means that when the object of negation exists, it is not asserted that it is refuted. Since the object of negation remains, it is not the case that the application of the reason is not present.

original: gang zhig gnod pa med pa'i yul can gyi tshul gzhan du 'gyur /
analyzed: gang zhig gnod pa med pa'i yul can gyi tshul gzhan du 'gyur /
translated: How could the object of negation be reversed, and yet the object of negation still remain?

original: 'di dag nyid kyi mjug bsdu ba ni de lta bas na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di dag nyid kyi mjug bsdu ba ni de lta bas na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The summary of this section is stated in the lines beginning ‚ÄúFor these reasons . . .‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir de ltar gtan tshigs kyi khyab pa ni thams cad du bsgrub par bya ba dang med na mi 'byung ba khas ma blangs na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar gtan tshigs kyi khyab pa ni thams cad du bsgrub par bya ba dang med na mi 'byung ba khas ma blangs na /
translated: For these reasons, if the pervasion of the reason is not accepted everywhere, then the nonobservation of the object of negation is not established.

original: khyab pa phyi rol pa ni dga' bas gtan tshigs kyi sbyor bas don med par 'thob po //
analyzed: khyab pa phyi rol pa ni dga' bas gtan tshigs kyi sbyor bas don med par 'thob po //
translated: Therefore, the external pervasion is obtained without effort by the application of the reason.

original: de'i phyir rang @316a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang @316a * //
translated: For that reason, the object of negation is reversed by the power of the reason.

original: gi bsgrub par bya ba yod pa dang med pa dag las yin gyi gzhan du yang yin na ni rang gi bsgrub bya yod kyang med la med kyang yod pas so //
analyzed: gi bsgrub par bya ba yod pa dang med pa dag las yin gyi gzhan du yang yin na ni rang gi bsgrub bya yod kyang med la med kyang yod pas so //
translated: If the reason were to be present in the presence and absence of the probandum, then the probandum would be present even when it is absent, and it would be absent even when it is present.

original: gtan tshigs chos can la cung zad cig kyang bsgrub par bya bar mi 'gyur la sgrub par byed par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs chos can la cung zad cig kyang bsgrub par bya bar mi 'gyur la sgrub par byed par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The reason would not prove anything at all about the subject, and it would not prove anything at all.

original: 'gog par yang mi byed pa ni de las bzlog pa 'gog par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog par yang mi byed pa ni de las bzlog pa 'gog par mi byed pa'o //
translated: It does not negate what is to be negated, because it does not negate the opposite of that.

original: des na sgrub pa dang dgag par byed pa dag spangs pa yin na sbyor bar mi nus so //
analyzed: des na sgrub pa dang dgag par byed pa dag spangs pa yin na sbyor bar mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, if it is devoid of affirmation and negation, it cannot be a syllogism.

original: rang gi bsgrub par bya ba med na mi 'byung ba'i gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba gdon mi za bar gtan tshigs thams cad khas blangs par 'dod par bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi bsgrub par bya ba med na mi 'byung ba'i gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba gdon mi za bar gtan tshigs thams cad khas blangs par 'dod par bya'o //
translated: One must accept that the application of a reason that is invariably concomitant with the absence of the probandum is necessarily the application of all reasons.

original: de yang gags byed pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis mthong ba dang ma mthong ba la rag las pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang gags byed pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis mthong ba dang ma mthong ba la rag las pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is not dependent on whether or not one sees a reason that is a cause of obstruction.

original: gang gi phyir sngar ji skad bshad pa bzhin du gnod pa dang med na mi 'byung ba dag 'gal bar grub po zhes bya ba'i mjug bsdu ba ni de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sngar ji skad bshad pa bzhin du gnod pa dang med na mi 'byung ba dag 'gal bar grub po zhes bya ba'i mjug bsdu ba ni de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: is stated in the line ‚ÄúTherefore, . . . ‚ÄùüîΩIf the object of refutation existed as a thing that is different from that, thenüîΩthe author of the treatise would have to have mentioned another essence.

original: de ni de las khyad par gzhan pa'i dngos por gnas na mtshan nyid mdzad pas kyang ngo bo gzhan zhig smos par 'os par 'gyur na gang zhig khyad par yod bzhin du yang gang zhig du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ni de las khyad par gzhan pa'i dngos por gnas na mtshan nyid mdzad pas kyang ngo bo gzhan zhig smos par 'os par 'gyur na gang zhig khyad par yod bzhin du yang gang zhig du 'gyur te /
translated: But how could there be a difference when there is no difference?üîΩThe basis of difference and the difference itself could be confused, but it is

original: gang las khyad par gyi gzhi dang khyad par yod pa dag 'khrul pa srid kyi 'ba' zhig pa kho na la mi srid do //
analyzed: gang las khyad par gyi gzhi dang khyad par yod pa dag 'khrul pa srid kyi 'ba' zhig pa kho na la mi srid do //
translated: impossible for there to be a confusion with respect to a mere thing.

original: dpe smos pa ni dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dpe smos pa ni dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The example is stated in the line ‚ÄúFor example, . . . ‚ÄùüîΩEven though the object of hearing and so on are related to the subject, they

original: mnyan bya la sogs pa chos can dang 'brel pa yod kyang mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa'o //
analyzed: mnyan bya la sogs pa chos can dang 'brel pa yod kyang mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa'o //
translated: are not present in the similar instances.

original: mig gis gzung bya la sogs pa mthun pa'i phyogs yod du zin kyang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la med pa'o //
analyzed: mig gis gzung bya la sogs pa mthun pa'i phyogs yod du zin kyang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la med pa'o //
translated: Even if there were a concordant factor, such as the object of the eye, etc., it would not exist in the subject of the proposition.

original: des na gang zhig khyad par gyi gzhi la khyab pa yod pa gang yin pa la 'khrul pa srid kyi mtshan nyid kyis ma bstan to //
analyzed: des na gang zhig khyad par gyi gzhi la khyab pa yod pa gang yin pa la 'khrul pa srid kyi mtshan nyid kyis ma bstan to //
translated: Therefore, when there is pervasion of the basis of qualification, error is possible, but it is not taught by the definition.

original: gal te 'dir yang de 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'dir yang de 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If it were to occur here, too,

original: 'di dag 'di ni de ma thag tu bshad zin to //üîΩmed na mi 'byung ba yod pa la gnod pa srid pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag 'di ni de ma thag tu bshad zin to // med na mi 'byung ba yod pa la gnod pa srid pa yin no //
translated: then these have just been explained.üîΩWhen there is a necessary connection, error is possible.

original: med na mi 'byung ba la gnod pa med pa yod de /
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba la gnod pa med pa yod de /
translated: When there is no necessary connection, there is no error.

original: yod par gyur bas 'khrul pa mi srid do //
analyzed: yod par gyur bas 'khrul pa mi srid do //
translated: When there is a necessary connection, error is not possible.

original: gang gis na khyad par gyi gzhi dang khyad par yod pa mtshan nyid gzhan du bstan par 'os pa ma yin /
analyzed: gang gis na khyad par gyi gzhi dang khyad par yod pa mtshan nyid gzhan du bstan par 'os pa ma yin /
translated: How could it be that the basis of qualification and the qualification exist, but it is not proper to teach them as different characteristics?

original: bsgrub bya dang med na mi 'byung ba'i gtan tshigs dang 'gal @316b ba ni bsgrub bya dang bzlog pa ma yin na /
analyzed: bsgrub bya dang med na mi 'byung ba'i gtan tshigs dang 'gal @316b ba ni bsgrub bya dang bzlog pa ma yin na /
translated: If the reason of necessary connection and the proposition are not contradictory,

original: med na mi 'byung ba'i yul la gnod pa mi srid do //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba'i yul la gnod pa mi srid do //
translated: It is impossible to invalidate a subject that does not exist.

original: bshad zin pa'i rnam pas yang dag pa'i gtan tshigs nyid las bzlog pa yul med pa la sbyor ba ni gtan tshigs ltar snang bar brjod do //
analyzed: bshad zin pa'i rnam pas yang dag pa'i gtan tshigs nyid las bzlog pa yul med pa la sbyor ba ni gtan tshigs ltar snang bar brjod do //
translated: The opposite of a correct reason, as it has been explained, is called a pseudo-reason, when it is applied to a non-existent subject.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar phyir zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar phyir zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir ro ;
translated: ‚Äú Because‚Äù means ‚Äúfor that reason.‚Äù

original: / de med pa ni gnod pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: / de med pa ni gnod pa spangs pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Its non-existence‚Äù is the absence of invalidation.üîΩThe existence of a reason that is not a non-observation of a related object is not a pseudo-reason, because it is not a non-observation of a cause, etc.üîΩThe existence of a reason that is not a non-observation of a related object is not a pseudo-reason, because it is not a non-observation of a cause, etc.

original: logs shig tu ni med na mi 'byung ba can gyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i bdag nyid kyi gtan tshigs dang 'gal ba 'di gnyis kyi mtshan nyid gzhan du brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: logs shig tu ni med na mi 'byung ba can gyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i bdag nyid kyi gtan tshigs dang 'gal ba 'di gnyis kyi mtshan nyid gzhan du brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: The existence of a reason that is not a non-observation of a related object is not a pseudo-reason, because it is not a non-observation of a cause, etc.üîΩThe existence of a reason that is not a non-observation of a related object is not a pseudo-reason, because it is not a non-observation of a cause, etc.üîΩThe existence of a reason that is not a non-observation of a related object is not a pseudo-reason, because it is not a non-observation of a cause, etc.üîΩThe existence of a reason that is not a non-observation of a related object is not a pseudo-reason, because it is not a non-observation of a cause, etc.üîΩThe existence of a reason that is not a non-observation of a related object is not a pseudo-reason, because it is not a non-observation of a cause, etc.üîΩThe existence of a reason that is not a non-observation of a related object is not a pseudo-reason, because it is not a non-observation of a cause, etc.üîΩThe existence of a reason that is not a non-observation of a related object is not a pseudo-reason, because it is not a non-observation of a cause, etc.üîΩThe existence of a reason that is not a non-observation of a related object is not a pseudo-reason, because it is not a non-observation of a cause, etc.üîΩThe existence of a reason that is not a non-observation of a related object is not a pseudo-reason, because it is not a non-observation of a cause, etc.

original: ma 'khrul ba'i ngo bo gzhan mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'khrul ba'i ngo bo gzhan mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The existence of a reason that is not a non-observation of a related object is not a pseudo-reason, because it

original: gang gi phyir med na mi 'byung ba yod pa la gnod pa mi srid pa de'i phyir ji skad bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba la go bar bya ba'i don dam bcas pa'i nyes pa mngon sum dang 'gal ba la sogs pa rnams
analyzed: gang gi phyir med na mi 'byung ba yod pa la gnod pa mi srid pa de'i phyir ji skad bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba la go bar bya ba'i don dam bcas pa'i nyes pa mngon sum dang 'gal ba la sogs pa rnams
translated: Because it is impossible to invalidate that which exists without which something else does not occur, therefore, it is impossible for the application of a reason having the characteristics as just explained to be invalidated by direct perception, etc.,

original: kyang mi srid do //
analyzed: kyang mi srid do //
translated: and it is impossible for the faults of the thesis to be invalidated.

original: de ji ltar gnod pa spangs pa'i gtan tshigs kyi tshul gzhan brjod pa yin /
analyzed: de ji ltar gnod pa spangs pa'i gtan tshigs kyi tshul gzhan brjod pa yin /
translated: How could it be that you state another mode of reasoning that avoids invalidation?

original: gal te mi srid kyang de dag brjod na ni 'bras bu med pa ga la yin /
analyzed: gal te mi srid kyang de dag brjod na ni 'bras bu med pa ga la yin /
translated: If it is impossible, but you state them, then how could it be that they are fruitless?

original: 'ba' zhig pa'i sbyor ba srid pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'ba' zhig pa'i sbyor ba srid pa yin no zhe na /
translated: It is possible to apply them alone.

original: dam bca' ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dam bca' ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The statement of the thesis, etc.,

original: gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba la dam bca' ba 'ba' zhig la sbyor ba med do //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba la dam bca' ba 'ba' zhig la sbyor ba med do //
translated: is not the application of the reason alone.

original: gtan tshigs kyi yul nyid du khas blangs pas yul med na gtan tshigs de yod pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi yul nyid du khas blangs pas yul med na gtan tshigs de yod pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the thesis, etc., are accepted as the domain of the reason, it is not logical that the reason exists when the domain does not exist.

original: des na bstan bcos mdzad pa slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos kyang mngon sum dang 'gal ba la sogs pa dam bca' ba'i skyon gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: des na bstan bcos mdzad pa slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos kyang mngon sum dang 'gal ba la sogs pa dam bca' ba'i skyon gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the author of the treatise, DignƒÅga, also states the fault of a thesis that contradicts perception, and so on.

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog pa log par rtogs pa mthong bas sbyor ba mi 'os su zin kyang phyogs kyi mtshan nyid brjod pa'i rigs pa 'thob pa nyid do /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog pa log par rtogs pa mthong bas sbyor ba mi 'os su zin kyang phyogs kyi mtshan nyid brjod pa'i rigs pa 'thob pa nyid do /
translated: Even though it is not appropriate to apply a proof that sees the opposite of what is to be proven and the opposite of what is to be proven, it is still reasonable to state the definition of a position.

original: phyogs nyid la bsal ba'i tshig gis tshad ma dang 'gal ba bshad do //
analyzed: phyogs nyid la bsal ba'i tshig gis tshad ma dang 'gal ba bshad do //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù in the statement ‚ÄúThe definition of a position is stated only‚Äù is explained as contradicting a valid means of knowledge with respect to the position itself.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur bas phyogs kyi mtshan nyid rnam par gcad par mi bya ste the tshom gyi bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur bas phyogs kyi mtshan nyid rnam par gcad par mi bya ste the tshom gyi bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One should not eliminate the definition of a position due to an absurd consequence, because it is the object of doubt that is to be proven.

original: tshad mas gnod par bya ba dang gnod par byed pa mi 'jug pa'i phyir de kho na gnod pa med pa'i yul can yin te tshul gzhan ni bsal bar bya ba sel bar byed pa ni 'dis kyang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: tshad mas gnod par bya ba dang gnod par byed pa mi 'jug pa'i phyir de kho na gnod pa med pa'i yul can yin te tshul gzhan ni bsal bar bya ba sel bar byed pa ni 'dis kyang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because the object of refutation and the refuting agent do not engage in what is contradicted by valid knowledge, it is only the object of that which is without contradiction that is the object. The other mode is stated by ‚Äúthis also,‚Äù which is the elimination of what is to be eliminated.

original: med na mi @317a * //
analyzed: med na mi @317a * //
translated: If it does not exist, then it is not tenable that the self is the appropriator.üîΩ

original: 'byung bar gyur pa gnod pa med pa bstan pas brjod par 'dod pa'i grangs gcig pa can 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa'i skyon gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs brjod pa bsal cing snga ngas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'byung bar gyur pa gnod pa med pa bstan pas brjod par 'dod pa'i grangs gcig pa can 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa'i skyon gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs brjod pa bsal cing snga ngas pa yin no //
translated: If it does not exist, then the fault of the contradiction of the non-erroneous one-with-the-desired-number is stated.

original: gzhan gyis dris ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyis dris ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: The opponent‚Äôs question is like what?

original: rnam pa gang gis ji lta bu'i med na mi 'byung ba dang lhan cig mi gnas pa'i rnam pa de lta bu gtan tshigs kyi zla bo dang med na mi 'byung ba dag kyang yin /
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis ji lta bu'i med na mi 'byung ba dang lhan cig mi gnas pa'i rnam pa de lta bu gtan tshigs kyi zla bo dang med na mi 'byung ba dag kyang yin /
translated: By what aspect, in what way, is the non-arising when not existing and the non-co-abiding, in that way, the reason and the counter-correlate are non-arising and also one-with-the-desired-number is eliminated?üîΩWhat is stated by the proponent of the conclusion?üîΩThe one-with-the-desired-number is eliminated.üîΩThe one-with-the-desired-number is eliminated.üîΩThe one-with-the-desired-number is eliminated.

original: gang gis brjod par 'dod pa'i grangs gcig pa dang ldan pa bsal ba yin zhe na /üîΩgrub mtha' smra bas yang dag par bstan pa ni gcig gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

original: gtan tshigs gcig gi mtshan nyid rigs te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs gcig gi mtshan nyid rigs te /
translated: The one-with-the-desired-number is eliminated.üîΩThe one-with-the-desired-

original: gal te rang gi bsgrub par bya ba yod pa kho nas yod pa'i phyir rang gi bsgrub bya la 'khrul par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te rang gi bsgrub par bya ba yod pa kho nas yod pa'i phyir rang gi bsgrub bya la 'khrul par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: If it exists only because its probandum exists, how could it be mistaken with respect to its probandum?

original: de lta ma yin na med na mi 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na med na mi 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, then the definition of invariable concomitance would be undermined.

original: chos can gang la mtshan nyid gcig yod par gyur pa chos can de kho na yin pa la yin pa de'i phyir 'gran zla'i gtan tshigs gzhan yang 'gal ba yin pa des na gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: chos can gang la mtshan nyid gcig yod par gyur pa chos can de kho na yin pa la yin pa de'i phyir 'gran zla'i gtan tshigs gzhan yang 'gal ba yin pa des na gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: If a property-possessor has a single property, then it is just that property-possessor, and it is just that property. Therefore, since it is contradictory for another rival reason to exist, how could it be endowed with the characteristics of a reason?

original: gtan tshigs gcig gi bdag nyid kyi bsgrub par bya ba de la gnod par byed pa ni de dang 'gal ba'i chos gzhan yod pa kho na ste med kyang yod pa'i phyir med na mi 'byung ba ma yin pas gnod pa dang mtshungs so //
analyzed: gtan tshigs gcig gi bdag nyid kyi bsgrub par bya ba de la gnod par byed pa ni de dang 'gal ba'i chos gzhan yod pa kho na ste med kyang yod pa'i phyir med na mi 'byung ba ma yin pas gnod pa dang mtshungs so //
translated: The existence of another property that is contradictory with that property which is the identity of a single reason is just the refutation of the probandum. Since it exists even when it does not exist, it is not an invariable relation. Therefore, it is similar to a refutation.

original: gnod pa mi srid pa mtshungs pas gtan tshigs kyi zla bos bsal ba kho nas bsal to //
analyzed: gnod pa mi srid pa mtshungs pas gtan tshigs kyi zla bos bsal ba kho nas bsal to //
translated: Since the impossibility of refutation is similar, it is refuted just by the refutation of the rival reason.

original: 'dir yang skyon gzhan brjod par 'dod nas rnam par rtog pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dir yang skyon gzhan brjod par 'dod nas rnam par rtog pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Here, wishing to state another fault, the root text says, ‚ÄúMoreover, if the reason and the predicate of the proposition are the same, then the reason would not be established, and the predicate of the proposition would not be affirmed.‚Äù

original: dngos po ni don dam pa ste gtan tshigs kyi zla bo gang yin pa de ni mi srid pa ci 'di yang dag pa'i shes pa'am /
analyzed: dngos po ni don dam pa ste gtan tshigs kyi zla bo gang yin pa de ni mi srid pa ci 'di yang dag pa'i shes pa'am /
translated: The ultimate is the object. The counterpart of the reason is the predicate of the proposition. Is it impossible that the predicate of the proposition is a correct cognition, or is it the opposite of the predicate of the proposition, or is it the affirmation of the predicate of the proposition, or is it the opposite of the predicate of the proposition?üîΩOr is it the cognition that is the opposite of the predicate of the proposition?üîΩOr is it the reason that is the counterpart of the reason?üîΩOr is it the predicate of the proposition that is the counterpart of the reason?

original: bzlog pa nye bar bkod pa'am /
analyzed: bzlog pa nye bar bkod pa'am /
translated: Or is it the opposite of the predicate of the proposition?üîΩOr is it the cognition that is the opposite of the predicate of the proposition?üîΩOr is it the reason that is the counterpart of the reason?

original: bsgrub par bya'am de las zlog pa'i shes pa gtan tshigs su 'dod /üîΩgang las brjod par 'dod pa'i grangs gcig pa can gyi mtshan nyid du brjod /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya'am de las zlog pa'i shes pa gtan tshigs su 'dod / gang las brjod par 'dod pa'i grangs gcig pa can gyi mtshan nyid du brjod /
translated: Or is it the predicate of the proposition that is the counterpart of the reason?üîΩOr is it the opposite of the predicate of the proposition?üîΩOr is it the cognition that is the opposite of the predicate of the proposition?üîΩOr is it the reason that is the counterpart of the reason?üîΩOr is it the predicate of the proposition that is the counterpart of the reason?

original: yang na 'di gtan tshigs kyi zla bo de bsgrub par bya ba dang / bzlog pa sgrub par byed pa ma bstan pa zhig yin /üîΩdon dam par yod pa yin yang skyon gzhan ma mthong ngo snyam nas cir 'gyur zhes @317b bya ba smos so //
analyzed: yang na 'di gtan tshigs kyi zla bo de bsgrub par bya ba dang / bzlog pa sgrub par byed pa ma bstan pa zhig yin / don dam par yod pa yin yang skyon gzhan ma mthong ngo snyam nas cir 'gyur zhes @317b bya ba smos so //
translated: Or is it the opposite of the predicate of the proposition?üîΩOr is it the cognition that is the opposite of the predicate of the proposition?üîΩOr is it the reason that is the counterpart of the reason?üîΩOr is it the predicate of the proposition that is the counterpart of the reason?üîΩOr is it the opposite of the predicate of the proposition?üîΩOr is it the cognition that is the opposite of the predicate of the proposition?üîΩOr is it the reason that is the counterpart of the reason?üîΩOr is it the predicate of the proposition that is the counterpart of the reason?üîΩOr is it the opposite of the predicate of the proposition?üîΩOr is it the cognition that is the opposite of the predicate of the proposition?üîΩOr is it the reason that is the counterpart of the reason?üîΩOr is it the predicate of the proposition that is the counterpart of the reason?

original: gal te snga ma'i rnam par rtog pa'am phyi ma de la nyes pa ci zhig yod snyam pa'o //
analyzed: gal te snga ma'i rnam par rtog pa'am phyi ma de la nyes pa ci zhig yod snyam pa'o //
translated: Or is it the opposite of the predicate of the proposition?üîΩOr is

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas gal te gtan tshigs kyi zla bo mi srid pas yang dag pa'i shes pa la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs su 'dod na de'i tshe 'di mtshan nyid ma yin pa ni brjod par 'dod pa'i grangs gcig pa'o //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas gal te gtan tshigs kyi zla bo mi srid pas yang dag pa'i shes pa la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs su 'dod na de'i tshe 'di mtshan nyid ma yin pa ni brjod par 'dod pa'i grangs gcig pa'o //
translated: The proponent of tenets says: If you assert that the reason is a correct consciousness and so on because its counterpart is impossible, then at that time this is not a definition because it is a single enumeration that is not asserted.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: nges par bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges par bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible to ascertain.

original: gang gi dngos po la gtan tshigs kyi zla bo mi srid pa nyid du de bzhin du bshad do //
analyzed: gang gi dngos po la gtan tshigs kyi zla bo mi srid pa nyid du de bzhin du bshad do //
translated: The reason is explained in that way because its counterpart is impossible in that thing.

original: gzhan gyi 'dod pa la ltos nas 'di dag brjod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan gyi 'dod pa la ltos nas 'di dag brjod pa yin gyi /
translated: This is stated in reliance on the assertions of others.

original: gzhan dag gis mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag las 'brel pa med kyang med na mi 'byung ba 'dod pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag las 'brel pa med kyang med na mi 'byung ba 'dod pa de'i phyir /
translated: Even though there is no relationship between what others see and do not see, they assert that if something does not exist, it does not occur.

original: de'i gtan tshigs kyi zla bo rnam pa de lta bu yod pa srid pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i gtan tshigs kyi zla bo rnam pa de lta bu yod pa srid pa yin te /
translated: Therefore it is possible that the counterpart of that reason exists in that way.

original: de yang mi dmigs kyang res 'ga' zhig 'byung bas dngos po nyid la de med par ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang mi dmigs kyang res 'ga' zhig 'byung bas dngos po nyid la de med par ma nges pa yin te /
translated: Even though that is not observed, because it sometimes occurs, it is not ascertained that it does not exist in that thing.

original: 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis med na mi 'byung bar smra ba kho bo cag la ni gtan tshigs kyi zla bo mi srid do //
analyzed: 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis med na mi 'byung bar smra ba kho bo cag la ni gtan tshigs kyi zla bo mi srid do //
translated: But for us, who maintain that the reason is a non-observation of something that is related, it is impossible for there to be a counter-reason.

original: shin tu nges pa kho na ste /üîΩde'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa tshad mas grub pa'i med na mi 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan can gyi gtan tshigs gcig gis rang gi bsgrub par bya ba sgrub par byed pas slar yang de nyid kyi chos can la de'i mtshan nyid
analyzed: shin tu nges pa kho na ste / de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa tshad mas grub pa'i med na mi 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan can gyi gtan tshigs gcig gis rang gi bsgrub par bya ba sgrub par byed pas slar yang de nyid kyi chos can la de'i mtshan nyid
translated: It is quite certain that

original: de dang 'gal ba sgrub par byed pa'i 'grang zla'i gtan tshigs mi srid par nus so //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba sgrub par byed pa'i 'grang zla'i gtan tshigs mi srid par nus so //
translated: a single reason, which has the nature of a non-observation of something related, which is characterized by the identity or origination from it, and which is established by a valid cognition, proves its probandum. Therefore, it is impossible for there to be a counter-reason that proves the opposite of that reason with regard to the same subject.

original: dngos po rnams la 'gal ba'i rang bzhin gnyis mi rigs pas 'gal ba'i chos gnas na mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir dang / 'gal ba'i chos sgrub par byed pa srid na de nyid kyi rang gi bsgrub par bya ba la med na mi 'byung bar thog mar de la tshad mas yod par sgrub par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgal te dngos po la gtan tshigs kyi zla bo med par nges par kho bo cag gis nges par mi nus kyi de lta na yang gtan tshigs kyi zla bo mi srid pas brjod par 'dod pa'i grangs gcig pa bstun na gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid du 'dod
analyzed: dngos po rnams la 'gal ba'i rang bzhin gnyis mi rigs pas 'gal ba'i chos gnas na mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir dang / 'gal ba'i chos sgrub par byed pa srid na de nyid kyi rang gi bsgrub par bya ba la med na mi 'byung bar thog mar de la tshad mas yod par sgrub par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro // gal te dngos po la gtan tshigs kyi zla bo med par nges par kho bo cag gis nges par mi nus kyi de lta na yang gtan tshigs kyi zla bo mi srid pas brjod par 'dod pa'i grangs gcig pa bstun na gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid du 'dod
translated: Since it is not logical for things to have two contradictory natures, if contradictory phenomena were to abide, they would have different characteristics, and if it were possible to establish contradictory phenomena, it would be illogical to first establish them with valid knowledge in that which is not established without the presence of the probandum.

original: par gyur pa ci'i phyir ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: par gyur pa ci'i phyir ma yin zhe na /
translated: If we cannot ascertain that a thing lacks a counterpart of a reason, we cannot ascertain it. However, since a counterpart of a reason is impossible, why is it not asserted that the reason is the counterpart of the one that is wished to be expressed?

original: sgrub par byed pa'i chos ma nges pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i chos ma nges pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The text says, ‚ÄúThe property of the probandum is not ascertained,‚Äù and so on.

original: rtogs par byed pa'i chos kyi gtan tshigs de ma nges pa'i ngo bo @318a * //
analyzed: rtogs par byed pa'i chos kyi gtan tshigs de ma nges pa'i ngo bo @318a * //
translated: The reason that is the property that is to be realized is not ascertained.

original: yin na ni gang gi phyir de'i mtshan nyid ni sgrub par byed pa'i chos su mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: yin na ni gang gi phyir de'i mtshan nyid ni sgrub par byed pa'i chos su mi 'gyur te /
translated: If it were, then the reason would not be the property to be established,

original: dper na phyogs kyi chos the tshom can bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na phyogs kyi chos the tshom can bzhin no //
translated: just as the property of the subject in a doubtful syllogism is not.

original: the tshom can gyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni gtan tshigs ma yin pa 'gal yang gtan tshigs su mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: the tshom can gyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni gtan tshigs ma yin pa 'gal yang gtan tshigs su mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The reason is not a reason when it has the characteristic of being doubtful.

original: gang yang gtan tshigs kyi zla bo ma mthong ba de dngos po kho na la gtan tshigs kyi zla bo mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang yang gtan tshigs kyi zla bo ma mthong ba de dngos po kho na la gtan tshigs kyi zla bo mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And if the counter-reason is not seen, then the counter-reason is impossible in reality, because the reason is real.

original: dngos po de la gtan tshigs kyi zla bo mi srid par dogs na ni gnod par byed pa'i shes pa med na gnod par dogs pa ni mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po de la gtan tshigs kyi zla bo mi srid par dogs na ni gnod par byed pa'i shes pa med na gnod par dogs pa ni mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If you suspect that the counter-reason is impossible in that reality, then it is unreasonable to suspect that it is undermined without a cognition that undermines it.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: gnod pa'i shes pa ma skyes pas //
analyzed: gnod pa'i shes pa ma skyes pas //
translated: Without a cognition of undermining arising,

original: dogs pa tshad ma med na min //üîΩzhes bshad do zhe na /
analyzed: dogs pa tshad ma med na min // zhes bshad do zhe na /
translated: suspicion is not without valid cognition.

original: mtshan nyid mtshungs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid mtshungs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says ‚Äúhaving the same characteristic,‚Äù and so on.

original: gtan tshigs kyi zla bo la dogs pa ni mthong ba dang ma mthong ba'i rgyu mtshan gyi mtshan nyid mtshungs kyi med na mi 'byung ba de la mthong ba na 'gran zla'i gtan tshigs la gnod pa srid pa'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi zla bo la dogs pa ni mthong ba dang ma mthong ba'i rgyu mtshan gyi mtshan nyid mtshungs kyi med na mi 'byung ba de la mthong ba na 'gran zla'i gtan tshigs la gnod pa srid pa'o //
translated: The doubt about the counter-reasoning is that when the reason and the counter-reasoning have the same characteristic, and are invariably concomitant, then when the reason is seen, the counter-reasoning is possible.

original: gang gi phyir de dag kyang mtshan nyid mtshungs pa rnams ni 'gran zla ma mthong ba de rnams la yang gtan tshigs kyi zla bo srid pa'i yul dogs pa skyed par byed do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag kyang mtshan nyid mtshungs pa rnams ni 'gran zla ma mthong ba de rnams la yang gtan tshigs kyi zla bo srid pa'i yul dogs pa skyed par byed do //
translated: Because those which have the same characteristic, even when the counter-reasoning is not seen, generate the doubt that the counter-reasoning is possible.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: zla bo srid pa mthong ba dang zla bo ma mthong ba la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zla bo srid pa mthong ba dang zla bo ma mthong ba la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no difference between seeing the counter-reasoning and not seeing the counter-reasoning.

original: 'di dang cig shos la khyad par 'ga' yang med pa gang yin pa de la srid par dogs par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dang cig shos la khyad par 'ga' yang med pa gang yin pa de la srid par dogs par mi bya'o //
translated: If there is no difference between this and the other, then there should be no doubt about the possibility.

original: skyes bu'i nus pa ma tshang ba la sogs pas de mthong ba srid pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: skyes bu'i nus pa ma tshang ba la sogs pas de mthong ba srid pa yin zhe na /
translated: If you say that the possibility is seen due to the incompleteness of the person's ability, etc.,

original: des ci zhig //
analyzed: des ci zhig //
translated: what is the point of that?

original: brjod dogs tshad ma med na min //
analyzed: brjod dogs tshad ma med na min //
translated: It is not so if there is no valid cognition of the possibility.

original: zhes bya'o // yang na khyad par ni 'brel ba'i mtshan nyi med na mi 'byung bar nges par mthong bas gtan tshigs kyi zla bo ma mthong ngo zhes bya bar 'dod na ni gang gi tshe 'gran zla srid par dogs pa khas blangs pa nyams pa yin pa de'i tshe khyad
analyzed: zhes bya'o // yang na khyad par ni 'brel ba'i mtshan nyi med na mi 'byung bar nges par mthong bas gtan tshigs kyi zla bo ma mthong ngo zhes bya bar 'dod na ni gang gi tshe 'gran zla srid par dogs pa khas blangs pa nyams pa yin pa de'i tshe khyad
translated: Or else, if one maintains that the difference is that the reason is seen to be invariably concomitant with the probandum, and that the counter-example is not seen, then when one admits the possibility of a rival reason, one‚Äôs own position is undermined.

original: par yod na ni de gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: par yod na ni de gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: If there is a difference, then that is the definition of a reason.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir des gtan tshigs kyi khyad par gyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs cha gcig tu sel ba rnam pa de lta bu'i gtan tshigs srid pas rang gi bsgrub par bya ba nges par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir des gtan tshigs kyi khyad par gyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs cha gcig tu sel ba rnam pa de lta bu'i gtan tshigs srid pas rang gi bsgrub par bya ba nges par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, by that, the reason‚Äôs difference is ascertained, and the probandum is thereby excluded from a part of the discordant side.

original: rnam pa de lta bur mi 'gyur ba de ni khyad par spangs pa'i gtan tshigs kyi zla bo la ma mthong ba gang yin pa de mtshan nyid can @318b la ma yin pa gtan tshigs su mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bur mi 'gyur ba de ni khyad par spangs pa'i gtan tshigs kyi zla bo la ma mthong ba gang yin pa de mtshan nyid can @318b la ma yin pa gtan tshigs su mi 'gyur ro //
translated: That which is not such a reason, and is not seen to be a counter-example of the reason, which is devoid of the difference, is not a reason, because it does not have the characteristics of a reason.

original: de lta na yang gal te gtan tshigs dang zla bo'i gtan tshigs mthong ba'i rgyus ci zhig tu gyur na gang gis de ldog pa de la brjod par 'dod pa grangs gcig pa can du byed de /
analyzed: de lta na yang gal te gtan tshigs dang zla bo'i gtan tshigs mthong ba'i rgyus ci zhig tu gyur na gang gis de ldog pa de la brjod par 'dod pa grangs gcig pa can du byed de /
translated: In that case, if one sees a reason and a contradictory reason, what would be the point of making the assertion that the number of reasons is one?

original: ji skad bshad pa med na mi 'byung bar brjod pa kho nas de ldog par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa med na mi 'byung bar brjod pa kho nas de ldog par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If one says that the contradictory reason is refuted by the mere statement of the reason,

original: de lta na zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩgtan tshigs de'i khyad par dang 'brel pa la zla bo'i gtan tshigs srid par gyur na brjod par 'dod pa'i grangs gcig pa can dogs pa med do //
analyzed: de lta na zhes bya ba smos te / gtan tshigs de'i khyad par dang 'brel pa la zla bo'i gtan tshigs srid par gyur na brjod par 'dod pa'i grangs gcig pa can dogs pa med do //
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says, ‚ÄúIn that case‚Ä¶‚ÄùüîΩIf the connection between the reason and its predicate is possible, then there is no doubt that the number of reasons is one.

original: ji srid bshad pa'i khyad par khas blang ba mtshan nyid kyi gtan tshigs mi srid pas gang zhig brjod par 'dod pa'i grangs gcig pa rnam par gcod par byed pa yin /
analyzed: ji srid bshad pa'i khyad par khas blang ba mtshan nyid kyi gtan tshigs mi srid pas gang zhig brjod par 'dod pa'i grangs gcig pa rnam par gcod par byed pa yin /
translated: As long as one accepts the stated distinction, the reason that has the characteristics of a reason is impossible, and thus it eliminates the assertion that the number of reasons is one.

original: gang gis 'di don dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur ba ni 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can gyi gtan tshigs ltar snang bar rnam par gcod pa'i phyir /üîΩbrjod par 'dod pa'i grangs gcig pa can gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid du byed pa yin na /
analyzed: gang gis 'di don dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur ba ni 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can gyi gtan tshigs ltar snang bar rnam par gcod pa'i phyir / brjod par 'dod pa'i grangs gcig pa can gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid du byed pa yin na /
translated: The reason for this is that the definition of a correct sign is that it is a property of the logical subject and is an unmistaken contradictory object of knowledge.üîΩIf the definition of a correct sign is that it is a property of the logical subject and is an unmistaken contradictory object of knowledge, then since there is no rival correct sign in regard to an existent thing, the sign is established.

original: dngos po la 'gran zla'i gtan tshigs med pas gtan tshigs su grub pa ni 'brel ba mtshan nyid can gyi khyad par gyi gtan tshigs 'dod pa na 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can gyi gtan tshigs ltar snang ba srid par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos po la 'gran zla'i gtan tshigs med pas gtan tshigs su grub pa ni 'brel ba mtshan nyid can gyi khyad par gyi gtan tshigs 'dod pa na 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can gyi gtan tshigs ltar snang ba srid par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If one asserts that a sign is a specific property that is related to the logical subject, then it is impossible for there to be a sign that is a rival correct sign.

original: de las rnam par bcad pa med pas brjod par 'dod pa'i grangs gcig pa can du ci ste 'gyur snyam bstan pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de las rnam par bcad pa med pas brjod par 'dod pa'i grangs gcig pa can du ci ste 'gyur snyam bstan pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: If there is no exclusion of that, then why would it be the case that the definition of a correct sign is that it is a property of the logical subject and is an unmistaken contradictory object of knowledge?

original: 'brel pa'i mtshan nyid kyi khyad par khas blangs pas 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa nyams par 'gyur te mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa'i mtshan nyid kyi khyad par khas blangs pas 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa nyams par 'gyur te mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason is fallacious because it contradicts the definition of a reason that is nonerroneously related to the property.

original: yang 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa'i mtshan nyid ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa'i mtshan nyid ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is the definition of a nonerroneous contradiction?

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The text says, ‚ÄúThe property of the reason is its own nature,‚Äù and so on.

original: gtan tshigs kyi bdag nyid ni mtshan nyid gang yin pa de dang ldan pa'i gtan tshigs dag chos can gcig la 'gal ba bsgrub par bya ba dang ; sgrub par byed pa phan tshun 'gal ba 'du ba na 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi bdag nyid ni mtshan nyid gang yin pa de dang ldan pa'i gtan tshigs dag chos can gcig la 'gal ba bsgrub par bya ba dang ; sgrub par byed pa phan tshun 'gal ba 'du ba na 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When the property of the reason is its own nature, and the reason is related to that, and the contradictory property and the property to be proven are related to the same basis, then the contradiction is called nonerroneous.

original: 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa'i mtshan nyid rnams ni de dang 'brel ba khas blang bar 'gyur na mi srid do //
analyzed: 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa'i mtshan nyid rnams ni de dang 'brel ba khas blang bar 'gyur na mi srid do //
translated: The definition of a nonerroneous contradiction is related to that, but it is impossible.

original: de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba dag rang gi bsgrub par bya ba dang 'brel pa dang @319a * //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba dag rang gi bsgrub par bya ba dang 'brel pa dang @319a * //
translated: The nature of that and the arising from that are related to the property to be proven.

original: ldan pa gtan tshigs gcig ni chos can 'ga' zhig la srid pa yin gyi /
analyzed: ldan pa gtan tshigs gcig ni chos can 'ga' zhig la srid pa yin gyi /
translated: The reason is that the reason is possible in regard to some subjects,

original: gnyis pa de'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa de nyid la gtan tshigs mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis pa de'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa de nyid la gtan tshigs mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but it is impossible in regard to the very subjects that possess the characteristic of the second reason.

original: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin la 'gal ba rnam pa gnyis mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin la 'gal ba rnam pa gnyis mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible for the nature of things to be contradictory in two ways.

original: chos 'gal ba gnas na mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir de la mi 'khrul pa'i gtan tshigs gnyis pa de la srid pa'i go skabs su ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: chos 'gal ba gnas na mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir de la mi 'khrul pa'i gtan tshigs gnyis pa de la srid pa'i go skabs su ga la 'gyur //
translated: If contradictory properties are present, then because of the difference in characteristics, how could there be a second reason that is nonerroneous in regard to that?

original: 'o na ni gal te rnam pa de lta bu khyad par yod par gyur na ni 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa nyams par 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'o na ni gal te rnam pa de lta bu khyad par yod par gyur na ni 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa nyams par 'gyur na /
translated: But if there were such a difference, then the nonerroneous contradiction would be lost.

original: brjod par 'dod pa'i grangs gcig pa can med do //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa'i grangs gcig pa can med do //
translated: But there is no single number that is intended to be expressed.

original: de lta na yang gtan tshigs med par thal bar mi 'gyur na gtan tshigs med par des bshad pas ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na yang gtan tshigs med par thal bar mi 'gyur na gtan tshigs med par des bshad pas ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: Even if that is so, if it does not follow that there is no reason, then what is the point of explaining that there is no reason?

original: khyad par de'i ngo bo yang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: khyad par de'i ngo bo yang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe nature of that difference,‚Äù etc.

original: 'brel ba'i mtshan nyid ni gang gi phyir dngos po la 'gran zla'i gtan tshigs mi srid pas de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid nges pa'i ngo bor khyod kyis ma bstan gyi /
analyzed: 'brel ba'i mtshan nyid ni gang gi phyir dngos po la 'gran zla'i gtan tshigs mi srid pas de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid nges pa'i ngo bor khyod kyis ma bstan gyi /
translated: The definition of a relation is this: since a rival reason is impossible for a thing, you have not taught its nature as ascertained by the definition of identity or origination.

original: kho bo cag gis ni ji lta ba bstan to //
analyzed: kho bo cag gis ni ji lta ba bstan to //
translated: But we have taught it as it is.

original: gang zhig gang gi ngo bor rtogs nas zla bo ni mi rtogs pas srid dam mi srid pa dag blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi ngo bor rtogs nas zla bo ni mi rtogs pas srid dam mi srid pa dag blta bar bya'o //
translated: One should see whether it is possible or impossible for something to be realized as the nature of something else, so that its rival is not realized.

original: gang la khyad par dang bcas pa med pa de la 'gran zla srid pa de yin te /
analyzed: gang la khyad par dang bcas pa med pa de la 'gran zla srid pa de yin te /
translated: For that which has no distinction, a rival is possible.

original: lung la brten pa'i rjes su dpag pas rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: lung la brten pa'i rjes su dpag pas rtogs par byed do //
translated: One realizes it by inference based on scripture.

original: gang la khyad par dang bcas pa yod pa'i dngos po stobs kyis zhugs pa'i rjes su dpag pa de la sbyor ba'i zla bo mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang la khyad par dang bcas pa yod pa'i dngos po stobs kyis zhugs pa'i rjes su dpag pa de la sbyor ba'i zla bo mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For that thing which has a distinction, the rival of the application is impossible for the inference which engages by the power of the thing.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar de bas na dngos po la khyad par med pa kho nas khyed rnams shes par byed pa la yang khyad par med pa kho na yin pas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar de bas na dngos po la khyad par med pa kho nas khyed rnams shes par byed pa la yang khyad par med pa kho na yin pas so //
translated: Since it is so, therefore, since there is no difference in the thing, there is no difference in the cognition of it.

original: de'i phyir thams cad du gang la yang sbyor ba'i zla bo ma mthong /
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad du gang la yang sbyor ba'i zla bo ma mthong /
translated: Therefore, in every case, one does not see a rival application for anything.

original: de la yang sbyor ba'i zla ba'o //
analyzed: de la yang sbyor ba'i zla ba'o //
translated: And for that, there is a rival application.

original: yul la dogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul la dogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Doubt about the object arises.

original: de nyid kyi dogs pa bstan par byed pa ni zla bo'i gtan tshigs mthong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi dogs pa bstan par byed pa ni zla bo'i gtan tshigs mthong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To show just that doubt, he says, ‚ÄúWhen the rival reason is seen,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang yang zla bo'i gtan tshigs mthong ba de yang dang por 'gran zla mthong ba dang cig shos dus thams cad du zla bo ma mthong bas khyad par cung zad kyang mi rtogs so //
analyzed: gang yang zla bo'i gtan tshigs mthong ba de yang dang por 'gran zla mthong ba dang cig shos dus thams cad du zla bo ma mthong bas khyad par cung zad kyang mi rtogs so //
translated: Also, when the rival reason is seen, first, one sees the rival, and later, at all times, one does not see the rival, so one does not understand any difference at all.

original: gang mthong ba las shes pa de la 'gran zla srid pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang mthong ba las shes pa de la 'gran zla srid pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: That which is known from seeing has the possibility of a rival, but not the other.

original: mthong ba dang ma mthong ba tsam gyi rgyu @319b mtshan gyis rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag thams cad du mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba dang ma mthong ba tsam gyi rgyu @319b mtshan gyis rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag thams cad du mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the reason for seeing and not seeing is the same in all cases.

original: de lta na yang phyi nas de la 'gran zla'i sbyor ba mthong bar gyur na thams cad du de'i mtshan nyid mtshungs par 'gran zla yod par dogs par ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang phyi nas de la 'gran zla'i sbyor ba mthong bar gyur na thams cad du de'i mtshan nyid mtshungs par 'gran zla yod par dogs par ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Even so, if one later sees a rival application, then one will not stop doubting that it has a rival, since its characteristics are the same in all cases.

original: gal te gang dag 'gran zla srid pa de rnams la gdon mi za bar res 'ga' zhig 'di dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te gang dag 'gran zla srid pa de rnams la gdon mi za bar res 'ga' zhig 'di dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is possible that there is a rival, then it is impossible that it is sometimes perceived.

original: yang na skyes bu'i chos kyang de dag dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na skyes bu'i chos kyang de dag dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Or else, it is impossible that the human qualities are perceived.

original: gal te de rnams la 'di med pa nyid des na rnam pa de lta bu gtan tshigs de 'byung ba yin na de ji ltar gtan tshigs de kho bo cag la med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de rnams la 'di med pa nyid des na rnam pa de lta bu gtan tshigs de 'byung ba yin na de ji ltar gtan tshigs de kho bo cag la med pa yin zhe na /
translated: If it is the case that it is the absence of that in those that is the reason, then how could that reason be absent in our case?

original: gang zla bo'i gtan tshigs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang zla bo'i gtan tshigs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If you say that the reason is a rival, etc.,

original: gang dag la 'gran zla'i gtan tshigs srid pa de rnams la yang thams cad du de'i zla bo'i gtan tshigs rtogs par byed pa rnams kyis dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang dag la 'gran zla'i gtan tshigs srid pa de rnams la yang thams cad du de'i zla bo'i gtan tshigs rtogs par byed pa rnams kyis dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: But even in those cases where rival reasons are possible, the reasoner who is seeking a rival reason will not always find one.

original: thams cad gzigs pa'i dmigs pas ni dngos po yod pa thams cad la khyab pa yin te /
analyzed: thams cad gzigs pa'i dmigs pas ni dngos po yod pa thams cad la khyab pa yin te /
translated: The reasoner who sees all will have a reason that covers all existing things.

original: 'brel pa ma tshang ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa ma tshang ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the non-observation of a related, absent object is a reason.

original: 'o na ni gang la thams cad du rtogs par byed pas 'gran zla ma mthong ba de la de'i tshe dogs pa ji ltar yin /
analyzed: 'o na ni gang la thams cad du rtogs par byed pas 'gran zla ma mthong ba de la de'i tshe dogs pa ji ltar yin /
translated: But if you say that when a reasoner does not see a rival reason anywhere, then how can there be any doubt about it at that time?

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: gnod pa'i shes pa ma skyes na //
analyzed: gnod pa'i shes pa ma skyes na //
translated: When a reason for error has not arisen,

original: dogs pa tshad ma med na min //
analyzed: dogs pa tshad ma med na min //
translated: doubt is not possible without a reason.

original: zhes bshad do //üîΩde bzhin du 'ang pha rol gyis //
analyzed: zhes bshad do // de bzhin du 'ang pha rol gyis //
translated: And also:

original: nye bar brtags la rmongs pas na //
analyzed: nye bar brtags la rmongs pas na //
translated: Because of confusion about what is to be examined,

original: gnod par byed pa'ang ma skyes na //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa'ang ma skyes na //
translated: even when a reason for error has not arisen,

original: tha snyad bya ba thams cad la //
analyzed: tha snyad bya ba thams cad la //
translated: in all cases of verbal usage,

original: the tshom zad pa dag rjes 'brang 'gyur //
analyzed: the tshom zad pa dag rjes 'brang 'gyur //
translated: doubt will follow.

original: zhes smra'o // shes rab phul du byung ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes smra'o // shes rab phul du byung ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Those who possess the highest wisdom, etc.

original: de lta na 'jal bar byed pa kha cig rtsva ku sha'i rtse mo lta bu shin tu phul du byung ba'i shes rab dang ldan pas gtan tshigs kyi zla bo brtags na kho bo cag gis mthong ste /
analyzed: de lta na 'jal bar byed pa kha cig rtsva ku sha'i rtse mo lta bu shin tu phul du byung ba'i shes rab dang ldan pas gtan tshigs kyi zla bo brtags na kho bo cag gis mthong ste /
translated: Thus, some logicians who are like the tip of the ku≈õa grass possess the highest wisdom, and when they examine the counterparts of our reasons, we see that they are like the following.

original: dper na rig byed kyi byed pa po sel ba'i gtan tshigs bde bar gshegs pa slob ma dang yang slob brgyud pas gzhon nu ma len skyes pa'i snga rol 'gran zla'i sbyor ba rnams nye bar dgod pa ma mthong ba de nyid shes rab phul du byung bar
analyzed: dper na rig byed kyi byed pa po sel ba'i gtan tshigs bde bar gshegs pa slob ma dang yang slob brgyud pas gzhon nu ma len skyes pa'i snga rol 'gran zla'i sbyor ba rnams nye bar dgod pa ma mthong ba de nyid shes rab phul du byung bar
translated: For example, the opponent of the argument refuting the creator of the Vedas, the followers of the Sugata, and their students and students‚Äô students, did not see any rival arguments prior to the birth of KumƒÅrila.

original: sbyar bas gtan tshigs kyi zla bo brtags na /
analyzed: sbyar bas gtan tshigs kyi zla bo brtags na /
translated: But when he applied his highest wisdom,

original: de dang de mthong bas ji srid 'tsho'i bar du zla bo'i gtan tshigs mthong bas 'de'i dogs pa nam yang ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dang de mthong bas ji srid 'tsho'i bar du zla bo'i gtan tshigs mthong bas 'de'i dogs pa nam yang ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: he saw them, and as long as he lives, he will never be able to stop his fear of seeing rival arguments.

original: @320a * // des na ji ltar dogs pa tshad ma med pa can yin zhes brjod /
analyzed: @320a * // des na ji ltar dogs pa tshad ma med pa can yin zhes brjod /
translated: Therefore, how could it be said that the qualm is without a valid cognition?

original: mtshan nyid mtshungs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang 'gran zla srid pa'i dogs pa'i rgyu bshad zin pa nyid de /
analyzed: mtshan nyid mtshungs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang 'gran zla srid pa'i dogs pa'i rgyu bshad zin pa nyid de /
translated: As for the statement ‚Äúhaving a similar characteristic,‚Äù etc., the cause for the qualm that a competitor might exist has already been explained.

original: zla bo srid par dogs pa la de'i rgyu mtshan srid pas rtogs pa la sogs pas bltas pa tsam gyis bzlog par mi nus so //
analyzed: zla bo srid par dogs pa la de'i rgyu mtshan srid pas rtogs pa la sogs pas bltas pa tsam gyis bzlog par mi nus so //
translated: When one doubts that a competitor might exist, one cannot stop the doubt simply by looking at the reason for the existence of the competitor, such as by ascertaining the pervasion.

original: des 'gran zla'i sbyor ba 'di khyad du bsad pa'i rgyu cung zad cig brjod par bya dgos te /
analyzed: des 'gran zla'i sbyor ba 'di khyad du bsad pa'i rgyu cung zad cig brjod par bya dgos te /
translated: Therefore, one must state some reason for disregarding the competitor‚Äôs argument.

original: dper na kho bo cag gis rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs su brjod pa la bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma'i dbang gis de'i bdag nyid du nges pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa yod pa gtan la phab pa dang / 'bra bu'i gtan tshigs kha du bsad pa'i rgyu cung zad cig brjod par bya dgos te /
analyzed: dper na kho bo cag gis rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs su brjod pa la bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma'i dbang gis de'i bdag nyid du nges pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa yod pa gtan la phab pa dang / 'bra bu'i gtan tshigs kha du bsad pa'i rgyu cung zad cig brjod par bya dgos te /
translated: For example, in the case of our statement of a reason based on nature, the existence of the forward pervasion and the counter pervasion, which are ascertained to have the same nature as the predicate by the power of a valid cognition that undermines the opposite of the predicate, is established.

original: dper na kho bo cag gis rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs su brjod pa la bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma'i dbang gis de'i bdag nyid du nges pa'i rjes su mthong ba de'i rgyus ni ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: dper na kho bo cag gis rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs su brjod pa la bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma'i dbang gis de'i bdag nyid du nges pa'i rjes su mthong ba de'i rgyus ni ma nges pa yin te /
translated: For example, in the case of our statement of a reason based on nature, the ascertainment of the pervasion by the power of valid knowledge that contradicts the reverse of that is the cause of the ascertainment of the pervasion.

original: zla bo srid pa dang mi srid pa dag ni 'dir zla bo srid pa yin no zhes de lta bu'i ngo bo nges pa yin pa de'i phyir dngos po la gtan tshigs kyi 'gran zla mi srid pa gang yin pa de gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid de ni
analyzed: zla bo srid pa dang mi srid pa dag ni 'dir zla bo srid pa yin no zhes de lta bu'i ngo bo nges pa yin pa de'i phyir dngos po la gtan tshigs kyi 'gran zla mi srid pa gang yin pa de gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid de ni
translated: Since the possibility and impossibility of the opposite are ascertained here, the nature of the reason is ascertained. Therefore, the definition of a reason is that which is impossible in the face of the opposite of the property of the subject.

original: ma nges pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma nges pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of that, it is not ascertained.

original: brjod par 'dod ba'i grangs gcig par smra ba rnams la cung zad cig kyang gtan tshigs su mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod ba'i grangs gcig par smra ba rnams la cung zad cig kyang gtan tshigs su mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, for those who assert the one-sided, the reason is not established.

original: ma nges pa ni gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid du mi 'gyur ba'i mjug bsdu ba ni des na de ltar na ci 'dod par la mi srid pa'i gtan tshigs zla bo gang yin pa de ni yan dag pa'i shes pa'i gtan tshigs las bzlog par 'dod pa yin
analyzed: ma nges pa ni gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid du mi 'gyur ba'i mjug bsdu ba ni des na de ltar na ci 'dod par la mi srid pa'i gtan tshigs zla bo gang yin pa de ni yan dag pa'i shes pa'i gtan tshigs las bzlog par 'dod pa yin
translated: The summary of the reason why indefinite is not a characteristic of a reason is ‚ÄúTherefore, in that case, whatever is a reason that is impossible for any desired property is asserted as the opposite of a correct reason.‚Äù

original: no // rang gi rnam par rtog pa bsal nas rna par rtog pa gnyis ba bas la 'khar dod nas 'on te zla bo'i gtan tshigs rab tu ma bstan pa zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: no // rang gi rnam par rtog pa bsal nas rna par rtog pa gnyis ba bas la 'khar dod nas 'on te zla bo'i gtan tshigs rab tu ma bstan pa zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Having cleared away his own conception, he states the second conception, ‚ÄúOr, is it that a counterexample is not taught?‚Äù

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa las bzlog pa'i gtan tshigs su 'dod pa'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa las bzlog pa'i gtan tshigs su 'dod pa'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: One should add, ‚ÄúIt is asserted as a reason that is the opposite of a correct reason.‚Äù

original: 'di'i phyogs kyang slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po yang bzhed pa yin par gzhan gyis bstan pa ni 'di skad du zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di'i phyogs kyang slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po yang bzhed pa yin par gzhan gyis bstan pa ni 'di skad du zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The master DignƒÅga also asserts this position. The statement by another that ‚ÄúIt is like this‚Äù is as follows.

original: slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos ci zhig bshad ce na 'o na ni gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos ci zhig bshad ce na 'o na ni gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He said, ‚ÄúWhen someone says sound is permanent because it is audible,

original: mnyan @320b par bya ba'i mtshan nyid phyogs kyi chos kyi gtan tshigs nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: mnyan @320b par bya ba'i mtshan nyid phyogs kyi chos kyi gtan tshigs nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: the definition of what is to be heard becomes the reason, the property of the subject.

original: sgra ni rtag pa yin te mnyan par bya ba yin pa'i phyir sgra bzhin no zhes de skad du gzhan gyis bshad par gyur pa la slob dpon gyis sgrar bshad pa'i chos can gang dang gang la mi rtag pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs byas pa nyid dang rtsol
analyzed: sgra ni rtag pa yin te mnyan par bya ba yin pa'i phyir sgra bzhin no zhes de skad du gzhan gyis bshad par gyur pa la slob dpon gyis sgrar bshad pa'i chos can gang dang gang la mi rtag pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs byas pa nyid dang rtsol
translated: Sound is permanent because it is audible, just as sound is.‚Äù

original: ba las byung ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid 'ga' zhig bye brag pa la sogs pa mi ston pa de'i tshe khyed kyi gtan tshigs 'di 'gran zla nyid ma bstan par gyur na zhes bya ba bshad pa lta bu'o zhe na /
analyzed: ba las byung ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid 'ga' zhig bye brag pa la sogs pa mi ston pa de'i tshe khyed kyi gtan tshigs 'di 'gran zla nyid ma bstan par gyur na zhes bya ba bshad pa lta bu'o zhe na /
translated: When someone else explains it in this way, the master Dignaga said, ‚ÄúWhen someone does not teach the characteristics of the reason, such as being a product or being derived from effort, to a Vaisesika and so on, then at that time your reason is not taught to have a rival.‚Äù

original: de skad du de slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas dbang po yin pas phyag brkyang nas bstan bcos mdzad pas sngon mdzad pa yin te /
analyzed: de skad du de slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas dbang po yin pas phyag brkyang nas bstan bcos mdzad pas sngon mdzad pa yin te /
translated: The master Vasubandhu, who is endowed with the eye of knowledge, extended his hand and composed this treatise.

original: 'di ni de ni zhes bya ba la gang gi tshe slob dpon yang de bzhed pa yin no zhes 'ga' zhig 'chad pa de dang de dag ni ches shin tu nyon mongs par gyur pa ji lta bar byas pa'i phyir bsgrags su mi rung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de ni zhes bya ba la gang gi tshe slob dpon yang de bzhed pa yin no zhes 'ga' zhig 'chad pa de dang de dag ni ches shin tu nyon mongs par gyur pa ji lta bar byas pa'i phyir bsgrags su mi rung ba'o //
translated: Some explain that the phrase ‚Äúthis is said by him‚Äù means that the master also accepts this. But they are not to be trusted, since they have acted in a way that is extremely offensive.

original: bla ma'i skyon bsgrags su mi rung ba dang rigs pa'i rjes su 'brang ba rnams kyis bcab tu mi rung ba ste sba bar mi rung ba'o //
analyzed: bla ma'i skyon bsgrags su mi rung ba dang rigs pa'i rjes su 'brang ba rnams kyis bcab tu mi rung ba ste sba bar mi rung ba'o //
translated: It is not proper to proclaim the faults of one‚Äôs guru, and it is not proper to conceal the faults of one who is a follower of reasoning.

original: des na ci bla ma'i skyon brjod dam yang na rigs pa la ltos par bya ba yang yin /
analyzed: des na ci bla ma'i skyon brjod dam yang na rigs pa la ltos par bya ba yang yin /
translated: So, is it the faults of the guru that are being stated, or is it the faults of one who is a follower of reasoning?
