original: des gnyi ga yang mi nus pa'i phyir ches shin tu nyon mongs par gyur ba ji ltar rgal bar nus pa yin te res 'ga' yang ma yin no //üîΩ'di la nyes pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: des gnyi ga yang mi nus pa'i phyir ches shin tu nyon mongs par gyur ba ji ltar rgal bar nus pa yin te res 'ga' yang ma yin no //üîΩ'di la nyes pa ci zhig yod /
translated: Since he is unable to do either, how could he be one who is able to cross over the extremely offensive? He is not able to do so at all.

original: gang gis na 'di shin tu nyon mongs pa yin /
analyzed: gang gis na 'di shin tu nyon mongs pa yin /
translated: How is this a great affliction?

original: re zhig gtan tshigs 'di zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: re zhig gtan tshigs 'di zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says: ‚Äúbecause of this reason,‚Äù

original: mnyan par bya ba nyid la sogs pa gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mnyan par bya ba nyid la sogs pa gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: and so on. The definition of a reason is that which is to be heard.

original: dngos po ni sgra la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po ni sgra la sogs pa'o //
translated: A thing is sound and so on.

original: rang gi bsgrub par bya ba'i de nyid ni rtag pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi bsgrub par bya ba'i de nyid ni rtag pa'o //
translated: Its reality is its permanence.

original: de'i rang bzhin ni de'i bdag nyid du byas pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ni de'i bdag nyid du byas pa'o //
translated: Its nature is its essence.

original: de mnyan bya nyid la tshad ma can gang dag gis so //
analyzed: de mnyan bya nyid la tshad ma can gang dag gis so //
translated: Those who are authoritative with regard to its being what is to be heard are the sages.

original: skyes bu rnams ni dpyod pa dang bya ka ra na ba la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: skyes bu rnams ni dpyod pa dang bya ka ra na ba la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The sages are those who are engaged in analysis, in the performance of their duties, and so on.

original: des mngon par mtho ba ni mtho ris so //
analyzed: des mngon par mtho ba ni mtho ris so //
translated: By them, the higher realms are the higher status.

original: nges par legs pa ni byad grol la sbyor bar byed de /
analyzed: nges par legs pa ni byad grol la sbyor bar byed de /
translated: The definite goodness is the attainment of liberation.

original: de lta na dngos po'i de kho na nyid bsgoms pas nyon mongs pa ma spangs na ni re zhig mtho ris su skye bar byed do //
analyzed: de lta na dngos po'i de kho na nyid bsgoms pas nyon mongs pa ma spangs na ni re zhig mtho ris su skye bar byed do //
translated: Thus, if the reality of things is cultivated but the afflictions are not abandoned, then one is born in the higher realms for a while.

original: nyon mongs pa spangs pa yin na ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i pha rol tu byon par 'gyur ro //üîΩyang na sgra rtag pa nyid du rtogs pa'i rig byed @321a * //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spangs pa yin na ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i pha rol tu byon par 'gyur ro // yang na sgra rtag pa nyid du rtogs pa'i rig byed @321a * //
translated: If it were the case that the afflictions were abandoned, then one would have gone beyond nirvana.

original: tshad mar byed pas me la mchod sbyin la sogs pas mtho ris sgrub bar byed la rig byed kyi mtha' bsten pa las byad grol yin no //
analyzed: tshad mar byed pas me la mchod sbyin la sogs pas mtho ris sgrub bar byed la rig byed kyi mtha' bsten pa las byad grol yin no //
translated: Or, one would establish heaven through the performance of fire sacrifices, etc., by taking the Veda as a valid means of knowledge in the understanding of the permanence of sound.üîΩAnd one would be liberated through the study of the Vedanta.

original: khyed shes rab kyi rigs kyis bye brag pa la sogs pa skyes bu sam byas pa las gzhan pa'i gtan tshigs 'gran zla'i gtan tshigs bstan ni gang 'dir rtag pa nyid sgrub par byed pa'i gzhung 'jug pa ni gtan tshigs 'gran zla ma bstan na ni 'grub bo
analyzed: khyed shes rab kyi rigs kyis bye brag pa la sogs pa skyes bu sam byas pa las gzhan pa'i gtan tshigs 'gran zla'i gtan tshigs bstan ni gang 'dir rtag pa nyid sgrub par byed pa'i gzhung 'jug pa ni gtan tshigs 'gran zla ma bstan na ni 'grub bo
translated: You, however, by the power of your wisdom, have taught the arguments that are the rivals of the arguments of the Vai≈õe·π£ikas, etc., and so the presentation of the proof of permanence here is established when the rival arguments are not presented.

original: // de nye bar bstan de bas la ba yin no //
analyzed: // de nye bar bstan de bas la ba yin no //
translated: But when they are presented, it is not.

original: dngos po de dag dang ni rtag pa nyid kyi phun sum tshogs pa las nyams pas de tshad mar byed pa'i skyes bu rnams mtho ris dang byang grol phun sum tshogs pa nyams pa'i mnyan bya'i mtshan nyid kyi gtan tshigs dus ba ma tshang bas skyob par byed
analyzed: dngos po de dag dang ni rtag pa nyid kyi phun sum tshogs pa las nyams pas de tshad mar byed pa'i skyes bu rnams mtho ris dang byang grol phun sum tshogs pa nyams pa'i mnyan bya'i mtshan nyid kyi gtan tshigs dus ba ma tshang bas skyob par byed
translated: And since they have fallen from the perfection of permanence, the people who take them as valid cognition have fallen from the perfection of high rebirth and liberation.

original: mi nus pa ni rgyal srid shor ba ltar dka' thub kyi nags tshal du 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: mi nus pa ni rgyal srid shor ba ltar dka' thub kyi nags tshal du 'gro ba ste /
translated: They are unable to protect, like someone who has lost his kingdom going to the forest of ascetics.

original: rang nyid nyes par brjod pas 'dir khyed kyis ji skad du smra par bya ;üîΩde nyid bzhad gang du byed pa'i de'i phyogs la skyon bstan pa ni sgrub pa nyid skyes bus spobs ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rang nyid nyes par brjod pas 'dir khyed kyis ji skad du smra par bya ; de nyid bzhad gang du byed pa'i de'i phyogs la skyon bstan pa ni sgrub pa nyid skyes bus spobs ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Since you have been criticized for your faults, what can you say here?üîΩTo show the fault in his position, he says, ‚ÄúThe proof is just the person‚Äôs confidence . . .‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe 'gran zla gtan tshigs ma bstan pa gtan tshigs su 'dod pa de'i tshe skyes bu'i spobs pas byas pa'i sgrub par byed par khas blangs bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'gran zla gtan tshigs ma bstan pa gtan tshigs su 'dod pa de'i tshe skyes bu'i spobs pas byas pa'i sgrub par byed par khas blangs bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When you assert that the absence of a reason that is a rival reason is a reason, then you accept that the proof is made by the person‚Äôs confidence.

original: des kyang dngos bo las cung zad cig sgrub pa dang sgrub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des kyang dngos bo las cung zad cig sgrub pa dang sgrub pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not that it establishes something slightly different from the thing.

original: de ltar na gang gi tshe gtan tshigs kyi 'gran zla ba bstan ba de'i tshe sgrub bar byed ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar na gang gi tshe gtan tshigs kyi 'gran zla ba bstan ba de'i tshe sgrub bar byed ba'o //
translated: Thus, when the opponent's reason is shown to be inconclusive, then it is a proof.

original: gang gi tshe bstan pa de'i tshe sgrub ba ma yin pas skyes bu'i spobs bas byas pa'i sgrub par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe bstan pa de'i tshe sgrub ba ma yin pas skyes bu'i spobs bas byas pa'i sgrub par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: When it is shown to be inconclusive, then it is not a proof. Therefore, a proof is made by the person's eloquence.

original: gzhan yang 'gran zla'i gtan tshigs ma bstan pa'i gtan tshigs de gtan tshigs su khas len par byed na rnam par rtog pa gnyis te ci don dam par na gtan tshigs de'i chos yod pa'am yang na de ma yin pa'i chos yod pa yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'gran zla'i gtan tshigs ma bstan pa'i gtan tshigs de gtan tshigs su khas len par byed na rnam par rtog pa gnyis te ci don dam par na gtan tshigs de'i chos yod pa'am yang na de ma yin pa'i chos yod pa yin /
translated: Moreover, when one accepts a reason that does not show a contradictory reason, there are two alternatives: either that reason has the property in the object or it does not have that property.

original: de la rnam par rtog ba dang po'i dbang du byas nas gtan tshigs de yang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de la rnam par rtog ba dang po'i dbang du byas nas gtan tshigs de yang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: With respect to that, in consideration of the first alternative, it says, that reason also.

original: thog ma'i khyad par de ni gang gi ngo bo nyid kho na de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos yod par gyur na de lta bu'i rang bzhin las mngon par 'dod pa'i 'brel ba gang yin pa 'dod na de'i tshe ji ltar gzhan du byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: thog ma'i khyad par de ni gang gi ngo bo nyid kho na de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos yod par gyur na de lta bu'i rang bzhin las mngon par 'dod pa'i 'brel ba gang yin pa 'dod na de'i tshe ji ltar gzhan du byed par 'gyur /
translated: The difference between the two is that when the property to be proven exists in the nature of the reason, then the relation of the reason to the property to be proven is as asserted. But if the reason is different from the property to be proven, then how can it be the reason?

original: gtan tshigs gzhan @321b de ma yin pa'i chos yod par ji ltar byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: gtan tshigs gzhan @321b de ma yin pa'i chos yod par ji ltar byed par 'gyur /
translated: How can the reason be different from the property to be proven?

original: rnam pa 'ga' zhig kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa 'ga' zhig kyang ma yin no //
translated: In no way at all.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: dngos po rnams ni gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid gang gi ngo bo yod pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba'i chos yod pa'i bdag nyid de las gzhan du byung pa ni de las bzlog pa ste med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po rnams ni gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid gang gi ngo bo yod pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba'i chos yod pa'i bdag nyid de las gzhan du byung pa ni de las bzlog pa ste med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nature of things is such that when the reason exists, the property to be proven exists. If the reason were different from the property to be proven, then the reason would be the opposite of the property to be proven.

original: rang gi bsgrub par bya ba'i chos med na ni 'byung ba'i rang bzhin kho na chos can gcig la dngos po gnyis 'gal bas gnyi ga'i rang bzhin gcig tu gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi bsgrub par bya ba'i chos med na ni 'byung ba'i rang bzhin kho na chos can gcig la dngos po gnyis 'gal bas gnyi ga'i rang bzhin gcig tu gyur ba'o //
translated: If the property to be proven does not exist, then the nature of the reason would be to occur in one locus and not in another. But this is impossible, because two contradictory properties cannot belong to one thing.

original: gcig la 'gal ba gnyis kyi ngo bo nyid mi srid do //
analyzed: gcig la 'gal ba gnyis kyi ngo bo nyid mi srid do //
translated: It is impossible for a single thing to have the nature of two contradictory things.

original: 'gal ba'i chos gnas pa de'i gcig pa nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i chos gnas pa de'i gcig pa nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If contradictory properties were to exist in a single thing, then the unity of that thing would be destroyed.

original: yang rnam par rtog ba gnyis pa yin pa de'i tshe de ma yin pa'i chos yod pa can med na yang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi ngang tshul can dang 'brel par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang rnam par rtog ba gnyis pa yin pa de'i tshe de ma yin pa'i chos yod pa can med na yang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi ngang tshul can dang 'brel par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, if the second alternative is the case, then even if the property of being nonexistent were to exist in the property of being existent, you would still have to accept that the property of being existent is related to the property of being existent.

original: ji ltar gzhan las kyang 'gran zla'i gtan tshigs ma bstan par gnas skabs su yang 'ga' zhig gis sgrub par byed pa yin //
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan las kyang 'gran zla'i gtan tshigs ma bstan par gnas skabs su yang 'ga' zhig gis sgrub par byed pa yin //
translated: Just as in the case of other [properties], even if a countering reason is not stated, sometimes a property-possessor is established.

original: de la sgrub par byed pa ma yin te gtan tshigs bstan pa'i gnas skabs 'ga' zhig ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la sgrub par byed pa ma yin te gtan tshigs bstan pa'i gnas skabs 'ga' zhig ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that sometimes a property-possessor is not established even if a reason is stated.

original: mjug bsdu ba ni de lta bas na ngo bo nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba ni de lta bas na ngo bo nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The summary is stated from ‚ÄúTherefore, by nature‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin ni gzhan du bya bar mi nus pas 'gal ba gnyis kyi ngo bo yang gcig la mi srid pas de'i phyir don dam par na rang rang gi bsgrub par bya ba la med na mi 'byung bar jiüîΩskad bshad pa'i mtshan nyid kyis rang bzhin dang 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs de'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid la 'gran zla'i gtan tshigs mi srid pa'i phyir rjod par 'dod pa'i grangs gcig pa ni mtshan nyid ma yin pas rjod par 'dod pa'i grangs
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin ni gzhan du bya bar mi nus pas 'gal ba gnyis kyi ngo bo yang gcig la mi srid pas de'i phyir don dam par na rang rang gi bsgrub par bya ba la med na mi 'byung bar ji skad bshad pa'i mtshan nyid kyis rang bzhin dang 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs de'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid la 'gran zla'i gtan tshigs mi srid pa'i phyir rjod par 'dod pa'i grangs gcig pa ni mtshan nyid ma yin pas rjod par 'dod pa'i grangs
translated: Because in that case, the essence of things cannot be made otherwise, and it is impossible for the nature of two contradictory things to be the same. Therefore, ultimately, if the reason is not a necessary condition for its probandum, then it is not a correct reason.üîΩThe reason is not a correct reason because it is impossible for a contradictory reason to exist in the definition of a reason that has the characteristics of an effect or nature, as explained.

original: gcig pa can gyi mtshan nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: gcig pa can gyi mtshan nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the definition of a reason that has the characteristics of an effect or nature is not one that has the number one as desired.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rnam par gcad par bya ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rnam par gcad par bya ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is said, ‚Äúbecause of the object of exclusion, etc.‚Äù

original: rjod par 'dod pa'i grangs gcig pas 'gran zla'i gtan tshigs rnam par gcad par bya bar brjod do //
analyzed: rjod par 'dod pa'i grangs gcig pas 'gran zla'i gtan tshigs rnam par gcad par bya bar brjod do //
translated: The number one as desired is said to be the object of exclusion of a contradictory reason.

original: yang na 'gran zla'i gtan tshigs su rigs kyi 'bras bu dang rang bzhin ma yin @322a * //
analyzed: yang na 'gran zla'i gtan tshigs su rigs kyi 'bras bu dang rang bzhin ma yin @322a * //
translated: Or, the result of the class is not the nature of the reason.üîΩ

original: pa'i phyir ji ltar gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid du 'gyur /üîΩde ltar na 'dis tshul gnyis ba srid ba ni ji skad bshad pa'i med na mi 'byung ba srid pa las tshul gzhan khas blangs pa yang gtan tshigs ltar snang ba nyid de /üîΩgtan tshigs ltar snang de las gzhan //
analyzed: pa'i phyir ji ltar gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid du 'gyur / de ltar na 'dis tshul gnyis ba srid ba ni ji skad bshad pa'i med na mi 'byung ba srid pa las tshul gzhan khas blangs pa yang gtan tshigs ltar snang ba nyid de / gtan tshigs ltar snang de las gzhan //
translated: Or, since the result of the reason and the nature of the reason are not the competitors, how could they be the reason‚Äôs characteristics?

original: zhes bya ba de'i don gyi 'grel pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de'i don gyi 'grel pa yin no //
translated: Thus, this is the commentary on the meaning of the verse:üîΩAny other than the reasonüîΩis a pseudo-reason.

original: shes pa nyid bsal bar bya ba ni yang shes pa nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: shes pa nyid bsal bar bya ba ni yang shes pa nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The refutation of consciousness itself is stated in the lines beginning ‚ÄúConsciousness itself . . .‚Äù

original: gnod pa med pa'i yul can dang rjod par 'dod pa'i grangs gcig ba ni 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs nyid med na mi 'byung bar 'gyur ba la gnod pa med pa'i 'gran zla'i gtan tshigs mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod pa med pa'i yul can dang rjod par 'dod pa'i grangs gcig ba ni 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs nyid med na mi 'byung bar 'gyur ba la gnod pa med pa'i 'gran zla'i gtan tshigs mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The single number of the subject that is not impaired and the one that is intended to be expressed are the result and nature reasons, which are the non-observation of the essential nature. This is because it is impossible for a competitor reason that is not impaired to exist.

original: rnam par gcad par bya ba med par gyur pa la yang rtags kyis chos kyi mtshan nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: rnam par gcad par bya ba med par gyur pa la yang rtags kyis chos kyi mtshan nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bshad do //
translated: And when there is no object to be excluded, the evidence cannot be the definition of the property.

original: shes pa ni shes pa nyid do //
analyzed: shes pa ni shes pa nyid do //
translated: Consciousness is consciousness itself.

original: de nyid ni shes pa yod par brjod pas so //
analyzed: de nyid ni shes pa yod par brjod pas so //
translated: It is itself, because it is expressed as the existence of consciousness.

original: de lta na shes pa'i sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan ni shes pa nyid du brjod do //
analyzed: de lta na shes pa'i sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan ni shes pa nyid du brjod do //
translated: Thus, the reason for the application of the word consciousness is said to be consciousness itself.

original: de yang shes pa kho na skyed par gyur pa la shes pa nyid ces tha snyad du byed do //
analyzed: de yang shes pa kho na skyed par gyur pa la shes pa nyid ces tha snyad du byed do //
translated: And that is called consciousness only when it has come into existence as consciousness.

original: rtags kyi ngo bo ni ma yin na ji ltar rtags kyi mtshan nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: rtags kyi ngo bo ni ma yin na ji ltar rtags kyi mtshan nyid du 'gyur /
translated: But if it is not the nature of the evidence, how can it be the definition of the evidence?

original: gal te yang rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba spyi'i rnam pa'i rtags su rnam par gzhag pa de lta na yang shes pa ni rtags kyi chos ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te yang rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba spyi'i rnam pa'i rtags su rnam par gzhag pa de lta na yang shes pa ni rtags kyi chos ma yin no //
translated: Even if the appearance of conceptualization is established as the evidence of the universal aspect, consciousness is not the property of the evidence.

original: 'dir rang dga' pa ni rtags ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir rang dga' pa ni rtags ma yin te /
translated: Here, the self-evident is not the evidence.

original: de skad du rnam rtog tha dad par rang dga' ba ni don gyi rten ma yin te /
analyzed: de skad du rnam rtog tha dad par rang dga' ba ni don gyi rten ma yin te /
translated: As it is said, the self-evident, which is the different conceptualizations, is not the basis of the object.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i yul khong du chud pa ni don med pa la dmigs pa med pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i yul khong du chud pa ni don med pa la dmigs pa med pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bshad do //
translated: The object of conceptual thought is not apprehended as meaningless.

original: de'i phyi rol gyi dngos po la brten pa kho na rtags su rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyi rol gyi dngos po la brten pa kho na rtags su rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
translated: The external thing is the reason.

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub bar byed pa'i rtog pa ni dngos po mthong ba las nyams bas na /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub bar byed pa'i rtog pa ni dngos po mthong ba las nyams bas na /
translated: The conceptual thought of the probandum and the probans is based on the perception of the thing.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid la ni rjes su 'gro ba 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid la ni rjes su 'gro ba 'ga' yang med do //
translated: There is no concomitance with the specific characteristic.

original: de'i chos de nyid kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i rnam par rtog pa du ma las ldog pa ni dngos po yod pa mthong ba'i brgyud pa dang 'brel pas mi slu bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i chos de nyid kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i rnam par rtog pa du ma las ldog pa ni dngos po yod pa mthong ba'i brgyud pa dang 'brel pas mi slu bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The conceptual thought that follows the nature of that thing is not deceived by the connection with the continuity of the perception of the existent thing, because it is turned away from the many conceptual thoughts that follow that nature.

original: 'bras bu la sogs pa'i rtags su bstan pa'i rgyu mtshan bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'bras bu la sogs pa'i rtags su bstan pa'i rgyu mtshan bshad zin to //
translated: The reason for teaching the effect, etc., as reasons has been explained.

original: de 'bras bu la sogs pa'i bdag nyid @322b kyi ngo bo shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa la snang ba spyi'i rnam par rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid du gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de 'bras bu la sogs pa'i bdag nyid @322b kyi ngo bo shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa la snang ba spyi'i rnam par rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid du gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that the form of the object appears in the form of a concept that knows the nature of the effect, etc.

original: de ngo bo med pa dngos po'i ngo bo 'gal ba'i phyir dang / de'i ngo bo ni rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan spyi'i bdag nyid ni spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ngo bo med pa dngos po'i ngo bo 'gal ba'i phyir dang / de'i ngo bo ni rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan spyi'i bdag nyid ni spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is essenceless, and the nature of a thing is contradictory, and because its nature is the form of a concept that has abandoned the nature of a generality.

original: gang gi phyir phyi rol du ma gyur kyang phyi rol du mngon par shes pa ni rjes su mi 'gro ba yang rjes su 'gro bas spyi'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir phyi rol du ma gyur kyang phyi rol du mngon par shes pa ni rjes su mi 'gro ba yang rjes su 'gro bas spyi'i bdag nyid do //
translated: Because it is not external, but is cognized as external, it is a generality, even though it does not correspond to its object.

original: de lta na rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bor bshad pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bor bshad pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, it is not explained to be the nature of a concept.

original: ji skad du /üîΩshes las tha dad ma yin pa //
analyzed: ji skad du / shes las tha dad ma yin pa //
translated: As it is said:

original: ji ltar don gzhan 'brang bar 'gyur //üîΩzhes bshad pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar don gzhan 'brang bar 'gyur // zhes bshad pa'o //
translated: How can something that is not different from consciousnessüîΩBe a different object?

original: rnal ma'i don bas ma bar bya ste /
analyzed: rnal ma'i don bas ma bar bya ste /
translated: The meaning of the verse should be explained as follows.

original: rtog par byed pa'i skyes bu gang mi slu bar byed pa'i rtags de'i rang gi ngo bo brjod par bya ba bstan bcos byed pas de mthong ba'i ngo bo 'di rtogs par byed pa gang la de'i ngo bo srid pa de'i ngo bo srid pa de'i sgrub par
analyzed: rtog par byed pa'i skyes bu gang mi slu bar byed pa'i rtags de'i rang gi ngo bo brjod par bya ba bstan bcos byed pas de mthong ba'i ngo bo 'di rtogs par byed pa gang la de'i ngo bo srid pa de'i ngo bo srid pa de'i sgrub par
translated: The author of the treatise states the nature of the sign that is nondeceptive for the person who is to understand it.

original: byed pa yin no //
analyzed: byed pa yin no //
translated: That which is the nature of what is seen by him is the proof of that which is possible for him.

original: de ma tshang ba ni sgrub par byed pa ma yin no zhes rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: de ma tshang ba ni sgrub par byed pa ma yin no zhes rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
translated: That which is incomplete is not a proof.

original: de la sgrub par rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa de ni 'dod pa'i don dang nye bar 'jog par byed pa la yid ches nas 'jug pa'i dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de la sgrub par rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa de ni 'dod pa'i don dang nye bar 'jog par byed pa la yid ches nas 'jug pa'i dmigs pa yin no //
translated: That which is established as a proof is the object of engagement of one who has confidence in the presentation of the desired object.

original: de la de ni rigs pas rnam par gzhag pa'o ;
analyzed: de la de ni rigs pas rnam par gzhag pa'o ;
translated: That is the rational establishment.

original: /'di rtags kyi bdag nyid kyi ngo bo gang yin pa de'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur bas 'os pa yin te /
analyzed: /'di rtags kyi bdag nyid kyi ngo bo gang yin pa de'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur bas 'os pa yin te /
translated: That which is the nature of the sign is suitable to be its characteristic,

original: phyogs kyi mtshan nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: phyogs kyi mtshan nyid bzhin no //
translated: like the characteristic of a class.

original: gzhan gyi ngo bo ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo bo ma yin no //
translated: It is not the nature of something else.

original: 'di shes pa rtags su sgrub par byed ba ni rigs pa nyid de bsgrub bya sgrub pa la nyer bar sbyor ba rtags kyi mtshan nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'di shes pa rtags su sgrub par byed ba ni rigs pa nyid de bsgrub bya sgrub pa la nyer bar sbyor ba rtags kyi mtshan nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the reason is established by the cognition, that is correct, but the definition of a reason is that it is applied to the establishment of the probandum.

original: rtog pa skye ba la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩgang gi tshe rjes su dpag par bya ba rtog pa skye pa la nye bar sbyor bas de tsam gyi rtags kyi mtshan nyid du 'dod na ni de'i tshe ha cang thal bar 'gyur bar 'gyur ba yin no //üîΩde nyid ni de lta na ni rtog pa skye ba la nye bar sbyor ba tsam rtags kyi mtshan nyid yin na gzhal bya don dang skyes bu 'jal bar byed pa po dang sogs pa'i sgra ldan pa dang 'du ba la sogs pa dang snang ba dang yidüîΩla byed pa la sogs pa rtags kyi mtshan nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtog pa skye ba la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / gang gi tshe rjes su dpag par bya ba rtog pa skye pa la nye bar sbyor bas de tsam gyi rtags kyi mtshan nyid du 'dod na ni de'i tshe ha cang thal bar 'gyur bar 'gyur ba yin no // de nyid ni de lta na ni rtog pa skye ba la nye bar sbyor ba tsam rtags kyi mtshan nyid yin na gzhal bya don dang skyes bu 'jal bar byed pa po dang sogs pa'i sgra ldan pa dang 'du ba la sogs pa dang snang ba dang yid la byed pa la sogs pa rtags kyi mtshan nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Ascertainment means the arising of a cognition.üîΩIf you accept that the definition of a reason is that it is applied to the arising of the cognition of the probandum, then it follows, absurdly, that

original: 'dir rgyu ni dag med par zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'dir rgyu ni dag med par zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: If that were the case, then the mere application to the arising of a cognition would be the definition of a reason. But then it would follow, absurdly, that the object of comprehension, the person who comprehends, and so on, as well as the subject, the object, and so on, as well as the object, the person, and so on, as well as the object, the person, and so on, as well as the object, the person, and so on, as well as the object, the person, and so on, as well as the object, the person, and so on, as well as the object, the person, and so on, as well as the object, the person, and so on, as well as the object, the person, and so on, as well as the object, the person, and so on, as well as the object, the person, and so on, as well as the object, the person, and so on, as well as the object, the person, and so on, as well as the object, the person, and so on, as well as the object, the person, and so on, as well as the object, the person, and so on, as well as the object, the person, and so on, as well as the object, the person, and so on, as well as the object, the person, and so on, as well as the object, the person, and so on, as well as the object, the person, and so on, as well as the object, the person, and so on, as well as the object, the person, and so on, as well as the object, the person, and so on, as well as the object, the person, and so on, as well as the object, the person, and so on, as well as the object, the person, and so on, as well as the object, the person, and so on, as well as the object, the person, and so on, as well

original: @323a * // gzhal bya la sogs pa med par ni rtags can la shes pa skye bar mi 'gyur bar byas so //
analyzed: @323a * // gzhal bya la sogs pa med par ni rtags can la shes pa skye bar mi 'gyur bar byas so //
translated: But if the object of comprehension and so forth do not exist, then the cognition of the sign would not arise.

original: 'dir gzhan dag mi 'dod bar brjod pa ni 'o na ni nges pa smos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩgal te gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid shes pa rtags kyi mtshan nyid ma yin na de'i tshe slob dpon gyis /
analyzed: 'dir gzhan dag mi 'dod bar brjod pa ni 'o na ni nges pa smos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / gal te gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid shes pa rtags kyi mtshan nyid ma yin na de'i tshe slob dpon gyis /
translated: Here, to state what others do not accept, he says, ‚ÄúWell then, the statement of ascertainment . . .‚Äù

original: rjes dpag bya dang de mtshungs la //üîΩyod dang med pa la med par //
analyzed: rjes dpag bya dang de mtshungs la // yod dang med pa la med par //
translated: If the cognition of the nature of another is not the definition of a sign, then at that time the master DignƒÅga‚Äôs statement of ascertainment, ‚ÄúInference for others is not for those who do not have the same object,üîΩand it is not for those who do not have the same object of comprehension,üîΩand it is not for those who do not have the same object of ascertainment,‚Äù

original: nges pa ni zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di dag mdzad pa'i nges pa smos par khyed 'dod pas de ni mi mdzad pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: nges pa ni zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di dag mdzad pa'i nges pa smos par khyed 'dod pas de ni mi mdzad pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: would not be made by him, because you assert that.

original: de'i nges pa smos pa ni rtags kyi ngo bo bstan pas don gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i nges pa smos pa ni rtags kyi ngo bo bstan pas don gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement of ascertainment is not made by him because it is a different topic from the teaching of the nature of the sign.

original: de nyid don gzhan yin pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid don gzhan yin pa bstan pa ni /
translated: To teach that it is a different topic, he says,

original: mthun phyogs mi mthun phyogs dag la //
analyzed: mthun phyogs mi mthun phyogs dag la //
translated: ‚ÄúWith respect to the similar class and the dissimilar class . . .‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: and so forth.

original: gzhan gyis mthun pa'i phyogs mthong ba tsam dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs mthong ba tsam go bar byed pa'i gtan tshigs su 'dod pas de dag mthong ba dang ma mthong ba bsgrub ya sgrub par nus pa'i gtan tshigs su mi 'gyur ba kho nas shes par 'dod pa'i
analyzed: gzhan gyis mthun pa'i phyogs mthong ba tsam dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs mthong ba tsam go bar byed pa'i gtan tshigs su 'dod pas de dag mthong ba dang ma mthong ba bsgrub ya sgrub par nus pa'i gtan tshigs su mi 'gyur ba kho nas shes par 'dod pa'i
translated: Since others assert that mere seeing of the similar class and mere seeing of the dissimilar class are reasons, they are not reasons that can prove the probandum through seeing or not seeing.

original: don nges pa smos pa mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: don nges pa smos pa mdzad pa yin no //
translated: Thus the meaning of the term ‚Äúdefinite‚Äù is stated.

original: gang gi phyir de dag mthong dang ma mthong dang ma mthong ba yod bzhin shes par byed pa'i gtan tshigs ma yin par mthong ba'i phyir de sngo bsangs kyi bu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag mthong dang ma mthong dang ma mthong ba yod bzhin shes par byed pa'i gtan tshigs ma yin par mthong ba'i phyir de sngo bsangs kyi bu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Since they are seen to be reasons that do not prove the existence of something through seeing, nonseeing, or both seeing and nonseeing, they are like the reason ‚Äúbecause he is the son of a dark woman.‚Äù

original: gnag gi phyir de ltar rgyu des na mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad la med par khyad par du byed bas na /
analyzed: gnag gi phyir de ltar rgyu des na mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad la med par khyad par du byed bas na /
translated: For that reason, the reason is specified as ‚Äúexisting in similar instances and not existing in any dissimilar instances.‚Äù

original: mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa thams cad la med pa mthun pa'i phyogs la de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid yod pa khyod par can ni go bar byed pa'i gtan tshigs yin no zhes bya ba 'di don shes pa'i phyir mtshan nyid gsungs pas
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa thams cad la med pa mthun pa'i phyogs la de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid yod pa khyod par can ni go bar byed pa'i gtan tshigs yin no zhes bya ba 'di don shes pa'i phyir mtshan nyid gsungs pas
translated: The inferential mark that is understood is the one that has the nature of being in the similar class and arising from that, in all that is not the similar class.

original: nges pa smos pa mdzad do zhes khong du chud bar bya'o //
analyzed: nges pa smos pa mdzad do zhes khong du chud bar bya'o //
translated: This is the definition of the inferential mark that is understood.

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te gang mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag la yod pa dang med pa'i 'brel pa sgrub pa'i tshad ma 'jug par nges pa de dag nyid kyis gtan tshigs go bar byed par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te gang mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag la yod pa dang med pa'i 'brel pa sgrub pa'i tshad ma 'jug par nges pa de dag nyid kyis gtan tshigs go bar byed par 'gyur gyi /
translated: This is what is being taught: The inferential mark that is understood is that which is ascertained to be the means of valid cognition that establishes the relation of existence and non-existence in the similar and dissimilar classes.

original: res 'ga' zhig mthong ba dang ma mthong ba tsam gyis 'di don shes @323b bar bya bar nges pa smos par mdzad pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: res 'ga' zhig mthong ba dang ma mthong ba tsam gyis 'di don shes @323b bar bya bar nges pa smos par mdzad pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that the definition of the inferential mark that is understood is stated by merely seeing or not seeing it sometimes.

original: rnal ma'i don gyi mjug bsdu ba ni des na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rnal ma'i don gyi mjug bsdu ba ni des na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The summary of the main point is stated with Therefore... and so on.

original: gang gis yod pa dang med pa khyad par can dag bstan pa'i ched du nges pa smos pa mdzad do //
analyzed: gang gis yod pa dang med pa khyad par can dag bstan pa'i ched du nges pa smos pa mdzad do //
translated: In order to teach the distinction between existence and non-existence, the word ‚Äúascertained‚Äù is used.

original: tshul gzhan brjod pa ma yin te bdag nyid ma yin pa'i tshul ni mtshan nyid du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: tshul gzhan brjod pa ma yin te bdag nyid ma yin pa'i tshul ni mtshan nyid du mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not a different mode, because a mode that is not the nature of something is not suitable as a definition.

original: des na gzhan gyi tshul ni rtags kyi mtshan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: des na gzhan gyi tshul ni rtags kyi mtshan nyid ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, another mode is not the definition of a reason.

original: gang gi phyir des na shes pa la sogs pa tshul gzhan gyis rtags kyi tshul 'ga' zhig la khyad par mi ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir des na shes pa la sogs pa tshul gzhan gyis rtags kyi tshul 'ga' zhig la khyad par mi ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that does not indicate any difference in the mode of the reason through a different mode such as cognition, etc.

original: 'o na ni mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa dang med pa gnyis go bar byed pa'i gtan tshigs su gzhan dag 'dod de mthong ba dang ma mthong ba de dag nyid sgrub par byed par de cis na don nges pa la smos pa
analyzed: 'o na ni mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa dang med pa gnyis go bar byed pa'i gtan tshigs su gzhan dag 'dod de mthong ba dang ma mthong ba de dag nyid sgrub par byed par de cis na don nges pa la smos pa
translated: If that is so, then others assert that existence and non-existence in similar and dissimilar cases are the reason that causes ascertainment, and those very things that are seen and not seen are the proof. Why then is ‚Äúascertained‚Äù mentioned?

original: zhe na / des na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhe na / des na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To answer that, he says ‚Äútherefore,‚Äù etc.

original: gal te rang bzhin dag yod pa dang med pa dag go bar byed pa'i gtan tshigs su 'dod do //
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin dag yod pa dang med pa dag go bar byed pa'i gtan tshigs su 'dod do //
translated: If you assert that the reason that makes known the existence and nonexistence of intrinsic reality

original: de lta na yang mthun pa'i phyogs kho na la yod pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid do zhes yod pa dang med pa mthong ba dang ma mthong ba tsam gyis rnam par gzhag pa yin te /üîΩde de las rnam pa de lta bu mi 'grub ste 'brel pa nyid med par byed pa'i tshad mas de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung bas sgrub par byed pa'i yul 'jug par khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: de lta na yang mthun pa'i phyogs kho na la yod pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid do zhes yod pa dang med pa mthong ba dang ma mthong ba tsam gyis rnam par gzhag pa yin te / de de las rnam pa de lta bu mi 'grub ste 'brel pa nyid med par byed pa'i tshad mas de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung bas sgrub par byed pa'i yul 'jug par khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: is that it exists only in similar instances and does not exist in dissimilar instances, then existence and nonexistence would be established merely by seeing or not seeing something.

original: de las thabs gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las thabs gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But that is not established in that way, because the valid knowledge that establishes the object of engagement is understood to be the nature of that or to arise from that, because there is no other method than that.

original: de khas ma blangs pa'i gtan tshigs mthun pa'i phyogs kho na la yod pa gtan tshigs su 'dod pa thams cad la gnod pa gzhan med pa'i rgyu de sa na yod pa dang med pa'i khyad par 'di gnyis bstan pas /
analyzed: de khas ma blangs pa'i gtan tshigs mthun pa'i phyogs kho na la yod pa gtan tshigs su 'dod pa thams cad la gnod pa gzhan med pa'i rgyu de sa na yod pa dang med pa'i khyad par 'di gnyis bstan pas /
translated: If you do not accept that, then all reasons that are asserted to exist only in similar instances are undermined, because the difference between existence and nonexistence in the reason is not taught.

original: nges pa zhes bya ba'i sgra sbyar ba yin /
analyzed: nges pa zhes bya ba'i sgra sbyar ba yin /
translated: The term ‚Äúascertainment‚Äù is applied.

original: mtshan nyid ni mtshan nyid mdzad pas so //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni mtshan nyid mdzad pas so //
translated: The definition is by the one who defines.

original: 'on ni yod pa dang med pa brjod pa tsam kho nas tshad ma las nges pa 'thob na gzhan du na de dag yod pa mi 'grub po zhe na /
analyzed: 'on ni yod pa dang med pa brjod pa tsam kho nas tshad ma las nges pa 'thob na gzhan du na de dag yod pa mi 'grub po zhe na /
translated: But if one obtains ascertainment from a valid cognition merely by the expression of existence and nonexistence, then in another case, those are not established.

original: des na gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: des na gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said ‚ÄúIf it is like that, etc.‚Äù

original: rjes dpag bya dang de mtshungs la //
analyzed: rjes dpag bya dang de mtshungs la //
translated: The existence and nonexistence of the object of inference and its similarity

original: yod dang med pa la med par //
analyzed: yod dang med pa la med par //
translated: are not in existence and nonexistence.

original: zhes brjod pa tsam gyis kyang ngos pa smos pa la mi ltos pas yod pa dang yod pa dang med pa de gnyis la sgrub pa'i tshad ma gang yin pa de 'jug na brgyal 'phral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes brjod pa tsam gyis kyang ngos pa smos pa la mi ltos pas yod pa dang yod pa dang med pa de gnyis la sgrub pa'i tshad ma gang yin pa de 'jug na brgyal 'phral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By the mere expression, even without depending on the expression of ascertainment, if the valid cognition that establishes those two, existence and nonexistence, engages, it would be absurd.

original: ji ltar nges pa ma smos pas yod pa dang med pa brjod pa tsam gyis de la 'jug pa 'phangs pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar nges pa ma smos pas yod pa dang med pa brjod pa tsam gyis de la 'jug pa 'phangs pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that by the mere expression of existence and nonexistence without the expression of ascertainment, the engagement in that is not implied?

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: If it were not like that, it is said ‚Äúit would not be tenable, etc.‚Äù

original: @324a * // gal te de sgrub pa'i tshad ma 'jug pas 'phags pa yin ba de'i tshe de dag nyid mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs gnyis la yod pa dang med pa dag gis yod par rang gi ngo bor rnam bar gzhag pa gang yin pa de mi 'grub
analyzed: @324a * // gal te de sgrub pa'i tshad ma 'jug pas 'phags pa yin ba de'i tshe de dag nyid mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs gnyis la yod pa dang med pa dag gis yod par rang gi ngo bor rnam bar gzhag pa gang yin pa de mi 'grub
translated: If it is a noble being because the valid cognition that establishes it is engaged, then at that time, those two, the similar class and the dissimilar class, do not exist, and whatever is posited as existent by their existence is not established.

original: bo // ci'i phyir mi 'grub ce na /
analyzed: bo // ci'i phyir mi 'grub ce na /
translated: Why is it not established?

original: shes par bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: shes par bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is said that it is because of the object of knowledge and so on.

original: shes pa dmigs su yod pa las skye ba'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir shes bya yod pa dang med pa'i mtshan nyid yod par rnam par 'jog pa ni rang gi ngo bo rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: shes pa dmigs su yod pa las skye ba'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir shes bya yod pa dang med pa'i mtshan nyid yod par rnam par 'jog pa ni rang gi ngo bo rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: Because the reason for the arising of the existent object of knowledge is the existent that is the characteristic of the existent, the establishment of its own nature is posited.

original: dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan med na rang nyid kyis don 'grub pa ni med de thams cad las 'grub par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan med na rang nyid kyis don 'grub pa ni med de thams cad las 'grub par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If the object of observation does not exist, it is not established by itself, because it would follow that everything would be established.

original: de'i phyir 'di'i ngo bo ni 'di lta bu yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di'i ngo bo ni 'di lta bu yin no //
translated: Therefore, its nature is like this.

original: di lta bu ma yin zhes bya ba 'di rnam par shes pa skyed pa nyid du rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: di lta bu ma yin zhes bya ba 'di rnam par shes pa skyed pa nyid du rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
translated: This is not so is to be posited as the production of consciousness.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar de'i phyir thams cad ni bstan bcos dang 'jig rten pa nyid kyi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar de'i phyir thams cad ni bstan bcos dang 'jig rten pa nyid kyi zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it is so, therefore it is said, all are established by treatises and worldly convention.

original: yod par rnam par gzhag pa nyid ni nges pa smos pa med kyang yod pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma 'dren cing 'phen pa yin no //
analyzed: yod par rnam par gzhag pa nyid ni nges pa smos pa med kyang yod pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma 'dren cing 'phen pa yin no //
translated: The mere establishment of existence is the bringing and projection of a valid cognition that proves existence, even without stating a certainty.

original: gzhan yang bstan bcos byed ba ni gzhan gyi don yin pa'i phyir des de sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma 'dras pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang bstan bcos byed ba ni gzhan gyi don yin pa'i phyir des de sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma 'dras pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Moreover, because the composition of a treatise is for the sake of others, it is to be applied that the valid cognition that proves it is projected by others.

original: yang ci 'dra ba zhig bstan bcos byed pa gzhan gyi don ngo bo gang rang nyid rnam par 'jog cing shes bya yod par sgrub pa'i tshad ma 'phen pa yang yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci 'dra ba zhig bstan bcos byed pa gzhan gyi don ngo bo gang rang nyid rnam par 'jog cing shes bya yod par sgrub pa'i tshad ma 'phen pa yang yin zhe na /
translated: Again, what kind of valid cognition does the composition of a treatise project, which is for the sake of others, the nature of which is to establish the existence of objects that are posited by oneself?

original: tshul gsum pa'i rtogs zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: tshul gsum pa'i rtogs zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said, the realization of the trimodal logical mark.

original: mi slu bar byed pa ni thob par byed par 'dod pa de'i don la yin no //
analyzed: mi slu bar byed pa ni thob par byed par 'dod pa de'i don la yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not deceptive‚Äù means that it is in regard to the object that is to be attained.

original: gal te de lta bu'i ngo bo bstan bcos byed pa gzhan gyi don yin pa de lta na yang ji ltar de sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma 'jug pa 'phen pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta bu'i ngo bo bstan bcos byed pa gzhan gyi don yin pa de lta na yang ji ltar de sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma 'jug pa 'phen pa yin zhe na /
translated: Even if the purpose of the treatise is to teach such a nature, how does it imply the engagement of the valid knowledge that establishes it?

original: gang dag tshul de zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gang dag tshul de zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The root text says, ‚ÄúThose who do not know the nature of the reason having three modes . . .‚Äù

original: tshul gsum po'i rtags kyi tshul gyi ngo bo rang bzhin te /
analyzed: tshul gsum po'i rtags kyi tshul gyi ngo bo rang bzhin te /
translated: The nature of the reason having three modes is the nature of the mode.

original: bstan bcos las bshad pa rtogs par byed pa bos mi shes pa de dag ni des te tshul gsum pa'i rtags pa bstan bcos nas bshad pa 'dod pa'i don la 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bstan bcos las bshad pa rtogs par byed pa bos mi shes pa de dag ni des te tshul gsum pa'i rtags pa bstan bcos nas bshad pa 'dod pa'i don la 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who do not know the explanation of the treatise will not engage in the object that is desired, the explanation of the reason having three modes in the treatise.

original: shes pa nyid kyi don ni shes par byed pa rang yod pa tsam gyis 'jug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa nyid kyi don ni shes par byed pa rang yod pa tsam gyis 'jug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúknowledge‚Äù is that it is not engaged by the mere presence of the knower.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar na phyir zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir te gzhan mtshon bar byed pa'i phyir ni gzhan dag gis shes par byed par tshul @324b gsum pa'i rtags shes par grub mod kyi /üîΩgal te yang nges pa zhes bya ba smos pa lhag ma yin te /üîΩ'on kyang khyed cag rtags kyi mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag la yod pa dang med pa'i khyad par bstan bcos byed pas mthun pa'i phyogs kho na la yod pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa kho na zhes bya ba la de ltarüîΩrigs pa can la sogs pa gzhan dag mthong ba dang ma mthong ba tsam gyis gang mthong ba dang ma mthong ba'i 'brel pa sgrub bar byed par khyod kyis de tsam gyis rnam par 'jog pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar na phyir zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir te gzhan mtshon bar byed pa'i phyir ni gzhan dag gis shes par byed par tshul @324b gsum pa'i rtags shes par grub mod kyi / gal te yang nges pa zhes bya ba smos pa lhag ma yin te / 'on kyang khyed cag rtags kyi mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag la yod pa dang med pa'i khyad par bstan bcos byed pas mthun pa'i phyogs kho na la yod pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa kho na zhes bya ba la de ltar rigs pa can la sogs pa gzhan dag mthong ba dang ma mthong ba tsam gyis gang mthong ba dang ma mthong ba'i 'brel pa sgrub bar byed par khyod kyis de tsam gyis rnam par 'jog pa yin te /
translated: Because of that, the term ‚Äútherefore‚Äù means ‚Äúfor that reason.‚ÄùüîΩüîΩThe term ‚Äúonly‚Äù is a remainder.üîΩüîΩHowever, you logicians teach that the difference between the existence and nonexistence of a reason in similar and dissimilar cases is taught by the author of the treatise.üîΩüîΩYou logicians and so on prove the relationship between what is seen and what is not seen by mere seeing and not seeing. You posit that relationship in that way.üîΩ

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means ‚Äúbecause of that.‚ÄùüîΩIf you say that the reason is not established, then you should not say that the reason is established.üîΩIf you say that the reason is not established, then you should not say that the reason is established.üîΩIf you say that the reason is not established, then you should not say that the reason is established.üîΩIf you say that the reason is not established, then you should not say that the reason is established.üîΩIf you say that the reason is not established, then you should not say that the reason is established.

original: rgol ba de dag dgag pa'i phyir mtshan nyid mdzad pas nges pa'i sgra slob dpon gyis rab tu sbyar ba ni kho bo cag khas len pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rgol ba de dag dgag pa'i phyir mtshan nyid mdzad pas nges pa'i sgra slob dpon gyis rab tu sbyar ba ni kho bo cag khas len pa yin gyi /
translated: The master‚Äôs use of the term ‚Äúonly‚Äù is to refute those opponents, and we accept that.

original: gang gzhan la log par rtogs pa med na de'i tshe 'di rab tu sbyor ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gzhan la log par rtogs pa med na de'i tshe 'di rab tu sbyor ba ma yin no //
translated: But when there is no misunderstanding, then it is not used.

original: 'on kyang yang mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag gis yod pa dang med pa'i yul dag gis mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par du byed do //
analyzed: 'on kyang yang mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag gis yod pa dang med pa'i yul dag gis mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par du byed do //
translated: Moreover, one distinguishes the similar and dissimilar instances by means of the existence and nonexistence of the property in the similar and dissimilar instances, respectively.

original: yod pa dang med pa las rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa cis na mi 'dod ce na /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa las rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa cis na mi 'dod ce na /
translated: Why is it not accepted that the presence and absence of the property follow from the presence and absence of the reason?

original: yod pa dang med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response is ‚ÄúExistence and nonexistence, etc.‚Äù

original: la lar mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa mthong ba'i gtan tshigs la lar mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa mthong ba yod du zin kyang de ni sngo bsangs yin te /
analyzed: la lar mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa mthong ba'i gtan tshigs la lar mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa mthong ba yod du zin kyang de ni sngo bsangs yin te /
translated: In some cases, a reason is seen to be present in the similar instance, but in some cases, it is seen to be absent in the dissimilar instance. Even though that is so, it is not the case that the reason is not a correct reason. For example, the reason ‚Äúbecause of being blue‚Äù proves that the subject, a patch of color, is a flower, because it is seen to be present in the similar instance, a jasmine flower, and it is seen to be absent in the dissimilar instance, a patch of color that is not a flower.

original: sngo bsangs kyi bu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa bzhin rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa la the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngo bsangs kyi bu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa bzhin rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa la the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the son of a dark-skinned woman, etc.

original: de lta na rjes su 'gro ba ni thams cad du bsgrub bya yod pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs yod pa la khyab pa'am bsgrub bya med na gtan tshigs med pa'i ldog pa ni la lar bsgrub bye dang gtan tshigs yod pa mthong ba tsam gyis ma yin te
analyzed: de lta na rjes su 'gro ba ni thams cad du bsgrub bya yod pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs yod pa la khyab pa'am bsgrub bya med na gtan tshigs med pa'i ldog pa ni la lar bsgrub bye dang gtan tshigs yod pa mthong ba tsam gyis ma yin te
translated: Thus, the pervasion is the presence of the reason in the presence of the probandum, or the absence of the reason in the absence of the probandum. The mere seeing of the presence of the probandum and the reason in some cases is not the pervasion.

original: thams cad la yod pa dang med pa ni 'brel pa med pa'i ngal bo rnams lhan cig 'byung bar nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad la yod pa dang med pa ni 'brel pa med pa'i ngal bo rnams lhan cig 'byung bar nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the presence and absence of all things are not necessarily concomitant, as is the case with the presence and absence of a poor person.

original: de ltar la lar bsgrub par bya bar mngon par 'dod pa de med par gyur pa las med par mthong ba'i gtan tshigs kyang thams cad du de med na gdon mi za bar med pa de ni 'bad pa med par de ldog par nges pas ldog par 'gyur
analyzed: de ltar la lar bsgrub par bya bar mngon par 'dod pa de med par gyur pa las med par mthong ba'i gtan tshigs kyang thams cad du de med na gdon mi za bar med pa de ni 'bad pa med par de ldog par nges pas ldog par 'gyur
translated: Thus, the absence of the reason in the absence of the probandum, which is desired to be proven in some cases, is the counter-pervasion. The absence of the reason in the absence of the probandum is ascertained without effort, because it is ascertained that it is absent in the absence of the probandum.

original: pa med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde'i phyir 'brel pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma yod pa nyid ji skad bshad pa'i mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi @325a * //
analyzed: pa med pa'i phyir ro // de'i phyir 'brel pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma yod pa nyid ji skad bshad pa'i mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi @325a * //
translated: because there is no connection.üîΩTherefore, the existence of a valid cognition that establishes the connection is established as existing in the similar and dissimilar instances, as explained above.üîΩBut not otherwise.üîΩIn order to eliminate such a misconception, the word ‚Äúniyama‚Äù is used.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa dang med pa grub pa yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes log par rtogs pa bsal ba'i ched du nges pa smos pa mdzad pa yin no zhes bstan pa ni gang las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa dang med pa grub pa yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes log par rtogs pa bsal ba'i ched du nges pa smos pa mdzad pa yin no zhes bstan pa ni gang las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te //
translated: To explain this, he says ‚Äúfrom which‚Äù and so on.

original: kho bos zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gyis nges pa smos pa mdzad pa ni gzhan du kho bo cag mngon par 'dod pa'i phyir kho bos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kho bos zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gyis nges pa smos pa mdzad pa ni gzhan du kho bo cag mngon par 'dod pa'i phyir kho bos zhes bya'o //
translated: ‚Äú By me‚Äù means that the master uses the word ‚Äúniyama‚Äù because he wishes to state something else.üîΩTherefore, in order to eliminate such a misconception, even without the ascertainment of the meaning, one should not misconstrue.

original: des na de ltar log par rtogs pa bsal ba'i phyir nges pa'i mos pa med kyang log par rtogs par mi bya'o zhes bstan pa de nyid kyi rigs pas shes pa nyid tshul gzhan ma yin par bstan pa ni gnag gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa
analyzed: des na de ltar log par rtogs pa bsal ba'i phyir nges pa'i mos pa med kyang log par rtogs par mi bya'o zhes bstan pa de nyid kyi rigs pas shes pa nyid tshul gzhan ma yin par bstan pa ni gnag gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa
translated: To explain this very reasoning, he says ‚Äúbecause of the cow‚Äù and so on.

original: smos te / tha dad par gyur pas ni phyogs kyi chos la sogs pa ni tshul gsum pa las so //üîΩgang las she na /
analyzed: smos te / tha dad par gyur pas ni phyogs kyi chos la sogs pa ni tshul gsum pa las so // gang las she na /
translated: The reason is stated:üîΩBecause they are different, the property of the position, etc., are the three modes.üîΩFrom what?üîΩ

original: tshul gsum pa de nyid kyi tshig gis de sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma 'phen par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul gsum pa de nyid kyi tshig gis de sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma 'phen par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word then indicates that the reason is established by the statement of the triply characterized reason, because the statement of the triply characterized reason implies the valid cognition that establishes it.

original: ci 'dra ba'i zhe na /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba'i zhe na /
translated: What kind of valid cognition?

original: phyogs kyi chos nyid las nye bar gtong ba'i don bzhin no //
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos nyid las nye bar gtong ba'i don bzhin no //
translated: Like the statement of the property of the subject.

original: dper na phyogs kyi chos brjod pa kho na gtan tshigs nye bar gtod pa'i don rtogs pa de nyid kyis can la gtan tshigs yod par gyur par bstan pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / phyogs kyi chos brjod pa de'i tshul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dper na phyogs kyi chos brjod pa kho na gtan tshigs nye bar gtod pa'i don rtogs pa de nyid kyis can la gtan tshigs yod par gyur par bstan pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / phyogs kyi chos brjod pa de'i tshul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For example, just by understanding the statement of the property of the subject to be the statement of the reason, one understands that the reason is present in the subject, because the statement of the property of the subject has that form.

original: des na tha dad pa nye bar gtad pa tshul gzhan du ni mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na tha dad pa nye bar gtad pa tshul gzhan du ni mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the implication of the difference is not in another way,

original: de ltar tshul gsum pa'i tshig de nyid brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar tshul gsum pa'i tshig de nyid brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the statement of the triply characterized reason itself is stated.

original: 'dir gzhan dag mi 'dod pas spong ba ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhan dag mi 'dod pas spong ba ni /
translated: Here, others' rejection of what is not accepted is:

original: 'o na ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩgal te tshul gsum pa'i tshig gis yang dag pa'i shes pa skyed pa bzhes bya ba des na de las tha dad par brjod par mi bya ba de lta na ni rjes su 'gro ba las tha dad pa'i ldog pa brjod par mi bya ba la ldog pa
analyzed: 'o na ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / gal te tshul gsum pa'i tshig gis yang dag pa'i shes pa skyed pa bzhes bya ba des na de las tha dad par brjod par mi bya ba de lta na ni rjes su 'gro ba las tha dad pa'i ldog pa brjod par mi bya ba la ldog pa
translated: Well, then, it follows that one should not state the forward pervasion, etc.üîΩIf the statement of the trimodal logical mark generates correct knowledge, then it should not be stated separately from that.

original: las tha dad pa'i rjes su 'gro ba yang ngo //
analyzed: las tha dad pa'i rjes su 'gro ba yang ngo //
translated: In that case, one should not state the counterpervasion separately from the forward pervasion, and one should not state the forward pervasion separately from the counterpervasion.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rjes su 'gro ba'am ldog pa gcig gi sbyor bas gnyi ga rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba'am ldog pa gcig gi sbyor bas gnyi ga rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the statement of one of them, the forward pervasion or the counterpervasion, comprehends the other.

original: de gnyis tshig tha dad pa ni byas pa de bzhin du shes pa nyid kyang tshul gsum pa'i go bar bya ba las kyang tha dad par brjod par bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: de gnyis tshig tha dad pa ni byas pa de bzhin du shes pa nyid kyang tshul gsum pa'i go bar bya ba las kyang tha dad par brjod par bya'o zhe na /
translated: Just as the statement of the trimodal logical mark comprehends the object to be comprehended, the trimodal logical mark, so too, the statement of the trimodal logical mark should be stated separately from the object to be comprehended.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas ma yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas ma yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The proponent of the conclusion says, ‚ÄúNo, it is not so.‚Äù

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag tha dad pa ni med kyi 'on kyang tshul tha dad pa nyid do //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag tha dad pa ni med kyi 'on kyang tshul tha dad pa nyid do //
translated: There is no difference between the forward and reverse pervasions, but there is a difference in their modes.

original: de lta na rjes su 'gro bas mthun pa'i phyogs @325b la yod par brjod do //
analyzed: de lta na rjes su 'gro bas mthun pa'i phyogs @325b la yod par brjod do //
translated: In that case, the forward pervasion is stated as existing in similar instances.

original: yang ldog las ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa de dag ni phan tshun ltos pas so //
analyzed: yang ldog las ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa de dag ni phan tshun ltos pas so //
translated: Moreover, the reverse pervasion is stated as the absence of that in dissimilar instances. They are mutually dependent.

original: phan tshun nang du 'du ba yin te /
analyzed: phan tshun nang du 'du ba yin te /
translated: They are mutually inclusive.

original: sgrub pa dang dgag pa'i tshul tha dad pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub pa dang dgag pa'i tshul tha dad pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are different modes of affirmation and negation.

original: gang dang gang tha dad pa'i ngo bo de dang de'i nar du 'du bar 'gyur ba mi rigs so//
analyzed: gang dang gang tha dad pa'i ngo bo de dang de'i nar du 'du bar 'gyur ba mi rigs so//
translated: It is not logical that what is different in nature is mutually inclusive.

original: 'o na ni gang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa ngo bo tha dad pa de lta na ji ltar tshul gsum du brjod par bye /
analyzed: 'o na ni gang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa ngo bo tha dad pa de lta na ji ltar tshul gsum du brjod par bye /
translated: If that is so, then how can the three modes be stated when the forward and reverse pervasions are different in nature?

original: phan tshun tha dad pa'i bdag nyid ni gcig pa nyid du mi rung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: phan tshun tha dad pa'i bdag nyid ni gcig pa nyid du mi rung ngo zhe na /
translated: It is not logical that what is different in nature is the same.

original: ngo bo nyid tha dad pas mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir dngos po tha dad pa la nyes ba 'di med do //üîΩgang gi phyir ji lta ba'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa rnam pa rnam par gzhag par bya ba de lta bu 'dis nang du 'du bar brjod de /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid tha dad pas mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir dngos po tha dad pa la nyes ba 'di med do // gang gi phyir ji lta ba'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa rnam pa rnam par gzhag par bya ba de lta bu 'dis nang du 'du bar brjod de /
translated: Since they have different natures, they have different characteristics. Therefore, this fault does not apply to different things.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: Because of this, we say that the forward and reverse formulations are included in the way things really are, not in any other way.

original: ji ltar 'di dag rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di dag rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: How are they formulated?

original: ldog pas byas pa tha dad pa la brten pa'i de lta na yang tshul tha dad pa 'di nyid ni ldog pa tha dad pa yin du zin kyang don dam par tha dad pa me de rtags gcig la tshul gsum du brjod do //
analyzed: ldog pas byas pa tha dad pa la brten pa'i de lta na yang tshul tha dad pa 'di nyid ni ldog pa tha dad pa yin du zin kyang don dam par tha dad pa me de rtags gcig la tshul gsum du brjod do //
translated: Although they are different in terms of the different things that are their bases, they are the same in terms of their exclusion. Therefore, although they are different in terms of their exclusions, they are not different in terms of their ultimate nature. Thus, we say that they are the three modes in relation to a single reason.

original: 'on ni 'di ni don la tha dad pa 'ga' zhig kyang med kyi gzhan du sbyor ba tha dad pa yin no zhes sngar bshad pa ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on ni 'di ni don la tha dad pa 'ga' zhig kyang med kyi gzhan du sbyor ba tha dad pa yin no zhes sngar bshad pa ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: But if they are not different in terms of their ultimate nature, how can they be different in terms of their application?

original: tshig gcig gis kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: tshig gcig gis kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúEven though they are the same in terms of their ultimate nature,‚Äù and so on.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i sgo nas rab tu sbyor ba na tshig gcig gis rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid go bar byed pa yin no zhes kho bo cag brjod la /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i sgo nas rab tu sbyor ba na tshig gcig gis rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid go bar byed pa yin no zhes kho bo cag brjod la /
translated: When one applies the reason in terms of concomitance and reverse pervasion, one word indicates the different characteristics of concomitance and reverse pervasion.

original: don gcig la rang bzhin gnyis med do zhes brjod do //
analyzed: don gcig la rang bzhin gnyis med do zhes brjod do //
translated: We say that one thing cannot have two natures.

original: phan tshun tha dad pa nyid dag gi don gyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun tha dad pa nyid dag gi don gyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nature of the object is mutually different.

original: 'dir gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: 'dir gzhan dag na re /
translated: Here, others say:

original: 'on ni de kho na la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'on ni de kho na la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúBut in reality, etc.‚Äù

original: bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The idea is this:

original: mtshan nyid gsum pas bstan pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dag ldog pa la brten pa phan tshun nang du 'du bar bshad pa ni der yang rig par bya ba kho na ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid gsum pas bstan pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dag ldog pa la brten pa phan tshun nang du 'du bar bshad pa ni der yang rig par bya ba kho na ste /
translated: The explanation that the basis of concomitance and reverse pervasion taught by the three characteristics mutually include each other is only to be understood in that way.

original: de lta na de kho na la yod do zhes bya ba mtshan nyid kyi dag de'i shugs kyis de med pa la med par rtogs so //
analyzed: de lta na de kho na la yod do zhes bya ba mtshan nyid kyi dag de'i shugs kyis de med pa la med par rtogs so //
translated: Thus, ‚Äúexisting only in reality‚Äù is the characteristic of that, and by implication, ‚Äúnot existing in unreality‚Äù is understood.

original: de med pa la gdon mi za ba mi do zhes bya ba 'dis kyang de yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de med pa la gdon mi za ba mi do zhes bya ba 'dis kyang de yod pa yin no //
translated: And this statement, ‚ÄúIf it does not exist, then it is not,‚Äù also shows that it exists.

original: 'brel pa med na ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'brel pa med na ni ma yin te /
translated: But if there is no relation, then it is not.

original: gcig med pas gzhan med pa ni 'brel pa de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba dag gis de yod na yod pa'i ngo bo kho na'o //üîΩdes kyang mthun pa'i phyogs sam mi mthun @326a * //
analyzed: gcig med pas gzhan med pa ni 'brel pa de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba dag gis de yod na yod pa'i ngo bo kho na'o // des kyang mthun pa'i phyogs sam mi mthun @326a * //
translated: When one does not exist, the other does not exist, because of the relation of identity or causality. If it exists, then it has the nature of existing.

original: pa'i phyogs dag la yod pa dang med pa gcig rtogs par byed pas 'brel pa khyad par can gyi mtshan nyid kyi tshig gis gnyi ga rtogs par ma brjod par mi bya'o snyam na /
analyzed: pa'i phyogs dag la yod pa dang med pa gcig rtogs par byed pas 'brel pa khyad par can gyi mtshan nyid kyi tshig gis gnyi ga rtogs par ma brjod par mi bya'o snyam na /
translated: And that also makes known the existence or nonexistence in similar or dissimilar instances, so the definition of a special relation should not be stated in such a way that it does not make known both.

original: de lta na tshig gcig gi don gyi nang du 'dus pas tha dad pa'i ngo bo yang 'dir rnyed par dka'o //
analyzed: de lta na tshig gcig gi don gyi nang du 'dus pas tha dad pa'i ngo bo yang 'dir rnyed par dka'o //
translated: But if that is so, then it is difficult to find a definition of a relation that is not included in the meaning of the word ‚Äúone.‚Äù

original: des kyang ji skad du bshad pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dag kyang 'on te logs shig tu mi bya ste /
analyzed: des kyang ji skad du bshad pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dag kyang 'on te logs shig tu mi bya ste /
translated: And that also makes known the pervasion as explained, so why not make it separately?

original: de dang de'i gnas skabs kho na yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de dang de'i gnas skabs kho na yin no zhe na /
translated: It is just the state of being that and that.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas tshig 'dis ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas tshig 'dis ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The proponent of tenets says, ‚ÄúBy this statement,‚Äù

original: de kho na yod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gnyi ga yang 'phen pa ni rab tu bstan pa'o ;
analyzed: de kho na yod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gnyi ga yang 'phen pa ni rab tu bstan pa'o ;
translated: both ‚Äúexistence of reality‚Äù and so on are indicated.

original: / ga las she na /
analyzed: / ga las she na /
translated: From what?

original: shus kyis gnyi ga bstan par nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shus kyis gnyi ga bstan par nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is able to indicate both.

original: gal te ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúWhat is it like?‚ÄùüîΩ‚Äú Even by one‚Äù and so on are stated.üîΩWhat is the nature of the two?

original: gcig gis kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te dag ci 'dra ba zhig / nges par bstan pa ni mthun pa'i phyogs kho na la yod pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa kho nas thun mang du gnyis pa 'phen pa ni med na mi
analyzed: gcig gis kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te dag ci 'dra ba zhig / nges par bstan pa ni mthun pa'i phyogs kho na la yod pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa kho nas thun mang du gnyis pa 'phen pa ni med na mi
translated: The definition is that because it exists only in the similar class and does not exist in the dissimilar class, the second is indicated by the common locus.

original: 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is a necessary condition.

original: re zhig tshig gcig tu bstan pa tsam gyis gnyi ga gcig gi ngo bo dang tha dad pa'i ngo bo'i don rnams kyi ngag gcig gis bstan par mi bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: re zhig tshig gcig tu bstan pa tsam gyis gnyi ga gcig gi ngo bo dang tha dad pa'i ngo bo'i don rnams kyi ngag gcig gis bstan par mi bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not that the two are indicated by a single statement, because it is not possible to indicate by a single statement the objects that are the same nature and different natures.

original: mtshan nyid kyi tshig gcig gis gnyi ga rtogs kyang tha dad par brjod pa gang yin pa de ni sbyor ba nges pa'i phyir chos mthun pa'i sbyor ba la mi mthun pa brjod par mi bya ba dang / chos mi mthun pa'i sbyor ba la yang chos mthun pa mi brjod do //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi tshig gcig gis gnyi ga rtogs kyang tha dad par brjod pa gang yin pa de ni sbyor ba nges pa'i phyir chos mthun pa'i sbyor ba la mi mthun pa brjod par mi bya ba dang / chos mi mthun pa'i sbyor ba la yang chos mthun pa mi brjod do //
translated: Although both are understood from a single statement of the reason, the reason is stated separately in order to determine the application. Therefore, in a similar application, a dissimilar reason should not be stated, and in a dissimilar application, a similar reason should not be stated.

original: yang gcig rjod par byed pas tshul gzhan bstan pa'i don mi rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yang gcig rjod par byed pas tshul gzhan bstan pa'i don mi rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, when one is stated, the other is understood by implication.

original: de ltar tshul gsum pa brjod pa ni shes pa dang rjes su 'brel pas shes bya la yod par rnam par gzhag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar tshul gsum pa brjod pa ni shes pa dang rjes su 'brel pas shes bya la yod par rnam par gzhag par mi bya'o //
translated: Thus, since the statement of the three modes is connected with cognition, it should not be posited as existing in the object of cognition.

original: bstan bcos byed pa la brten nas gzhan gyis khong du chud par bya ba'i don du shes pa nyid ni tshul gsum pa bstan pas go na /
analyzed: bstan bcos byed pa la brten nas gzhan gyis khong du chud par bya ba'i don du shes pa nyid ni tshul gsum pa bstan pas go na /
translated: For the purpose of causing others to understand based on the treatise author's cognition, if the three modes are understood through the statement,

original: shes pa yang brjod pa ni dgos pa cung zad cig kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa yang brjod pa ni dgos pa cung zad cig kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: stating cognition again serves no purpose whatsoever.

original: 'di tha dad par brjod par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di tha dad par brjod par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not reasonable to state them separately.

original: 'on te 'ba' zhig pa yang tshig gcig gi don gyi nang du 'du bar 'gyur ba phan tshun tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te 'ba' zhig pa yang tshig gcig gi don gyi nang du 'du bar 'gyur ba phan tshun tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: Or, if it is a mere single word, then it would be included in the meaning of a single word, and would be a nature that is not different from each other.

original: de nyid kyi phyir tshig gcig gi don gyi nang du 'dus pa yin par 'dod do zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir tshig gcig gi don gyi nang du 'dus pa yin par 'dod do zhe na /
translated: Therefore, if it is asserted that it is included in the meaning of a single word,

original: yod pa dang med pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: then it is said that ‚Äúexistence and nonexistence‚ÄùüîΩare not included in the meaning of a single word.

original: ngag gcig @326b pa'i don la mi ltos par de'i nang du 'dus pa tsam gyis mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa dag gi yod pa dang med pa dag phan tshun 'phen pa'i nang du 'du bar 'gyur ba'i tha dad pa'i ngo bo'i don
analyzed: ngag gcig @326b pa'i don la mi ltos par de'i nang du 'dus pa tsam gyis mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa dag gi yod pa dang med pa dag phan tshun 'phen pa'i nang du 'du bar 'gyur ba'i tha dad pa'i ngo bo'i don
translated: Merely being included in that without relying on the meaning of a single word, existence and nonexistence of things that are not similar and dissimilar classes would be included in each other.

original: rnams kyang tshig gcig gi don gyi nang du 'du bar ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnams kyang tshig gcig gi don gyi nang du 'du bar ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because different things are not seen to be included in the meaning of a single word.

original: 'o na ni nges pa dang ldan pa'i yod pa dang / med pa 'ba' zhig pa nyid de dag kyang phan tshun 'phangs pas 'ba' zhig pa yang der thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ni nges pa dang ldan pa'i yod pa dang / med pa 'ba' zhig pa nyid de dag kyang phan tshun 'phangs pas 'ba' zhig pa yang der thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
